Policy: Directive 2011/92/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment.
Policy_Content: This Directive concerns the assessment of the environmental effects of those public and private projects which are likely to have significant effects on the environment. Member States are required to adopt all measures necessary to ensure that, before consent is given, projects likely to have significant effects on the environment are made subject to a requirement for development consent and an assessment with regard to their effects. Environmental impact assessment must identify, describe and assess the following factors: (a) human beings, fauna and flora; (b) soil, water, air, climate and the landscape; (c) material assets and the cultural heritage; (d) the interaction between these factors.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Offshore Petroleum and Greenhouse Gas Storage Regulations 2011.
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for the elimination and minimization of the environmental, health and safety hazards and risks involved in undertaking petroleum and greenhouse gas activities and, in particular, to make provision in relation to: the manner in which certain petroleum activities, greenhouse gas activities or greenhouse gas injection and storage activities are carried out in the offshore area; the manner in which certain facilities are designed, constructed, installed, operated, modified and decommissioned in the offshore area; to ensure that operations in the offshore area are carried out in accordance with good oilfield practice and are compatible with optimum long-term recovery of petroleum; and to prescribe requirements for various administrative activities, fees and other matters.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 960 of 2011 on Procedures for Purchasing and Selling Ferrous and Non-ferrous Metal Cuttings and Scrap and for Issuing Licences for the Purchase of Metal Cuttings and Scrap in Latvia, and also the Rate of the State Fee for a Licence for the Purchase of Ferrous and Non-ferrous Metal Cuttings and Scrap and the Payment Procedures of the State Fee
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes (1) the procedures, by which a licence for the purchase of ferrous and non-ferrous metal cuttings and scrap in the Republic of Latvia shall be issued; (2) the procedures, by which scrap shall be purchased and sold; (3) the rate of the State fee to be paid in euro for the licence; (4) the procedures, by which the State fee shall be paid; and (5) the procedures, by which the basic principles of radiation safety and nuclear safety for the protection against ionising radiation in procuring scrap shall be introduced. The Regulation shall apply to (1) articles of ferrous and non-ferrous metals and their parts, which are not usable for the intended purpose because of breakage, cutting up, wear or other reasons and which in accordance with the laws and regulations regarding waste classification and properties that make waste hazardous, have not been classified as hazardous waste; (2) scrap produced in conducting economic activity in manufacturing, construction, agriculture or other sectors of national economy, as well as in everyday life; and (3) non-reusable metal constructions of buildings, engineering structures or other infrastructure objects or their parts, which have been classified as construction waste or waste related to demolition of structures and which, in accordance with the laws and regulations.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Royalties/fees,Radiation,Nuclear energy,Waste management,Waste non-domestic sources,Hazardous waste,Waste domestic sources

Policy: Regional Decree No. 544-p validating the Regulation on protected natural territory of regional significance – state nature reserve “Chikmansky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Chikmansky” shall be considered biological (zoological) reserve constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of precious, rare and endangered wild fauna species and natural habitats thereof. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of the forest-steppe zone of the Western Siberia in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection of reproductive habitats of elk, roe deer, hares, grouse birds, badger settlements, other species of wild animals; (d) protection of habitats of rare and endangered species of animals, plants and mushrooms; (e) maintenance of ecological balance and stability of functioning of ecosystems; (f) protection of winter camps and elk migration routes; and (g) ensuring environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) all types of hunting; (b) all types of fisheries; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder; (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) creation of forest plantations and operation thereof, cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal from natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) washing vehicles in water protection areas and movement of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (y) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons; and (z) stay with unleashed dogs outside residential areas, sharpening and training of hunting dogs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Cultural heritage,Protection of habitats,Education,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Birds,Endangered species,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1512 validating the Regulation on allocation and inventory of cutting areas in public forests.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of allocation and inventory of cutting areas in public forests. Allocation and inventory of cutting areas shall be carried out by state forest manager. Registration of standing timber shall be carried out in the following forms: (a) by cutting area; (b) by number of trees destined for cutting and timber extraction; and (c) by amount of extracted timber. Allocation of cutting areas for procurement of non-timber forest products is not envisaged. Documentation related to public forest fund (cutting areas of public forest) shall include: (a) maps of cutting areas; and (b) annual evaluation of cutting area.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Inventory,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Politique Nationale Genre.
Policy_Content: Conscient du problème de l'inégalité dans l'accès au savoir et aux opportunités économiques et politiques en défaveur de la femme, le Tchad a elaboré la Politique Nationale du Genre, dont l'objectif est celui de promouvoir l’égalité et l’équité entre les hommes et les femmes en vue d’un développement durable.. Fondé sur une approche participative et consultative, cette politique sectorielle de portée nationale vise le Tchad comme un pays débarrassé de toutes les formes d’inégalités et d’iniquités de genre, de toutes formes de violences, où les hommes et les femmes ont la même chance d’accès et de contrôle des ressources et participent de façon équitable dans les instances de prise de décisions en vue d’un développement durable.

Policy: Outline for Development-oriented Poverty Reduction in China’s Rural Areas (2011-2020).
Policy_Content: The Outline for Development-oriented Poverty Reduction in China’s Rural Areas (2011-2020) is a guiding document of national poverty alleviation and development work for the next decade. It has been formulated to further accelerate the development of poor areas, promote common prosperity, and achieve by 2020 the goal of building a moderately prosperous society. The Outline is a cross-sectoral document. The main objectives are: adequate food and clothing, compulsory education, basic medical care and housing will be available to all poor population; the growth rate of per capita net income of farmers in poor areas will be higher than the national average level; the indicators of basic public services will be close to the national average level; and the tendency of development gap enlargement will be reversed. The Outline is divided into five parts, nine chapters and forty-nine articles. The first part is the foreword; the second part contains two chapters, including general requirements and targets and tasks; the third part includes one chapter which specifies target group and scope; the fourth part contains four chapters covering specific, industrial and social poverty reduction programs as well as international cooperation; the fifth part involves two chapters including policy guarantee and organizational leadership.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Forestry

Policy: Egypt’s National Strategy for Adaptation to Climate Change And Disaster Risk Reduction
Policy_Content: The Egypt’s National Strategy for Adaptation to Climate Change and Disaster Risk Reduction is a multi-sectoral document which addresses climate change and adaptation measures as part of an integrated strategy of the Egyptian government and its sustainable development programs and plans. The planning or implementation of any project or program incorporated in the development plans would therefore take into account the impacts of climate change. The Strategy lays out risks, disasters, and crises generated by climate change in each sector, mainly the impact on the coastal areas, water resources, agriculture, health and population and tourism, and ends with a presentation of the risks related to food security. In view of the continuous updating of the expected impacts resulting from climate change, this is a flexible and living strategy, adopting a twin-track approach. The first five years address the urgent issues that cannot be deferred, followed by three five-year plans. The National Strategy aims at achieving the following goals: increasing the flexibility of the Egyptian community in dealing with the risks and disasters caused by climate change and its impact on different sectors and activities and enhancing the capacity to absorb and contain climate-related risks and disasters. In essence, the strategy adopts adaptation and protection as the two basic means of defense, considering the minimum temperature increase of no more than 2° Celsius and two sea level rise scenarios of 0.5 meters and 1 meter until the end of the 21st century, as foreseen by the Copenhagen Accord of 2010. In order to achieve the goals, the following determinants must be met: political will; provision of human, financial and natural resources; reform and amendments of legislation, laws and institutional frameworks; strengthening of the information, monitoring, assessment and follow up national system; identification of performance indicators and development of a national model for social and economic analysis and projection.

Policy: Stratégie du Sous-secteur de l’Elevage, des Pêches et des Industries Animales au Cameroun.
Policy_Content: Dans le cadre de maximiser la contribution  de l’élevage, de la pêche, et de l’aquaculture à l’économie nationale, le Cameroun a élaboré la présente stratégie du sous-secteur de l’élevage des pêches et des industries animales. Fondé sur une approche participative, la stratégie vise à assurer la sécurité alimentaire des populations dans un souci de développement durable, respectueux de l’environnement. L’objectif global est accroître la production pastorale et halieutique en vue de satisfaire non seulement les besoins nutritionnels des populations et les besoins en matières premières des agro-industries, mais aussi de dégager des excédents pour l’exportation. Pour atteindre cet objectifs, les actions de la stratégie s’articulent autour des trois axes stratégiques suivants: 1) l’amélioration de la productivité et de la compétitivité des filières; 2) le développement institutionnel et renforcement des capacités des acteurs; 3) la  gestion durable des ressources naturelles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries

Policy: Somaliland National Vision 2030.
Policy_Content: The Somaliland National Vision is a national policy with a multi-sectoral approach. The policy aims at achieving the national development by 2030. To this end, the five key pillars of this policy are: economic development, infrastructure development, governance and rule of law, social development, and environmental protection.

Policy: Law No.9 of 2011 for the establishment and management of natural reserves in the Kurdistan Region.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 6 articles aims at establishing protected natural areas in the Region with the following tasks (i) conservation of environmental resources represented by biological diversity and geological diversity; (ii) preservation of plant and animal species within and outside their habitats and ecosystems; (iii) promotion of scientific research in biology and environmental systems; (iv) encouraging eco-tourism and human activities without damage to natural resources; (v) sensitize citizens to the importance of preserving natural reserves and the importance of plant and animal genetic resources; (vi) economic development of the sites through the sustainable use of their resources without damaging the natural environment; (vii) preserving the cultural, traditional and traditional knowledge of the community related to the site.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: National Policy for Water Resources Management.
Policy_Content: With this Policy the Government of Rwanda is outlining its vision for the water resources management sub-sector. It replaces the 2004, which was ill-aligned with the Water Law No. 62/2008. The Act embodies many modern and cutting-edge principles of sustainable water resources, which are not reflected in the 2004 water policy. Additionally, the Government has been introducing reforms in the water sector that have significantly changed the context for water resources management and rendered the 2004 policy out of date. This Policy firmly puts Rwanda on the path for sustainable water resources management. The Policy together with its Strategic Action Plan will make it possible for Government to embark on systematic development of the water resources management sub-sector.

Policy: National Food R&D and Innovation Strategy.
Policy_Content: The National Food R&D and Innovation Strategy is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The goal of this Strategy is to produce high value added, innovative and branding food products with environmental-friendly technologies. The Strategy further develops six strategic targets, production of raw materials, industrial R&D and innovation activities, local capabilities and innovative products, food consumption and health, mission-oriented prioritized R&D projects, and sustainability and environment-friendly technologies.

Policy: State Action Plan on Climate Change (Haryana).
Policy_Content: After the India’s National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC) was announced all States have been asked to prepare a state level action plan to deal with challenges of climate change. The state level action plans are envisaged to be an extension of the NAPCC at various levels of governance aligned with the 8 National Missions. To synergize sustainable development and adaptation to climate change a list of programs and policies as perceived by the State have been identified by state sectoral departments. Forestry: Under the State Action Plan, both adaptation and mitigation projects could be proposed for addressing climate change impacts on forest ecosystems as well as to mitigate the climate change through enhancing the carbon sinks. Forests in Haryana are vulnerable to climate change risks and any afforestation/reforestation programme to be implemented under the Greening India Mission (GIM) could also be vulnerable to climate change impacts.

Policy: Interim Action Plan for Hazardous Waste Management in the Palestinian Territory.
Policy_Content: This Interim Action Plan for Hazardous Waste Management in the Palestinian Territory is a nationwide sectoral document prepared in the framework of the second phase of the National Strategy for Solid Waste Management in the Palestinian Territories (NSSWM) 2010-2014. It is a short-term action plan that considers the necessary measures and actions to reduce risks to health and the environment based on the available data and the accomplished reports. The second part of the Action Plan addresses management measures for the leather industry and galvanizing industry, chosen as the priority hot spot areas to focus actions on.

Policy: Brunei National Energy Research Institute Order, 2011 (No. S 79).
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 22 sections divided into seven Parts and three Schedules, made under Article 83(3) of the Constitution, creates the Brunei National Energy Research Institute. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Institute, with the following functions: create and develop a world class premier energy research and development capabilities in Brunei Darussalam; conduct research and development in all fields of energy including energy technology development and verification; undertake or enter into contractual testing, consultancy, research or development projects for the purpose of its functions; promote, commercialize and enable deployment of research products and innovative solutions into the local and international marketplace in the field of energy; provide financial assistance for appropriate and approved energy research and development activities; promote collaborative links between governments, businesses, industries, universities and societies in identifying and exploiting key niches for developments and progress in energy; encourage a multi-disciplinary and holistic approach to problem-solving in the field of energy; encourage a culture that is energy-conscious and committed towards energy security and environmental sustainability, etc.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 128 amending Decree No. 347/98, as amended and in force, in compliance with Commission Directive 2010/68/EU.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Decree is to adopt the Greek legislative frame to the provisions of Commission Directive 2010/68/EU, as this has been amended and in force. Previous amendments have been incorporated into the Greek legislation with Presidential Decrees Nos. 158/1999, 137/2002, 294/2003, 194/2009 and 39/2010. The present Decree implements the two articles of the Directive as regards the updating of the standards applicable to a number of items of marine equipment and the replacement of the Annex to Presidential Decree No. 347/98 with the Annex attached hereto.

Policy: Act No. CLXVIII of 2011 on handling weather-related and other natural risks affecting agricultural production.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to create a risk pool for the mitigation of the impact of negative weather and other natural events, to strengthen the responsibility of farmers based on self-provisioning, to render more efficient the state aid and to distribute responsibility proportionately. This Act in composed of four chapters. In Chapter I lays down general provisions, such as definitions of terms used. Article 3 establishes that damages caused by natural disasters to agricultural producers must be shared among the agricultural producer, the buyer having stipulated contracts before harvesting, the insurer, the lessor of the agricultural land and the state. Chapter II regulates the system of risk management and its financial resources. There are also rules on the contribution to the insurance premium. Chapter III provides for the management of damages caused by vis major weather or other natural events to farms and forestries. Chapter IV contains final provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The latest consolidated version of the Act entered into force on 17 November 2014.

Policy: Government Regulation on Water Management Matters (1560/2011).
Policy_Content: This Government Regulation implements provisions of the Water Act of 2011 principally in respect to the conditions and procedures for authorizations under the Act. The Regulation also concerns ditch drainage and some other matters. The Regulation sets out general information that must be included in the application and establishes specific rules for the application for a permit for, among other things, projects involving a water abstraction, projects affecting water conservation zones, water flows, change in water level and hydropower facilities. the Regulation also sets out the procedures for the handling of applications. In addition to what has been laid down in section 1 of Chapter 11, a notification regarding the application shall contain the information specified by this Regulation. Drainage ditching rules concern cultivated soils.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Complementary Law No. 140 on administrative proceedings related to the protection of natural heritage, the environment, combating pollution and the preservation of forests, fauna and flora and amending the Environmental Policy Act.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the cooperation between the Union, the States, the Federal District and the municipalities on administrative proceedings related to the protection of natural heritage, the environment, provisions against pollution and the preservation of forests, fauna and flora and amending several articles of the Environmental Policy Act. Amendments deal with norms to be satisfied between Government, Federal States, Districts and Municipalities on administrative procedures and actions related to natural heritage and environmental protection as well as fighting against any illegal pollution activity, forest, flora and fauna preservation. This Law aims at giving powers to the decentralized offices in order to let them manage and protect the local ecosystems and habitats. It aims also at guaranteeing the balanced socio-economic development with special attention to environmental protection and human, animal and ecosystem harmonization.

Policy: Mahogany Industry Licensing and Branding Decree 2011 (No. 53 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Decree concerns the power of the Mahogany Industry Council to issue licences for purchasing plantation-grown mahogany logs from the Fiji Hardwoord Corporation Limited. Such licence may contain conditions which the Council may, at its discretion, determine. The Decree also provides that only timber harvested under the direction of the Corporation and produced by a licensee in conformity with the Fiji Mahogany Brand Protocol, as set out in Schedule 2 to this Decree, may be branded with the Fiji Mahogany Brand and provides rules for such branding of timber. Schedule 4 contains the Fiji Plantation-grown Mahogany harvesting Code of Practice.

Policy: Ley de desarrollo agropecuario, rural y sustentable de la Ciudad de México. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de desarrollo agropecuario, rural y sustentable de la Ciudad de México, reconoce los siguientes derechos, ejercidos de  manera individual o colectiva: 1) Derecho a la alimentación: Toda persona humana tiene derecho a disfrutar de  una alimentación suficiente en calidad y cantidad, que promueva una adecuada  nutrición; 2) Derecho a la soberanía alimentaria: El derecho de toda persona humana de  tener una alimentación que le conviene culturalmente, desde el punto de vista de  la salud y de lo económico orientada a una alimentación adecuada; 3) Derecho a la seguridad alimentaria: El derecho de toda persona humana a que  se le procure el abasto suficiente de alimentos y de productos básicos y  estratégicos en el ejercicio de su derecho a la alimentación; y 4) Derecho a la educación alimentaria: El derecho de toda persona a recibir una  educación alimentaria y nutricional adecuada que les permita tener mayor  conocimiento sobre el adecuado consumo de alimentos en la prevención de  enfermedades, así como en la generación de una cultura alimentaria, la  preservación de la riqueza alimentaria y de las cocinas tradicionales, como parte  de su patrimonio.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants, Water

En particular, habilita en el ámbito de la Dirección de Producción Forestal los siguientes registros: a) Registro de Titulares de Emprendimientos Forestales o Forestoindustriales; b) Registro de Profesionales Responsables de Emprendimientos; c) Registro de Emprendimientos Forestales o Forestoindustriales. Además, la Resolución establece disposiciones relativas a la presentación de proyectos de plantación y actividades silvícolas de especies forestales.

Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-735 du 7 décembre 2011 portant création, attributions, composition et fonctionnement de la commission nationale du développement durable.
Policy_Content: Il est est créé, sous l’autorité du ministre chargé du développement durable, une commission nationale du développement durable. La commission assiste le Gouvernement dans sa politique de développement durable. A ce titre, elle est chargée, notamment, de: s’assurer de l’intégration des préoccupations de développement durable et de l’environnement dans les politiques, les stratégies et les plans de développement sectoriels; faire des propositions sur les politiques, les stratégies et les plans d’action en matière de développement durable et d’environnement; veiller à la mise en oeuvre desdits politiques, stratégies et plans d’action, ainsi qu’au respect des normes environnementales nationales, régionales et internationales dans toutes les activités économiques, sociales et culturelles; s’assurer de l’implication des parties prenantes au processus décisionnel du développement durable aux niveaux départemental et national; analyser les différents rapports sur la mise en œuvre des accords internationaux en matière de développement durable et d’environnement; examiner et adopter les rapports élaborés par les structures techniques au compte des contributions du Gouvernement destinées à la commission des Nations Unies pour le développement durable et en exploiter les comptes rendus et recommandations; s’assurer de l’utilisation rationnelle des ressources naturelles; donner des avis sur la stratégie nationale de développement durable ; s’assurer de la vulgarisation de la notion de développement durable au niveau national; s’assurer de la prise en compte effective des préoccupations des populations au niveau national.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Decisión Nº 768 - Sistema de Información de Estadísticas de Turismo de la Comunidad Andina.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Cross Compliance) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (W.S.I. No. 2941 (W.317) of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Cross Compliance) (Wales) Regulations 2004 so as to: make provision in Wales for the administration and enforcement of cross compliance under Council Regulation (EC) No 73/2009 in respect of the requirement to establish buffer strips along water courses as a Good Agricultural and Environmental Condition for which farmers receive payment under the Common Agricultural Policy of the European Union. the Regulations: prohibit the spreading of manufactured fertilizer within 2 metres of the surface of a water course; prohibit the spreading of organic manure within 10 metres of the surface of a water course; prohibit the spreading of organic manure within 50 metres of a borehole, spring or well.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants, Water

Article 2 establishes that the Zurich Aircraft Noise Index is an instrument for detecting and monitoring the aircraft noise deriving from the Airport Zurich. The text consists of 16 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (A); Zurich Airport Index (B); Measures to ensure compliance with benchmark (C); Contributions to measures in the field of spatial planning (D); Measures to improve the quality of living (E); Further provisions (F). Policy: Décret 2011-179/PR du 07 décembre 2011 fixant les modalités d'organisation et de fonctionnement du fonds d'appui aux collectivités territoriales.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret détermine les modalités d'organisation et de fonctionnement du fonds d'appui aux collectivités territoriales (FACT) créé par la loi n° 2007-011 du 13 mars 2007 relative à la décentralisation et aux libertés locales dont la mission est de mobiliser des ressources financières en vue de renforcer les capacités de gestion des collectivités territoriales, de compenser financièrement les transferts de compétences, et d'appuyer leurs actions de développement. Le guichet « appui à l’investissement » du FACT est destiné à financer les équipements sociaux, les équipements, services et ouvrages dont l'accès ou l'usage est gratuit, notamment les infrastructures hydrauliques et énergétiques; les voiries et les ouvrages de franchissement; les écoles ; les aménagements urbains ; et les centres de santé.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo N° 873 - Ley de Ética Gubernamental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Ética Gubernamental tiene por objeto normar y promover el desempeño ético en la función pública del Estado y del Municipio, prevenir y detectar las prácticas corruptas y sancionar los actos contrarios a los deberes y las prohibiciones éticas establecidas en la misma. La presente Ley se aplica a todos los servidores públicos, permanentes o temporales, remunerados o ad-honorem, que ejerzan su cargo por elección, nombramiento o contrato, que presten servicio en la administración pública, dentro o fuera del territorio nacional.  Asimismo, quedan sujetos en lo que fuere aplicable, las demás personas que, sin ser servidores públicos, administren bienes o manejen fondos públicos. También están sujetos los ex-servidores públicos por las transgresiones a esta Ley que hubieren cometido en el desempeño de su función pública o por las violaciones a las prohibiciones éticas a que se refieren la presente Ley.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Strategic Cropping Land Act 2011.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 292 sections divided into nine Chapters, aims to protect land that is highly suitable for cropping; manage the impacts of development on that land; and preserve the productive capacity of that land for future generations. To achieve its purposes, this Act: (a) identifies areas in which land that is likely to be highly suitable for cropping may exist (called ‘potential SCL’); and (b) has provisions for deciding whether or not land is highly suitable for cropping (called ‘strategic cropping land’ or ‘SCL’); and (c) establishes— (i) protection areas and the management area for SCL and potential SCL; and (ii) principles to protect land that is SCL or potentialSCL and to manage the impacts of development on it. (2) Management of the impacts on land that is SCL or potential SCL is achieved by: (a) an assessment under this Act for development under particular other Acts; and (b) imposing conditions on the development.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 30 January 2012.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 941 of 2011 on Ecodesign Requirements for Energy-related Goods (Products)
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the ecodesign requirements for specific energy-related groups of goods (products) referred to in the laws and regulations regarding ecodesign so that they may be placed on the market or put into service, except vehicles intended for carriage of passengers or cargoes, as well as the procedures for administrative co-operation and exchange of information among ministries, institutions subordinate thereto and the procedures for sending of information to the European Commission and European Union Member States. The Regulation defines an energy-related product as any product that has an impact on energy consumption during use which is placed on the market or put into service, and includes parts intended to be incorporated into products covered by this Regulation which are placed on the market or put into service as individual parts for end-users and of which the environmental performance can be assessed independently.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Energy conservation/energy production,Internal trade,Protection of environment
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. 6.140 creating the State Policy on Climate Change and to Fight against Poverty (PEMCP).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 21 articles divided into six Chapters, creates the State Policy on Climate Change and to Fight against Poverty (PEMCP) establishes its concepts, principles, objectives, guidelines, instruments and strategies. This Policy aims to ensure the population and the public authorities the stabilization of concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere at a level that prevents dangerous anthropic interference in the climate system and ensure that food production is not threatened, enabling economic development to proceed in a sustainable manner. PEMCP has the following specific objectives: compatibility of socio-economic development with the protection of the climate system; reduction of anthropic emissions of greenhouse gases in relation to their different sources; encouraging the development, use and exchange of environmentally responsible practices and the cleanest technologies available; strengthening reforestation and recovery actions in degraded areas or any type of anthropic removals by greenhouse gas sinks in the state territory; implementation of measures to promote adaptation to climate change by the state and its municipalities, with the participation and collaboration of the interested social economic agents, in particular those especially vulnerable to their diverse effects; preservation, conservation and recovery of environmental resources, with particular attention to natural biomes such as caatinga, cerrado or any other biomes considered as Natural State Heritage; consolidation of legally protected areas and reforestation and restoration of vegetation cover in degraded areas; support to the development of the Brazilian Reduction and Emissions Market (MBRE), through public and private state actions of mitigation and GHG removal. Promotion and creation of market instruments to enable the implementation of the REDD, Renewable Energy, Carbon Sinks, and Liquid Greenhouse Gas Emission Reduction Projects, etc.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Emissions,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Zoning,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Poverty
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Norm IBAMA No. 15 establishing the procedures for the export of wood products and by-products of native species from natural or planted forests.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 13 articles and three Annexes, establishes the procedures for the export of wood products and by-products of native species from natural or planted forests. In particular, this Norm applies to the export of wood products and by-products of native origin, required to be controlled in national territory by the relevant Federal legislation, which will depend on the export authorization from Ibama. The export of charcoal from planted forests, including exotic species, will depend on an export authorization from Ibama. The authorization referred to will follow the model in Annex III. The shipment of wood products and by-products destined for fairs, exhibitions, tests or commercial promotion abroad is subject to authorization as provided for in this Normative Instruction.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: International trade,Forestry protection measures,Authorization/permit,Procedural matters,Sustainable use,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Timber
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

The Annex, which contains the status, consists of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Chairperson (sect. 2); Office of the Chairperson (sect. 3); Field units of the Agency (sect. 4); Power of attorney (Sec. 5); Control and internal audit (sect. 6); Administering of undeveloped properties (sect. 7).

Policy: Loi n° 2011-1749 relative au plan d'aménagement et de développement durable de Corse.
Policy_Content: La collectivité territoriale de Corse élabore le plan d'aménagement et de développement durable de Corse. Le plan définit une stratégie de développement durable du territoire en fixant les objectifs de la préservation de l'environnement de l'île et de son développement économique, social, culturel et touristique, qui garantit l'équilibre territorial et respecte les principes énoncés aux articles L. 110 et L. 121-1 du code de l'urbanisme. Il fixe les orientations fondamentales en matière de protection et de mise en valeur du territoire, de développement agricole, rural et forestier, de pêche et d'aquaculture, d'habitat, de transports, d'infrastructures et de réseaux de communication et de développement touristique. Il définit les principes de l'aménagement de l'espace qui en résultent et il détermine notamment les espaces naturels, agricoles et forestiers ainsi que les sites et paysages à protéger ou à préserver, l'implantation des grandes infrastructures de transport et des grands équipements, la localisation préférentielle ou les principes de localisation des extensions urbaines, des activités industrielles, artisanales, commerciales, agricoles, forestières, touristiques, culturelles et sportives.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Order No. 1132 on third party use of facilities for extraction, treatment and transport of hydrocarbon.
Policy_Content: The Order sets rules on procedures to ensure appropriate and effective use of facilities for the extraction, processing and transportation of hydrocarbons. It applies to their access which shall be based upon natural resources terms of exploitation of the Danish subsoil between users and owners. These agreements must ensure that their purpose for using facilities are not unfairily given to other companies.  Users and owners shall help to provide and exchange information necessary for a rapid and effective implementation of the agreement negotiations. Owners shall, within 15 working days, give answer to user's query regarding availability of facilities - such as production profile, desired production start date and available information on the composition of the hydrocarbons to be handled. This information shall be submitted to the energy Committee for approval.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 15 December 2011.

Policy: Décret nº 2011-1771 relatif aux formalités à accomplir pour les travaux sur constructions existantes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet la simplification des formalités à accomplir pour certaines extensions de constructions existantes. Le décret porte de vingt à quarante mètres carrés la surface hors œuvre brute maximale des extensions de constructions existantes, situées dans les zones urbaines des communes couvertes par un plan local d'urbanisme ou un document d'urbanisme en tenant lieu, soumises à la procédure de déclaration préalable. Au-delà de quarante mètres carrés, les extensions en cause donnent lieu à un permis de construire. Entre vingt et quarante mètres carrés, sont également soumises à la procédure de permis de construire les extensions qui ont pour effet de porter la surface totale de la construction au-delà de l'un des seuils fixés par le code de l'urbanisme pour le recours obligatoire à un architecte. Enfin, le décret supprime l'obligation de déposer un permis de construire pour toute modification du volume d'une construction entraînant également le percement d'un mur extérieur, quelle que soit la surface créée.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Order No. 1133 on Energy Agency's functions and powers.
Policy_Content: The Order sets rules on functions and powers of the Energy Agency, which is an institution assisting the Ministry of Climate, Energy and Construction on issues in regards to climate, energy and buildings. The Energy Agency assesses the Danish and international development on climate, energy and building and, among its tasks, it implements surveillance in cooperation with Energinet.dk in the installation of wind turbines, purchase of wind power units for local citizens and granting funds in support of local windmill studies and research.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.600 - Crea la Ventanilla Única Forestal.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Ventanilla Única Forestal, para centralizar los trámites y procedimientos que requiere el ejercicio de la actividad forestal con fines comerciales.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Order No. 510 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on forest management for growing forest fruit plants, berry plants, ornamental plants and medicinal plants.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the issues of forest management for growing forest fruit plants, berry plants, ornamental plants and medicinal plants. The aforesaid forest management shall be considered entrepreneurial activity that shall be regulated by forest lease contracts concluded between forest administration and natural and legal persons. Primarily for growing forest fruit plants, berry plants, ornamental plants and medicinal plants shall be conceded non-forest land out of stock of public forest, still unforested felling areas, and other unforested areas where natural reforestation is impossible without planting forest species. Lease holders shall carry out their activity in conformity with forest organization projects, shall comply with terms and provisions lease contract and shall prevent soil erosion.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Council Directive 2011/97/EU amending Directive 1999/31/EC as regards specific criteria for the storage of metallic mercury considered as waste.
Policy_Content: This Directive supplements Annexes I, II and III to Directive 1999/31/EC by inserting further provisions concerning the storage of mercury considered as waste and related criteria.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law No. 13.839 establishing the State Policy to Promote Cooperatives' Economy, the Cooperative Program, the Programme for Popular and Solidarity Economy, the State Programme to Strengthen Local Production Chains and the Gaucho Micro-credit Programme and for Cooperation Networks.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 8 Chapters, establishes the State Policy to Promote Cooperatives' Economy, the Cooperative Program, the Program for Popular and Solidarity Economy, the State Program to Strengthen Local Production Chains and the Gaucho Micro-credit Program and the Program for Cooperation Networks.  This State Policy is a tool for promoting economic development of the state, the diversification of market chains and local clusters, cooperation between companies and institutions, the popular and solidarity economy, self-management, collective learning, innovation and export culture. The State Policy seen as a guidelines for the Promotion of Economic Cooperation aims at promoting the following sectors: economic development of productive chains, regions and local economies; development with distribution of wealth and income produced socially in order to boost endogenous development; chains and local clusters, networks of cooperation and the popular and solidarity economy and microcredit as instruments of economic and regional development; strengthening the productive enterprises; adding value to products, companies and labor; promoting solidarity, cooperation, association and the creation of networks as a means of strengthening economic activity; stimulating self-organization businesses, workers and institutions in Local Productive Arrangements with participatory governance, coordination and self development plan; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Cooperative/producer organization,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Policy/planning,Sustainable development,Subsidy/incentive,Financial agricultural measures

Policy: Decision No. 02-UPI-732/11 (Ecotoxicological Research).
Policy_Content: This Decision officially grants the permission that authorizes the Montenegrin “Center for ecotoxicological investigation” (CETI) as official state air quality monitoring institution, aimed to monitor and measure the concentration of sulfur dioxide, nitrogen dioxide and nitrogen monoxide, residues of PM10 and PM2.5, including the presence of lead, benzene, carbon monoxide, ground-level ozone, arsenic, cadmium, nickel. benzo (a) pyrene in the air (also by using the instruments for automatic measurement and sampling and other ground performed analysis  from stationary monitoring points).

Policy: Decree amending the Decree establishing the program of agricultural activities in vulnerable areas.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development lays down some amendments and addenda to the Decree establishing the program of agricultural activities in vulnerable areas. In particular, the present Decree establishes standards for the storage of manure and slurry for individual types of animals (originally specified in Annex 2 to the amended Decree) and standards of generation of nitrogen per one animal (supplemented Annex 7).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 509 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on forest management for agro-forestry.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of forest management for agro-forestry, except for water protection areas where conduct of agricultural activities, except for haymaking and apiculture, is prohibited by law. Use of forests by citizens for agricultural activities shall be regulated by lease contracts. Forest management of agro-forestry shall be applicable for all types of forests. Natural and legal persons using forest plots for agro-forestry shall comply with contractual provisions and in accordance with forest management plan elaborated thereby.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 7701 – Ley de Parques y Areas Industriales de la Provincia de Salta.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se establece el marco regulatorio para la instalación de parques y áreas industriales en la Provincia de Salta. Uno de los objetivos primordiales es propender a una radicación ordenada de los establecimientos industriales, en armonía con el medio ambiente y con los núcleos urbanos. Se fijan criterios de planificación y organización, siendo principio rector el de la integración con el medio ambiente: los Parques y Áreas Industriales deben dar pleno cumplimiento a la legislación ambiental vigente en la Provincia con el objetivo de su correcta integración con el ambiente (art. 38).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Clean Energy Regulator Act 2011 (No. 163).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 57 sections and divided into four Parts, provides for the establishment of the Clean Energy Regulator and defines its composition and its functions and powers. The Regulator is a statutory authority that will administer the carbon pricing mechanism, National Greenhouse and Energy Reporting Scheme, the Renewable Energy Target and the Carbon Farming Initiative.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Australian Renewable Energy Agency Act 2011.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 74 sections divide into six Parts and completed by four Endnotes, aims to improve the competitiveness of renewable energy technologies and to increase the supply of renewable energy in Australia. The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) is established in section 2 and has the following functions: (a) to provide financial assistance for: (i) research into renewable energy technologies; or (ii) the development, demonstration, commercialisationor deployment of renewable energy technologies; or (iii) the storage and sharing of information and knowledge about renewable energy technologies; (b) to enter into agreements for the purpose of providing financialassistanceas mentioned in paragraph (a) and to administer such agreements; (c) to collect, analyse, interpret and disseminate information and knowledge relating to renewable energy technologies and projects; (d) to provide advice to the Minister relating to renewable energy technologies, including advice about the following: (i) improving the competitiveness of renewable energy technologies; (ii) increasing the supply of renewable energy in Australia; (iii) improving the development of skills in the renewable energy technologysector; (iv) increasing the use of renewable energy technologies; (e) to liaise with State and Territory governments and other authorities for the purpose of facilitating renewable energy projects for which financial assistance is, or is proposed to be, provided as mentioned in paragraph (a); (f) any other functions that are prescribed by the regulations; (g) any other functions conferred on ARENA by this Act or any other Commonwealth law; (h) to do anything incidental to, or conducive to, the performance of the above functions.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Renewable energy,Energy conservation/energy production,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 1 July 2012.

Policy: Law No. 505-IV amending Ecological Code (Law No. 212-Z).
Policy_Content: Article 6 shall be amended to add the following wording: “7-1) quota setting for emissions of ozone depleting gases; 7-2) inventory of ozone depleting gases; 7-3) introduction of market mechanisms for reduction of emissions of ozone depleting gases; and 7-4) system of monitoring of actual amount of emissions and absorption of ozone depleting gases.” Article 19 shall be amended to add the following wording: “3-1) validation of the land use planning programmes and projects for reduction of emissions and absorption of ozone depleting gases.” Article 51 shall be amended to add the following wording: “State environmental audit shall be mandatory and it shall precede adoption of legal, organizational and economic decisions related to nature management and impact upon environment and public health. Realization of projects without prior positive conclusions of state environmental audit shall be prohibited.”
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Federal Law No. 382-FZ “On state information system of fuel and energy sector”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law regulates relations originating from setting up, operation and improvement of state information system of fuel and energy sector, including data collection, processing, storage, access and dissemination thereof. The scope of this Federal Law shall be to grant access to information, related to the state and estimates of fuel and energy sector, to governmental bodies, local self-government, officials, organizations and citizens. Operator of the information system shall be federal executive body regulating fuel and energy sector.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1728 du 2 décembre 2011 relatif à la surveillance de la qualité de l'air intérieur dans certains établissements recevant du public.
Policy_Content: La loi du 12 juillet 2010 portant engagement national pour l'environnement a posé l'obligation de surveiller périodiquement la qualité de l'air intérieur dans certains établissements recevant du public (ERP) accueillant des populations sensibles ou exposées sur de longues périodes, comme les crèches, les écoles, les établissements d'accueil de personnes handicapées ou encore les établissements pénitentiaires pour mineurs. Le décret précise que cette surveillance doit être réalisée tous les sept ans par le propriétaire ou l'exploitant de l'établissement, au moyen d'une évaluation des systèmes d'aération et d'une campagne de mesure des polluants, conduites par des organismes accrédités. Les personnes fréquentant les établissements concernés sont tenues informées des résultats de ces évaluations et mesures. En cas de dépassement des valeurs de référence, le propriétaire ou l'exploitant est tenu de faire réaliser une expertise afin d'identifier les sources de pollution et d'y remédier. A défaut, cette expertise peut être prescrite par le préfet, aux frais du propriétaire ou de l'exploitant.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1727 relatif aux valeurs-guides pour l'air intérieur pour le formaldéhyde et le benzène.
Policy_Content: La loi du 1er août 2008 relative à la responsabilité environnementale oblige à définir des valeurs-guides pour l'air intérieur dans les établissements recevant du public (ERP). Le décret y pourvoit pour le formaldéhyde, gaz incolore principalement utilisé pour la fabrication de colles, liants ou résines, et pour le benzène, substance cancérogène aux effets hématologiques issue de phénomènes de combustion (gaz d'échappement, cheminée, cigarette, etc.). La valeur-guide pour le formaldéhyde est fixée pour une exposition de longue durée à 30 µg/m³ au 1er janvier 2015 et à 10 µg/m³ au 1er janvier 2023. La valeur-guide pour le benzène est fixée pour une exposition de longue durée à 5 µg/m³ au 1er janvier 2013 et à 2 µg/m³ au 1er janvier 2016.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Arrêté 2 décembre 2011 modifiant l'arrêté du 24 octobre 2003 relatif à la commercialisation des matériels forestiers de reproduction.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté modifie les listes des essences forestières prévues aux articles L. 551-1 et R*. 551-1 du Code forestier, de celles pour lesquelles l'admission de matériels de base identifiés est autorisée sur le territoire français, des matériels forestiers de reproduction produits dans un pays non membre de l'Union européenne admis à la commercialisation sur le territoire national en application de l'article R.* 554-3 du code forestier et es essences forestières pour lesquelles la commercialisation à l'utilisateur final de matériels forestiers de reproduction identifiés est interdite sur le territoire français conformément à l'article R.* 554-2 du code forestier.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ordinance implementing the Market Structural Act.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Market Structural Act in its version of 26 September 1990 (BGBl. I p. 2134). In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the designation of authorities responsible for the efficient enforcement of the afore-mentioned Act. The text consists of 6 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the content and publication of the public tender and its related procedures, the procedure for deciding when selecting natural and legal persons for the official support of the Fund for Environmental Protection and Energy Efficiency Fund, support for the implementation of programs, projects and other activities in the field of environmental protection and energy efficiency.

Policy: Decree No. 48.642 providing for the payment of indemnities to the native farmers displaced from the indigenous lands called Serrinha, Nonoai, Monte Caseiros and Ventarra, through an administrative transaction.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 10 articles and one Annex, establishes administrative and legal proceedings, providing for the payment of indemnities to the native farmers displaced from the indigenous lands called Serrinha, Nonoai, Monte Caseiros and Ventarra, through an administrative transaction. This Decree defines native farmers those who, in good faith, occupied lands located in indigenous areas alienated by the State, and becoming legitimate owners thereof. The right of indemnity extends to the legitimate heirs of the native farmer lands. The amount of indemnities due to native farmers will be paid according to the classifications specified in the text. The Decree also establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to obtain such indemnification. The beneficiary must prepare a deed of recognition of the Union's domain over the property located within the boundaries of the indigenous area, according to Annex I.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,Abandoned land/unoccupied land,Land tenure,Ownership,Indigenous peoples,Liability/compensation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural land,Traditional rights/customary rights,Zoning

Policy: Resolución Nº 271-2011 (COMIECO-LXI) ─ Modifica la Resolución Nº 37-99 (COMIECO-XIII), que aprueba el Reglamento Centroamericano de Medidas de Normalización, Metrología y Procedimientos de Autorización y el Reglamento Centroamericano sobre Medidas y Procedimientos Sanitarios y Fitosanitarios.
Policy_Content: El Consejo de Ministros de Integración Económica (COMIECO) de Centroamérica, mediante Resolución Nº 271-2011 (COMIECO-LXI) aprobó la modificación, por sustitución total del Reglamento Centroamericano sobre medidas y procedimientos sanitarios y fitosanitarios (Anexo 2 de la Resolución Nº 37-99 (COMIECO-XIII), que tiene por tiene por objeto regular las medidas sanitarias y fitosanitarias que puedan afectar directa o indirectamente el comercio entre los Estados Parte y evitar que se constituyan en barreras innecesarias al comercio, así como desarrollar las disposiciones legales para armonizar gradual y voluntariamente las medidas y procedimientos en materia sanitaria y fitosanitaria con el propósito de proteger la salud y la vida humana y de los animales o para preservar la sanidad de los vegetales, de conformidad con lo establecido en el Protocolo al Tratado General de Integración Económica Centroamericana - Protocolo de Guatemala y en el Acuerdo sobre la Aplicación de Medidas Sanitarias y Fitosanitarias (AMSF) de la Organización Mundial del Comercio (OMC), que se tendrá como normativa supletoria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Standards,Internal trade,International trade,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Food quality control/food safety,Plant protection,Pests/diseases

Policy: Resolution No. 04 establishing the parameters, procedures and rules for applying the bonus in forest concession contracts for federal public forests.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of three Chapters, establishes the parameters, procedures and rules for applying the bonus in forestry concession contracts for federal public forests. For the purposes of this Resolution, the bonus for forest concession contracts provided for in art. 30 of Law No. 11.284 is characterized by percentage discounts levied on the price for the round wood product established in the contract, according to the limits and terms contained in the contract. In contracts that provide for differentiated prices for groups of species, the application of the bonus will occur through a percentage discount on the contracted price for each group of species.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Concession,Royalties/fees,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,Public forest

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1419 validating the Regulation on allocation of the plots of land covered by territorial water for the construction of artificial installations.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of allocation of the plots of land covered by territorial and inland waters of the Caspian sea of the Republic of Kazakhstan for the construction of artificial installations, including harbour facilities. The aforesaid plots of land shall be conceded on lease for the period of 49 years. Concession and transfer of land shall be carried out by the local self-government by agreement with the respective water basin inspections. Application shall contain the following documentation: (a) notarized copy of registration of legal person; (b) notarized copy of taxpayer’s certificate; and (c) copy of statute of legal person.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Scheme (Amendment) (Registries and Fees etc.) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 2911 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Greenhouse Gas Emission Trading Scheme Regulations 2005 to give effect to Commission Regulation (EU) No 920/2010 for a standardised and secured system of registries pursuant to Directive 2003/87/EC. They also to amend the powers of the Environment Agency, the Scottish Environmental Protection Agency and the Department of the Environment in Northern Ireland to enable them to impose charges by means of charging schemes in respect of various functions in relation to the operation of emissions trading registries, the regulation of aviation activities under the EU Emissions Trading Scheme. The Regulations also enable the Environment Agency to making charging schemes in relation to its functions in respect of the approval of project activities established under the Kyoto Protocol or for authorization to participate in such project activities.

Policy: Regional Law No. 871-PK “On allotment of plots of land to multiple children family”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that plots of municipal land and plots of land with undelimited ownership shall be allotted to multiple children family in ownership free of charge and without sale for individual housing construction, suburban housing construction, subsidiary smallholding, farming, gardening, horticulture and stockbreeding. The aforesaid plots of land shall be allotted to families or single parents with three or more children of minority age. Minimum land area of plots of land shall be 0, 10 ha and maximum land area shall be 0, 25 ha.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Farming,Public land,Private land,Property rights,Family farming,Smallholders/peasants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 109-OZ “On allotment of land plots free of charge to citizens”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of allotment of public or municipal land plots free of charge to citizens with three or more children, residing on the regional territory, and establishes minimum and maximum land areas. It shall be applicable to land plots under housing constructions. Families with three or more children under age shall be granted the right of allotment of the aforesaid plots of land free of charge once-only on condition of ownership. Minimum land area shall be 0, 04 ha and maximum land area shall be 0, 2 ha.

Le texte traite entre autres les aspects suivants: gestion de la sûreté,  Conception, Exploitation; Vérification de la sûreté; Préparation à l'urgence. Le texte comprend 34 articles répartis en 5 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Prescriptions de sûreté génériques (2); Prescriptions de sûreté spécifiques (3); Dispositions finales (5).

Policy: Regulation (EU) No. 1255/2011 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Programme to support the further development of an Integrated Maritime Policy.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes a European Union Programme to support measures to develop the Union's Integrated Maritime Policy. The Programme includes the allocation of financial resources as set out in the Annex. The Programme aims at: a) the development and implementation of integrated governance of maritime and coastal affairs; b) the development of knowledge on the oceans, sea and coastal regions within and bprdering the European Union; c) the promotion of the protection of the marine environment and its biodiversity; d) the development of sea basin strategies.

Policy: Règlement d'application de l'ordonnance fédérale relative à l'étude de l'impact sur l'environnement (ROEIE).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi sur la protection de l’environnement du 7 octobre 1983, l'ordonnance relative à l'étude de l'impact sur l'environnement du 19 octobre 1988 et la loi cantonale sur la protection de l'environnement du 18 novembre 2010. Notamment, le présent règlement organise dans le canton la mise en œuvre de l'étude de l'impact sur l'environnement (EIE) telle que celle-ci est prescrite par la législation susvisée. Le texte comprend 16 articles répartis en 5 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Etablissement du rapport d'impact (2); Procédure décisive (3); Appréciation - Décision finale (4); Dispositions transitoires et finales (5). Policy: Law No. 224 Technical Regulation “On radiation safety”.
Policy_Content: This Law shall be applicable for protection of human life, health and environment against hazardous impact of ionizing radiation and establishes requirements for ensuring radiation safety. It shall be applicable to all processes that cause risks of ionizing radiation of human beings. It contains calculation formula for radiation safety levels. The following categories shall be subject to the following objects: (a) radiation sources; (b) radioactive substances and radioactive waste storage sites; (c) foodstuffs and agricultural commodities; (d) potable water and foodstuffs manufactured therewith; (e) fertilizers and nutrients; and (f) industrial waste with high contents of natural radionuclides.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Radiation,Fertilizers/nutrients,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Waste disposal,Public health,Transport/storage,Pollution control,Hazardous waste,Food quality control/food safety,Agricultural commodities,Water supply,Potable water,Standards

Policy: Law No. 14.626 establishing the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 16 articles and 2 Annexes, establishes the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities and for other activities carried out by individuals or institutions, which need to use natural resources. These activities include: extraction, production, transport and trade of any potentially products dangerous for the environments, as well as to products and sub-products originated from fauna and flora. This State Cadastre, regulated by the State Delegation of IBAMA, integrates the National System on Environmental Information established by Federal Law No. 6.938, and its amendments. The Annexes list all the potentially polluting activities and establish class, category and level of risk of these activities.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Climate Change Authority Act 2011 (No. 143).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 83 Sections divided into five Parts, establishes the Climate Change Authority. It specifies composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Authority, entitled to carry out following functions: (a) to conduct reviews under: (i) Part 22 of the Clean Energy Act 2011; and (ii) section 306 of the Carbon Credits (Carbon Farming Initiative) Act 2011; and (iii) sections 76A and 76B of the National Greenhouse and Energy Reporting Act 2007; and (v) Part 3 of this Act; (b) if requested to do so by the Climate Change Minister, to assist the Climate Change Minister in preparing the Commonwealth Government’s response to recommendations set out in a report of such a review; (c) to conduct research about matters relating to climate change; (d) to conduct research for purposes in connection with the performance of any of the Authority’s functions; (e) such other functions as are conferred on the Authority by this Act; (f) such functions as are conferred on the Authority by any other law of the Commonwealth; (g) to do anything incidental to or conducive to the performance of any of the above functions.

Policy: Urban Lands Lease Holding Proclamation No. 721/2011.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation provides for the lease of urban land. “Urban land” means land located within an administrative boundary of an urban center; “urban center” means any locality having a municipal administration or a population size of 2000 or more inhabitants of which at least 50% of its labor force is engaged in non-agricultural activities. This Proclamation shall be applicable to all urban centers with in Ethiopia with regard to urban land. The Proclamation sets out the fundamental principles of lease and provides that no person may acquire urban land other than the lease holding system provided under this Proclamation. Also, no person may enclose and use any plot of land adjacent to his lawful possession without the permission of the appropriate body and no region or city administration may permit or transfer urban land in a manner contrary to the provisions of this Proclamation. An urban land shall be permitted to be held by leasehold: a) if its use is in conformity with the urban plan guidelines or, if the urban center does not have such guidelines, as per the regulations issued by the region or the city administration; and b) through the modality of tender or allotment. The Proclamation sets out the tender and allotment procedures. Any person permitted urban land lease holding in accordance with this Proclamation shall conclude a contract of lease with the appropriate body. Leasehold certificate shall be issued to a person to whom an urban land lease holding is permitted. The period of urban land lease shall vary depending on the level of urban development and sector of development activity or the type of service and shall have the ceiling of 15 years for urban agriculture.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Renewable Heat Incentive Scheme Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 2860 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations establish for Great Britain a renewable heat incentive scheme under which owners of plants which generate heat from specified renewable sources and meet specified criteria may receive payments at prescribed tariffs for the heat used for eligible purposes. Payments may also be made to biomethane producers who produce biomethane for injection. The Regulations also provide for the procedures for accreditation, registration, change of ownership and preliminary accreditation with the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Ley Nº 26.732 - Prorrógase el derecho a la exportación de hidrocarburos creado por el artículo 6° de la Ley N° 25.561.
Policy_Content: En virtud de la presente Ley se prorroga por un plazo de cinco años el derecho a la exportación de hidrocarburos creado por el segundo párrafo del artículo 6º de la Ley 25.561, Ley de emergencia pública.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Resolution No. 19/2011/QH13 on results of supervision and stepping up of the implementation of environmental policies and laws in economic zones and craft villages.
Policy_Content: This Resolution provides the approved contents of the National Assembly Standing Committee’s report on results of supervision of the implementation of environmental policies in economic zones and craft villages. The report includes: the results obtained; limitations and weaknesses as well as proposals to step up the implementation of environmental policies; proposals to form and build coastal economic zones in association with environmental protection to avoid the danger of environmental pollution; proposals to control and manage environmental pollution in craft villages; proposals to strengthen the state management apparatus of environmental protection form the central to local levels; etc.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Sustainable Use of Pesticides Regulations.
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern the authorization, placing on the market, use and control of plant protection products in commercial form and the placing on the market and control of active substances. These provisions transpose Directive 2009/128/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for Community action to achieve the sustainable use of pesticides.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Sistema de Fondos de Garantía Recíproca para la Promoción de las MIPYMES, Vivienda Social y Educación Técnica-Profesional, tiene como objetivo facilitar el acceso al financiamiento a las MIPYME, el acceso a la vivienda social y a los programas de financiamiento educativo.

Policy: Resolution No. 18/2011/QH13 on terminating the implementation of Resolution No. 08/1997/QH10 and Resolution No. 73/2006/QH11 on the project on planting five million hectares of new forests.
Policy_Content: This Resolution provides for the termination of the implementation of the National Assembly’s Resolutions No. 08/1997/QH10 and No. 73/2006/QH11 on the project on planting five million hectares of new forests as the key targets of the project have been achieved.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Arrêté du 25 novembre 2011 portant validation d'un programme de réduction de la consommation énergétique des ménages les plus défavorisés dans le cadre du dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie.
Policy_Content: Le dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie repose sur une obligation de réalisation d'économies d'énergie imposée aux fournisseurs d'énergie dont les ventes annuelles sont supérieures à un seuil. Ces obligations sont assorties d'une pénalité financière pour les fournisseurs d'énergie ne les remplissant pas dans le délai imparti. Les fournisseurs d'énergie peuvent s'acquitter de leurs obligations par la détention de certificats d'économies d'énergie, obtenus sous certaines conditions à la suite d'actions d'économies d'énergie ou par l'achat à d'autres acteurs ayant mené ces actions. Le programme de réduction de la consommation énergétique des ménages les plus défavorisés décrit en annexe du présent arrêté est éligible au dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie à compter de la date d'entrée en vigueur du présent arrêté.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Malaysian Timber Industry Board (Amendment of Third Schedule) Order, 2011.
Policy_Content: This Order amends the third Schedule of the Malaysian Timber Industry Board (Incorporation) Act 1973 by substituting for the words "Malaysian Furniture Industry Council (MFIC)" appearing under column Name, the words "Malaysian Furniture Council (MFC)".
