Policy_Content: En application des directives 2009/72 et 2009/73, traitant respectivement du marché intérieur de l'électricité et du marché intérieur du gaz naturel, le décret fixe la procédure de certification des sociétés gestionnaires des réseaux de transport de gaz ou d'électricité. Policy: Décret n° 2011-1479 du 9 novembre 2011 relatif à l'étiquetage des produits ayant une incidence sur la consommation d'énergie.
Policy_Content: La directive européenne 2010/30/UE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 19 mai 2010 établit un cadre pour l'harmonisation des mesures nationales concernant l'information des utilisateurs finals, notamment par voie d'étiquetage et d'informations relatives aux produits, sur la consommation d'énergie et, le cas échéant, d'autres ressources essentielles pendant l'utilisation ainsi que des renseignements complémentaires relatifs aux produits liés à l'énergie, permettant ainsi aux utilisateurs finals de choisir des produits ayant un meilleur rendement. Elle impose aux fabricants qui mettent sur le marché ou qui mettent en service ces produits de fournir une étiquette et une fiche comportant des informations relatives à la consommation du produit en énergie ou en autres ressources essentielles pendant son utilisation. Ces informations seront définies par des règlements délégués de la Commission européenne pour chaque type de produit. Ces étiquettes et ces fiches devront être fournies aux distributeurs qui devront les porter à la connaissance des acheteurs. Le présent décret précise le champ d'application et les modalités de cette obligation d'information.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regional Law No. 639-128 “On protected areas of regional significance”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes jurisdictional competence of regional state bodies and regulates relations in the sphere of setting up and protection of protected natural areas of regional significance. Regional Government shall have the following plenary powers: (a) environmental investigation; (b) environmental audit; (c) decision-making on constitution of natural parks and validation of the regulations thereon; (d) constitution of state nature reserves of regional significance; (e) attribution of the status of nature monuments to regional nature complexes and proclamation of territory of their location protected areas; (f) certification of nature monument; and (g) land-use planning of regional protected areas with mapping of the boundaries thereof.

Policy: Instrucción Nº 213 de 2012 de Tribunal Supremo Popular, sobre la incidencia de hechos que pudieran afectar la transparencia de la administración del patrimonio público.
Policy_Content: La presente Instrucción establece que cuando del examen de un proceso judicial se advierta por la Sala de justicia, por la Sección del Tribunal Municipal o por el Tribunal Militar que lo tramita, la incidencia de hechos que pudieran afectar la transparencia de la administración del patrimonio público, además de ponerlo en conocimiento de la Fiscalía deberá igualmente hacerlo saber por escrito a la Contraloría General de la República o en su caso, a los contralores jefes provinciales y del municipio especial de Isla de la Juventud.

Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the Merchant Shipping Act, 2009, set out procedures for port state control of foreign ships in ports of Kenya for purposes of various listed Conventions including MARPOL. Policy: Regional Law No. 105-ZRH “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be conservation, management, protection and promotion of the objects of cultural heritage. All the objects of cultural heritage of regional and municipal significance shall be subject to mandatory recording in the State register of the objects of cultural heritage. Boundaries of protection areas around the objects of cultural heritage and regime of land tenure and land-use planning shall be validated by the Regional Government in accordance with the conclusions of state historical and cultural expertise on motion by the authorized regional state executive body.

Policy: Regional Law No. 88-ZRH "On allotment free of charge in ownership of land plots to citizens having three or more children.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the cases and the procedure of allotment free of charge in ownership to citizens having three and more children of the plots of land pertaining to state and municipal property, and it also establishes minimum and maximum land area (dimensions) of such land plots. The aforesaid plots of land shall be allotted for individual residential housing construction and subsidiary smallholding. Land area for individual housing construction shall be determined as follows: (a) minimum – 1.000 square metres, maximum – 2.000 square meters; and for subsidiary smallholding: (b) minimum - 1.000 square meters, maximum – 3.000 square meters.

Policy: Regional Law No. 74 “On allotment of land plots to multi-child families”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law sets forth the modalities of allotment in ownership by purchase or free of charge of plots of land pertaining to public and municipal property to multi-child families, and also establishes minimum and maximum land areas of the aforesaid plots of land. Multi-child family shall be considered family with three or more children less than 18 years of age. The aforesaid plots of land in inhabited areas shall be allotted for housing construction and subsistence family farming. Allotment of the aforesaid plots of land shall be performed once-only. Land tenure of the aforesaid plots of land shall be performed in accordance with authorized purposeful (specific) use of land established at the moment of allotment thereof.

Policy: Order No. 154 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on the procedure for immediate measures of iodine prophylaxis of the population in the event of radiation accident.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for immediate measures of iodine prophylaxis of the population in the event of radiation accident. Iodine prophylaxis - blockage of human thyroid gland or iodine blockade, consisting in urgent introduction of a medicine of potassium iodide into the human body in order to prevent or reduce the absorption of radioactive isotopes of iodine by thyroid gland in the event of a radiation accident. The obligatory measures of iodine prophylaxis shall be as follows: (a) definition of the monitoring zone of the NPP, where iodine prophylaxis is planned; (b) calculation of a sufficient amount of potassium iodide preparations; (c) storage and regular updating of a sufficient quantity of potassium iodide preparations in the mode of round-the-clock availability for the population in the shortest period of time; (d) availability of the order of actions of the officials responsible for making a decision on iodine prophylaxis; and (e) the priority of iodine prophylaxis among infants, children and adolescents, newborns, nursing mothers. Local self-government shall: (a) prepare proposals for the purchase and accumulation of a sufficient amount of potassium iodide preparations for the population living in NPP monitoring areas, based on the daily requirement of these drugs in accordance with the regulations for iodine prophylaxis; and (b) establish the order of accumulation, storage, availability, regular updating of the stock of drugs potassium iodide.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1457 du 7 novembre 2011 relatif à l'autorisation d'exercer l'activité d'achat d'électricité pour revente et à l'autorisation de fourniture de gaz .
Policy_Content: L'article 12 de la loi NOME, modifiant l'article 22 de la loi n° 2000-108 du 10 février 2000 relative à la modernisation et au développement du service public de l'électricité et dont les dispositions sont codifiées à l'article L. 333-1 du code de l'énergie, remplace le régime de déclaration de l'activité d'achat pour revente d'électricité par un régime d'autorisation. Le présent décret fixe les conditions d'application de ce régime d'autorisation. Celle-ci permet une vérification des capacités techniques et financières des fournisseurs et de la compatibilité de leur projet avec les droits et obligations mis en place par la loi NOME (accès régulé à l'énergie nucléaire historique, obligation de capacité).  Ce décret modifie également le décret n° 2004-250 du 19 mars 2004 relatif à l'autorisation de fourniture de gaz pour l'adapter à la situation du marché du gaz, notamment en modifiant le contenu du dossier de demande d'autorisation de fourniture (n° TVA intracommunautaire, nom du prestataire d'équilibre et informations supplémentaires sur les contrats d'un an et plus, conformément au règlement européen sur la sécurité d'approvisionnement) ainsi que la fréquence de transmission des informations et en prévoyant une procédure spécifique pour l'achat et la revente de gaz aux points d'échange de gaz (PEG).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1460 du 7 novembre 2011 modifiant les dispositions du code de l'environnement fixant les modalités du contrôle périodique de certaines catégories d'installations classées soumises à déclaration et modifiant le décret n° 2009-835 du 6 juillet 2009 relatif au premier contrôle périodique de certaines catégories d'installations classées soumises à déclaration.
Policy_Content: Certaines installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement (ICPE) relevant du régime de la déclaration peuvent être soumises, en fonction des risques qu'elles présentent, à des contrôles périodiques permettant à l'exploitant de s'assurer que ses installations fonctionnent dans les conditions requises par la réglementation. Le décret précise d'abord la périodicité de ces contrôles : ils doivent être effectués tous les cinq ans, ou tous les dix ans si l'installation est certifiée ISO 14001. Lorsqu'une installation relevant du régime de l'autorisation ou de l'enregistrement vient à être soumise au régime de la déclaration avec contrôle périodique, par suite d'une modification de la nomenclature ou du volume d'activité, le premier contrôle doit être opéré dans les cinq ans. Lorsqu'une installation non classée, ou relevant du régime de la déclaration sans contrôle périodique, vient à être soumise à ce régime par suite d'une modification de la nomenclature, ce premier contrôle doit être effectué dans les deux ans. Le décret permet ensuite de renforcer le suivi de la mise en conformité des installations, en mettant à la charge des organismes chargés des contrôles l'obligation d'informer le préfet des cas de non-conformité majeurs constatés, lui permettant de prendre les mesures nécessaires. Le décret dispense enfin de toute obligation de contrôle périodique les ICPE exploitées par des entreprises enregistrées sous le référentiel EMAS (système européen de management environnemental et d'audit).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ley que crea la Procuradoría Ambiental del Estado de Sonora.
Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Ley se crea la Procuradoría Ambiental del Estado de Sonora, cuya misión consiste en la inspección, vigilancia y sanción que en materia ambiental se encuentren asignadas al Estado en términos de la Ley del Equilibrio Ecológico y de Protección al Medio Ambiente del Estado de Sonora y demás ordenamientos legales aplicables. Asimismo la Procuradoría e responsable de realizar investigaciones sobre denuncias de hechos, actos u omisiones que causen daño al medio ambiente o representen riesgos graves para el mismo. La Ley se fundamenta en el derecho de las personas a disfrutar de un medio ambiente adecuado para su desarrollo, salud y bienestar.

Policy: Control of Ozone Layer Depleting Substances Proclamation (No. 716/2011).
Policy_Content: This Proclamation provides with respect to a system for licensing the import and export of controlled substances as required by the Montreal Protocol, to which Ethiopia is a party. Controlled substances are listed in the Annexes to the Protocol. The importation of any ozone-depleting substance is prohibited after the laps of the phase-out date stated in the schedule attached to this Proclamation. The Environmental Protection Authority may waive the prohibition where a reliable evidence is submitted to prove that the transaction has been initiated prior to the coming into force of this Proclamation or the substance is needed to run, repair or service an appliance that has not yet outlived its useful life. Without having authorization from the Authority, no person may establish, run or expand an enterprise with operations likely to increase the consumption of ozone depleting substances. The Proclamation furthermore specifies powers and duties of the Authority and requires federal or regional government organ empowered by law to issue business license or to control imports ("licensing authorities) to 'refuse, grant, renew, suspend or cancel trade licenses in tandem with the decision of the Authority to refuse, grant, renew, suspend or cancel authorization'.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Climate change,Ozone layer,Air quality/air pollution,International agreement-implementation,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,International trade,Authorization/permit

Policy: Law No. 13.825 on the State Unified System of Family Agroindustrial, Artisanal and Small Scale Food Safety (SUSAF-RS).
Policy_Content: This Law, composed of 11 articles, establishes the State Unified System of Family Agroindustrial, Artisanal and Small Scale Food Safety (SUSAF-RS). The SUSAF-RS aims at guaranteeing the safety, integrity and quality of the final product, guiding technical norms and instructions in which the evaluation of the sanitary condition will be based on technical parameters of Agroindustrial and Foodstuff Good Practices, respecting the local characteristics and the different scales of production, considering also the social, geographic, historical aspects and the cultural values aggregated to the products. SUSAF-RS has the following objectives: implement systemic integration of municipal inspection services; draw up the basic guidelines of the Family Agroindustrial, Artisanal and Small Scale Food Safety; give recommendations, through specific and socially appropriate technical documents; stimulate partnerships with public and private agencies, research and educational institutions, training, technical assistance and extension; monitoring the State municipal services; grant authorization; organize and register information on the Artisanal and Small Scale Food Family Agroindustries existing in the State.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Policy/planning,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Institution,Family farming,Smallholders/peasants,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Order No. 470 of the Federal Forest Agency validating Regulation on aerial protection against forest fires.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that aerial protection of forests against forest fires shall be carried out: (a) by federal executive bodies on forest plots pertaining to regional property; (b) by the Federal Forest Agency on forest plots under federal management; (c) by defence and security bodies on forest plots of defence and security; and (d) by the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service on forest plots of protected areas. Aerial protection against pests and negative environmental impact shall be carried out as part of forest pathology monitoring for sanitary protection of forests. Areas of application of aerial protection of forests shall be determined by the Federal Forest agency by agreement with regional executive bodies. Aerial patrolling of forests shall begin with the beginning of forest fire risk season.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.137 - Cambia la naturaleza jurídica de la Agencia Nacional de Hidrocarburos (ANH).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto cambia la naturaleza jurídica de la Agencia Nacional de Hidrocarburos (ANH), de Unidad Administrativa Especial a la de Agencia Estatal, con personería jurídica, patrimonio propio y autonomía administrativa, técnica y financiera, adscrita al Ministerio de Minas y Energía. La ANH tiene como finalidad identificar y evaluar el potencial hidrocarburífero del país y estructurar los estudios e investigaciones en las áreas de geología y geofísica para generar nuevo conocimiento en las cuencas sedimentarias con miras a planear y optimizar el aprovechamiento del recurso hidrocarburífero y generar interés exploratorio y de inversión.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.175 - Crea el Instituto Nacional de Metrología (INM).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Instituto Nacional de Metrología (INM), que tiene por objeto la coordinación nacional de la metrología científica e industrial y la ejecución de actividades que permitan la innovación y soporten el desarrollo económico, científico y tecnológico del país, mediante la investigación, la prestación de servicios metrológicos, el apoyo a las actividades de control metrológico y la diseminación de mediciones trazables al Sistema Internacional de unidades (SI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Nº 4134 - Crea la Agencia Nacional de Minería (ANM).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Agencia Nacional de Minería (ANM), con el objeto de administrar integralmente los recursos minerales de propiedad del Estado, promover el aprovechamiento óptimo y sostenible de los recursos mineros de conformidad con las normas pertinentes y en coordinación con las autoridades ambientales en los temas que lo requieran, lo mismo que hacer seguimiento a los títulos de propiedad privada del subsuelo cuando le sea delegada esta función por el Ministerio de Minas y Energía.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Unidad Nacional para la Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres, que tiene como objetivo dirigir la implementación de la gestión del riesgo de desastres, atendiendo las políticas de desarrollo sostenible, y coordinar el funcionamiento y el desarrollo continuo del Sistema Nacional para la Prevención y Atención de Desastres (SNPAD).
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Unidad de Planificación de Tierras Rurales, Adecuación de Tierras y Usos Agropecuarios (UPRA), que tiene por objeto orientar la política de gestión del territorio para usos agropecuarios, para lo cual la UPRA planificará, producirá lineamientos, indicadores y criterios técnicos para la toma de decisiones sobre el ordenamiento social de la propiedad de la tierra rural, el uso eficiente del suelo para fines agropecuarios, la adecuación de tierras, el mercado de tierras rurales y el seguimiento y evaluación de las políticas públicas en estas materias.

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.131 - Cambia la naturaleza jurídica del Instituto Colombiano de Geología y Minería (Ingeominas) que pasa a denominarse Servicio Geológico Colombiano (SGC).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto cambia la naturaleza jurídica del Instituto Colombiano de Geología y Minería (Ingeominas) de establecimiento público a Instituto Científico y Técnico, que se denominará Servicio Geológico Colombiano (SGC), adscrito al Ministerio de Minas y Energía, el cual hará parte del Sistema Nacional de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación (SNCTI). El SGC tiene como objeto realizar la investigación científica básica y aplicada del potencial de recursos del subsuelo; adelantar el seguimiento y monitoreo de amenazas de origen geológico; administrar la información del subsuelo; garantizar la gestión segura de los materiales nucleares y radiactivos en el país; coordinar proyectos de investigación nuclear; y el manejo y la utilización del reactor nuclear de la Nación”.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.155 - Transforma la Agencia Presidencial para la Acción Social y la Cooperación Internacional (Acción Social).

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Flag State Directive) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 2667 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, for purposes of implementing provisions in Directive 2009/21/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on compliance with flag State requirements require the Secretary of State: to ensure that certain information in respect of United Kingdom ships is kept and remains readily accessible; to provide information relating to a former United Kingdom ship upon request from the State whose flag the ship is now entitled to fly; to review the operation and effect of these Regulations and publish a report within five years after they come into force and within every five years after that.

The Text consists of 36 Articles divided into 8 Chapters: General provisions; Qualification and contract; Technical requirements; Technical review; On-site services; Design changes; Design review; Supplementary provisions.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-365 du 03 novembre 2011 portant création du Comité Interministériel de lutte contre la traite, l’exploitation et le travail des Enfants.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée du Comité Interministériel de lutte contre la traite, l’exploitation et le travail des Enfants. Le Comité Interministériel de lutte contre la traite, l’exploitation et le travail des Enfants a pour missions de concevoir, de coordonner et d’assurer la mise en œuvre des programmes et projets en vue de l'interdiction du Travail des Enfants.

Policy: Order No. 471 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on restriction on stay in forests for ensuring forest fire and sanitary safety.
Policy_Content: This Order sets restrictions on stay of citizens in forests, entry of automotive means of transport and establishes the arrangements for ensuring forest fires safety and sanitary safety in forests. The aforesaid restrictions shall be imposed in the following cases: (a) localization and liquidation of the hotbeds of forest pests and diseases with the application of pesticides; and (b) ascertainment of IV and V forest fire risk classes and proclamation of emergency situation in forests due to forest fires. The aforesaid restrictions can be imposed for the period up to 21 calendar days. The decision on imposition of restrictions shall be subject to mandatory publication in the official printed publications.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 4.167 - Cambia la naturaleza jurídica de la Financiera de Desarrollo Territorial S. A. (FINDETER).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto cambia la naturaleza jurídica de la Financiera de Desarrollo Territorial S. A. (FINDETER), transformandola de sociedad por acciones y en una sociedad de economía mixta de orden nacional, del tipo de las anónimas, organizada como un establecimiento de crédito, vinculada al Ministerio de Hacienda y Crédito Público y sometida a la vigilancia de la Superintendencia Financiera de Colombia, con la finalidad de ajustarse a los requerimientos de la Superintendencia Financiera de Colombia y adaptarse de manera efectiva a los cambios impuestos por las nuevas exigencias normativas. El régimen de FINDETER es el de derecho privado, y se someterá al régimen propio de las sociedades de economía mixta no asimiladas al de las empresas industriales y comerciales del Estado, independientemente de la participación del capital público en su patrimonio.
Subject: Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation (Exemption) (Burara Land) Order 2011 (L.N. No. 95 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order, made by the Minister for Forestry under section 4 of the Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, exempts land in Burara land in the Malaita Province from the provisions of that section for purposes of agricultural development and reforestation. Section 4 requires a licence to be obtained for commercial felling. In this area instead clear felling shall be undertaken only the area if the Commissioner gives prior written approval of the area to be cleared subject to the specified conditions. The Order defines offences.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 874 validating the Regulation on allocation of subsidies for partial compensation of expenditure of peasant farms for legalization of ownership of agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the proceedings, terms and conditions for allocation and distribution of subsidies from federal budget to the regional budgets for partial compensation of expenditure of peasant farms, including individual entrepreneurs, for legalization of ownership of agricultural land. Subsidies shall be allocated for legalization of ownership of the plots of agricultural land previously conceded on condition of permanent (open-ended) tenure, lifelong hereditary possession and land shares allotted on lease with the right of subsequent buy-out of the plots of agricultural land. The Act contains calculation formula for determination of the amount of subsidies.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret introduit dans le code de l'environnement deux sections relatives à la recherche et à l'exploitation de sites de stockage géologiques de dioxyde de carbone. Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 121-PG validating Forest plan.
Policy_Content: The Governor decrees that Regional Forest plan shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 280/11 approving the Regulation of the Urban Development Plan of Sequele the Province of Luanda.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation of the Urban Development Plan of Sequele the Province of Luanda (in the Annex). The above mentioned Urban Plan Regulation (PUCC), consisting of 7 Chapters, establishes the municipal urban land and territorial use planning and regulates all the interventions related to spatial organization and general conditions for building within the urban area of Sequele. The PUCC aims at fixing the standards and global parameters for the intervention area (AI) and limits its partial urban area.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 449-Z “On organization of collection and shipping point for timber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law, with a view of preventing illegal logging, establishes the modalities of organization and functioning of collection and shipping point for timber, and establishes the requirements for acceptance, registration and transportation of timber. Incoming, processing and shipping timber shall be subject to compulsory registration and shall be recorded in registration log. At the moment of timber delivery to collection and shipping point for timber copies of the following documents must be submitted: (a) personal identification document; (b) designation of authority in case of delivery of timber of the third party; (c) individual taxpayer identification number; and (d) timber ownership certificate (forest declaration stamped by state body or local authority that have allotted forest parcel or purchase and sale contract for forest species).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 29796 - Amplía el plazo de aplicación de la Ley Nº 27889, que crea el Fondo y el Impuesto Extraordinario para la promoción y desarrollo turístico nacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley amplía por diez años el plazo de aplicación de la Ley que crea el Fondo para la promoción y desarrollo turístico nacional para financiar las actividades y proyectos destinados a la promoción y desarrollo del turismo nacional, y el Impuesto Extraordinario para la promoción y desarrollo turístico nacional para los mismos fines.

Policy: Order No. 124 of the Committee on Environmental Protection validating the Rules on water protection zones of waterbodies.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that water protection zone is the territory adjacent to the waters of rivers, lakes, ponds, reservoirs and irrigation waterworks and irrigation systems, and main channels, where special conditions of water management are established in order to prevent pollution and depletion of water, maintain their environmental sustainability and good sanitary conditions. Within the limits of water protection areas, water protection zones are separated, with strict limitation of economic activities for sanitary protection purposes. The boundaries of water protection zones are established with the consideration of physic and geographic, soil, hydrogeological conditions, the purposeful use of the waterbody or parts thereof and the type of the relief. The dimensions of water protection zones and coastal strips of rivers, lakes, ponds, reservoirs, main channels, as well as the procedure for their use are determined by this Regulation. Along the banks of reservoirs located in the river beds and channels, the width of the water protection zone is set in accordance with the length of the river or the carrying capacity of the channel from the water edge corresponding to the normal backed water level in the reservoir. This Regulation establishes the dimensions (width and length) of water protection zones and the list of prohibited activities within their areas.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Surface water,Water conservation zone,Freshwater resources management
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Plan Estratégico de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional – PESAN 2012-2016.
Policy_Content: El Plan Estratégico de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional (PESAN) es un documento multisectorial de cobertura nacional, relativo al período 2012-2016, concebido como la principal herramienta de planificación para implementar los ejes estratégicos de la Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional del Estado guatemalteco, a través de programas integrales que contienen el conjunto de componentes, áreas y acciones estratégicas priorizadas. El Plan constituye el instrumento de la Política de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional cuya misión es alcanzar la coordinación, armonización, alineación de los esfuerzos interinstitucionales en coherencia con otras políticas sectoriales, para promover un desarrollo sostenible y sustentable con equidad, en el marco de la Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional, a fin de contribuir a mejorar las condiciones, nivel y calidad de vida de la población en territorios con mayor grado de inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional, todo ello mediante lineamientos estratégicos de planificación sectorial operativa que propicien las bases del desarrollo local enfocado a la competitividad, la diversificación autosostenibilidad y la autogestión comunitaria para la población guatemalteca.  Son ejes transversales del PESAN los siguientes: a) multiculturalidad; b) equidad de género; c) gestión de riesgo y cambio climático; 4) territorialidad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agroecology,Capacity building,Cooperative/producer organization,Disasters,Equity,Extension,Family farming,Fertilizers/nutrients,Financial agricultural measures,Fiscal and market measures,Food security,Gender,Governance,Land tenure,Public participation,Right to water,Rural employment,Smallholders/peasants,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Indigenous peoples,Climate change,Financing,Potable water,Poverty,Right to food,Human rights,Rainwater

Policy: Plan estratégico de seguridad alimentaria y nutricional para Occidente (PLANOCC) 2012-2016.
Policy_Content: El Plan estratégico de seguridad alimentaria y nutricional para Occidente (PLANOCC) es un instrumento estratégico basado en la Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional y en el Plan Estratégico de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional (PESAN). El PLANOCC se refiere al período 2012-2016 y tiene por alcance la región occidental del país, que incluye a los departamentos de Sololá, Totonicapán, Quetzaltenango, San Marcos, Huehuetenango y Quiché. El plan está diseñado para la implementación de sus objetivos estratégicos en una primera fase, con duración de 5 años. Se pretende en este período, establecer las bases para el abordaje integral e intersectorial de la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional en el área de influencia. Los principios que constituyen y determinan el marco conceptual del Planocc y el abordaje de la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional de la Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional son: la solidaridad, la soberanía alimentaria, la equidad entre hombres y mujeres, pueblos y espacio territorial, la integralidad de las acciones, la sostenibilidad, la transparencia, la precaución, la tutelaridad, la descentralización y la participación ciudadana.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Air Protection Law.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the authority and related responsibility in order to provide safe, sustainable and correct protection measures necessary for the air protection, considering the ozone layer as an essential part of it, including climate change mitigation and adaptation to climate changes, planning documents, monitoring and evaluation of air quality and of measures for the prevention and reduction of air pollution, air quality reporting and data exchange, monitoring over emissions of substances that deplete the ozone layer and fluorinated greenhouse gases, monitoring over greenhouse gas emissions.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Basic legislation,Monitoring,Data collection/reporting,Ozone layer,Offences/penalties,Climate change,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Inspection,Environmental standards,Pollution control

Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 7 articles, creates the State Programme for Agro-ecology and Incentives to Organic Agricultural production, under the State Secretariat of Agriculture, Livestock and Land Reform (SEAGRI). This Programme aims at promoting the agricultural organic production without the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides, in order to preserve and protect environmental habitats and increase the productive chain of agro-ecological production.

Policy: Decreto Nº 189 - Ley para el Fomento del Aprovechamiento de las Fuentes Renovables de Energía y Sustentabilidad Energética para el Estado y los Municipios de Guanajuato.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece las bases generales para fomentar la sustentabilidad energética en el Estado y los Municipios de Guanajuato. En primer lugar se regula la coordinación entre las autoridades estatales, municipales y federales para el aprovechamiento de fuentes renovables de energía. Por otro lado se regula la integración y funcionamiento del Consejo Estatal de Energía. Además se establecen mecanismos y formas de financiamiento para la sustentabilidad y eficiencia energética. Las fuentes renovables de energía contempladas por la Ley son las siguientes: a) el viento; b) la radiación solar en todas sus formas; c) el movimiento del agua en cauces naturales o artificiales; d) el calor de los yacimientos geotérmicos; e) la biomasa; y f) aquellas otras que los avances de la ciencia permitan determinar.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Renewable energy,Bioenergy,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 1446 of the Council of Ministers on some issues related to the competence of the Ministry of Public Health.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the Ministry of Public Health shall be national state governing body subordinated to the Council of Ministers. The Ministry shall perform the following tasks: (a) implementation of state policy in the field of protection of public health; (b) organization of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population and compliance with sanitary, epidemiological and hygienic rules and regulation; and (c) scientific research in the field of medical science. The Ministry establishes nutritional values for public organizations, rates of special dietary uses for patients of healthcare institutions and students of educational institutions.

Policy: Resolución Nº 701/2011 - Establécense los procedimientos de presentación y evaluación de solicitudes de liberación experimental de Organismos Vegetales Genéticamente Modificados que no cuenten con aprobación comercial.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto los procedimientos de presentación y evaluación de solicitudes de liberación experimental de Organismos Vegetales Genéticamente Modificados (OVGM) que no cuenten con aprobación comercial (OVGM regulados) en la República Argentina. El artículo 3º dispone que las responsabilidades emergentes de la autorización otorgada para la liberación experimental de Organismos Vegetales Genéticamente Modificados (OVGM), así como aquellas que pudieren surgir durante las distintas fases de evaluación, recaen exclusivamente en el solicitante. Además, se establece que la autorización otorgada no podrá ser objeto de transferencia, cesión ni enajenación por cualquier título.

Policy: Décret nº 2011-1371 du 27 octobre 2011 relatif à l'Institut national de l'information géographique et forestière (IGN).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret précise le statut de l'établissement public administratif dénommé « Institut national de l'information géographique et forestière (IGN) » issu de l'intégration de l'Inventaire forestier national au sein de l'Institut géographique national. L'IGN reprend les missions actuelles des deux établissements regroupés avec pour objectif de renforcer les capacités de description du territoire et de l'occupation du sol ainsi que d'inventaire de la ressource forestière. Le présent décret précise l'organisation et le fonctionnement de l'IGN, dans le cadre de son nouveau périmètre, ainsi que les dispositions financières et comptables applicables à l'établissement. Il précise également les conditions de transfert à l'IGN des agents et des droits et obligations de l'Inventaire forestier national.

Policy: Integrity Commission Law No.30 of 2011.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 31 articles aims at establishing the Integrity Commission with the main goal of (i) contributing to preventing and combating corruption; and (ii) adopting transparency in managing governance affairs at all levels by (1) investigating corruption cases; (2) following up on corruption cases that are not investigated by the Commission’s investigators through an official agency issued by its chairman; (3) developing a culture, in the public and private sectors, that values ​​integrity, respect for public service ethics, and the adoption of transparency, accountability, and interrogation, through public awareness and education programs; (4) preparing draft laws that contribute to preventing or combating corruption; (5) enhancing the Iraqi people's confidence in the government by requiring its officials to disclose their financial receivables, their foreign activities, investments, assets, gifts, or significant benefits that may lead to conflicts of interest; (6) issuing conduct regulations that include rules and standards for ethical behavior to ensure the correct performance of the duties of a public office; (7) carrying out any activity that contributes to combating or preventing corruption. The Chairman of the Commission shall (i) establish the general policy and its management; (ii) propose the annual budget; (iii) appoint and discipline the Commission employees; (iv) issue the regulations for the disclosure of finance receivables; (v) issue a code of conduct; (vi) issue the internal system of the Commission's departments. Article 10 lists the different departments of the Commission. The Commission has the power to investigate any corruption case by one of its investigators under the supervision of the competent investigating judge (art.11a). Article 17 indicates who are the people mandated to submit a financial disclosure report due to their public position. The Commission performs its duties in the field of preventing and combating corruption in cooperation with the Financial Supervision Bureau and the offices of the inspectors general (art.21).
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Order No. 863 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating Regulation on state registration of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs that are owners of the sources of emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of state registration of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs that are owners of the sources of emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air, and also registration of quantity and composition of pollutants. State registration shall include: (a) registration of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs; (b) registration of sources of pollution; and (c) registration of quantity and composition of pollutants. All registered data shall be inserted in specialized database. Federal Nature Supervision Service shall be the authorized state institution responsible for registration and keeping of the aforesaid database.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Resolution No. 33/2011 approving the National Programme for the Adaptation to Climate Changes (PANA).
Policy_Content: This Resolution, approves in the Annex the National Programme for the Adaptation to Climate Changes (PANA). This Programme aims at increasing country resistance to these climate changes through the adoption of transversal measures focused on the reduction if the negative effects of the climate changes and promoting the economic development and the sustainable use of natural resources. Several Maps and Tables are appended to the text.

Policy: Ordonnance cantonale sur l’énergie (OCEn).
Policy_Content: La présente loi met en exécution la Loi fédérale sur l’énergie du 26 juin 1998 e la loi cantonale du 15 mai 2011 sur l’énergie (LCEn). Le texte comprend 67 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Généralités (1er); Planification énergétique (2); Energie de réseau (3); Utilisation de l’énergie (4); Encouragement (5); Exécution (6); Dispositions transitoires et dispositions finales (7). Huit annexes sont jointes.

Policy: Ordonnance sur la coordination des contrôles dans les exploitations agricoles (Ordonnance sur la coordination des contrôles, OCCEA).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance porte la réglementation sur la coordination des contrôles dans les exploitations agricoles. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 674 validating the Regulation on radiation control at border checkpoints.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of radiation control at state border checkpoints, in particular vehicles, physical persons and commodities, with a view of preventing transportation across border of produce and commodities with excessive ionizing radiation levels. Radiation control shall be performed at several levels: (a) primary radiation control; (b) additional radiation control; (c) in-depth radiation examination; and (d) expertise. Radiation control at all levels must ensure compliance with radiation safety requirements.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ordonnance générale sur l'importation de produits agricoles (Ordonnance sur les importations agricoles, OIAgr).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met, entre autres, en exécution la loi du 29 avril 1998 sur l’agriculture (LAgr). Le premier chapitre traite du permis général d'importation, à savoir l'importation de produits agricoles figurant dans une des annexes de la présente ordonnance ou sous un numéro de tarif dans une des ordonnances spécifiques par produit relatives à la réglementation des marchés, requiert un permis. Le service compétent est l'Office fédérale de l'agriculture. Le texte comprend 55 articles répartis en 7 chapitres. Sept annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act amending the Ecological Agriculture Act.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to the Ecological Agriculture Act. In particular, the present Act amends provisions concerning registration of persons running business in organic farming (art. 6 of the amended Act), defines exceptions to the rules of organic farming (art. 9) and regulates animal husbandry in organic farming (art. 10) and offences (art. 33 and art. 33a).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Order No. 447 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the norms of area of district forestries and forest districts.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that district forestries shall be set within the boundaries of forest parks while forest districts shall be classified in three forest inventory categories: (1) 25 to 200 ha of forest area; (2) 400 to 800 ha of forest area; and (3) 3000 to 6000 ha of forest area.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Interministerial Order No. 419 regulating the performance of agencies and entities of the Federal Public Administration involved in environmental licensing.
Policy_Content: This Interministerial Order, consisting of four Chapters and three Annexes, regulates the performance of agencies and entities of the Federal Public Administration involved in environmental licensing, referred to in art. 14 of Law No. 11.516 of 28 August 2007. In particular, it regulates the activities of the National Indigenous Foundation-FUNAI, the Palmares Cultural Foundation-FCP, the National Historical and Artistic Heritage Institute-IPHAN and the Ministry of Health, in charge of drafting an opinion in an environmental licensing process under federal jurisdiction, in charge of the Brazilian Institute for the Environment and Renewable Natural Resources-IBAMA. It prescribes environmental studies related to the location, installation, operation and expansion of an activity or enterprise, presented as a subsidy for the analysis of the required license, such as: environmental report, environmental control plan and project, preliminary environmental report, environmental diagnosis, management plan, degraded area recovery plan and preliminary risk analysis, etc. IBAMA, at the beginning of the environmental licensing procedure, in the FCA-Activity Characterization Sheet, must request information from the entrepreneur on possible interference in indigenous land, quilombola land, protected cultural assets and in risky or endemic areas or regions for malaria.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: This Basic Policy and Action Plan for the Revitalization of Japan’s Food, Agriculture, Forestry, and Fisheries   is a multi-sectoral  policy document at national level. The overall purpose of the policy document is to enhance the competitiveness and soundness of Japan’s food, agriculture, forestry, and fisheries,   promote regional economies, and  realize an revitalization of them.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1336 du 24 octobre 2011 relatif à l'information sur la quantité de dioxyde de carbone émise à l'occasion d'une prestation de transport.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret s'applique aux prestations de transport de personnes, de marchandises ou de déménagement, effectuées par un ou plusieurs moyens de transport, ayant leur point d'origine ou de destination situé sur le territoire national, à l'exception des prestations de transport que les personnes publiques ou privées organisent pour leur propre compte. Il fixe les principes d'une méthode de calcul commune à tous les modes de transport (ferroviaire ou guidé, routier, fluvial, maritime, aérien). Le décret précise les modalités d'information du bénéficiaire. Des arrêtés du ministre chargé des transports détailleront des éléments particuliers de méthode et fixeront notamment les valeurs de référence utilisées dans les calculs.

Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Spatial Information Act of 5 October 2010. In particular, the present Law regulates the: a) enforcement of the Federal Spatial Information Act of 5 October 2007; b) collection and use of spatial information of the Canton and municipalities; c) establishment and running of the digital cadastre. The text consists of 31 articles divided into 7 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Principles (2); Official survey (3); Digital underground cadastre (4); Transversal spatial information system (5); Organization (6); Penalties and final provisions (7).

Policy: Regulation on protection of health from the adverse effects of noise and vibration.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Government Regulation is to protect human health from the adverse effects of noise and vibration. The present Regulation lays down: (a) threshold values of noise and vibration in the workplace, the method of their detection and measures to protect the health of employees; (b) threshold values of noise for protected outdoor space, protected outdoor spaces of buildings and protected interior spaces of buildings; (c) threshold values of vibration for protected spaces inside buildings; (d) method of measurement and assessment of noise and vibration for day and night. The present Regulation is composed of 23 articles divide into the following Sections: Subject matter (Sec. 1); Workplace noise (Sec. 2); Noise in the protected indoor space, protected outdoor space of buildings protected and outdoor space (Sec. 3); Vibrations at work (Sec. 4); Vibrations in protected areas (Sec. 5); Method of measurement and evaluation of noise and vibration (Sec. 6); Final provisions (Sec. 7).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 November 2011.

Policy: Regional Law No. 358-25-OZ “On realization of state plenary powers in the sphere of thermal energy supply to the population”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers of regional state bodies in relation to state regulation and supervision in the sphere of thermal energy supply to the population and rate setting for consumption of public utilities. Regional Government shall exercise the following plenary powers: (a) establishment of the authorized state institution; (b) coordination between authorized state bodies and institutions; (c) establishment of subsidies for payment of public utilities by some categories of citizens; and (d) rate setting of standard consumption of public utilities. Authorized regional executive bodies shall set rates of hot water charges and rates of reserve stock of fuel for thermal energy production, and compile regional fuel and energy balance plan.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Institution,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Water supply,Water charges

El mencionado territorio queda declarado como intangible y en consecuencia se prohíben los asentamientos y ocupaciones de hecho realizadas por personas ajenas a la titularidad del territorio indígena en cuestión.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Northern (Arctic) Federal University named after M.V. Lomonosov.
Policy_Content: The subject of cooperation under the Agreement is the interaction of the Parties in the organization of training in hydrometeorology and related fields and joint research in meteorology, hydrology, climatology, oceanology, heliogeophysics, environmental monitoring and pollution. The Parties will carry out coordinated activities aimed at using the achievements of basic science and applied research, training of specialists, in the interests of creating new technologies in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring, pollution, implementation of the results of research in the activities of Roshydromet and scientific and educational activities of the Northern Federal University. The Parties shall interact in the following fields: (a) implementation of joint scientific and educational programs and in the fields of interaction that are the subject of this Agreement; (b) exchange of information, holding joint working meetings to identify the most important issues, preparing proposals for their implementation in the field of hydrometeorology and related areas, environmental monitoring and pollution; (c) study of the atmosphere, ocean, surface waters in order to develop and create methods for the analysis and prediction of dangerous hydrometeorological phenomena, mathematical modeling of their dynamics, as well as the creation of databases of geoinformation resources, including those based on data from the Arctic Space Monitoring Center of SFU; (d) training of specialists in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields to meet the needs of Roshydromet staff renewal; (e) organization of industrial practice for students and other interested universities using the “floating university” on the research vessel “Professor Molchanov”; (f) development of scientific research on hydrometeorological and climatic processes in the Arctic Ocean seas; (g) identification and study of the links between climate change and the risks of dangerous natural processes, social and economic damages, risks of deterioration of the quality of life and health of the population; (h) development of the promising methods for monitoring environmental pollution with the involvement of the Arctic Center for Collective Use of Scientific Equipment of the Siberian Federal University; and (i) promoting the integration of federal, regional, and local observation networks, as well as the integration of information flows using geoinformation technologies.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Arrêté du 21 octobre 2011 fixant les conditions d'utilisations de certains produits de lutte contre les termites comme produits mentionnés à l'article L. 522-1 du code de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Les barrières antitermites de type résine physico-chimique (résine contenant une ou plusieurs substances actives insecticides qui durcissent après application par pulvérisation) sont des produits biocides encadrés par la directive 98/8/CE. Les barrières physicochimiques font partie des mesures de protection antitermites pouvant être employées lors de la construction d'un bâtiment neuf. L'Agence nationale de sécurité sanitaire de l'alimentation, de l'environnement et du travail a été saisie le 2 septembre 2008 par le ministère en charge de l'environnement afin de réaliser une évaluation simplifiée des risques sanitaires et environnementaux liés à la mise en œuvre de ces barrières antitermites de type résine physico-chimique. Cette évaluation conclut qu'une pluie intervenant dans un laps de temps court après l'application de ces résines par pulvérisation conduit à la lixiviation totale des substances actives insecticides, ce qui met en exergue un risque inacceptable pour l'environnement et rend de surcroît l'application du produit inefficace. Cet arrêté définit les conditions d'application des barrières antitermites de type résine physico-chimique et permet ainsi de réduire de façon significative les impacts environnementaux liés à leurs applications. Cet arrêté fixe notamment le temps de séchage minimum à respecter et l'interdiction d'application par temps de pluie.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ley Nº 4/2011 - Modifica la Ley Nº 8/2006, Ley de Sociedades Cooperativas de la Región de Murcia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley de Sociedades Cooperativas de la Región de Murcia, considerando la aplicación en la Unión Europea de las Normas Internacionales de Contabilidad (NIC), con la finalidad de aplicarlas a las sociedades cooperativas, requiriéndose la modificación de la regulación de su régimen económico, sobre todo en materia de las aportaciones, tanto obligatorias como voluntarias, de los socios al capital social de la cooperativa. La presente modificación legal deja a la libre decisión de cada sociedad cooperativa que sus estatutos sociales puedan prever la existencia de aportaciones a capital social no exigibles, pero reembolsables por decisión de la cooperativa, permitiendo así contabilizar las aportaciones de los socios como recursos propios. La norma introduce la posibilidad de desdoblar las aportaciones al capital social entre aquellas que han de ser reembolsables al socio en todo caso con motivo de su baja en la entidad y aquellas cuyo reembolso puede ser rehusado incondicionalmente por la cooperativa, posibilitando de esta manera la creación de un capital con mayor carácter de fijeza y estabilidad. Con la modificación, se posibilita a las cooperativas para que las aportaciones al capital social cuyos propietarios no tengan derecho incondicional al reembolso, puedan ser consideradas contablemente como fondos propios y no pasivos. Ello contribuirá a un reforzamiento patrimonial, en línea con lo exigido en la letra y el espíritu de las nuevas normas contables.

Policy: Atomic Energy (Radiation Safety in the Mining and Processing of Radioactive Ores) (No. 369 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide with respect to radiation safety in all stages of prospecting, mining, processing and related mining activities involving radioactive minerals and ores containing radioactive substances. An application for a licence to undertake any activity involving prospecting, site preparation, construction, mining or processing of radioactive ores shall be made to the Tanzania Atomic Energy Commission in the manner prescribed in the Third Schedule to these Regulations. An application for a license to operate a mine or ore processing facility other than a license to abandon, shall, in addition to the information required under the Atomic Energy (Protection from Ionizing Radiation) Regulations, contain the information prescribed by these Regulations. A person who holds a licence shall, among other things, (a) develop waste and tailings Management Programme to be integrated with the Radiation Protection and Safety Programme and with the overall project environmental management Programme.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1836 of 2011 licensing procedures for the construction of premises and buildings on agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides for the conditions and procedures for the licensing of building premises and facilities in exceptional cases on agricultural land. It is composed of 21 articles. Article 1 states that this Decree is mainly concerned with agricultural land already cultivated. The Decree prohibit the establishment of any facility or building outside of the urban boundaries, or in any areas that lack strategic planning. It also sets forth the types of land (exceptional cases) which can be used either for governmental projects of public utility, or projects that serve agricultural and livestock production, or privately owned land.In all of the previous cases, the consent of the Ministry of Agriculture is required. The Decree provides for the documents and administrative issues needed for the request of establishment or all premises as well as for public welfare projects. According to this degree, exceptions are also made to projects serving agricultural production, and  livestock and poultry providing for technical requirements on location and distances as well as allowing the inter-change of activities between projects.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 613-P validating the Regulation on protected area state complex reserve “Big steppe”.
Policy_Content: State complex reserve “Big steppe” is a protected area of regional significance, formed without expropriation of land plots form landowners, land tenants and land managers for an unlimited period of time. Land, subsoil, flora and fauna, waterbodies located in the reserve can be allotted for use in the manner prescribed by the regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation and the Krasnoyarsk Territory, and in accordance with this Regulation. The reserve is organized for the purpose of protection and reproduction of hunting wild fauna species authorized for commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the number of rare and endangered species of animals and birds valuable in scientific, economic and aesthetic terms, as well as protection of their habitats. The reserve was formed to perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of biodiversity of the typical natural landscape of the Kanskaya forest-steppe; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book; (c) monitoring the state of the environment, fauna, research work; and (d) organization of a system of environmental education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) hunting and hunting management; (b) final felling and selective felling for timber extraction; (c) procurement of soft resin; (d) destruction (devastation) of anthills, holes, nests and other  habitats of wild fauna species; (e) littering of the territory with household and industrial waste; (f) storage of pesticides, toxic chemicals, except for places specially equipped for the storage of hazardous substances; (g) use of pesticides, toxic chemicals; (h) travel and parking of snowmobile vehicles off public roads, with the exception of transport of bodies carrying out protection and control over compliance with the established regime or other security rules and use of natural resources on the territory of the reserve; (i) washing of any vehicles within the coastal protective strips of waterbodies; and (j) destruction or damage of installed warning or information signs (notices). Use of wild fauna species for scientific purposes and regulation of their numbers on the territory of the reserve shall be performed in accordance with acting legislation.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Tanzania Agriculture and Food Security Invesment Plan (TAFSIP) 2011-12 to 2020-21.
Policy_Content: TAFSIP is a ten-year investment plan which maps the investments needed to achieve the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program (CAADP) target of 6% annual growth in agricultural sector GDP. Its goal is to “contribute to the national economic growth, household income and food security in line with national and sectoral development aspirations”. It includes employment concerns explicitly, however this is translated into indicators and concrete activities only to a limited extent. A note shows that indicators will be gender disaggregated where possible. Formulation supported by FAO/DRET with technical inputs into the document which have been partially addressed. The TAFSIP document clarifies it should take over policy leadership from the ASDP. 109: Food and nutrition security takes a number of forms, all of which affect the quality of life and productivity of rural people. Chronic, transitory and emergency food insecurity due to poor agricultural productivity, food inaccessibility and natural disasters all play a role.

Policy: Co-operative Societies Act, 2011 (No. 31 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to establishment, registration, management, operation, reconstruction, amalgamation and dissolution of co-operative societies in Saint Christopher and Nevis. It also contains rules relative to the marketing of produce through co-operative societies and provides for settlement of disputes. For this purpose it establishes the Co-operative Societies Appeals Tribunal. Before carrying out business, co-operative societies shall be registered with the Registrar of Co-operative Societies established under this Act. Co-operative societies may establish an apex body, which shall coordinate, assist and promote activities for the development, growth and expansion of all co-operative societies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Arrêté interministériel n° 30 708/2011 portant création et organisation du Comité de coordination de la gestion et de l'inventaire de bois de rose et de bois d'ébène.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte création et organisation du Comité de coordination de la gestion et de l'inventaire de bois de rose et de bois d'ébène. Le Comité est chargé de favoriser la coopération entre les départements ministèriels concernés pour la réalisation du plan stratégique pour la gestion de stock, et de garantir la transparence notamment en ce qui concerne les démarches entreprises et la publication d'états de lieux sur l'avancement du plan d'assainissement dans le secteur.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Decree No. 1394 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on electric energy supply.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the Regulation on electric energy supply related to conclusion, fulfillment, renewal, amendment, extension and cancellation of electric energy supply, containing terms and conditions of electric energy supply, distribution and energy saving. It also specifies terms and conditions of technological connection of electricity-generating equipment to the national energy system. This Decree classifies electric energy supply in two categories: (a) for industrial purposes; and (b) for residential purposes.

Policy: Law No. 12.512 creating the Support Programmes for the Environmental Conservation and for the Promotion of Rural Productive Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 4 Chapters, creates the Programmes for the Environmental Conservation and for the Promotion of Rural Productive Activities. The Programme for the Environmental Conservation aims at promoting the conservation of Regional ecosystem, through its management and sustainable use. The implementation of this Programme will be under the Ministry of Environment. The beneficiaries of this Programme should be extremely poor families with livelihoods in the following areas: National forests, Extraction reserves, and Federal Sustainable development. The Programme for the Promotion of Rural Productive Activities aims at stimulating productive works and sustainable revenue generating activities, promoting the food and nutritional security and of beneficiaries and promote the active participation of stakeholders. The implementation of this Programme will be under the Ministry of the Agricultural and Social Development.

Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the conditions to be applied and met by all legal persons authorized to review the validity and suitability for the intended purpose of the product for fire protection, the conditions for obtaining the authorization, and the terms of expiry of the validity of documents and declared suitability for the intended purpose of products for fire protection.

Policy: Law No. 14.591 creating the State Programme for Agriculture of Social Interest (PPAIS).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 7 articles, creates the State Programme for Agriculture of Social Interest (PPAIS) aimed at family farmers, thus considered those who meet the requirements of Federal Law No. 11.326 of 24 July 2006, as well as their associations and cooperatives. The objectives of the PPAIS are: encourage the organisation and modernization of production and improve the marketing of family farming products; stimulate the production of family farming, contributing to the practice of adequate prices and expansion of the consumer market; promote the purchase of family farming products for state public bodies. For the achieving the above referred objectives, the organs of the State should use at least 30% of the resources destined for the acquisition of family agriculture foodstuff for public hospitals, prisons, public schools, institutions of social support and other entities.

Policy: Law No. 10469 dated 13 October 2011 concerning the protection against non-ionising radiations.
Policy_Content: This Law lays down rules and measures concerning public and workers’ protection against exposure from non-ionizing radiations in the frequencies of 0-300 GHz, and monitoring of such radiations. It consists of the following chapters: I - General Provisions, II- Organization of Structures of Protection against Non-ionizing Radiations, III- Sanctions, and IV- Final Provisions.

Policy: Natural Gas Supply Act (No. 1331 of 2013).
Policy_Content: The Act applies to transmission, distribution, supply and storage of natural gas, including liquefied natural gas (LNG). It also applies to biogas, gas from biomass and other types of gas on land, territorial sea, in the exclusive economic zone and on the Danish continental shelf area. The Minister for Climate, Energy and Building shall determine that transmission companies whose facilities do not have direct influence on the Danish natural gas market are fully or partially exempt from this Act. All consumers who are connected to the interconnected system or town gas grid must pay a proportionate share of Energinet.dk's costs necessary for the payment of surcharges in accordance with article 35c. Energinet.dk's administrative expenses related to the payment of subsidies shall be charged through Energinet.dk's tariffs. NO charges are applied to consumers in case of change of supplier. Energinet.dk or its subsidiaries may - in cooperation with other countries' transmission companies on climate, energy and building – have the minister's approval as co-owners of limited liability companies, whose task is to contribute to the effective exchange of gas between the countries as referred to in article 12, section 1, No. 4; and to promote competition in markets for natural gas in accordance to article 12, section 2. After prior application The Energy Monitoring Agency (Energinet.dk) shall certify companies for meeting requirements of procedures. Permission to LNG facilities may be granted only if the applicant can demonstrate that there is sufficient need for the LNG and upon compliance with terms of the exact construction and operation of the LNG facility, including collateral for disposal.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Natural gas,Energy conservation/energy production,Environmental standards,Transport/storage,Certification,Concession,Inspection,Internal trade,International trade
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Spatial Development Planning Law (2011)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for spatial development planning in Latvia. Its purpose is to ensure such spatial development planning that would raise the quality of the living environment, ensure sustainable, effective and rational use of territories and other resources, as well as targeted and balanced development of economy. According to the document, spatial development is planned by drawing up the following coherently co-ordinated spatial development planning documents: (1) at the national level – the Sustainable Development Strategy of Latvia and the National Development Plan; (2) at the regional level – the sustainable development strategy and the development programme of a planning region; (3) at the local level – the sustainable development strategy, the development programme, the spatial plan, a local plan and a detailed plan of a local government. At all the levels, when developing spatial development planning documents, a strategic environmental impact assessment must be ensured, if it is necessary in accordance with laws and regulations.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Policy/planning,Public land,Environmental planning,Sustainable development,Land-use planning,Integrated management,Cultural heritage

Policy: Arrêté du 12 octobre 2011 relatif aux installations de chargement ou de déchargement desservant un stockage de liquides inflammables soumises à autorisation au titre de la rubrique 1434-2 de la législation des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté s'inscrit dans une vaste refonte de l'ensemble des textes réglementaires qui concernent les installations de stockage de liquides inflammables soumises à autorisation ainsi que les installations de chargement ou de déchargement associées à ces stockages. Il vise principalement les installations permettant le chargement d'engins de transport (camion, train, bateau de navigation intérieure ou navire) à partir du stockage de liquides inflammables et les installations permettant le déchargement des engins de transport venant alimenter ce stockage.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent arrêté entre en vigueur partiellement à compter du 1er janvier 2012 pour les installations dont la demande d'autorisation a été effectuée avant le 1er juillet 2012. L'article 1er du présent arrêté précise les dispositions pour lesquelles est prévue une entrée en vigueur ultérieure.

Policy: Disposición Técnica Nº 1/11/CONEA - Reglamento Técnico de protección contra las radiaciones ionizantes.
Policy_Content: La presente Disposición Técnica de la Comisión Nacional de Energía Atómica (CONEA) aprueba el Reglamento Técnico de protección contra las radiaciones ionizantes, que tiene como objetivo establecer los requisitos básicos para la protección de las personas contra la exposición a la radiación ionizante y para la seguridad de las fuentes de radiación que pueden causar esta exposición, y se aplica a las prácticas, a las fuentes y a las intervenciones que se realicen en el territorio nacional, siendo de obligatorio cumplimiento para todas las entidades estatales y privadas, las personas naturales o jurídicas, nacionales o extranjeras, radicadas o con representación en el territorio nacional que realicen prácticas asociadas al empleo de radiaciones ionizantes o cualquier actividad con ellas relacionadas.

Policy: Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Amendment of the Energy Act 2008 etc.) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 2453 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, for purposes of implementation by the United Kingdom of Directive 2009/31/ EC, extend the territorial scope of Part 1, Chapter 3, of the Energy Act 2008 to all parts of England, Wales, Northern Ireland and their internal waters. Originally, that Chapter applied to the United Kingdom territorial sea and the Gas Importation and Storage Zone referred to in section 1 of the Act. Policy: Land and Marine Management Strategy for Grenada.
Policy_Content: The Land and Marine Management Strategy for Grenada is a national strategy adopted by the Government of Grenada in 2011 to guide the management of the land and marine sector. The overall goal of the Strategy is to achieve integrated national development that is environmentally sustainable. The instrument seeks to develop a coherent framework with an appropriate set of strategies that will foster productive and optimal utilization of land, freshwater, coastal and marine resources in an environmental sustainable manner. To achieve this, the Strategy will develop a legislative policy framework for land and marine management, establish network administrator organizations, develop tools for management of land and marine resources, and develop a framework for planning, implementation, monitoring and review.
