Policy: Governor’s Decree validating Forest plan.
Policy_Content: The Governor decrees that Regional Forest plan shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.Outrun pastures shall be widely used for transhumance on Alpine meadows. In case of low snow cover pastoralism shall be performed all the year round.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 301 - Ley de desarrollo social y humano para el Estado de Veracruz.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto promover, proteger y garantizar el pleno ejercicio de los derechos sociales de los veracruzanos y demás habitantes del Estado, mediante una política integral de desarrollo social y humano, disminuyendo la desigualdad social en sus diversas formas, derivada de la inequitativa distribución de la riqueza, los bienes y los servicios, entre los individuos, grupos sociales y ámbitos territoriales. Los derechos sociales reconocidos y protegidos por esta Ley contemplan expresamente el derecho a la alimentación y a disfrutar de un medio ambiente sano. Son fines específicos de estas disposiciones integrar las políticas y programas contra la pobreza, en el marco de las políticas contra la desigualdad social, así como fomentar la equidad de género en el diseño y operación de las políticas públicas.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Right to clean/healthy environment,Gender,Human rights,Indigenous peoples,Right to food,Poverty,Equity
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific
Entry into force notes: Esta Ley entró en vigencia el 2 de noviembre de 2011.

Policy: National Youth Policy of Barbados.
Policy_Content: The Commonwealth Youth Programme (CYP) advocated that a National Youth Policy must begin with a vision of youth that expresses faith in the future, especially by young people. During the process of gathering data for the National Youth Policy, a structured mechanism was sought to enable young people to discuss youth issues and to make recommendations on how best to address them. From the beginning it was realized that using traditional methods of consulting young men and women on an ad hoc basis would confirm the suspicion that young people were still not being considered as serious partners in national development. It was therefore decided that if the National Youth Policy of Barbados was to do justice to the modern challenges facing young people in a rapidly changing environment then there needed to be a national platform on which young people could, on a regular basis, express their views, participate in the process of making decisions that affect their lives and showcase their talents. This need became more pressing in the contemporary climate of near-hysteria about the deviant behaviour of a small segment of the youth population. With respect to the country’s flagship industry, tourism, it recognized that immediate action was necessary to expand and diversify the tourism product with focus on the development of special areas, market expansion and airlift. In agriculture, emphasis would be placed on greater use of technology in an effort to put land resources to good use, to save foreign exchange, and ensure food security. The energy, sector would be targeted for the advancement of alternative sources of energy such as wind, waste matter and solar. The Policy Vision, Goals, and Objectives of contemporary youth are clearly identified under these key strategy areas for intervention: a) Employment; b) Education; c) The Family; d) Core Values; e) Gangs; f) Housing; g) Lifestyle Diseases; h) Political Participation; i) The Environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Politique Nationale Genre 2011-2021.
Policy_Content: La Politique Nationale Genre 2011-2021 est un instrument à portée nationale qui a pour but de faire de Djibouti une société égalitaire, sans discrimination où les femmes et les hommes, dans tous le domaines de la vie sociale, économique et politique, travaillent équitablement et en parfaite harmonie au développement du pays. A cet effet, la PNG fonde son intervention sur deux objectifs globaux: 1) l’instauration d’un environnement socioculturel, juridique, économique, politique et institutionnel favorable à la réalisation de l’équité et de l’égalité de genre dans la société djiboutienne; 2) l’intégration effective du genre dans les interventions de développement dans tous les secteurs d’activité. Ainsi, la politique préconise cinq orientations stratégiques (OS): 1) OS1, Promotion d’une conscience de genre au niveau des ménages et de la communauté; 2) OS2, Renforcement de l’accès équitable des femmes, des hommes et des adolescent(e)s aux services sociaux de base; 3) OS3, Promotion équitable du potentiel de la femme et de l’homme au sein  de l’économie et de leur accès aux ressources économiques; 4) OS4, Renforcement de l’exercise équitable des droits des femmes et des hommes et de leur participation dans les instances de gestion et de décisions économiques et politiques; 5) OS5, Renforcement des capacités institutionnelles nationales de mise en oeuvre de la PNG.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Stratégie Nationale de Gestion des Risques de Catastrophes & Plan d’Action.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie Nationale de Gestion des Risques de Catastrophes & Plan d’Action est un instrument à portée nationale qui est conçue pour contribuer à la réduction des risques de catastrophes. La stratégie définit 5 axes stratégiques pour la réduction des risques de catastrophes, notamment: 1) Engagement des pouvoirs publics; 2) Évaluation des risques; 3) Alerte précoce et préparation à la réponse; 4) Sensibilisation; 5) Mobilisation des ressources et renforcement des capacités nationales.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Medium-Term Policy Framework 2011-2014.
Policy_Content: This policy, which a multi-sectoral approach and relating to the 2011-2014 period, sets out measures and actions to promote sustainable development in Trinidad and Tobago. The mission is to achieve economic inclusiveness in an innovation-driven growth economy with greater equity, more meaningful participation and a rising tide of prosperity for all in Trinidad and Tobago. The policy is structured upon seven Pillars, as follows: (1) People-Centred Development; (2) Poverty Eradication and Social Justice; (3) National and Personal Security; (4) Information and Communication Technologies; (5) A More Diversified, Knowledge Intensive Economy; (6) Good Governance; (7) Foreign Policy. The following strategic priorities are outlined for 2011-2014: Crime and Law and Order (Chapter III), Agriculture and Food Security (Chapter IV), Health Care Services and Hospitals (Chapter V), Economic Growth, Job Creation, Competitiveness And Innovation (Chapter VI), Poverty Reduction and Human Capital Development (Chapter VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 536 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food validating the Regulation on the procedure for managing of agrochemical certificate of a field and a land plot.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth the procedure for managing of agrochemical certificate of a field and a land plot, a document containing data on the agrochemical characteristics of soils and the state of their contamination with toxic substances and radionuclides, the form of which is attached in the Annex I. The agrochemical certificate of the field, land plot originates from the agrochemical certification of all agricultural lands, which is conducted for the purpose of exercise of state control over changes in fertility, soil contamination by toxic substances and radionuclides, rational use of agricultural lands. Agrochemical certification of arable land is carried out once in 5 years, hayfields, pastures and perennial plantations – once in 5-10 years and it is mandatory for all landowners and land tenants.

Policy_Content: This strategy aims to develop new renewable energy resources which are not yet widely explored in Lao PDR to replace resources that will be exhausted in the future, also known as “non-renewable energy” (fossil fuels, coal, natural gas etc). These renewable energy resources comprise biomass energy (biofuels, biogas, etc.); solar energy; wind; small hydropower (pag. 4).

Policy: Namibian Agriculture Marketing and Trade Policy and Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Agriculture Marketing and Trade Policy and Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at improving Namibia’s agricultural marketing and trade in the domestic and international markets that would result in the country reaping maximum benefits to achieve the objectives of Vision 2030. The overall goal shall be achieved by (i) promoting a culture where consumers will opt for Namibian originating agriculture products over foreign products in both domestic and international markets; (ii) guaranteeing that the products are of exceptional quality and comply with international standards; and (iii) ensuring that they are visible and accessible to the consumers. Consequently, it is necessary to ensure that all agricultural and agro-industrial products, both imports and Namibian originating products, destined for the domestic market meet the set minimum quality, technical regulations, standards and food safety requirements. For the purpose of this document, agriculture-related industries are understood to include sectors related to (i) inputs such as seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and agricultural machinery; (ii) processing and manufacturing; (iii) transportation, storage, retailing; and (iv) service and information such as finance, administration, and research and development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Les axes stratégiques identifiés dans le cadre de l’atteinte des objectifs de la présente stratégie sont : Axe 1 : Accroissement des superficies exploitées; Axe 2 : Intensification durable de la production rizicole ; Axe 3 : Valorisation de la production rizicole ; et Axe 4 : Recherche – Diffusion, appui-conseil, renforcement des capacités des acteurs.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1257 du 10 octobre 2011 relatif aux programmes d'actions à mettre en œuvre en vue de la protection des eaux contre la pollution par les nitrates d'origine agricole.
Policy_Content: Les programmes d'actions visant à lutter contre la pollution par les nitrates comportent des mesures destinées à une bonne maîtrise des fertilisants azotés et à une gestion adaptée des terres agricoles, dans l'objectif de restaurer et de préserver la qualité des eaux. Le décret a pour objet de remplacer les actuels programmes d'actions départementaux par un programme d'actions national et des programmes d'actions régionaux. Un groupe régional d'expertise "nitrates" est créé pour proposer les références techniques nécessaires à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle de certaines mesures du programme d'actions national.

Policy: Administrative Order No. 21 on the Revised Rules and Regulations Implementing the Social Reform and Poverty Alleviation Act.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order, consisting of eight Rules, establishes the Revised Rules and Regulations Implementing the Social Reform and Poverty Alleviation Act. These Rules are promulgated to proscribe the procedures and guidelines for the implementation of Title I of RA No. 8425. It is the policy of the State to: adopt a sustainable, integrated, area-based, sectoral and focused intervention to poverty alleviation wherein every poor Filipino family shall be empowered to meet its minimum basic needs of health, food and nutrition, water and environmental sanitation, income security, shelter and decent housing, peace and order, education and functional literacy, participation in governance and family care and psycho-social well-being; actively pursue asset reform or redistribution of productive economic resources to the basic sectors, including the adoption of a system of public spending which is targeted towards the poor; institutionalize and enhance the Social Reform Agenda (SRA), which embodies the results of the series of consultations and summits on poverty alleviation; adopt and operationalize the following principles and strategies as constituting the national framework integrating various structural reforms and anti-poverty initiatives: i Social reform shall be a continuing process that addresses the basic inequities in Philippine society through a systematic package of social interventions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: The Seventh Five-Year National Socio-Economic Development Plan (2011-2015).
Policy_Content: The Seventh Five-year National Socio-Economic Development Plan (2011-2015) is a national multi-sectoral plan that sets out the goals for social and economic development of the country for the period 2011-2015. The Plan aims to reach sufficient food production to meet demands by 2015 and sets a number of indicators to measure the production of rice, meat and fish, corn, vegetables, fruits, grain and livestock through a number of programmes and focused projects by application of modern techniques and technologies to raise productivity, revising sources of funds and tax policy, production, processing and marketing, as well as personnel development and training.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Norm MAPA No. 46 establishing Technical Regulation for organic systems used for Animal and Plant Production.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 4 Titles and 7 Annexes, divided in 119 articles, establishes the Technical Regulation for organic systems used for Animal and Plant Production. It also lays down the list of allowed substances to be used in organic systems for Animal and plant production (detailed from Annex I to VII). Art. 4 specifies that organic systems of production should aim at: taking care of the conservation of permanent protected areas; reducing the action of mankind works on natural ecosystems; protection, conservation and rational use of natural resources; improving animal and plant biodiversity and rehabilitation of degraded areas.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law lays down legal grounds for promotion of tourism thus ensuring exercise of right of citizens to recreation, free movement and access to historical and cultural heritage. Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1757-r validating the Strategy of social and economic development of the Urals Federal District for the period up to 2020.
Policy_Content: Strategy of social and economic development of the Urals Federal District for the period up to 2020 is a regional cross-sectoral policy document, which determines strategic guidelines, tasks, priorities, a scientifically based scenario of socio-economic development, ways and mechanisms to achieve goals aimed at constantly improving the level and quality of life of the population, as well as sustainable development of the economy of the Ural Federal District for the period until 2020. One of the priorities is to achieve the maximum possible use of the agricultural and production potential of the regions of the Ural Federal District for the stable development of its agricultural sector and ensuring food security of the population. Development of forestry complex envisages implementation of the following measures: (a) improving the organization of the rational and sustainable use of forests, the most important link of which should be the institution of long-term lease of forest plots with a full cycle of forest resources reproduction; (b) modernization of forestry and timber processing enterprises; (c) ensuring the efficient use of forests, as well as the development of market mechanisms for the use, conservation, protection and reproduction of forests; and (d) creation of a system of model forests in the District, which will help to solve the problem of pilot felling and other scientific research aimed at improving forest management and innovative development of the forestry complex.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry
Keyword: Policy/planning,Agricultural development,Food security,Agricultural commodities,Sustainable development,Forest management/forest conservation,Sustainable use,Afforestation/reforestation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Research

Policy: Regional Law No. 33-z "On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. Energy saving and improvement of energy saving shall envisage: (a) formation of the system of stimulation in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; (b) setting up energy management bodies; (c) improvement of registration of energy resources;  (d) stimulation of use of renewable energy resources; and (e) innovation. Public edifices and residential facilities shall be equipped with energy consumption metering devices.  Planning of energy consumption shall be carried out by the outcome of energy inspection and availability of fuel and energy resources.

Policy: Ordinance by the governing Council relating to environmental legislation.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Federal Environment Protection Act of 7 October 1983. In particular, article 1 establishes that the Environment Office of the Canton Thurgau is responsible for the correct and efficient enforcement of the afore-mentioned Federal Act. Furthermore, the Environment Office shall inform the public properly about issues of environment protection and the state of environmental pollution. The text consists of 45 articles divided into 10 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Protection of hazardous incidents (2); Incentive tax (3); Soil protection (4); Air hygiene (5); Noise prevention (6); Protection against non-ionizing radiation (7); Environmentally hazardous substances (8); Genetic technology in the non-human field (9); Transitional and final provisions (10).

Section 2 establishes that a mineral reserve for all minerals is established or continued over each parcel or tract of land identified by a site number and name set out in Column 1 of the Table, within the mining division and land district set out in Column 2 of the Table opposite the site number and name. Policy: Nairobi Action Plan on Large Scale Land-Based Investments in Africa.
Policy_Content: The High Level Forum on Foreign Direct Investments in Land in Africa, representing African governments, Members of Parliament, traditional leaders, private sector, civil society and other stakeholders, met in Nairobi, Kenya from 4 to 5 October, 2011. They resolve to work in close consultation with governments, parliaments, Regional Economic Communities (RECs), private sector, traditional leaders, civil society, development partners and other stakeholders to promote alternative land based investment models. These models should aim to increase agricultural productivity, maximize opportunities for Africa’s farmers, with special attention to smallholders and minimize the potential negative impacts of large-scale land acquisitions, such as land dispossession and environmental degradation, in order to achieve an equitable and sustainable agricultural and economic transformation that will ensure food security and development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 806 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on the state nature biosphere reserve “Russian Arctica”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state nature biosphere reserve “Russian Arctica” shall be located in the Archangel region. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) introduction of scientific methods in the field of environmental protection; and (f) restoration of damaged and disturbed natural, historical and cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the state nature biosphere reserve “Russian Arctica” shall be prohibited the following activities: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) commercial, coastal fisheries, and artisanal and sport fishing; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (g) blasting operations; (h) harvesting of non-timber products; (i) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction; (j) destruction and damage of local information boards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, equipped ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings in the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (k) introduction of alien species; (l) explosive works; (m) waste disposal; (n) organization of mass sport and entertainment events; (o) introduction of alien species; (p) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (q) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (r) unauthorized archeological excavations; and (s) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Biosphere reserves,Ecosystem preservation,Cultural heritage,Monitoring,Research,Tourism,Education,Waste disposal,Non-timber products,Management/conservation,Wild fauna
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Complementary Law No. 103 creating the Fund for Agricultural and Livestock Protection (FUNDEAGRO).
Policy_Content: This Law creates the Fund for Agricultural and Livestock Protection (FUNDEAGRO) as an agricultural and livestock protection measure, in order to enforce liabilities and compensations to the owner for an animal or plant affected by disease or pest. FUNDEAGRO will be constituted of the following resources: revenues from the application of fines for illegal activity; revenue from taxes and services from the Agricultural Protection Agency of the State of Ceará (ADAGRI); revenues from agreements and contracts entered into by the State with the Union, municipalities, public and private institutions. FUNDEAGRO beneficiaries are producers who fit under specific conditions. FUNDEAGRO will be managed by the ADAGRI, through a Management Committee and Executive Committee, which will have their attributions, composition and functioning regulated by Decree.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Keyword: Special fund,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Inspection,Monitoring,Animal health,Animal production,Animal welfare

Policy: Decree on types of charges and criteria for calculation of charges for air pollutants.
Policy_Content: This Decree, based on the provisions of the Federal Law on environmental protection fund, determines the types of compensation for air pollutants, here divided in relation to their type (air pollutants that derive from technological processes, industrial plants, devices and facilities which emit SO2, NO2 and particulate matter-dust), quantity and origin of such emissions. This text also set the obligations of taxpayers, calculation criteria for such fees, including possible corrective incentive coefficients.

Policy: Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) Strategic Plan 2011-2016
Policy_Content: The Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) Strategic Plan 2011-2016 is a national cross-sectoral strategic plan of the United States of America. BARDA’S overarching vision is of a nation with the capability to respond quickly and effectively to deliberate, natural, and emerging threats so as to minimize their impact and recover promptly. A critical enabling factor for the realization of this vision is the existence of a robust domestic pharmaceutical and biotechnology sector that actively collaborates with the U.S. Government to address unmet medical countermeasure and public health requirements. BARDA’s mission is to develop and procure needed medical countermeasures, including vaccines, therapeutics, diagnostics, and non-pharmaceutical countermeasures, against a broad array of public health threats, whether natural or intentional in origin. BARDA was created to address gaps in the U.S. Government medical countermeasure development and procurement process and to bridge the “valley of death” that separates candidates identified in early research from potential Food and Drug Administration (FDA) licensure/approval by providing funding, technical support and services necessary to advance candidate products through the developmental pipeline.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., General
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1.336/2011 - Regula el contrato territorial como instrumento para promover el desarrollo sostenible del medio rural.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto regular los contratos territoriales que celebren las Administraciones Públicas con los titulares de explotaciones agrarias como instrumento de apoyo al desarrollo rural sostenible y los contratos territoriales de zona rural que celebren las Administraciones Públicas competentes con los titulares de las explotaciones agrarias de las zonas rurales. El contrato territorial es un instrumento formal que establece el conjunto de compromisos suscritos entre una Administración Pública y el titular de una explotación agraria para orientar e incentivar su actividad en beneficio de un desarrollo sostenible del medio rural.

Policy: Land Registry (Fees) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 348 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order prescribes the fees to be taken in the Land Registry for the purposes of the Land Registration Act (Northern Ireland) 1970 and the manner in which those fees are to be paid. The principal changes in respect of the repealed 2010 Regulations concern: ad-valorem fees for leases, registration and application fees, and fees for an application for update of entries in an existing land certificate.

Policy: Administrative measures for major changes of hydropower engineering projects.
Policy_Content: These Measures aim to strengthen the hydropower project design and construction management, regulate design change behavior, and ensure the safety and quality of the projects. The Text consists of 13 articles. Design changes are those changes in the main engineering parameters, engineering design and migrant resettlement scheme in the stage of bidding design and in the stage of construction details design. The definitions of major design changes in hydropower projects are provided for in the Annex. After receiving the application for review of major design changes of the construction unit, the review unit shall be responsible for organizing and carrying out the review work, and submit the review opinions to the National Energy Administration.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 1057-OZ “On some issues related to turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning turnover of agricultural land within plenary powers pertaining to the jurisdictional competence of the regional administration. Privatization of agricultural land pertaining to regional state or municipal property shall begin from 1 January 2004. Minimum consolidated agricultural land plot area shall be two ha. Maximum agricultural land plot area that can be owned by a single household or by a single legal person within a single administrative unit shall be twenty-five percent of total available agricultural land area within the boundaries of a single municipal unit. Regional administration and local government shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land consolidation,Local government,Jurisdictional competence,Public land,Private land,Property rights,Land tenure,Common property
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Executive Decree No. 156/11 approving the Regulation of the National Direction of Agro-Industry within the Ministry of Geology, Mining and Industry.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Direction of Agro-Industry within the Ministry of Geology, Mining and Industry (DNAI). This Regulation, consisting of 4 Chapters and 1 Annex, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled to promote the Agro-Industry development, aiming at the incorporation of a processing industry system and the silvo-pastoralism activity within the National territory.

Policy: Act No. CXXVIII of 2011 concerning disaster management and amending certain related acts.
Policy_Content: This Act declares that disaster management is a national matter and it is duty of the State. It is composed of eight chapters. This Act shall be applied, in order to prevent disasters in the territory of Hungary, to human activities threatening with disaster, in case of danger, disaster, and if prevention is necessary against the harmful effects of a disaster. Chapter II provides for the governance of disaster recovery, including the tasks of the Government and governmental coordination, of the minister in charge of disaster management, of local governmental offices and of local commissions for protection, of the mayor, of services, of voluntary organizations. Anybody perceiving or having information of a disaster or the hazard thereof, must report it to the disaster recovery authorities, to the local fire-service and to the mayor’s office. Chapter III contains detailed rules regarding disaster recovering organs under the control of the minister and their tasks. Chapter IV regards the prevention of serious accidents involving hazardous substances. Chapter V contains the definition of risk of disaster and of danger, and provides for extraordinary measures to be taken by the Government in case of danger. Chapter VI regulates the operation of the civil protection service and the obligation of providing economic and material services. Chapter VII provides for the reimbursement of expenses for preparative actions and for recovery, and their cover.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Data collection/reporting,Governance,Hazardous substances,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Act entered into force on 6 May 2014.

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.366/11 - Por la cual se establece un régimen de aprovechamiento para la especie Copernicia alba - Karanda'y para la Región occidental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece disposiciones para el aprovechamiento de la especie Copemicia alba (Karanda'y). En este sentido, establece el diámetro mínimo permitido para la corta de dicha especie y el máximo de aprovechamiento por hectárea. Las personas físicas o jurídicas que se acojan al régimen dispuesto en la presente Resolución deben inscribirse en el Registro Público Forestal.

Policy: Punjab Power Development Board Act 2011 (Act XVIII of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 21 sections divided into four Chapters, provides for the establishment of the Punjab Power Development Board for the implementation of policies of the Government to facilitate the private investors in power sector and to harness the energy generation resources in the Province. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Board, entitled to perform the following activities: facilitate the private investors on in matters relating to the setting up of power projects; implement the policy relating to power generation and coordinate with various governmental agencies in the field of power generation; negotiate and finalize implementation plans, feasibility and operational studies; receive fees and charges from private investors in processing of their applications for power projects; issue certificate, permission or licence for use freshwater or land for power generation; explore potential sites for hydel and coal power generation and develop non-conventional sources of energy including solar, wind, biomass, biogas and solid waste; co-ordinate with any Federal authority for installation of power houses, grid stations and transmission lines; encourage and ensure exploitation of indigenous resources for development of thermal or hydel power projects in the Province; encourage the local and foreign entities to form joint ventures for participation in the development of the power projects; acquire, if necessary, land for power projects, etc.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Institution,Energy conservation/energy production,Bioenergy,Environmental planning,Biofuel,Public private partnership (PPP),Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Renewable energy,Research,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: Décret n°  2011-1215 du 30 septembre 2011 relatif aux pouvoirs du ministre chargé de l'énergie en matière d'agrément de plans d'actions d'économies d'énergie et de délivrance de certificats d'économies d'énergie.
Policy_Content: Le dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie repose sur une obligation de réalisation d'économies d'énergie imposée aux fournisseurs d'énergie dont les ventes annuelles sont supérieures à un seuil. Ces obligations sont assorties d'une pénalité financière pour les fournisseurs d'énergie ne les remplissant pas dans le délai imparti. Les fournisseurs d'énergie peuvent s'acquitter de leurs obligations par la détention de certificats d'économies d'énergie, obtenus sous certaines conditions à la suite d'actions d'économies d'énergie ou par l'achat à d'autres acteurs ayant mené ces actions. Depuis le début du dispositif, l'instruction des demandes était prise en charge par les préfets de département, en fonction de la localisation du siège social du demandeur. Afin d'adapter le dispositif aux objectifs plus ambitieux de la deuxième période d'obligations d'économies d'énergie tout en conservant sa fiabilité et en maîtrisant sa charge administrative, le décret prévoit de confier l'ensemble des compétences en matière d'agrément de plans d'actions d'économies d'énergie et de délivrance de certificats d'économies d'énergie au ministre chargé de l'énergie.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree No. 43.216 regulating the State Policy on Climate Change and Sustainable Development.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 12 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes norms for the implementation of State Law No. 5.690 of 14 April 2010, establishing the State Policy on Global Climate Change and Sustainable Development. In particular, it regulates the necessary adaptations to the impacts derived from climate change and takes measures in order to contribute to the reduction of the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. The targets for reducing emissions of greenhouse gases - GHG in Rio de Janeiro will be set with base year in 2010 and horizon in 2030, both for statewide application and for specific sectors of activity. The State should stimulate the increase of the participation of Low Carbon GDP in the state GDP, in order to integrate the State Policy on Global Climate Change and Sustainable Development to the principles of the Green Economy. The actions related to the Green Economy will observe the following principles: Generation of income and creation of jobs in sectors of low environmental impact and that contribute to the sustainable development; Reduce poverty through the development of low income areas and promotion of sustainable infrastructure; Valuation of assets such as: biodiversity, water resources, etc. through the promotion of environmental accounting. Promotion of programmes to increase efficiency in the use of resources and reduction of waste; Use market mechanisms to reduce emissions, promote new technologies and engage the financial and industrial sectors; Promote technological innovation in key areas such as renewable energy generation and sustainable construction. Creation of technological poles and promotion of pilots of new technologies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Farming,Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Poverty,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Enforcement/compliance,Institution,Climate change,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Emissions,Renewable energy

Policy: Notification of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce No. 1791/MOIC.DIMEX on Procedures to issue import and export license for plantation timber.

Pursuant to the following: Prime Minister’s Order No. 17/PM of 22 September 2008 on the governance, protection of forests and timber business; Government Secretariat’s notification No. 284/GS of 21 February 2012 on the authorization of the rights to the Department of Industry and Commerce at Provincial, Capital to approve the exportation of round wood (logs); Instruction Order No. 0395/MOIC of 25 February 2011 on elimination of obstacles for the circulation of goods; and Notification No. 0826/MOIC.DIMEX of 3 May 2011 on Import and Export Licensing in Lao PDR. The Minister of Industry and Commerce issues the following notification: In order to promote the utilization of plantation timber in place of natural timber in future as the raw material to supply wood processing factories, establishes that export licenses will be issued for plantation timber for company/factories for timber included in the annual harvesting plan of the Government and shall follow the following procedures for the exportation of plantation timber; importation of plantation timber; Necessary documents for importation or exportation of plantation timber; Duration of the consideration; Validity of license and renewal of license.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Authorization/permit,Internal trade,International trade,Timber,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Procedural matters,Planting material/seeds

Policy: Regulation No. 973 on for grants to non-governmental environmental organizations and charitable environmental foundations.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to facilitate commitments to environmental issues. The subsidy will encourage environmental activities locally, regionally and nationally. Subsidy shall be granted to institutions, foundations and NGOs. Allocation of grants shall be  split in two; one as 70% of the total allocated subsidy and one of 30% to societies. Ratio calculation shall be scored in a point-system (article 7). Granted subsidy under 500 000 NOK shall be paid on a semi-annual basis, and between NOK 500 000 and NOK 3 500 000 on a quartely basis. NOK 3.5 million and over shall be disboursed monthly.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 1 January 2011 for grant applications for the year 2012.

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 29/2011/A establishing the regime for preventing and managing hazardous residues.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree, consisting of  VII Titles, divided in 246 articles and XI Annexes, establishes the regime for preventing and managing hazardous residues within the Autonomous Region of Azores. It applies for all activities related with residue management (including: collection, transport, storage, treatment, processing and elimination of residues, soil decontamination and monitoring of final locations for storing harmful residues). It also applies for all packaging and containers placed on the market (for local or external market uses). The aim of this Decree is to protect and prevent the negative impact that these residues may have on the natural environment and on the human health. In particular it provides for preventing the pollution of the following natural elements: environment, superficial and underground waters, soil, air and atmosphere, in particular focusing on the reduction of the production of greenhouse effect. Annexes list requirements, standards, criteria and classification of harmful residues for the environment.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Environmental standards,Pollution control,Residues,Hazardous substances,Waste disposal,Waste prevention,Packaging/labelling,Classification/declassification,Disinfection/disinfestation,Waste management

Policy: Ley Nº 3.871 - Ley de Adaptación y Mitigación al Cambio Climático.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece las acciones, instrumentos y estrategias adecuadas de adaptación y mitigación al Cambio Climático en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, para reducir la vulnerabilidad humana y de los sistemas naturales, protegerlos de sus efectos adversos y aprovechar sus beneficios. El artículo 3º enumera los principios que rigen esta materia, a saber: a) Responsabilidades Comunes pero Diferenciadas; b) Transversalidad del Cambio Climático en las políticas de Estado; c) Prioridad. La autoridad ambiental de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires es responsable de la elaboración y adopción del Plan de Adaptación y Mitigación al Cambio Climático, cuyas finalidades son, entre otras: a) la proyección de políticas de Estado en materia de adaptación y mitigación al cambio climático para las generaciones presentes y futuras ; b) la incorporación del concepto de los riesgos climáticos futuros, su monitoreo y el manejo de riesgos, en los planes de formulación de políticas; c) la reducción de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en el ámbito territorial de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Emissions,Basic legislation,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy_Content: This Law of Parliament amends and re-publishes Law No. 9/2005 establishing the Fund for Petroleum sector. Amendments aim at regulating the principles of investment, allowing a better flexibility in terms of diversification of applications in order to increase in the future investments for performing any operation related to petroleum sector. It also rules for the requirements to be met in order to benefit from such Fund incentives.

Policy: Ordinance on the support of entrepreneurship in agriculture and rural development.
Policy_Content: This Government Ordinance, which is composed of 23 articles and 13 Annexes, lays down conditions of granting government support to entrepreneurship in agriculture and rural development in the form of grants. In particular, the support includes the subsidies to: participate in exhibition (art. 3), maintenance of herd books (art. 4), testing breeding value of animals (art. 5), collection of livestock by-products (art. 6), pollination of bees (art. 7), loss of livestock due to health measures (art. 8), loss of crops due to phytosanitary measures (art. 9), improve the quality of agricultural products (art. 12), improve the quality of processed agricultural products (art. 16), protection of fish genetic resources (art. 17), loss of fish due to health measures (art. 19). The subsidy is provided by the paying agency to the applicant after the submission of the application and fulfillment of prescribed conditions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Keyword: Agricultural development,Less favoured areas,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Special fund,Policy/planning,Capacity building

Policy: Decree on the support to forestry and rural development.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, which is composed of nine articles and three Annexes, lays down the ways and conditions of providing support to forestry and rural development. In particular, the support includes the subsidies to: sustainable forest management (art. 2), development of recreational functions of forests (art. 3), promotion (art. 4), protective measures against bark beetles (art. 5), participation in exhibition (art. 6). The subsidy is provided by the paying agency to the applicant after the submission of the application and fulfillment of prescribed conditions.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Law on restitution of confiscated property and compensation.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the conditions, manner and procedure of returning confiscated property and compensation for confiscated property, which is on the territory of the Republic of Serbia. This process shall be applied in relation with properties confiscated on the basis of previous agrarian reform, nationalization process, sequestration, as well other based on the acts of nationalization, after 9 March 1945, and regards properties confiscated form their legitimate owners.

Policy: Regulation establishing quota of emission allowance which can be granted to installations included in the scheme for greenhouse gases emission trading.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs, establishes percentage quota of emission allowance which can be granted to installations included in the scheme for greenhouse gases emission trading starting from 2013. The quota is established individually for: (1) fuel combustion installations excluding combustion of hazardous wastes or municipal with minimum thermal power grater than 20 MW, producing electrical energy, operating since at least 2008; (2) installations from sectors recognized as threatened to significant risk of emissions; (3) other installations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Regulation on monitoring of physical and chemical properties of liquid fuels.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment and Spatial Planning lays down, in accordance with Directive 98/70/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council relating to the quality of petrol and diesel fuels and amending Council Directive 93/12/EEC, rules of: (1) the monitoring of physico-chemical properties of fuels; (2) the method of reporting on measurements; (3) the conditions of granting and withdrawing authorization to carry out the monitoring. The present Regulation is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Monitoring of properties of fuel (Sec. 2); Carrying out the monitoring (Sec. 3); Annual reporting on monitoring (Sec. 4); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 5).

Policy: Parks (Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur) By-Laws 2012.

These By-Laws, consisting of 15 sections divided into four Parts, apply only to the Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur. Part II specifies the following matters: Offences for illegal activities; Prohibition on entry of animals; Prohibition on the catching, trapping or killing of animals; Prohibition on entry of vehicles; Prohibition on indiscriminate parking; Prohibition of entry during specific hours; Closure of park; Removal order from park. Policy: Ordonnance sur le registre foncier (ORF).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance règle:a) l’organisation de la tenue du registre foncier; b) la structure, le contenu et les effets juridiques du registre foncier; c) les communications et les transactions électroniques avec l’office du registre foncier; d) la procédure à suivre pour l’inscription, la modification et la radiation des droits réels immobiliers, de même que celle pour l’inscription, la modification et la radiation des annotations et des mentions; e) la délivrance des renseignements et la consultation du registre foncier. Le texte comprend 165 articles répartis en 6 titres comme suit: Dispositions générales (I); Communications et transactions avec l’office du registre foncier (2); Inscription, modification et radiation (3); Délivrance, modification et cancellation des titres de gage (4); Division et réunion d’immeubles (5); Dispositions finales (6).

Policy: Order No. 248 of the Minister of Environmental Protection amending Order No. 207-p of the Ministry of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the state environmental audit.
Policy_Content: Item 11 shall be amended to add the following wording: “11. Mandatory environmental audit shall be applicable to the following objects: 1) projected economic activities; 2) projects of state programmes having environmental impact; 3) projected emissions; 4) rules and regulations that may cause negative environmental impact; 5) contract for subsoil management; 6) projects of substantiation for expansion and suppression of protected areas; 7) biological substantiation for management of wild fauna and wild flora; 8) land use planning projects; 9) classification of areas as natural and technological disaster areas; 10) economic and other activities that may cause negative transboundary environmental effects; and 11) documentation related to application of technologies, techniques and equipment imported to the Republic of Kazakhstan.”

Policy: Shipping (Marine Inquiries and Investigations) Regulations 2011 (L.N. No. 69 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the  Shipping Act 1998 as to marine inquiries and investigations to be conducted by a Board of marine inquiry appointed under section 86 of the Act in accordance with the Code of the International Standards and Recommended Practices for a Safety Investigation into a Marine Casualty or Marine Incident as adopted and amended from time to time by the IMO. "ISM Code" includes any safety management procedure applying under the International Management Code for the Safe Operation of Ships and for Pollution Prevention. The Regulations set out general principles to be applied to an investigation and sets out the procedures of (preliminary) investigations and proceedings of a Marine Board inquiry. The Regulations also concern international cooperation and define offences.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Shipping (Dangerous Goods and IMDG Code) Regulations 2011 (L.N. No. 66 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations made by the Minister for Infrastructure Development under the Shipping Act 1998, concern carriage of dangerous goods by any commercial ship undertakes a voyage: (a) to Solomon Islands from any place outside of Solomon Islands jurisdiction; and (b) from a Solomon Islands port to any place outside of Solomon Islands jurisdiction. The Regulations define responsibilities of masters of a ship; require masters to comply with the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG) of IMO and other standards; prescribe rules for the carriage of dangerous goods.
Subject: Sea, Waste & hazardous substances, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Law No. 31/11 approving the Mining Code.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 22 Chapters and divided in 2 Parts and 2 Annexes, approves the Mining Code to be implemented within the territory of Angola. This Code regulates any geological and mining activity and in particular: geological research, investigation, finding and classification of minerals (namely diamonds), characterization, assessment, exploitation, commercialization, and use of existing mineral resources in the soil, underground, internal waters, territorial sea, continental shelf, Exclusive Economic Zone and in any other terrestrial or maritime area under the jurisdiction of the Republic of Angola. The Code does not apply for activities related to: recognition, prospection, research, assessment and exploitation of liquid or gas hydrocarbons.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on the organization of the natural gas market.

Policy: Ley Nº 174 - Declara de prioridad nacional y departamental la preservación, forestación y reforestación de la Serranía de San Pedro del Departamento de Cochabamba.
Policy_Content: En virtud de esta Ley se declara de prioridad nacional y departamental la preservación, forestación y reforestación de la Serranía de San Pedro del Departamento de Cochabamba. En este sentido se encomienda al Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Agua, al Gobierno Autónomo del Departamento de Cochabamba y al Gobierno Autónomo Municipal de Cochabamba, en el marco de sus competencias concurrentes, la cooperación técnica y financiera, con el fin de desarrollar políticas, planes, programas, proyectos de preservación, forestación y reforestación.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Resolution No. 358 of 2011 of Georgian Government on Rules for Cooperation and Distribution of Authority among Entities involved in Address Assignment Procedure
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the rules for cooperation and distribution of authority among entities involved in address assignment procedure. It consists of three articles: General provisions (1); Authority of the competent bodies in address assignment procedure (2); and Coordination Council (3). The purpose of the Resolution is to improve address assignment procedure and to standardize the system.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº 28/2011 - Integración del Régimen Especial Agrario de la Seguridad Social en el Régimen General de la Seguridad Social.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto proceder a la integración del Régimen Especial Agrario de la Seguridad Social en el Régimen General de la Seguridad Social, con el fin de contar con una mano de obra suficientemente motivada para arraigarse en la tierra, de manera que se evite que muchos proyectos emprendedores pueden verse en peligro por la falta de trabajadores cualificados.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Co-operative Societies (Amendment) Act (No. 11 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Co-operative Societies Act in sections 15 (in relation with the minimum number of members as a condition for registration, 26 (in relation with the minimum age of membership of a co-operative) and 91 (regarding the notice of the change of directors of a co-operative).

Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decree on the physical and chemical properties of liquid fuels.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia is to protect human health and environmental quality by reducing emissions of sulfur dioxide and other pollutants resulting from the combustion of certain types of fuel. The present Decree lays down: (1) technical specifications for liquid fuels intended for engines with positive-ignition and compression-ignition to be used for vehicles and non-road mobile machinery, vessels for inland waterways when not at sea, agricultural and forestry tractors, recreational vessels when not at sea and any vessels in the territorial sea of the Republic of Slovenia; (2) sulfur content of fuels intended for vessels using the flag of the Republic of Slovenia related in the region of the emission control of sulfur oxides under the jurisdiction and control of another country; (3) sulfur content of fuels used at combustion plants. The Decree is composed of 28 articles divided into the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Physico-chemical properties of fuels (Sec. 2); Obligations of the supplier and distributor (Sec. 3); Issuing permission for exception (Sec. 4); Inspection (Sec. 5); Penalty provisions (Sec. 6); Transitional and final proivisions (Sec. 7).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree entered into force on 1 October 2011.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 145/11 approving the Regulation of the National Direction of Petroleum and Biofuel (DNPB) within the Ministry of Oil.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Direction of Petroleum and Biofuel (DNPB) within the Ministry of Oil, according to Presidential Decree No. 33/11 (repealed by Presidential Decree No. 239/12). The Regulation, consisting of 4 Chapters and 2 Annexes, specifies composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled: to design and propose the National policy basis on oil and biofuel; to elaborate the development programme on oil and biofuel exploitation, according to the National Plan; to study and propose a legislation regulating the activities in this sector; to control the implementation of such activities; to carry out research on hydrocarbons, production, processing and trade of crude oil and natural gas, storage, transport and supply of derivatives, including bio fuel. Annexes list composition and duties of this Direction.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Executive Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Ley Departamental Nº 29 – Ley de fomento al turismo rural comunitario del Departamento de Tarija.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto impulsar un proceso de desarrollo del turismo en el área rural y poblaciones intermedias del Departamento de Tarija, generando una infraestructura turística adecuada y con recursos humanos capacitados para lograr el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales. Asimismo, la Ley persigue la promoción, conservación y protección del patrimonio cultural, histórico, artístico, arquitectónico, tangible e intangible de las comunidades campesinas e indígenas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Fertilizers Regulations, 2011 (GN. No. 350 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implements provisions of the Fertilizer Act, 2009 and provide in particular for - the registration of fertilizer and fertilizer supplements, and sterilizing plants; the registration and licensing of fertilizer dealers; sampling and testing of fertilizer and fertilizer supplements; packaging and labelling of fertilizers; storage of fertilizers; importation and exportation of fertilizer and fertilizer supplements; handling and transportation of fertilizer and fertilizer supplements. Animal and vegetable manures that are sold in their natural condition arc exempted from these Regulations. Every fertilizer or fertilizer supplement sold or imported under a name specified in the Twelfth and Thirteenth Schedule shall meet the requirements of the standard of that fertilizer or fertilizer supplement. Decisions on applications made under these Regulations shall be taken by the Executive Director of the Tanzania Fertilizer Regulatory Authority. Any person who intends to set up a sterilizing plant for the purpose or manufacturing fertilizer or fertilizer supplement from animal carcass shall obtain an Environmental Impact Assessment Certificate from relevant authority.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Planning and Development (Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 476 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 mainly to provide for matters of procedure and administration in relation to Part XA and Part XAB of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (inserted by the Planning and Development(Amendment) Act 2010), which relate to applications for substitute consent and appropriate assessment of proposed development, respectively. These Regulations also contain a number of other new provisions in relation to environmental impact assessment (in particular in relation to environmental impact assessment of local authority and state development), and also in relation to cases where a planning application is not decided by a planning authority.

Policy: European Union (Environmental Impact Assessment and Habitats) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 473 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations principally amend the Planning and Development Act 2000 for the purpose of giving further effect to Council Directive No. 85/337/EEC  and Council Directive 92/43/EEC in relation to proposed development in protected areas established pursuant to Community legislation. The Regulations concern, among other things: the determination whether activities that require consent of the Minister pursuant legislation concerning protection of birds or habitats (as specified) comprises development which is not exempted development; decisions of a planning authority on an application for a development permission (section 34 of the Act) where an environmental impact statement or a Natura impact statement is submitted; and consent for a development of a class as specified in Schedule 5 of the Act.

Policy: Regional Law No. 74-ZKO “On allotment of land in ownership free of charge to some categories of citizens”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law envisages cases and establishes the modalities of allotment in ownership free of charge public and municipal land to citizens for subsistence farming and housing construction, and also establishes dimensions of land area authorized for allotment. The following categories of of citizens for individual construction to the following categories of citizens: (a) citizens with three or more children under 18 years of age; (b) young families, and single parents of maximum 35 years of age; (c) persons deprived of the only one housing facility as a result of natural or technological disaster; and (d) persons with handicapped children. Allotment of land parcels free of charge to the aforesaid categories shall be performed once-only.

Policy: Decree No. 266 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on collection and recycling of mercuric valves.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes terms and conditions for collection of waste mercuric valves and the modalities of recycling thereof. The Regulation shall be mandatory for natural and legal persons using mercuric valves. Users of mercuric valves must collect and deliver spent mercuric valves in accordance with the modalities set forth by this Regulation. Waste mercuric valves shall be collected and stored separately from other waste in a special storage facility. Collected and delivered for recycling waste mercuric valves shall be registered in a special register. Collection of waste mercuric valves shall be performed by recycling organizations, manufacturers (including collection at sales points of energy saving valves) and at waste collection points where waste mercuric valves must be delivered in separate packages. Relations between consumers and recycling organizations shall be regulated by contracts.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Waste management,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste disposal,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Recycling/reuse,Contract/agreement

Policy: Protected Areas Act 2011 (No. 14 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Protected Areas Commission, the Protected Areas Trust and a Trust Fund and empowers the Minister to declare national protected areas. It applies to the territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, fishery zone and continental shelf as defined in the Maritime Zones Act 2010. The Act also provides with respect to the National Protected Areas System and allows village councils to apply to the Commission for village lands or any part thereof to be recognised as an Amerindian protected area. The Act also provides with respect to management of protected areas. The main objective of the Act is the conservation of biological diversity, natural landscapes, seascapes and wetlands and ecosystem preservation. The Act sets out principles of ecologically sustainable development.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Climate change,Environmental planning,Land-use planning,Indigenous peoples,Traditional rights/customary rights,Sustainable development,Basic legislation,Management/conservation,National parks,Institution,Marine protected areas,Hunting/capture,Community management,Protection of environment

Policy: Law No. 4014 on the environmental licensing of works and activities, regulation of illegal constructions in connection with environmental stability and other provisions falling under the competence of the Ministry of Environment.
Policy_Content: This law provides for the environmental assessment of works and activities in order to grand an authorisation (permit) to build (Part A, articles 1 to 22). It also makes provisions for the regulation of illegally constructed buildings, with the aim to promoting a better environmental stability (Part B, articles 23 to 37). The works and activities of the public and private sector, which their construction or their operation may cause environmental impacts, are classified in two categories (A and B). The first category (A) includes the works and activities which may cause significant environmental impacts and for which an Environmental Impact Assessment Study is required so as to be established the special terms and restrictions for the protection of the environment with regard to that particular work or activity, according to the provisions of articles 2, 3 and 4 to the present law. The works and activities of category A are classified: a) in those causing severe environmental impacts (subcategory A1) and b) in those that cause important environmental impacts (subcategory A2). The second category (B) includes works and activities which are only characterized by environmental impacts at a local level and do not compromise significantly the environment. The works falling under this category are subject to general specifications, terms and restrictions, according to the procedures established in article 8 to this law. Article 10 provides for the environmental building authorisation within areas included in the Natura 2000 network. Article 20 aligns the Greek legislation with article 23 “Environmental inspections” of Council Directive 2010/75/EU on industrial emissions and integrated pollution prevention and control. The works and activities are classified into the various categories according to the criteria set forth in Annex I to the law. Annex II provides for the content of the Environmental Impact Assessment Study. The salient point of Chapter B of the law regarding the arrangement of issues concerning illegally constructed buildings, is that as from the entry into force of the present law, any transfer or legal right on a real estate property must be accompanied with a written statement, made by the owner and certified by an engineer, declaring that the building in question does not include illegally built parts or use.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The provisions of Part A of this Law shall enter into force one month after its publication in the Official Gazette unless otherwise provided for by its individual sections; Part B of the Law shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 138/11 establishing organization and functioning of the Cabinet of Environment and Safety (GAS) within the Ministry of Oil.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree establishes organization and functioning of the Cabinet of Environment and Safety (GAS) within the Ministry of Oil, according to Presidential Decree No. 33/11 (repealed by Presidential Decree No. 239/12). The Regulation, consisting of 4 Chapters and 2 Annexes, specifies composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled: to guarantee the implementation of National policies and strategies related to environment and safety; to promote and collaborate on needed studies on the procedures related to environmental safety and management and improved modern technology; to coordinate and collaborate in designing norms, regulations and specific techniques related to safety and environment during any oil and biofuel activity; to give advices on the management plans on safety and environment, etc. Annexes list composition and duties of the above mentioned Cabinet.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Executive Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Roadmap to a Resource Efficient Europe.
Policy_Content: The Roadmap to a Resource Efficient Europe is a regional policy with a cross-sectoral approach. This policy designs a coherent action framework to ensure efficient use of water, land and marine resources, biodiversity, ecosystems, air, soil, fossil fuels, waste, and minerals in the cross-cutting policy areas and sectors, in order to transform the economy.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Sea, Water
Keyword: Marine pollution,Climate change,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Emissions,Energy conservation/energy production,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Land-use planning,Waste management,Waste prevention,Recycling/reuse,Fishery management and conservation,Fishing gear/fishing method,Bycatch,Protection of species,Marine fisheries,Coastal zone management,Agricultural commodities,Food quality control/food safety,Food security,Nutrition,Meat,Milk/dairy products,Food waste,Packaging/labelling,Pollution control,Water quality standards,Water shortage/drought,Water supply,Irrigation,Pesticides,Freshwater resources management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 048-2011-EM — Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 032-2002-EM, Glosario, siglas y abreviaturas del subsector hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el Glosario, siglas y abreviaturas del subsector hidrocarburos, incorporando la definición de Consumidor Directo con Instalaciones Estratégicas y disponen normas para su nscripción en el Registro de Hidrocarburos.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 559 validating the Regulation on calculation of environmental fees for environmental pollution.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that environmental fees shall be applicable to all natural and legal persons conducting production and economic activities on the national territory. Environmental fees shall be collected for: (a) emissions to the atmosphere from stationary and non-stationary sources; (b) effluent waste water discharge; and (c) waste disposal. This Ministerial Decree contains calculation formula.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental fees/charges,Pollution control,Polluter pays principle,Waste disposal,Air quality/air pollution,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No. 190 of 2011 (IX. 19.) Korm. of the Government concerning physical protection in the use of atomic energy and related authorization, reporting and controlling system.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides safety rules for applied, stored or transported radioactive sources and nuclear substances, to treated, stored or transported radioactive waste, to exsisting or to planned nuclear establishments, to radiactive waste storage plants and to fixed ot mobile ionizing radiation generating equipments non containing radioactive substances. Provisons of this Decree give rules on authorization of the listed activities and sites, physical safety requirements and measures to be taken in case of danger, controlling, classification of nuclear substances in terms of danger, and on the guarding service.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: First entry into force on 4 October 2011. The last consolidated version entered into force on 1 May 2014.

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 457-RG validating Forest plan.
Policy_Content: The Governor decrees that Regional Forest plan shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Governor’s Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 077/11/EM - Normas para intercambiar información a efectos de implementar la capacidad adicional para el abastecimiento de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución dicta normas para que el Comité de Operación Económica del Sistema (COES) y las empresas que sean requeridas intercambien información a efectos de implementar la capacidad adicional que se requiera para asegurar el abastecimiento de energía eléctrica en el Sistema Eléctrico Interconectado Nacional (SEIN).
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Internal trade,Subsidy/incentive,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Data collection/reporting,Non-governmental entity
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1.274/2011 - Plan estratégico del patrimonio natural y de la biodiversidad 2011-2017.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto aprueba el Plan estratégico del patrimonio natural y de la biodiversidad, un instrumento de alcance nacional y relativo al período 2011-2017. El plan desarrolla lo establecido en la Ley del Patrimonio Natural y de la Biodiversidad y se alinea con los compromisos asumidos por España en la materia en el ámbito internacional, en especial el Convenio de Naciones Unidas sobre la Diversidad Biológica. El plan buca responder a los siguientes tres objetivos del Convenio: a) la conservación de la diversidad biológica; b) el uso sostenible de sus componentes; c) el reparto justo y equitativo de los beneficios derivados de la utilización de los recursos genéticos. El plan establece Metas y especifica los objetivos para cada una de ellas. Las Metas son las siguientes: 1) disponer de los mejores conocimientos para la conservación y uso sostenible de la biodiversidad y los servicios de los ecosistemas; 2) proteger, conservar y restaurar la naturaleza en España y reducir sus principales amenazas; 3) fomentar la integración de la biodiversidad en las políticas sectoriales; 4) conservar la biodiversidad global y contribuir al alivio de la pobreza en el mundo; 5) promover la participación de la sociedad en la conservación de la biodiversidad y fomentar su concienciación y compromiso; 6) mejorar la gobernanza ambiental para la conservación de la biodiversidad; 7) contribuir al crecimiento verde en España; 8) movilizar los recursos financieros de todas las fuentes para alcanzar los objetivos de conservación de la biodversidad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sustainable use,Agro-forestry,Biodiversity,Genetic resources,Food security,Poverty,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest fires,Climate change,Traceability/product tracing,Institution,Policy/planning,Water quality standards,Effluent waste water/discharge,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Coastal zone management,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Environmental standards,Pollution control,Wild flora,Ecosystem preservation,Protected area,Management/conservation,Registration,Classification/declassification,Endangered species,Hunting/capture,Biosphere reserves,Protection of habitats,National parks,Education,Protection of species
