Policy: Order No. 907 on subsidy subsidies for Natura 2000 projects on the clearing of overgrown areas and for their grazing.
Policy_Content: The Order aims to provide subsidy to clear overgrown areas which need preparation for grazing in order to ensure improvement of conservation of habitats and species in specifically designated areas set out by Natura 2000 areas. The Danish AgriFish Agency shall grant subsidies upon prior assessment of land. Measures for the preparation of grazing include establishment of fences, water supply and electricity supply. Agreements of such grants shall be authorized for measures implemented between 15 July and 31 March and within 6 months’ from the initiation of clearing trees and shrubs for grazing. Non-eligible project costs include: expenses for gardens (if authorization of gracing has not been granted); expenses related to activities and subsidies under other legislations; finance and banking costs; VAT; expenses for the research of technological development; purchase, rental and/or lease of used equipment; expenses with reference to article 54 of the Commission Regulation (EC) No 1974/2006 of 15 December 2006 on implementing Council Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 on subsidy for rural development from the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD); costs related to areas such as inland dunes, heaths and forest; costs associated to the establishment of fences not related to the acquisition and installation of fences, including the cost of removal of existing fences.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Order enters into force on 22 August 2011.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 140384 establishing the National Network for monitoring of the quality and quantity of waters, determining the stations for measurements and the competent authorities for their operation, in compliance with article 4, paragraph of 4 of Law No. 3199/2003.
Policy_Content: Aim of the present Decree is the establishment of a National Network for monitoring the quality and quantity of surface and underground waters, as such waters are defined in article 2, paragraph 2 of Law No. 3199/2003, so as to achieve a more comprehensive overview on the situation of the waters in the country, according to article 4, paragraph 4 of the same law. Aim of the National Network is to monitor and follow-up the quantitative and qualitative conditions of the surface and underground waters in the fourteen water departments of the country, as are defined with Presidential Decree No. 51/2007. The Special Secretariat of Waters under the Ministry of Environment, Energy and Climatic Change shall be the competent authority for: a) the development and operation of the National Network; b) the monitoring and follow-up at a national level of quality and quantity surface and underground waters in collaboration with the decentralized Water Directorates of the country; c) the submission of annual reports and annual budget of the National Network operational costs. The documents will be compiled by data received by the state institutions involved in the process of monitoring.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Groundwater,Monitoring,Pollution control,Surface water,Water quality standards,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Data collection/reporting,Environmental planning,Freshwater resources management
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Ley N° 6.058 - Régimen de fomento para determinadas actividades vinculadas al sector forestal.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece un régimen de fomento para determinadas actividades vinculadas al sector forestal, con el fin de asistir y financiar: a) el cultivo de bosques de hasta 50 hectáreas, de pequeños productores que sean beneficiarios de la Ley 25.080; b) el traslado y radicación de emprendimientos foresto-industriales en parques industriales habilitados por las autoridades competentes; c) estudios de factibilidad y diseño ejecutivo de plantas industriales, asistencia técnica y comercial; d) la investigación científica y tecnológica en el mejoramiento genético de las especies forestales y en el aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos forestales.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 7.675 - Ley de biocombustibles.

Asimismo,  declara de interés provincial la investigación científica, la producción agropecuaria de materias primas utilizadas en la elaboración de biocombustibles, el acondicionamiento, la industrialización, depósito, distribución y el consumo de estos combustibles alternativos. En este marco, introduce beneficios para los proyectos de radicación de industrias de biocombustibles en el territorio provincial.

Policy_Content: Las presentes Guías técnicas de presentación de informes, así como para la emisión de guías de cambio de exploración inicial al de exploración avanzada y de exploración avanzada al de evaluación económica, tienen como finalidad dar cumplimiento a lo que dispone la Ley de Minería y normar la información que tienen que presentar al Ministerio los titulares mineros que han cumplido todas las disposiciones legales y reglamentarias y han suscrito el contrato de explotación.

Policy: Commission Regulation (EU) No. 834/2011 amending Annex I to Regulation (EC) No. 689/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the export and import of dangerous chemicals.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends Annex I to Regulation (EC) No. 689/2008 by adding new entries and deleting certain entries concerning those dangerous chemicals which may be imported into and exported from the European Union.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Règlement c/reg.1/08/11 du 19 août 2011 portant création de l'Agence régionale pour l'Agriculture et l'alimentation (ARAA).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement crée une Agence Régionale pour l'Agriculture et l'Alimentation (ARAA), une structure technique et autonome spécialisée dans le domaine agricole. L'ARAA a pour mandant d'assurer la mise en œuvre technique des programmes et le plan d'investissement régional et contribuer à l'opérationnalisation de la politique agricole de la CEDEAO en travaillant avec les Institutions régionales, agences et partenaires.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Ley Nº 7.675 - Adhesión a Ley Nacional Nº 26.093 sobre Régimen de Regulación y Promoción para la Producción y Uso Sustentable de Biocombustibles.
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Ley la Provincia de Salta se adhiere a la Ley Nacional Nº 26.093 que establece el Régimen de Regulación y Promoción para la Producción y Uso Sustentable de Biocombustibles. En este marco se declara de interés provincial la investigación científica, la producción agropecuaria de materias primas utilizadas en la elaboración de biocombustibles, el acondicionamiento, la industrialización, depósito, distribución y el consumo de estos combustibles alternativos.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Regulation No 8 of 5 August 2011 on forest timber.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the types of timber (or wood or tree cutting) activities as regards the forests and forest land on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria; the terms and procedure for the cutting and timber, also cutting of trees falling by its natural course; the rules for the marking of the timber and trees intended for cutting and the preparation of the accompanying documents; the terms and procedures for issuance of the necessary permits.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la Norma Técnica para la Coordinación de la Operación en Tiempo Real de los Sistemas Interconectados, respecto a la regulación primaria de la frecuencia.

Policy: Act on marine safety.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Act is to enhance safety at sea and the prevention of marine pollution. This Act regulates provisions concerning marine safety relating to the construction of vessels, their equipment, inspection of vessels, qualifications of crew, safety of navigation and saving life at sea. These provisions apply to Polish vessels and foreign vessels located on Polish internal waters, Polish territorial sea or Polish maritime zone. The Act is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Construction of vessels and their equipment (sect. 2); Inspection of vessels (sect. 3); Crew (sect. 4); Safety of navigation (sect. 5); Saving life at sea (sect. 6); Penalties (sect. 7); Changes in valid provisions, transitional and final provisions (sect. 8).
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 25 January 2012.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 687 validating the Regulation on control over reliability of data related to forest fire risks and forest fires.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of control over reliability of data related to forest fire risks and forest fires submitted by the representatives of the authorized institutions in the sphere of forest relations. Collected data shall be submitted daily during fire risk season, monthly within the 5th of each month and annually (annual report) by 30 January. The authorized body shall be responsible for non-submittal or untimely submittal of data related to forest fire risks. Federal Forest Agency shall be the authorized institution entrusted with control over correctness and reliability of data related to forest fire risks.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 790 - Ley de Creación del Sistema Salvadoreño para la Calidad.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Creación del Sistema Salvadoreño para la Calidad, tiene como objetivos: a) integrar la infraestructura nacional de la calidad, encargada de desarrollar, fortalecer y facilitar la cultura de calidad, promoviendo la competitividad de los sectores productores, importadores, exportadores y comercializadores en general, de bienes y servicios, generando confianza en el intercambio de éstos; y b) contribuir a proteger los derechos de los consumidores y el goce a un medio ambiente sano, garantizando la seguridad y calidad de los productos, incluidos los alimentos y servicios, así como todo tipo de equipo e instalaciones, procurando la salud de las personas y la salud animal y vegetal.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural commodities,Internal trade,International trade,Institution,Inspection,Consumer protection,Environmental standards,Right to clean/healthy environment,Human rights,Standards

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 544 - Crea la Dirección General de Desarrollo Rural.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo crea la Dirección General de Desarrollo Rural, como una dependencia de nivel operativo del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, responsable de promover y fomentar el desarrollo rural del país, a fin de cumplir de manera eficiente con las atribuciones que le competen al Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería y alcanzar los objetivos previstos en el Plan Quinquenal de Desarrollo 2010-2014 en lo que corresponde al sector agropecuario así como en la Política Sectorial Agropecuaria y planes institucionales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Deceased Estates (Wills, Inheritance and Protection) Act, 2011 (No. 14 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to matters regarding inheritance and the administration of estates of deceased persons in Malawi. It shall apply to the administration of estates of all persons dying domiciled, or leaving property, in Malawi on or after the date upon which the Act comes into operation; but any property belonging to the estate of such persons which, at the coming into operation of this Act, remains partly or wholly undistributed, shall be distributed in accordance with the provisions of this Act. Except as provided for in this Act, no person shall be entitled under any other written law or under customary law to take by inheritance any of the property to which a deceased person was entitled at the date of his or her death. The Act provides with respect to the making of wills, inheritance in case of intestacy, powers of court, protection and administration of (small) estates, execution of wills and related matters.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Rural and Regional Adjustment Regulation 2011.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of four Parts and completed by 35 Schedules, implements the Rural Adjustment Authority Act 1994. Part 2 deals with the approval of schemes, specifying that each scheme set out in each of schedules 1 to 15 and 17 to 26 is approved under section 11 of the Act. The objective of the scheme is to provide assistance that will: (a) strengthen the economy of Queensland regions; and (b) facilitate the development of sustainable primary production in Queensland. Application of scheme (1) The scheme consists of the following programs: (a) the first start program; (b) the sustainability program. (2) An applicant may apply for assistance under more than 1 program. It does not apply to: a) refinancing existing business loans or equipment finance; b) purchasing new equipment or other assets.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Keyword: Public health,Rural employment,Aquaculture,Forest management/forest conservation,Collecting/harvesting,Non-governmental entity,Agricultural development,Animal health,Apiculture/sericulture,Fishery management and conservation,Grazing,Financial agricultural measures,Financing,Fiscal and market measures,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Zoning,Subsidy/incentive

Policy: Atomic Energy Act, 2011 (No. 16 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns regulation of activities involving nuclear material and provides for the creation of an Atomic Energy Regulatory Authority (AERA). It also provides for, among other things - notification and licensing for those who want to engage in activities or practices involving radiation sources, nuclear material or any radioactive materials; responsibilities of a licensee; inspection and enforcement and compliance monitoring; fundamental radiation safety principles to apply to activities and practices in Malawi involving radiation sources, nuclear material or any radioactive materials; emergency response and preparedness to accidents or incidents and other emergencies; radioactive waste management; the transportation of radioactive material; mining and processing.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Nuclear energy,Pollution control,Radiation,Institution,International relations/cooperation,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,International trade,Waste management

Policy_Content: Ce décret porte la modification des dispositions des articles 3(1); 4; 6; 7; 10; et 12 du décret n° 94/259/PM du 31 mai 1994 portant création d’une Commission nationale consultative pour l’environnement et le développement durable, concernant la composition et attributions des organes de la Commission.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-548 du 17 août 2011 fixant les modalités de contrôle de la gestion foncière.
Policy_Content: Il est créé, en la forme administrative, par le présent décret, des actes littéraux de contrôle de la gestion foncière qui constituent des documents secondaires du cadastre national foncier. Les actes littéraux de contrôle de la gestion foncière sont des documents par lesquels les services du cadastre et du domaine de l’Etat procèdent au contrôle des transactions foncières. La délivrance des actes littéraux créés par le présent décret donne lieu à une perception des frais par l’Etat. Une procédure de contrôle de la gestion foncière est aussi établie.

Policy: Order No. 891 on system operation and application of power transmission grid.
Policy_Content: This Order applies to the transmission system operator Energinet.dk, transmission companies and users of the transmission network. It sets regulations with regard to Energinet.dk’s technical and financial responsibility for network losses in that part of the transmission network made available. Energinet.dk must disclose information to foreign system operators, to ensure cooperation between the system operators and their performance in receiving system operator's tasks – and shall implement a coherent and comprehensive planning, which can form the basis for an assessment of current and future market conditions, supply, system operations, research and development activities necessary for environmentally friendly and energy efficient transmission and distribution of electricity. Energinet.dk shall therefore submit an annual environmental report to the Danish Energy Agency (DEA) explaining the progress of key environmental development within the electricity supply system (its total emissions of CO2, SO2 and Nox, of methane and nitrous oxide, as well as information on the production and management of the main waste products) and containing summaries and forecasts for production (balance sheet for the previous year and a forecast for the next 10 years). Projects approved on the basis of these issues in accordance to article 18 (section 5) of Order No. 444 of 11 June 2002 on the system operation and use of the transmission grids, are implemented in adherence to articles 20 and 22 of this Order.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Transport/storage,Policy/planning,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Renewable energy,Environmental planning,Research,Data collection/reporting
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 19 August 2011.

Policy: Order No. 930 on rules for reviewing rates and conditions for the supply of electricity, and conditions for the use of transmission and distribution networks.
Policy_Content: This Order applies to the collective electricity supply companies and sets regulations with regard to methods of calculation determining the terms and conditions of access to transmission and distribution networks, i.e. prices, tariffs and conditions of service. Network and regional transmission companies shall notify their expected supplied electricity for the coming regulating year before 10 December of the previous year, in accordance to Order No. 335 of 15 April 2011. Energinet.dk and its owned subsidiaries, must publicly report prices, tariffs and conditions for services (including supply agreements) within 30 days after their implementation and submit their financial reports no latger than 1 June.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Order No. 410 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food validating the Regulation on the procedure and terms and conditions for competitive selection of agricultural service cooperatives eligible to financial support out of state budget.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth the procedure and terms and conditions for competitive selection (tender) of agricultural service cooperatives eligible to financial support out of state budget in accordance with the procedure for using the funds provided for in the state budget to support agricultural servicing cooperatives. The purpose of competitive selection shall be to determine the list of agricultural servicing cooperatives eligible for financial support at the expense of funds provided in the state budget. Annex I contains application form for participation in competitive selection. Annex II contains the form of estimate of expenditure for purchase of agricultural machinery and equipment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1164 du 17 août 2011 portant modification des règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale pour l’Emploi des Jeunes (ANEJ).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie des règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale pour l’Emploi des Jeunes (ANEJ). L’ANEJ a pour mission de : participer à la mise en œuvre de la politique de l’emploi des jeunes ; intervenir sur le marché du travail en vue de favoriser l’emploi des jeunes ; assister les jeunes à la recherche d’un emploi, d’une formation ou d’un conseil professionnel ; accueillir, d’informer et d’orienter les jeunes demandeurs d’emploi ; assister les employeurs dans leurs démarches pour l’embauche des jeunes ; créer une banque de données recensant les idées de création d’emplois et d’entreprises ; assister les jeunes pour la création d’activités productives. A l’exception de l’article 1er, sont abrogées toutes les autres dispositions du décret n° 2001-109 du 7 février 2 001 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale pour l’Emploi des Jeunes (ANEJ).

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta parcialmente el que modifica la organización del Sistema Nacional para la Prevención y Atención de Desastres, respecto a la ejecución de las transferencias del Fondo Nacional de Calamidades Subcuenta Colombia Humanitaria.

Policy: Decreto Nº 296/011 - Reglaméntase el art. 383 de la Ley 18.719 que creó el “Fondo  de Desarrollo Rural”, a los efectos de establecer las formas y condiciones en que se podrá requerir el reembolso total o parcial de los apoyos recibidos por los productores.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto contiene la reglamentación del artículo 383 de la Ley Nº 18.719 del Presupuesto Nacional (período 2010-2014) el cual crea el Fondo de Desarrollo Rural. Estas disposiciones establecen que la administración y ejecución del Fondo se realizará por la Dirección General de Desarrollo Rural del Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca. Asimismo, establecen que la población objetivo a recibir el apoyo son los productores agropecuarios, priorizando a los productores familiares, los pescadores artesanales, los asalariados rurales y la población rural, así como los grupos y organizaciones que nuclean a dicha población.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy_Content: This Regulations amends the Regulation on permits and licenses foreseen by the Environment Act. The Regulation repeals Clause 2 of Article 7, amends Annex No. 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

Policy: Avalanche Material-Incineration Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Federal Air Pollution Control Act (BGBl. I No 137/2002). In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the ban of incinerating materials deriving from avalanches on grassland. Article 1 establishes that such material shall only be incinerated in the period from 16 April to 31 October. The text consists of 3 articles as follows: Authorization of incinerating biogenetic material incurred by avalanches in alpine regions difficult to access (1); Safety measures (2); Relation to Salzburg Fire Police Ordinance 1973; Entry into force (4).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 31 August 2011.

Policy: Order No. 679 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Frantz Josef Archipelago”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of federal significance “Frantz Josef Archipelago” shall be classified as biological (zoological) protected area destined for conservation and reproduction of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Archangel region and shall be under the direct jurisdiction of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes (landscapes of “Frantz Josef Archipelago”); (b) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species, including aquatic species and birds, and keeping ecological balance; (c) protection of natural habitats and migratory routes of wild fauna species (d) scientific research; (e) ecological monitoring; and (f) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, sport and artisanal hunting and stay with firearms and hunting gear; (b) commercial and coastal fisheries and stay with fishing gear (c) exploration of subsoil and mining, including soil disturbance; (d) any activity causing modification of hydrogeological regime; and (e) collection of zoological species.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Monitoring,Education,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Hunting/capture,Birds,Endangered species,Migratory species,Protection of habitats,Research,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation on the form and content of the invitation for education, the manner of conducting the education, as well as the manner of keeping the single records for the conducted education.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions Macedonian Law on nature protection, determines the form and content of the invitation for education, the manner of conducting the education, as well as the manner of keeping a single record of conducted education. The education is organized and conducted by the state inspector for nature protection. The education is conducted in the premises of the State Inspectorate of Environment, which performed the inspection, which is closest to the seat of the legal entity or to the facility where the irregularity was determined.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Manuel de Procedure d'attribution des forêts communautaires en République Centrafricaine.
Policy_Content: Le présent Manuel des procédures a été élaboré en application de la loi n°08.022 du 17 octobre 2008 portant Code forestier de la République Centrafricaine (l’article 135 alinéa 2), et conformément aux dispositions de la Convention 169 de l’OIT, pour clarifier et compléter les dispositions de l’Arrêté n°09.021 du 30 avril 2009 fixant les modalités d’application de la loi n°08.022 afin de faciliter et concrétiser l’attribution des forêts communautaires aux communautés intéressées. Le manuel est structuré en sept (07) chapitres: les dispositions légales et conventionnelles (Chapitre I) ; l’information, la sensibilisation et l’organisation des communautés en vue de la gestion d’une forêt communautaire (Chapitre II) ; l’implication des peuples autochtones (Chapitre III) ; les différentes étapes de la consultation et la concertation (Chapitre IV) ; la composition du dossier de demande d’attribution d’une forêt communautaire (Chapitre V) ; le traitement administratif d’un dossier de demande d’attribution de forêt communautaire (chapitre VI) ; et les dispositions transitoires qui abordent la gestion, le suivi et le contrôle des activités à l’intérieur d’une forêt communautaire1 et des dispositions finales (chapitre VII).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Community management,Traditional rights/customary rights,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se crean los Consejos Consultivos para el Desarrollo Sustentable de la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales.
Policy_Content: Mediante el presente Acuerdo se crea el Consejo Consultivo Nacional para el Desarrollo Sustentable, como órgano de consulta de la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales. Dicho Consejo está integrado a su vez por seis Consejos Consultivos Regionales y 32 Consejos Consultivos Núcleo. Entre las finalidades se contempla el facilitar la participación de la ciudadanía en la política ambiental, así como en el análisis de temas nacionales e internacionales en materia de medio ambiente y recursos naturales.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 466 validating the Regulation on protection of human life in waterbodies.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Ministerial Decree shall be to protect human life and health during recreational water use of surface waterbodies. The population shall be informed of prohibition and restrictions on recreational use of waterbodies. Local government and authorized institutions and organizations shall be responsible for appointment of the officials responsible for protection of human life, health and environment during recreational use of waterbodies.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Surface water,Public health,Local government,Access-to-information,Recreational water use,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Measures for the administration of acceptance of hydropower engineering projects.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to strengthen the management of hydropower project construction. The Measures consist of 35 Articles divided into 5 Chapters: General provisions (I); Acceptance of impoundment (II); Acceptance of engineering control (III); Final acceptance (IV); Supplementary provisions (V). The National Energy Administration is responsible for the management, guidance, coordination and supervision of the hydropower project acceptance. Acceptance of impoundment, acceptance of control engineering and final acceptance shall be carried out by an Acceptance Committee. The Acceptance Committee shall be set up by the host unit entrusted by the National Energy Administration in conjunction with relevant provincial authorities.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Measures entered into force as of the date of promulgation.

Policy: Decreto Nº 36.786/MINAET - Manual para la clasificación de tierras dedicadas a la conservación de los recursos naturales dentro de la zona marítimo terrestre en Costa Rica.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Manual para la clasificación de tierras dedicadas a la conservación de los recursos naturales dentro de la zona marítimo terrestre en Costa Rica, con los siguientes objetivos: 1) Identificar dentro de la zona marítimo terrestre aquellos terrenos que clasifiquen como bosques de aptitud forestal (suelos Clase VII y VIII), humedales (manglares, esteros, rías, marismas, lagunas costeras, pantanos, bosques anegados, salitrales), para certificarlos e incorporarlos como parte del Patrimonio Natural del Estado (PNE); 2) Delimitar de conformidad con la Ley Forestal las áreas de protección.
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Joint Order No.213 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and No. 243 of the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade validating assessment criteria of risks in the sphere of environmental protection, reproduction and management of natural resources related to private entrepreneurship.
Policy_Content: This Joint Order establishes assessment criteria of risks in the sphere of environmental protection, reproduction and management of natural resources related to private entrepreneurship that shall be used for inspection by the authorized officials. Risk assessment shall be considered the totality of quantitative and qualitative indices related to nature managers activities’ that enable to classify nature mangers by risk groups divided in four categories. Environmental risk groups shall include ecological control of emissions and discharge, waste disposal, environmental damages and availability of cancellation of environmental authorization.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. 121 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on the procedure for preparation and submittal of requests for public information administered by the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for preparation and submittal of requests for public information administered by the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate. Access to public information shall be ensured by provision thereof at request of public information by natural persons, legal persons and association of citizens without the status of legal entity, except for subjects of authoritative powers in the exercise of their functions. Request of public information can be either collective or individual, either oral or written. Public information shall be released at request free of charge. Annex 1 contains the form of request of public information.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: These Regulations relate to agreements between access authorities and owners and occupiers of land with respect to access land as provided for by the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 and the Marine Coastal Access Act 2009. Access may be required by authorities to carry out works. The Regulations provide for the period within which, and the manner in which, appeals under section 38(1) of the 2000 Act and paragraph 4 of Schedule 20 to the 2009 Act are to be brought, and also make provision for the advertising of those appeals and for the appeal procedures.

Policy: Energy Act 2011 (2011 Cap. 16).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for: improvement of energy efficiency; security of energy supplies; measures for educing carbon emission; extension of powers of the Coal Authority in relation to offering and charging for services relating to non-coal mining activities; and repeal of the Home Energy Conservation Act (HECA) 1995. The Act implements elements of government programmes UK’s transition to a secure, safe, low-carbon, affordable energy system, and to mobilise commitment to ambitious action on climate change internationally. Specific issues that are dealt with include: Green Deal plans (agreements for energy improvements), Regulations to be made by the Secretary of State so as to provide for a scheme authorizing persons to act as green deal providers and green deal installers and regulating the conduct of these ‘green deal participants’; promotion of reductions in carbon emissions; flexibility in making arrangements about maritime boundaries with the United Kingdom's neighbours in relation with reduction of carbon emissions; incentives for renewable energy; and carbon budgeting under the Climate Change Act 2008.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Sea

Policy: Local Courts Act, 2011 (No. 10 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to constitution, administration and jurisdiction of local courts and related matters. It also provides for appeal against decisions of local courts to the District Appeal Courts or to Customary Appeals Division of High Court. There is hereby established for each Chiefdom of Sierra Leone a Local Court which shall consist of a Chairman, Vice Chairman and such other members as the Minister may determine. A Local Court shall have jurisdiction, among other things, to hear and determine all civil cases governed by customary law (defined), including cases between Paramount Chiefs or Chiefdom Councils involving a question of title to land. A Court may order the recovery of possession of land and the restitution of property. A Court may also administer the estate of deceased persons. Subject to this Act and any Rules made under it, he practice and procedure of the Court shall be governed by customary law. The Act provides for appointment of Customary Law Officers and defines their functions and defines regulation-making powers of the Rules of Court Committee and the Chief Justice for purposes of this Act.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Desarrollo Forestal (PNDF) 2011-2020.
Policy_Content: El Plan Nacional de Desarrollo Forestal (PNDF) es un instrumento estratégico de carácter sectorial y alcance nacional, relativo al período 2011-2020, que tiene por objetivo asegurar la implementación y consolidación de la política forestal del país, contribuyendo al desarrollo sostenible en su dimensión social, económica y ambiental. El documento se desarrolla en torno a los siguientes siete ejes estratégicos: 1) Ordenamiento de tierras forestales; 2) Posicionamiento del sector forestal; 3) Competitividad de la actividad forestal; 4) Sostenibilidad de la actividad forestal; 5) Coordinación, eficiencia y efectividad institucionales; 6) Innovación y sostenibilidad del financiamiento; 7) Cambio climático, mitigación y adaptación.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: National Plan for Food and Nutrition Security (2012-2015).
Policy_Content: This National Plan for Food and Nutrition Security (CAISAN 2012-2015) has a twin-track for an immediate hunger relief interventions with a long-term strategy for sustainable growth. To provide effective results, this Plan objectives, in line with the guidelines set forth in Decree No. 7.272/2010, must respond primarily to the great challenges that threaten the human rights to adequate food and food sovereignty. These challenges are the result of a broad debate within the government and civil society, organized in the National Council for Food and Nutritional Security (CONSEA), intended to explain the central public agendas of food security and nutrition by defining key priorities to be monitored more systematically in view of eradicating extreme poverty, and eliminating hunger and food insecurity through plans promoting participatory environmental management of indigenous territories. According to the National Household Survey 2009 11.2 million people still live with serious food insecurity in Brazil. Although the data show a positive evolution in access to food, food availability and food utilisation in quantity and quality, groups living in rural Northern areas, such as: households headed by women, coloured and indigenous communities are more vulnerable to hunger.

Policy: South Sudan Development Plan 2011-2013.
Policy_Content: The South Sudan Development Plan (SSDP) 2011-2013 is a national planning instrument adopted by the Government as a response to core development and state building challenges during the first three years of independence. It is based upon the theme of realising freedom, equality, justice, peace and prosperity for all. The plan identifies key development objectives for the new Republic of South Sudan and outlines priority programmes for achieving these objectives. It builds on the country’s strengths and opportunities, including abundant natural resources and an energetic and hard-working people, to address the challenges of establishing the new state, tackling poverty, low social indicators and the need to build sustainable peace and security for all citizens. The main objectives of the plan include: a) improving governance, b) achieving rapid rural transformation to improve livelihoods and expand employment opportunities, c) improving and expanding education and health services, and d) deepening peace building and improving security.

Policy: Politique Nationale de Protection Sociale au Niger.
Policy_Content: La présente Politique National de Protection Sociale qui s’inscrit dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre de la stratégie de développement accéléré et de la réduction de la pauvreté. Il s’agit d’une politique multisectorielle d’une portée nationale qui offre une vision et des perspectives a long terme pour la création d’un système cohérent et intégré de protection sociale. À travers une approche basée sur les droits humains universels et les principes d’équité dans le cadre d’un véritable pacte sociale entre l’Etat et les citoyens, la Politique a pour objectif général de contribuer à l’atténuation de la vulnérabilité des groupes défavorisés et aider les populations à faire faces aux risques les plus significatifs de la vie.

Policy: Zambia National Agricultural Policy 2012-2030.
Policy_Content: The Zambia National Agricultural Policy 2012-2030 is a cross cutting policy whose vision is to develop a competitive and diversified agricultural sector driven by equitable and sustainable agricultural development through: (i) Promoting sustainable increase in agricultural productivity of major crops with comparative advantage; (ii) Continuously improving agricultural input and product markets so as to reduce marketing costs and increase profitability and competitiveness of agribusiness; (iii) Increasing agricultural exports as a way of fully utilizing the preferential markets (regional and international) and increase contribution to foreign exchange earnings; (iv) Improving access to productive resources and services for small scale farmers, especially women and young farmers; (v) Continuously strengthening public and private sector institutional capabilities to improve agricultural policy implementation, resource mobilization, agriculture research, technology dissemination, and implementation of regulatory services.

Policy: National Agriculture Policy 2012 - 2030.
Policy_Content: This National Agriculture Policy is a review of the NAP 2004 - 2015. It is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at facilitating the development of a competitive, diversified, equitable and sustainable agriculture sector, in order to achieve by 2030 the national economic Vision for the agricultural sector of a competitive and diversified sector driven by equitable and sustainable agricultural development. The NAP envisages the achievement of the following objectives (i) promote sustainable increase in agricultural productivity of major crops with comparative advantage; (ii) improve agricultural input and product markets so as to reduce marketing costs of agribusiness, including small-scale farmers and farmer groups; (iii) increase agricultural exports to preferential markets at regional and international levels; (iv) improve access to productive resources and services for small-scale farmers, especially women and young farmers, in outlying areas to enable them to increase production of staple foods, including fruits and vegetables, for own consumption and the surplus for income generation; and (v) strengthen public and private sector institutional capabilities to improve agricultural policy implementation, resource mobilization, agriculture research, technology dissemination, and implementation of regulatory services. In summary, agriculture sector goals are (1) increase the annual growth rate of the real crop GDP; (2) increase the value and growth rate of crop exports; and (3) contribute to reduction of poverty and food insecurity.

Policy: National Energy Policy of Antigua and Barbuda, 2011.
Policy_Content: This Policy is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The strategic objectives of this Policy are (I) energy cost reduction, (ii) diversification and efficient use of energy sources, (iii) electricity reliability improvement, (iv) environmental protection, and (v) clean energy focused businesses. The priority areas of the Government of Antigua and Barbuda are energy conservation, protection of environment, generation of electricity using renewable energy sources, promotion of clean technologies, energy efficiency, and emission reduction. A Sustainable Energy Plan will be developed to meet the energy needs of the present generation by 2030 while safeguarding the environment and enabling future generations to meet their own energy needs, with a specific focus on energy conservation and efficiency, renewable energy development, education and awareness. An Energy Unit will be established within the Prime Minister’s office to be responsible for the monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of this policy and the development and implementation of the Sustainable Energy Plan.

Policy: National Youth Policy.
Policy_Content: The National Youth Policy is a national policy with multi-sectoral approach with a duration of four years (2011-2014). The policy aims to provide an enabling environment where youth development is mainstreamed into the various focal areas of national development. The policy is focused on the areas of empowering youths to explore and use their abilities and potential that will help create an enabling environment for sustainable livelihoods and success and the further acquisition of knowledge and skills; facilitating equal opportunity for participation in leadership and decision-making processes at all levels; encouraging youths to actively participate in sports and recreational activities to attain maximum achievements and satisfaction; encouraging youths to appreciate and practice high standards of personal health, hygiene, and healthy lifestyles; promoting and enhancing life-skills training and experiences; facilitating the engagement of youth in environment management and conservation of Fiji’s natural resources including mitigating the impacts of climate change; promoting respect and understanding for cultural, religious, and ethnic diversity.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Sector Strategic Framework.
Policy_Content: This WASH Sector Strategic Framework is a nationwide cross-sectoral document aiming to identify priority areas (distinguished in three levels of priority High, Medium, and Low) for future interventions and it spells out a number of approaches that these will have to use. It is a major step for putting into practice the principles laid out in the Water Policy of 2007. After setting out the priorities for water sector development, the Policy links them to the other sectors, providing a basic framework to guide future detailed implementation strategies. The Vision at the basis of the document is to achieve "Sustainable harnessing and accountable management of water resources that respond to water related public-health needs, livelihoods and development aspirations of the people of South Sudan in an equitable manner". The consequent Mission aims at drawing up of policies, standards, guidelines and plans for water resources management, development and utilization; and provision of sanitation and hygiene services.

Policy: Ley pecuaria del Estado de Oaxaca.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley establece el marco normativo para la organización, programación y fomento pecuario en el Estado de Oaxaca. Sus disposiciones tienen por objeto: a) procurar la sanidad, mejoramiento y protección de las especies animales útiles al hombre y su medio ambiente, que constituyan un aprovechamiento zootécnico-económico; b) la industrialización y comercialización de sus productos, subproductos y esquilmos del sector pecuario y aquellos de la agricultura empleados en la nutrición animal e industrias afines; c) el establecimiento de las medidas sanitarias aplicables; d) la regulación de la propiedad y movilización del ganado, sus productos, subproductos y su sacrificio; e) la conservación, mejoramiento y aprovechamiento racional de los recursos naturales relacionados con el sector pecuario que impulsen el desarrollo sustentable; f) el fomento al mejoramiento genético de los hatos, criaderos, criaderos de abejas reinas, parvadas, piaras, apiarios y rebaños fundamentalmente, así como de las diferentes especies zootécnicas que se aprovechen con fines comerciales, industriales, traspatio, investigación u otros.
Subject: Livestock, Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Keyword: Animal production,Food quality control/food safety,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Range,Pastoralism,Framework law,Animal health,Apiculture/sericulture,Pests/diseases,Cooperative/producer organization,Marking/identification,Inspection,Grazing,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Law No. 15/2011 establishing the guidelines for the contracting, implementing and monitoring process of public-private partnerships, large-scale projects and business concessions.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 42 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes the guidelines for the contracting, implementing and monitoring process of public-private partnerships (PPP), large-scale projects (PGD) and business concessions (CE) carried out in the country, under the initiative, decision and control of governmental entities at the central, provincial and local levels. The following are excluded from the scope of this Law: a) the contracting of simple supply of goods and services to State institutions, including contracting public works and consulting services; b) public-private partnerships of social, humanitarian, cultural, sporting or similar non-profit nature. The PPP, PGD and CE contracts are subject to compliance with the following guiding principles namely: a) its framework in the policy, strategy and development plans of the respective economic or social sector; b) its contribution to the development of the effective and efficient exploitation capacity and economic valuation of national assets and resources; c) fairness in sharing the benefits accruing from each activity, between the contracting parties and stakeholders; d) commitment in the prevention and mitigation of risks inherent in each specific undertaking; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Business/industry/corporations,Public private partnership (PPP),Sustainable development,Fiscal and market measures,Concession
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 4.682 - Se crea en el ámbito de la Provincia de Río Negro el "Plan de Remediación Ambiental" destinado a las áreas afectadas por la exploración y explotación de hidrocarburos y otras actividades conexas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea en el ámbito de la Provincia de Río Negro el Plan de Remediación Ambiental, destinado a las áreas afectadas por la exploración y explotación de hidrocarburos y otras actividades conexas. En particular, dicho Plan cuantifica los daños y pasivos causados por la explotación y exploración de hidrocarburos al medio ambiente, a la salud de la población y a los fundos superficiales, debiendo determinar los potenciales costos de remediación y reparación que pudieran suscitarse como consecuencia del cumplimiento de objetivos como: limpieza general de las superficies de los yacimientos; remediación del subsuelo por derrames de petróleo; repoblamiento vegetal y forestal de las zonas desertificadas, con especies autóctono-nativas; remediación y preservación de fuentes naturales de agua potable.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: La presente Ley entró en vigencia el 30 de agosto de 2011.

Policy: Ley Nº 4.682 - Plan de Remediación Ambiental.

El Plan tiene por objeto cuantificar los daños y pasivos causados por la explotación y exploración de hidrocarburos al medio ambiente, a la salud de la población y a los fondos superficiales, debiendo determinar los potenciales costos de remediación y reparación.

Policy: Neighbourhood Disputes (Dividing Fences and Trees) Act 2011.
Policy_Content: The objects of this Act, consisting of 99 sections divided into six Chapters and completed by one Schedule, are: a) to provide rules about each neighbour’s responsibility for dividing fences and for trees so that neighbours are generally able to resolve issues about fences or trees without a dispute arising; and b) to facilitate the resolution of any disputes about dividing fences or trees that do arise between neighbours. This Act applies to the following areas: 1) Agricultural land is rural land of more than half a hectare used for cultivating crops on a commercial basis regardless of whether the land is also used for residential purposes. 2) Pastoral land is rural land of more than half a hectare used for grazing stock on a commercial basis regardless of whether the land is also used for residential purposes. 3) Prescribed rural land is agricultural land, pastoral land or other rural land of more than half a hectare primarily used for residential purposes. 4) Residential land is land, other than agricultural land and pastoral land, used primarily for residential purposes.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Land-use planning,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Dispute settlement,Cultural heritage,Grazing
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: Ss 1-2 of this Act enter into force on 9 August 2011. Remaining provisions on 1 November 2011.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 11/2011 creating the National Institute of Meteorology of Guinea-Bissau (INM-GB).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law approves the Statute of the National Institute of Meteorology of Guinea-Bissau (INM-GB). The above mentioned Statute, consisting of 7 Chapters, specifies composition, duties and competencies of this National Institute, entitled to implement National policies on this area, to guarantee the control over weather forecast and regularly disseminate information on the National territory; to guarantee controls and research on climate change, analyzing the impacts that they may have on local populations; to guarantee the settlement and conservation of meteorological, climatic and hydrometric stations, to guarantee the collection, treatment and analysis of data in the domain of meteorology. This Decree-Law repeals the General Direction of National Meteorology (DGMN) transferring its competencies and functions to the INM-GB.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

El Decreto contempla mecanismos como la cuenta públcia participativa, los consejos de la sociedad civil, la consulta ciudadana y el acceso a la información relevante.

Policy: Loi nº 1-13 du 9 août 2011 portant revision du Code foncier du Burundi.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte revision du Code foncier. La question foncière est un enjeu majeur de développement  pour le Burundi  Le pays est confronté à une importante croissance démographique, à une multiplication des conflits sur la terre liés à la perte de valeur du témoignage oral du système traditionnel, à la situation post-conflit qui voit le retour massif des réfugiés et des déplacés, ce qui accroit de plus en plus la pression foncière. De plus, le Code foncier appliqué jusqu’aujourd’hui date du 1er septembre 1986. Ce Code contient des dispositions datant de l’époque coloniale, qui ne peuvent pas résoudre les problèmes actuels. Aussi, le besoin s’est fait sentir d’avoir des dispositions légales contenues dans un code unique.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Basic legislation,Land tenure,Ownership,Servitude,Cadastre/land registration,Public land,Concession,Transfer,Right of use,Expropriation,Policy/planning,Traditional rights/customary rights,Smallholders/peasants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2011-001 du 08 août 2011 portant réglementation et répression des infractions relatives aux bois de rose et aux bois d'ébène.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance porte interdiction de l'exploitation du bois d'ébène et du bois de rose. Tous les agréments d'exportation délivrés sont annulés. Les stocks des bois précieux saisis sur tout le territoire Malagasy seront inventoriés. Les opérateurs ont  un délai jusqu’au 07 septembre 2011 pour déclarer leurs stocks de bois de rose. Les dispositions de cette ordonnance  prévoient entre autres l'aggravation du quantum des peines, la répression du stockage ou détention, de l'achat, de l'exportation de bois de rose et de bois d'ébène, la suppression des circonstances atténuantes et de la faculté accordée aux juges d'ordonner le sursis à l'exécution des peines d'emprisonnement ou d'amende, à l'égard des individus coupables des infractions relatives aux bois de rose et bois d'ébène et la mise en place d'une juridiction spéciale.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,International trade,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Offences/penalties

Policy: Regional Law No. 62-OZ “On particulars of regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of regional state bodies and local government related to land tenure of urban land pertaining to public land. It shall not be applicable to agricultural land and land of protected areas. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) decision-making related to auction sale of plots of land or trade of the right to conclude lease contracts; (b) decision-making related to transfer ion ownership of urban land plots; (c) decision-making on cessation of public servitude; (d) decision-making related to establishment of land charges; and (e) validation of distribution scheme of land plots o cadastre maps.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation of Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region on  supply and use of electricity power.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to lay down the general principles of the construction, production, supply and utilization of the electric power, and to ensure and promote the development of the electric power, protect the legitimate rights and interests of investors, entrepreneurs and users of electric power and maintain the safe services of electric power. The Regulation consists of 54 articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Supply and Utilization of Electricity (II); Electricity Price and Electricity Fee (III); Agricultural Use of Electricity (IV); Protection of Electric Facilities (V); Supervision and Inspection (VI); Legal Responsibilities (VII); Supplementary Provisions (VIII).  The people's government at or above the county level shall, when distributing electricity quotas, guarantee proper proportion of electricity for use in agriculture and in the rural areas, giving first priority to rural use of electricity for draining water-logged fields and combating drought as well as for seasonal agricultural production. The Regulation further provides for obligations of electricity suppliers, restrictions on the use of electrical products, and offences and penalties.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 789-KZ “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of environmental protection, including air protection, environmental audit, and is aimed at conservation, rational management and reproduction of natural resources, prevention of negative environmental impact of economic activities and mitigation of the consequences thereof. Regional territory shall be subject to ecological certification with a view of provision of citizens, organizations and state bodies with reliable information related to the state of environment. Regional ecological certificate shall contain information characterizing ecological state of the territory, assessment of environmental impact and stock of natural resources and the scale of their management.

Policy: Austrian Spatial Development Concept ÖREK 2011
Policy_Content: This Policy,the Austrian Spatial Development Concept (ÖREK) is a strategic steering instrument for overall spatial planning and development at the national and Länder level as well as for cities and municipalities. An economic spatial development strategy should pursue the following general objectives: -substantially support structural change and promote the competitiveness of the country and its regions; -contribute to the specific and spatially harmonised expansion of regional location qualities (especially accessibility) and secure this sustainably; -reduce the effects of national borders and strengthen cross-border economic relations; -promote research and development, strengthen the innovation capacity of the regions and improve the qualifications of inhabitants.

Policy: Order No. 388 of the Ministry of Economic Development validating the Requirements for land surveying.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes requirements for land surveying projects of the plots of land. Land surveying project shall be approved by: (a) common decision of the assembly of land shareholders for agricultural land; and (b) decision of the owner of a land share or land shares. Land surveying project shall be validated by land cadastre engineer. Annex 1 contains the form of recommended model land surveying project.

Policy: Law No. 751 “On licensing system”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, organizational and economic grounds of licensing system, the list of activities subject to licensing, the types of authorizations and permits, ensuring protection of legal rights of citizens and environment. The Act consists of 6 Sections divided into 32 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) principles of regulation of licensing system; (3) assessment procedures of regulatory documentation; (4) the modalities of issuance of authorization or permit; (5) authorities and the list of authorizations and permits; and (6) conclusive provisions. Authorization and permit shall be issued for the period of validity of the respective licence (Art. 8). Authorization and permits shall be issued for the activities performed in the following fields: (a) phytosanitary and plant quarantine; (b) veterinary; (c) sanitary and epidemiological supervision; (d) environmental protection; (e) land survey; (f) energy; and (g) transport (Art. 29).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law No. 760 “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal grounds of state policy in the sphere of environmental protection and is aimed at ensuring sustainable development, healthy and favourable environment, prevention of negative environmental impact, ecological safety and rational use of natural resources. The present Law regulates the relations connected with interaction of the society and environment, arising during the implementation of economic and other environmental impact related activities on the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan. The organizational basis of the state policy in the field of environmental protection shall be programs, strategies and plans for environmental protection developed by the authorized state body of the Republic of Tajikistan in the area of environmental protection and is approved by the Government.  The following are subject to protection against pollution, spoilage, damage, depletion, destruction and economic and other activities by natural and legal persons: (a) land, subsoil, soils; (b) surface and underground water; (c) atmospheric air, the ozone layer of the Earth; and (d) fauna and flora, including forests all species of biodiversity, as well as genetic fund thereof. State nature reserves and buffer zones, state nature sanctuaries, nature sanctuaries, and national parks, dendrological parks, botanical gardens and forest reserves are subject to special protection. Other natural complexes and objects of special nature protection, scientific, historical, cultural, aesthetic, recreational, healthcare and environmental significance, including biosphere reserves and buffer zones, as well as rare or endangered wild fauna and wild flora species, natural habitats thereof shall be subject to special protection.  Groundwater formation zones (river valleys, alluvial cones, pre-mountain shelves), rare geological discoveries (deposits) and mineralogical formations, paleontological objects and other subsoil areas of special scientific, cultural and other value, riparian zones and water protection zones (strips) of waterbodies and fishery reservoirs shall be subject to special protection in accordance with the procedure determined by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan. This Law establishes the competence of the government, authorized state bodies and local government in the field of environmental protection. It also establishes the rights and the duties of citizens in the field of nature management and environmental protection. Use of natural resources shall require payment of environmental fees. The Act consists of 17 Sections divided into 85 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) competence of state executive bodies in the sphere of environmental protection; (3) rights and duties of citizens, public associations and other non-governmental entities in the sphere of environmental protection; (4) economic regulation in the sphere of environmental protection; (5) rate setting of environmental standards; (6) environmental impact assessment and environmental audit; (7) ecological requirements applicable to location, construction and putting in operation of enterprises, edifices and works; (8) ecological requirements applicable to the functioning of enterprises; (9) environmental emergencies and disasters; (10) environmental statistics; (11) protected areas; (12) observation of the state of environment; (13) environmental control; (14) environmental audit; (15) environmental education; (16) liability, compensation and dispute settlement; and (17) conclusive provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protection of environment,Framework law,EIA,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Non-governmental entity,Disasters,Protected area,Education,Liability/compensation,Dispute settlement,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental fees/charges,Public health,Cultural heritage,Local government,Soil pollution/quality,Surface water,Groundwater,Recreational water use,Sustainable development,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Environmental planning

Policy: Law No. 761 “Forest Code”.
Policy_Content: This Forest Code establishes that its provisions shall be applicable to the unified national forest fund, including land of public forest, unforested land, forest resources and beneficial properties of forest irrespectively of land tenure. Forest resources shall be managed and protected with the consideration of multifunctional value of forests, as well as recognition of them as the main means of production in forestry sector. The forest legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan is based on the following principles: (a) government regulation and control; (b) preservation of biodiversity of forests, natural reserves and areas of natural and cultural heritage; (c) sustainable forest management, for the development and sustainable use of forest resources on the basis of forest management planning; (d) compensation for damage to forest and hunting due to the infringement of acting legislation; (e) availability of information on the state of the forest fund; (f) economic principles and payment for use of forest resources; (g) public participation in the conservation, protection, reproduction and sustainable use of the forest fund; (h) recognition of the national importance of forests performing climate-regulating, environment-forming, soil-protective, water protection and other protective functions. All forests located on the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan, as well as lands of the state forest fund, regardless of the forms of economic activity, shall form unified forest fund. The unified forest fund includes the state forest fund and the public forest fund. The state forest fund includes natural forests, regardless of their land tenure, forests of artificial origin, which are under the jurisdiction of state bodies, as well as unforested land, which are provided for the needs of forestry. The public forest fund includes forests of artificial origin, planted at the expense of the funds of dekhkan (agricultural) farms, production cooperatives, legal entities, and also at the expense of other non-state economic entities. Forest fund of the Republic of Tajikistan shall be protected from fires, felling and hunting, from harmful insects and other pests that are harmful to the forest. State Forest Service shall be subordinated to the authorized state forest institution and its staff shall be attributed the competence of forest inspectors. The objective of forest management shall be enforcement of legal and technical requirements of rational use of forest resources. State forest fund shall be subject to mandatory inventory, registration and periodical (once in 5 years) monitoring. This Forest Code consists of IX Sections sub-divided into XVI Chapters composed of 75 Articles. Section I is general part. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Section II regards state management and control of forests. Chapter II regards state management and control of forest fund. Section III regards guardianship and protection of forests. Chapter III regards guardianship and protection of forest fund. Chapter IV regards State Forest Service. Chapter V establishes the particulars of guardianship, protection, reproduction and sustainable use of forests. Section IV regards organization of forestry sector. Chapter VI establishes tasks and requirements of organization of forestry sector. Section V regards state forest inventory. Chapter VII regards state forest inventory and forest planning. Section VI regards afforestation, reforestation and raising forest productivity. Chapter VIII regards afforestation and reforestation. Section VII establishes the right of forest ownership. Chapter IX regards forest ownership. Section VIII regards forest uses. Chapter X establishes the criteria for joint forest management. Chapter XI establishes the right of forest use. Chapter XII regards management of forest fund. Section IX establishes economic mechanisms of forest management. Chapter XIII regards forestry economy. Chapter XIV regards financing of forestry sector. Chapter XV regards international cooperation. Chapter XVI lays down final provisions.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Framework law,Basic legislation,Forest service/forest officers,Sustainable use,Public forest,Public participation,Inventory,Monitoring,Forest species,Afforestation/reforestation,Forestry protection measures,Biodiversity,Policy/planning,Forest fires,Pests/diseases,Cultural heritage,Offences/penalties,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Government of Kurgan region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Kurgan region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Kurgan region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Kurgan region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 337 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on timber extraction.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes requirements for timber extraction in all the forest zones of the Russian Federation. Timber extraction shall be carried out in accordance with the requirements set forth by this Regulation, regional forest management plan, forestry regulations of forest districts (forest parks), and also forest development plan and forest declaration (except for cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract for standing timber). Indigenous population of the North, Siberia and Far East of the Russian Federation shall have the right for timber extraction for personal needs as traditional rights free of charge. Timber extraction shall be carried out within rated wood cutting areas in accordance with purposeful use of forests, forestries and predominant forest species. Timber extraction and logging, partial processing, storage and transportation of timber shall be carried out by the person managing plot of land for the period of 12 months from the date state in forest declaration or for the period established by purchase and sale contract.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Loi n°2011-005 du 01 août 2011 instituant l’Ordre des géomètres experts à Madagascar.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée un Ordre des géomètres experts à Madagascar regroupant les personnes habilitées à exercer la profession de géomètre expert. En effet, est géomètre expert le technicien, exerçant une profession libérale qui, en son propre nom et sous sa responsabilité personnelle, effectue les études topographiques et les opérations topographiques foncières notamment: bornage, fixation des limites des biens et de leur consistance, établissement d’un plan régulier, lotissement, évaluation immobilière, expertise judiciaire. Cette loi fixe l’organisation de la profession de géomètre expert (bureau national de l’ordre, bureau régional de l’ordre, l’assemblée générale, et tableau de l’ordre).  Ensuite, elle détermine l’exercice de la profession:cabinet-démission-vacance.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 593 validating National Program for the establishment of the National Ecological Network for the period of 2011-2018.
Policy_Content: This cross-sectoral National Ecological Network is an integral part of the Pan-European Ecological Network and has been developed in accordance with the requirements of the Pan-European Biological and Landscape Diversity Strategy (Sofia, 1995), which laid the foundation for cooperation between governments, international organizations, institutions, agencies and non-governmental organizations. The strategy aims to conserve ecosystems, habitats, flora and fauna, and landscape diversity of European importance through the development of the Pan-European Ecological Network over a period of 10 years. The evolution and trends of annual biodiversity loss, soil degradation, damage and significant changes in natural ecosystems, especially the consequences of these phenomena, require a change in approach to the prevention of natural disasters, namely the transition from defensive actions to forms of management, sustainable management of natural resources and ecosystems. This requires a new approach to the problems through territorial planning and sustainable management of natural ecosystems, protection and conservation of flora and fauna, and therefore, the inclusion of solutions to these problems in the concept of sustainable development of the country by reducing and preventing environmental degradation.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
