Policy: Governmental Decree No. 435 validating the Regulation on constituting of a permanent command center for the prevention of avalanches, landslides, other slope processes and the elimination of their consequences on public roads of the Kyrgyz Republic.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that permanent command center for the prevention of avalanches, landslides, other slope processes and the elimination of their consequences on public roads shall be coordinating authority for the prevention of the aforesaid natural disasters. The main purpose of the permanent command center shall be to prevent the loss of life, destruction of inhabited areas, power lines, gas pipelines, water supply lines, sewage systems and others. The main tasks of the permanently operating command center shall be as follows: (a) organization and implementation of continuous monitoring of the state of avalanche, landslide-prone areas, rockfalls and other slope processes for preventive measures; (b) organization of preventive measures in order to reduce the threat of avalanche, landslides, rockfalls and other slope processes; (c) organization of early warning system of the population, organizations and departments through the mass media about the arrangements underway; (d) planning and organizing explanatory work through the mass media on the use of vehicles in winter, during the arrangements for the forced descent of avalanches, landslides and rockfalls; and (e) coordination of actions to eliminate the consequences of avalanche, landslides, rockfalls and other slope processes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Monitoring,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Risk assessment/management

Policy: Ley Nº 22/2011 - Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto regular la gestión de los residuos impulsando medidas que prevengan su generación y mitiguen los impactos adversos sobre la salud humana y el medio ambiente asociados a su generación y gestión, mejorando la eficiencia en el uso de los recursos. Tiene asimismo como objeto regular el régimen jurídico de los suelos contaminados. Esta Ley es de aplicación a todo tipo de residuos, con las siguientes exclusiones: 1) Las emisiones a la atmósfera reguladas en la Ley de calidad del aire y protección de la atmósfera, así como el dióxido de carbono capturado y transportado con fines de almacenamiento geológico y efectivamente almacenado en formaciones geológicas de conformidad con la Ley de almacenamiento geológico de dióxido de carbono. Tampoco se aplicará al almacenamiento geológico de dióxido de carbono realizado con fines de investigación, desarrollo o experimentación de nuevos productos y procesos siempre que la capacidad prevista de almacenamiento sea inferior a 100 kilotoneladas. 2) Los suelos no contaminados excavados y otros materiales naturales excavados durante las actividades de construcción, cuando se tenga la certeza de que estos materiales se utilizarán con fines de construcción en su estado natural en el lugar u obra donde fueron extraídos. 3) Los residuos radiactivos. 4) Los explosivos desclasificados. 5) Las materias fecales, paja y otro material natural, agrícola o silvícola, no peligroso, utilizado en explotaciones agrícolas y ganaderas, en la silvicultura o en la producción de energía a base de esta biomasa, mediante procedimientos o métodos que no pongan en peligro la salud humana o dañen el medio ambiente. La determinación de los residuos que han de considerarse como residuos peligrosos y no peligrosos se hará de conformidad con la lista establecida en la Decisión 2000/532/CE de la Comisión, de 3 de mayo de 2000.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Decree on the landfill of waste.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Decree of this Government of the Republic of Slovenia is to minimize the effects of adverse environmental impacts of the lamndfill of waste, particularly due to the effects of pollution caused by emissions of substances in surface water, groundwater, soil and atmosphere, and in the context of global environmental pollution to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and prevent risks to human health. The present Decree lays down maximum levels of pollutants in waste disposal, compulsory treatment and other conditions of the disposal and the conditions and actions related to the design, construction, operation and closure of landfills and treatment after their closure. This Decree also establishes mandatory practices and other conditions for the disposal of waste in underground storage. This Decree is composed of 68 articles divided into the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Mandatory practices and other conditions of waste disposal (Sec. 2); Spatial planning, design and construction of the landfill of waste (Sec. 3); Environmental permit for the landfill operations (Sec. 4); Operation of the landfill (Sec. 5); Closing the landfill and measures after closure of the landfill (Sec. 6); Waste disposal in underground storage (Sec. 7); Control (Sec. 8); Penalty provisions (Sec. 9); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 10).
Subject: Land & soil, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Grid Expansion Acceleration Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act simplifies the planning of grid expansion projects which involve several federal states or cross national boundaries: power line routes are centrally planned and approved by the Federal Network Agency in a process involving early public participation. In addition, the Federal Network Agency is responsible for the statutory planning approval procedure for grid expansion projects, which means it can define the precise route of the power lines. The transfer of the planning responsibility from state to federal level streamlines the process and avoids the fragmentation of tasks. The text consists of 35 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Federal Grid Plan (2); Planning Statement (3); Common provisions (4); Authorities and bodies (5); Penalties and final provisions (6).
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decreto Nº 36764-MAG — Política de Estado para el Sector Agroalimentario y el Desarrollo Rural Costarricense, 2010-2021.
Policy_Content: El presente documento establece la Política de Estado para el Sector Agroalimentario y el Desarrollo Rural Costarricense, que es una política multisectorial y de alcance nacional, relativa al período 2010-2021. En el marco de los lineamientos y las prioridades definidas para el sector agroalimentario en el Plan de Gobierno 2010-2014, el documento está concebido como el instrumento de dirección, coordinación y articulación que orientará las decisiones y acciones para que el sector agroalimentario y rural contribuya al crecimiento y al desarrollo nacional. Esta Política de Estado se sustenta en cuatro ejes temáticos, denominados pilares de la política: a) competitividad; b) innovación y desarrollo tecnológico; c) gestión de los territorios rurales y agricultura familiar; y d) cambio climático y gestión agroambiental. El objetivo general enunciado en el Capítulo 3 (Lineamientos generales de la política) es alcanzar un sector agroalimentario posicionado como motor del desarrollo costarricense, inclusivo, moderno, competitivo y responsable ambientalmente.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 105/11 approving the Regulation of the Hydrographical and Maritime Marking Institute of Angola (IHSMA).
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the Hydrographical and Maritime Marking Institute of Angola (IHSMA). The Regulation, consisting of 3 Chapters, establishes the functioning of the above mentioned institution, entitled to define its organization and functioning, created to implement the functions of coordination, orientation, control, inspection, licensing and regulation of all activities related to hydrography, cartography navigation, oceanography, drainage and maritime signalization, taking into consideration the pollution control of maritime sector.

Policy: Décret n°953-PR-METFP du 27 juillet 2011 portant création et organisation de l'Ecole Supérieure des Métiers du Bois.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un établissement public à caractère professionnel dénommé Ecole Supérieure des Métiers du Bois (E.S.M.B) ou (l'Ecole). Cette Ecole est placée sous la tutelle du Ministère de l'Enseignement Technique et de la Formation Professionnelle.

Policy: Act to eliminate fees for the maintenance of small parcels of public land (P.L. No. 17-48).
Policy_Content: This Act stipulates that the Department of Public Lands shall not assess rental fees in respect to small parcels of public land, not in excess of 300 square meters, adjacent to land used for residential purposes where the residential land owner maintains the public land by removing undesirable vegetation and habitat for pests.
Subject: Land & soil, Cultivated plants

Policy: Regional Decree No. 342-PP validating the Regulation on composition, elaboration, coordination and submittal for validation of land-use planning projects related to protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes composition, elaboration, coordination and submittal for validation of land-use planning projects related to protected areas. The scope of the aforesaid project shall be to ensure functioning of protected areas in compliance with legal regulation and classification of protected areas with a view of conservation of unique and typical natural complexes and objects and ecological education of the population.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que regula los criterios ambientales de calidad de los combustibles líquidos y sólidos utilizados en hornos y caldera de uso comercial e industrial y en motores de combustión interna de vehículos automotores, respecto a los requisitos de calidad para los biocombustibles y sus mezclas con el combustible fósil.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Programa de reducción de la contaminación ambiental, racionalización del subsidio de combustibles del transporte público y su chatarrización, respecto al incentivo financiero no reembolsable para la chatarrización que se otorgará en función del tipo de vehículo y de los rangos de antigüedad.

Policy: Ley Nº 29779 - Ley que otorga plazo excepcional a los deudores de la deuda agraria y establece medidas para viabilizar la reestructuración de la deuda agraria y la acogida a sus beneficios.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley otorga plazo excepcional a los deudores comprendidos en la Ley de reestructuración de la deuda agraria, en la Ley que viabiliza la ejecución del Programa de Reestructuración de la Deuda Agraria (PREDA) y en el Decreto de Urgencia que dicta medidas para viabilizar la ejecución del PREDA, para que se acojan a sus beneficios.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo modifica la Ley marco de asociaciones público-privadas para la generación de empleo productivo y que dicta normas para la agilización de los procesos de promoción de la inversión privada, en relación a la definición de la naturaleza de las iniciativas privadas.

Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Decreto, se mantiene vigente la suspensión del otorgamiento de contratos para la prospección, la exploración y la explotación en la Plataforma Continental Uruguaya.

Policy_Content: This Decision approves the master plan on the socio-economic development of Kien Giang province.

Policy: Decree No. 62/2011/ND-CP on the establishment of provincial cities, towns, urban districts, wards and townships.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides for conditions and criteria for, and process of, compilation and appraisal of dossiers of establishment of provincial cities, towns, urban districts, wards and townships. The Ministry of Home Affairs shall assume the prime responsibility for guiding the implementation of this Decree.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 25 September 2011.

Policy: Radioactive Substances Exemption (Northern Ireland) Order 2011 (S.R. No. 289 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order revokes and replaces a series of exemption orders made under the Radioactive Substances Act 1993 and its predecessor (the Radioactive Substances Act 1960 in order to rationalize the current system of exemptions and align this more closely with the structure and terminology used in the Basic Safety Standards Directive. Particular provision is made in relation to the disposal of various kinds of radioactive waste, whether from natural sources or contamination.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Radioactive Substances Act 1993 (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 290 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Radioactive Substances Act 1993 in provisions which make provision with respect to the control on the handling of radioactive substances and the disposal of radioactive waste. The principal objective is to further adjust the provisions of the Act to Council Directive 96/29/Euratom laying down basic safety standards for the protection of the health of workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionizing radiation. New provisions define the substances and articles which are classified as “radioactive material” or “radioactive waste” under the Act, and which are subject to the controls under the Act. A new Schedule 1A (Tables of NORM industrial activities, radionuclides and summation rules) is introduced, Schedule 1 replaced and sections 8(4) and (5) and 15(1) repealed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2011-887 du 26 juillet 2011 portant renouvellement de l'Observatoire des territoires.
Policy_Content: L'Observatoire des territoires placé auprès du ministre chargé de l'aménagement du territoire,  est chargé de rassembler, d'analyser et de diffuser les informations et les données relatives aux dynamiques et aux inégalités territoriales ainsi qu'aux politiques menées dans le champ de l'aménagement et du développement des territoires. Le présent décret renouvelle l'observatoire pour une durée de six ans. Il confirme les missions de l'observatoire, ajuste sa composition et précise les modalités de son fonctionnement.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Law No. 129 amending Law No. 15 on prohibition of felling, transportation, purchase and trade, procurement and use, import and export of precious (walnut and junipers) forest species.
Policy_Content: Article 1 shall be amended to add the following wording: “forest species damaged in a way preventing growth thereof”.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest species,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Land clearing,Offences/penalties,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 415 validating the Regulation on Special Fund of the Ministry of Energy.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that Special Fund of the Ministry of Energy shall be used for the following purposes: (a) regular public hearings related to energy policy; (b) publication of annual reports of the Ministry of Energy; (c) scientific research related to elaboration of standards, methodologies and guidelines; and (d) international cooperation.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 407 validating the outcome of the National Forest Inventory.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree entitles State Agency on Environmental Protection and Forestry, with the consideration of the results of the National Forest Inventory, to perform analysis of the national forest legislation, inserting the necessary amendments therein, to carry out forest organization of the Unified forest fund (the totality of public forests) and protected areas,  and together with State Registration Service to insert modifications in the national land cadastre and distribution of land by categories.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law No. 145 “On attribution of special status to border areas”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to ensure better living conditions of the population in border areas. Priority activity of state bodies and local self-government in border areas with special status shall be: (a) land reclamation; (b) conservation and rational management of natural resources; and (c) prevention of natural disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: Law No. 142 Technical Regulation “On fire safety”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be protection of human life, health, environment and, in particular, forests against fires. Forest fire prevention and extinguishing shall be ensured by specialized forest fire service. It contains rates of water resources required for extinguishing forest materials.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force 12 calendar months after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 137 “On energy efficiency of edifices”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to promote and improve energy efficiency of edifices with a view of reduction of consumption of energy resources and emissions of greenhouse gases to the atmosphere. It shall be applicable to: (a) edifices of different types; (b) projecting, operation, rent, lease, trade of edifices and energy renovation thereof. Energy efficiency of edifices shall be based upon the following principles: (a) efficient and rational use of energy resources; (b) reduction of consumption of primary energy; (c) consistency of regulations set for energy efficiency of edifices; and (d) reduction of emissions of greenhouse gases in CO2 equivalent. It also regulates energy certification of edifices.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force six months after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2218-OD amending Regional Law No. 1908-OD “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: Article 14 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Land parcels within the boundaries containing objects of cultural heritage of regional significance shall be classifies as protected areas by decision of the Regional Administration that establishes the modalities of land tenure and protection thereof”.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 29778 - Ley marco para el desarrollo e integración fronteriza.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley marco para el desarrollo e integración fronteriza, define los espacios de frontera y establece los mecanismos de formulación, coordinación, ejecución y seguimiento de la Política Nacional de Desarrollo e Integración Fronterizos.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 066-2011-PCM ─ Plan de Desarrollo de la Sociedad de la Información en el Perú - La Agenda Digital Peruana 2.0.
Policy_Content: La presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Plan de Desarrollo de la Sociedad de la Información en el Perú - La Agenda Digital Peruana 2.0, elaborado por la Comisión Multisectorial de Seguimiento y Evaluación para el Desarrollo de la Sociedad de la Información (CODESI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 7/2011 creating the Interministerial Comission of Biofuels (CIB).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 9 articles, creates the Inter-ministerial Commission of Biofuel (CIB). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled to guarantee the implementation of Policies and Strategies of Biofuel; to establish mechanisms of biofuel sustainable production based on local agro-energetic resources; to participate in the identification of adequate areas for producing biofuel prime-materials in coordination of the Ministry of Agriculture; to promote the research, development and innovation in biofuel sector; to create the environment for investments in biofuel production area; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Order No. 318 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on preparation and conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species growing on land pertaining to public or municipal property, and model form of purchase and sale contract of forest species.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of preparation and conclusion of purchase and sale contract related to forest species growing on land pertaining to public or municipal property. Purchase and sale contract shall be concluded: (a) through tender in case of timber extraction for state and municipal needs, timber extraction of fir trees and other coniferous species for Happy New Year celebration; and (b) without tender in cases envisaged by the Articles 19 and 30 of the Forest Code. Purchase and sale contracts shall be conclude by state bodies and local self-government within their sphere of competence. Indigenous population of the North, Siberia and Far East of the Russian Federation shall have the right for timber extraction for personal needs as traditional rights free of charge.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest species,Contract/agreement,Timber extraction/logging,Traditional rights/customary rights,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 319 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on preparation and conclusion of lease contracts of the plots of forest pertaining to public or municipal property, and model form of lease contract of a plot of forest.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that plots of forest that have passed state registration shall be subject to lease. Plot of public forest can be conceded on lease for one of the following purposes: (a) timber extraction; (b) procurement of soft resin; (c) procurement of non-timber forest products; (d) hunting; (e) agriculture; (f) scientific research and education; (g) recreational activity; (h) growing of fruits, berries, edible nuts, ornamental and medicinal plants; (i) creation of artificial waterbodies; (j) processing of timber and other forest resources; (k) exploration; (l) growing of planting material of forest species; and (m) other uses of forests in accordance with purposeful use of land. The duration of lease contract can be for the period up to 49 years. Lease contract shall be subject to mandatory state registration.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 7.535 creating the National Programme for Water Use "Água para todos".
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 13 articles, creates the National Programme for Water Use "Água para todos". By the creation of this Programme, this Decree establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to access and use water resources in rural areas and agricultural lands for irrigation purposes, human consumption, and agricultural production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Federal Law No. 260-FZ amending Federal Law No. 264-FZ on agricultural development.
Policy_Content: Article 7 shall be amended to add the following wording: “As a condition for provision of subsidies from federal budget to regional budgets for the production of some agricultural commodities can be established availability of agricultural insurance contracts issued to the producers of agricultural commodities (except for agricultural small-holding and agricultural consumer cooperatives) complying with the requirements set by the Federal Law on state support in the sphere of agricultural insurance”.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: Regulation on information required for preparation of the national allocation plan for emission allowances.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs and seven Annexes, lays down the scope, deadline of submitting and the form of information which are used for preparation of the national allocation plan for emission allowances. An operator of installation included in the emission trading scheme, passes to the National Centre for Emission Management the following information: (1) installation identification; (2) volume of production and emission of carbon dioxide and activities taken to reduces emission of carbon dioxide and energy introduced in the biomass; (3) types and volume of spent fuel; (4) description of combustion processes; (5) description of technological processes; (6) reduction of carbon dioxide as a result of joint implementation projects; (7) planned or new fuel combustion installations; (8) planned or new installation other than fuel combustion installations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 31 July 2011.

Policy: Ley Nº 29768 - Ley de Mancomunidad Regional.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer el marco legal de la mancomunidad regional, estableciendo un mecanismo de coordinación entre gobiernos regionales para la prestación conjunta de servicios públicos, cofinanciamiento en la ejecución de obras que promuevan la integración y participación social. La mancomunidad regional no constituye nivel de gobierno.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ley Nº 29769 - Ley de promoción de la calidad y autenticidad de los productos industriales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de necesidad pública la promoción de la comercialización segura de productos industriales, nacionales o importados, a fin de luchar contra la adulteración de los envases, recipientes, envolturas o empaques intactos originales.

Policy: Resolución Nº 234-2011-MIMDES ─ Modifica el Texto Único de Procedimientos Administrativos (TUPA) del Ministerio de la Mujer y Desarrollo Social (MIMDES).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica el Texto Único de Procedimientos Administrativos (TUPA) del Ministerio de la Mujer y Desarrollo Social (MIMDES), en aspectos relacionados con procedimientos administrativos.

Policy: Land (Duties and Taxes) (Amendment of Schedule) Regulations 2011 (GN No. 149 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Land (Duties and Taxes) Act in the Second Schedule in relation to the date of transfer of land by a company forming part of a group of companies or a lessee who is the holder of a new lease pursuant to section 6(1E) of the State Lands Act or section 10(3B) of the Pas Géométriques Act.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decreto Nº 257/011 - Otórgase a la Oficina de Planeamiento y Presupuesto  un crédito por el Impuesto al Valor Agregado incluido en las adquisiciones de bienes y servicios destinados a la ejecución del “Programa de Cambio Climático”.
Policy_Content: Por medio del presente Decreto se otorga a la Oficina de Planeamiento y Presupuesto de la Presidencia de la República Oriental del Uruguay un crédito por el Impuesto al Valor Agregado incluido en las adquisiciones de bienes y servicios destinados a la ejecución del Programa de Cambio Climático.

Policy: Petroleum (Exploration and Production) Act, 2011 (Act No. 7 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the exploration and exploitations of oil resources in Sierra Leone. It also establishes the Petroleum Directorate. It also concerns the protection of the environment from polluting activities related to the exploration and exploitations of oil resources. Notwithstanding any right of ownership or otherwise that any person may possess in and to the soil or water, in or under which petroleum is found or situated, no person shall conduct any petroleum operations except in accordance with petroleum rights granted under this Act. The following petroleum rights may be acquired under this Act:- (a) a reconnaissance permit; (b) a petroleum licence and; (c) a permit for the laying and operation of pipelines to transport petroleum produced from fields subject to more than one licence.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1028 du 25 juillet 2011 abrogeant et remplaçant le décret n° 2006-1336 du 29 novembre 2006  portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale du Plan de Retour vers l’Agriculture.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret abroge et remplace le décret n° 2006-1336 du 29 novembre 2006 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale du Plan de Retour vers l’Agriculture.Il crée une personne morale de droit public dénommée « Agence nationale du Plan de Retour vers l’Agriculture (ANREVA) », dotée de l’autonomie financière. Elle a pour mission d’assurer la mise en œuvre des pôles d’émergence Intégrés et la promotion de l’initiative privée dans le secteur agro-sylvopastoral sur l’étendue du territoire national.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Order No. 469 dated 25 July 2011 establishing the forest extension service.
Policy_Content: The Order establishes the Extension Services Section within the local forestry departments. Its composition and the number of employees are attached to this order. The central Department of Forests and Pastures is responsible for laying down the mission, function, tasks and performance of the extension service. This act needs to be approved by the Minister.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Executive Decree No. 102/11 approving the Regulation of the National Direction of the Territorial Development within the Ministry of Planning (DNDT).
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Direction of the Territorial Development within the Ministry of Planning (DNDT). This Regulation, consisting of 3 Chapters and 1 Table, regulates activities and responsibilities of the above mentioned Direction, entitled to propose territorial development policies, assist their implementation and participate in the designing process of Provincial Development Programmes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Executive Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Order No. 650 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on issuance by the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service of permits for emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air, except for radioactive substances.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates issuance by the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service of permits for emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air from stationary sources subject to federal state environmental audit. The aforesaid permits shall be issued to legal persons and individual entrepreneurs that are owners of stationary pollution sources subject to federal state environmental audit. The aforesaid permits establish quantity of pollutants authorized for emission to atmospheric air in compliance with requirements envisaged by the federal legislation.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Land (Duties and Taxes) (Amendment of Schedule) (No. 3) Regulations 2011 (GN No. 149 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Land (Duties and Taxes) Act in the Second Schedule by adding at the end of the Schedule a note on the definition of the date of transfers of specified transactions of purchase, including transfer by a lessee who is the holder of a new lease pursuant to section 6(1E) of the State Lands Act or section 10(3B) of the Pas Géométriques Act. Schedule 2 specifies rates for purposes of section 4(4) of the principal Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Arrêté n° 22.808/2011 du 25 juillet 2011 modifiant et complétant l’Arrêté 7161/2009/MDE/OMH du 24 Août 2009 et instaurant le Comité Technique Pétrolier.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté instaure un Comité Technique Pétrolier chargé de l’approbation du lieu de toute nouvelle implantation. Ce Comité est présidé par le Ministre chargé des Hydrocarbures. Sa composition et son mode de fonctionnement seront définis par Arrêté du Ministre chargé des Hydrocarbures.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Forest Education Promotion Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to preserve forests in a sustainable manner and thereby contribute to the development of the State and society and the improvement of the quality of life of citizens by providing for matters necessary for the promotion of forest education to ensure that citizens acquire correct knowledge about forests and develop a proper sense of value thereof. Article 6 establishes the Forest Education Council and lists its tasks, such as the formulation of comprehensive plans; matters regarding the promotion and support of forest education; the designation of institutions for training forest education specialists; the certification of forest education programs; the establishment and designation of forest education centers. The text consists of 26 articles.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act on the Preservation, Management and Use of Agro-Fishery Bioresources.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the development of agriculture and fishery, farming and fishing villages, and the national economy by securing diversity of agro-fishery bioresources and enhancing the competitiveness of the agro-fishery bioindustry through systematic preservation and management, and sustainable use of agro-fishery bioresources. In particular, article 3 establishes that the State and local governments shall each establish and implement policies necessary for the preservation, management, and use of agro-fishery bioresources to ensure the diversity of agro-fishery bioresources and the sustainable use thereof. Article 24 establishes the Committee for Deliberation on Agricultural Bioresources under the jurisdiction of the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs to deliberate on matters concerning the establishment and adjustment of major policies, such as a Master Plan for agricultural bioresources. The text consists of 33 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Nuclear Safety Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to provide for matters concerning safety management in the research, development, production, use, etc. of nuclear energy, in order to ensure the prevention of disasters resulting from radiation and to contribute to public safety. Article 3 establishes that the Nuclear Safety and Security Commission shall formulate a comprehensive plan for nuclear safety and security in the utilization and safety control of nuclear energy every five years. Also Institutions specialized in nuclear safety and security may be established under the supervision of the Commission to professionally carry out functions concerning nuclear safety management. The text consists of 121 articles.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Energy Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the sustainable development of the national economy and enhancement of the welfare of citizens by providing for basic matters concerning the formulation and implementation of energy policies and energy-related plans to realize a stable, efficient and environmentally friendly energy demand and supply structure. Article 9 establishes that the Government shall establish the energy Committee under the jurisdiction of the Minister of Trade, Industry and Energy to deliberate on matters concerning major energy policies and energy-related plans. Article 13 rules that the Korea Institute of Energy Technology Evaluation and Planning shall be established to efficiently support the planning, evaluation, management of the energy technology development-related projects. The text – consisting of 26 articles – deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: responsibilities and duties of the State, formulation of local plans, development of energy technology, conducting energy welfare projects, penalty provisions.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Nuclear Energy Promotion Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to provide for matters concerning the research, development, production and use of nuclear energy to contribute to enhancing people's lifestyles and welfare by facilitating the advancement of academic research and industrial development. Article 3 establishes that an Atomic Energy Commission shall be established under the jurisdiction of the Prime Minister to deliberate and decide on important matters concerning the use of nuclear energy. The functions of the afore-mentioned Commission are listed in article 4, such as Integration and coordination of matters concerning the use of nuclear energy; Matters concerning the conduct of testing and studies on the use of nuclear energy; Matters concerning master plans for the management of radioactive waste referred to in article 6 of the Radioactive Waste Control Act. Article 17 provides for the Creation of a Research and Development Fund for Nuclear Energy. This Fund shall be used for the following projects: 1) Research and development projects on nuclear energy; 2) Projects for supporting machineries, equipment, materials and apparatuses necessary to conduct research and development projects on nuclear energy; 3. Projects for fostering nuclear energy-related human resources; 4) Other projects related to research and development projects on nuclear energy, prescribed by Presidential Decree. The text consists of 23 articles.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act on Protective Action Guidelines against Radiation in the Natural Environment.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect citizen's health and environment, improve the quality of life of citizens, and contribute to public safety by providing for matters regarding safety control of radiation to which citizens may be exposed in their daily lives. In order to protect citizen's health and environment from environmental radiation, the Nuclear Safety and Security Commission shall formulate a five-year comprehensive plan for environmental radiation protection, consulting with the heads of related central administrative agencies. This Commission shall formulate an annual implementation plan each year for the relevant comprehensive plan, consulting with the heads of related central administrative agencies, as prescribed by Presidential Decree, and shall notify the heads of related central administrative agencies of the plan. The text consists of 1 articles.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation on the collection of market data.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, which is composed of 16 paragraphs and one Annex, lays down: (1) detailed scope of the collection of data on agricultural market; (2) the way of indicating entrepreneurs obliged to provide this information; (3) the form and deadlines of submitting market data. The scope of data collection includes: quantity of marketing and prices of  purchase, sale, market, marketplace, wholesale, producers and importers. The scope of the information to be provided and collected depends on the products concerned, such as: beef, veal, pork, cereals, poultry, eggs, mutton, sugar, fodder, milk, fruits, vegetables, flowers, oil plants, hop, tobacco, flax and hemp fiber. The Annex specifies agricultural foodstuffs included in individual markets and detailed scope of market data collected for these foodstuffs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 18 August 2011.

Policy: Resolución Nº 686/2011 - Requiérese a todos los establecimientos radicados en el ámbito de la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo que realicen vuelco discontinuo de sus efluentes líquidos, la obligatoriedad de informar a la ACUMAR.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece para todos los establecimientos radicados en el ámbito de la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo que realicen vuelco discontinuo de sus efluentes líquidos la obligación de informar a la Autoridad de la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo el día y la hora en la que se encuentra prevista la realización de cada vuelco, con la anticipación que se indica.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 612 validating the Regulation on criteria of agricultural soil fertility reduction.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that essential criteria of agricultural soil fertility reduction shall be change of the following three criteria caused by the violation of the provisions on rational soil management established by the national land legislation.  The criteria shall be set as follows: (a) reduction of organic substances in arable land by 15 percent and over; (b) reduction of inorganic acidity in acid soil by 10 percent and over; (c) increase of alkalinity in black alkali soli by 10 percent and over; (d) reduction of labile phosphorus by 25 percent and over; and (e) reduction of exchange potassium by 25 percent and over.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Radiological Protection Act, 1991 (Nuclear Safety) Order 2011 (No. 390 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order carries into effect in Ireland’s obligations in relation to Directive 2009/71/Euratom. The objectives of this Directive are to establish a Community framework in order to maintain and promote the continuous improvement of nuclear safety and its regulation through the provision of appropriate national arrangements for a high level of nuclear safety to protect workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionising radiation from nuclear installations. The Order, among other things, Order establishes the Radiological Protection Institute of Ireland as the competent authority in the State for the purpose of this Order and the Directive.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Radiological Protection Act, 1991 (Licensing Application and Fees) Regulations, 2007 by substituting the definition of substituting for the definition of “ionising radiation”, which now reads:‘ionising radiation’ means the transfer of energy in the form of particles or electromagnetic waves of a wavelength of 100 nanometers or less, or a frequency of 3 x 1015 Hertz or more, capable of producing ions directly or indirectly; ”.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2011-864 du 22 juillet 2011 relative à la protection et à la mise en valeur des terres agricoles dans les départements d'outre-mer, dans le Département de Mayotte et à Saint-Martin .
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance a pour objet de renforcer, en les adaptant aux départements et collectivités d'outre-mer concernés, les mesures de la loi de modernisation de l'agriculture et de la pêche relatives à la lutte contre la régression des terres agricoles. Les articles 1er à 4 de l'ordonnance modifient le code rural et de la pêche maritime, en améliorant, dans un nouveau titre VIII consacré aux dispositions particulières à l'outre-mer, le classement de ces dispositions au sein du livre Ier du code rural et de la pêche maritime. L'article 2 étend aux départements d'outre-mer et dans le Département de Mayotte le rôle de la commission départementale de la consommation des espaces agricoles prévue par l'article 51 de la loi du 27 juillet 2010, en en adaptant la composition et en en élargissant les compétences. Cette commission, présidée par le préfet, et composée d'experts en matière de foncier agricole en proportion égale : représentants de l'Etat concernés, profession agricole, opérateur foncier agricole, propriétaire foncier, association agréée de protection de l'environnement, aura un rôle déterminant sur les projets entraînant un déclassement des terres agricoles puisqu'elle est appelée à donner un avis favorable, selon des critères strictement encadrés, sur le projet présenté. A Saint-Martin, compte tenu des compétences que cette collectivité est appelée à exercer à compter du 1er janvier 2012 en matière d'urbanisme, cette commission aura un rôle consultatif de portée générale. L'article 3 reclasse au sein du titre VIII nouvellement créé les dispositions existantes relatives aux terres incultes ou manifestement sous-exploitées, et y ajoute deux mesures nouvelles : d'une part, une procédure simplifiée d'information du public lors de la procédure d'enquête sur l'état d'inculture ou de sous-exploitation des terres, conformément à l'article 7 de la charte de l'environnement ; d'autre part, l'obligation pour l'attributaire de présenter un projet de mise en valeur du fonds qui lui a été attribué, afin d'éviter que ces terres ne retombent dans le même état d'inculture ou de sous-exploitation que précédemment.  L'article 4, afin de limiter le morcellement des terres agricoles, néfaste à une exploitation efficace sur le plan économique et qui accentue la pression en faveur de l'urbanisation, soumet certaines divisions de parcelles agricoles à déclaration et à autorisation dont l'examen est confié à la commission départementale d'aménagement foncier.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Land & soil
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Contract/agreement,Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Farming,Financial agricultural measures,Institution,Land reform,Policy/planning,Special fund,Marine fisheries,Fishing authorization,Mariculture,Fishery management and conservation,Offences/penalties,Enforcement/compliance,Allocation/quota,Internal trade

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2011-866 du 22 juillet 2011 adaptant à l'outre-mer diverses dispositions relatives à la pêche de la loi de modernisation de l'agriculture et de la pêche .
Policy_Content: L'article 94 de la loi n° 2010-874 du 27 juillet 2010 de modernisation de l'agriculture et de la pêche (LMAP) habilite le Gouvernement à adapter par ordonnance aux départements d'outre-mer, à Mayotte, Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, Saint-Martin et Saint-Barthélemy les dispositions des articles 85 à 88 de la LMAP codifiées aux articles L. 912-3, L. 912-4, L. 921-2, L. 921-2-2 et L. 923-1-1 du code rural et de la pêche maritime. Ces mesures d'adaptation des dispositions législatives à l'outre-mer sont insérées au titre V du livre IX du code rural et de la pêche maritime.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2011-865 du 22 juillet 2011 relative à la mise en valeur des terres incultes ou manifestement sous-exploitées à Saint-Barthélemy et à Saint-Martin.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet d'adapter la législation actuellement applicable en matière de mise en valeur des terres incultes ou manifestement sous-exploitées dans les collectivités d'outre-mer de Saint-Barthélemy et de Saint-Martin.  L'article 1er reprend à l'identique, sous la seule réserve de la désignation des institutions particulières à ces deux collectivités, les modifications apportées aux dispositions du code rural et de la pêche maritime qui régissent la mise en valeur des terres incultes ou manifestement sous-exploitées dans les départements d'outre-mer par l'ordonnance n° 2011-864 du 22 juillet 2011 relative à la protection et à la mise en valeur des terres agricoles dans les départements d'outre-mer, dans le Département de Mayotte et à Saint-Martin. Ces modifications consistent, d'une part, en une procédure simplifiée d'information du public lors de la procédure d'enquête sur l'état d'inculture ou de sous-exploitation des terres, pour se conformer aux dispositions de l'article 7 de la Charte de l'environnement, et, d'autre part, dans l'obligation faite à l'attributaire de présenter un projet de mise en valeur du fond dont il sollicite l'attribution, afin d'éviter que ces terres ne retombent dans le même état d'inculture ou de sous-exploitation que précédemment.

Policy: Government Decree No. 558 “On urgent measures in the phytosanitary area to prevent import and spreading in the Republic of Moldova of certain organisms that are harmful to plants, plant products and other related objects falling under the quarantine phytosanitary regime”.
Policy_Content: This Government Decree sets forth urgent measures in the phytosanitary area for the prevention of introduction and spreading pest Anoplophora chinensis (Forster). The phytosanitary control body together with the forestry authority annually conducts official checks on the presence of Anoplophora chinensis (Forster) and on the detection of signs of infection by this pest on the national territory. Exact delimitation of the restriction zones will be carried out on the basis of deep scientific principles, the biology of Anoplophora chinensis (Forster), the level of infection, the specific distribution of these plants in the area to be tested, and evidence of the establishment of a pest. At the first detection of an organism in a certain zone and after a demarcation survey, the radius of the buffer zone can be reduced to one kilometer from the boundary of the zone of infection. When confirming the presence of Anoplophora chinensis (Forster) outside the zone of infection, the boundaries of the zone change in accordance with the results of enhanced monitoring of the presence of this organism through appropriate monitoring or taking urgent measures to destroy it in order to give the buffer zone the status of a zone free from this organism. In the contaminated zone, the necessary measures will be taken to destroy Anoplophora chinensis (Forster), including deforestation and destruction of infected plants and plants with signs of infection of Anoplophora chinensis (Forster), including roots, annually until April 30.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Forest management/forest conservation,Pests/diseases,Quarantine,International trade,Plant protection

Policy: Federal Law No. 256-FZ “On safety of fuel and energy complex”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes organizational and legal requirements in the sphere of ensuring safety of fuel and energy complex, except for nuclear energy objects. The purpose of this Federal law shall be to ensure stable and safe functioning of the objects of fuel and energy complex and protection thereof against illegal intrusion. Objects of fuel and energy complex shall be classified according to the following categories: (a) high risk; (b) medium risk; and (c) low risk. Only legal persons registered on the territory of the Russian Federation can be responsible for ensuring safety of the objects of fuel and energy complex. Owners of the objects of fuel and energy complex classified as high risk cannot rent out constructions, sites or plots of land without prior consent of regional executive bodies. In the process of projecting of the objects of fuel and energy complex shall be envisaged special measures and arrangements for localization and mitigation of the consequences of disasters. Each object of fuel and energy complex shall be issued safety certificate containing limited access data.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force ninety days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trade Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act is contained in article 1 of the Act of 21 July 2011 (BGBl. I 1475) implementing the Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading within the Community and amending Council Directive 96/61/EC. The text consists of 35 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Authorization and monitoring of emissions (2); Vested rights and allocations (3); Common provisions (4); Penalties (5); Transitional provisions (6). Five Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Climate change,Emissions,Authorization/permit,Policy/planning,Emissions trading,Internal trade,Offences/penalties,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decision No. 1208/QD-TTg approving the national master plan for power development in the 2011-2020 period, with considerations to 2030.
Policy_Content: This Decision approves the master plan for power development which aims at: ensuring adequate supply of electricity; utilizing effectively domestic energy resources in combination with importing rationally electricity and fuel; developing electricity along with protecting natural resources and the eco-environment; prioritizing the development of renewable energy sources for electricity production; etc.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decision enters into force on the date of its signing.

Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo modifica la Guía de procedimientos para desarrollar la consulta pública sobre los impactos ambientales, respecto a la ponderación de la Sensibilidad Social respecto a la aceptación, disconformidad o no aceptación del proyecto a desarrollar.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-1017 du 21 juillet 2011, fixant les attributions et l'organisation des directions régionales des domaines de l'Etat et des affaires foncières.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée dans chaque gouvernorat une direction régionale des domaines de l'Etat et des affaires foncières.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decree establishing sustainability criteria and targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from fuels.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment, which is composed of 13 articles and three Annexes, establishes sustainability criteria for biofuels and bioliquids and limit values ??for greenhouse gas emissions from cultivation of agricultural plants. Art. 3 lays down sustainability criteria for biofuels and bioliquids, art. 4 provides details on proving compliance with the sustainability criteria, art. 5 specifies method of calculation of greenhouse gas emissions throughout the lifecycle of biofuels and bioliquids and art. 9 describes provisions concerning reducing greenhouse gas emissions from fuel other than biofuel.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Ozone layer,Energy conservation/energy production,Bioenergy,Biofuel,Renewable energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 September 2010.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to promote environment-friendly, sustainable development and healthy and pleasant life of citizens by forecasting and assessing the environmental impacts of a plan or project and by formulating measures for environmental conservation when a plan or project that has an environmental impact is formulated and implemented. In particular, the Minister of Environment, the heads of planning agencies, the heads of agencies with authority for the approval for plans or projects and project implementers not subject to obtaining approval shall form and operate an Environmental Impact Assessment Council in order to deliberate the matters listed in article 8. The text consists of 76 articles.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: EIA,Basic legislation,Pollution control,Sustainable development,Risk assessment/management,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Institution,Environmental audit,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agricultural and Fishery Products Quality Control Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to increasing the income of farmers and fishermen and protecting consumers by securing the safety of agricultural and fishery products, improving the merchantable quality thereof and facilitating fair and transparent trade through the appropriate quality control of agricultural and fishery products. In particular, the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs or the Minister of Oceans and Fisheries shall establish the Council on the Quality Control of Agricultural and Fishery Products under his jurisdiction to deliberate on matters concerning the quality control of agricultural and fishery products, processed fishery products. under this Act. The text consists of 123 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Fisheries
Keyword: Farming,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Consumer protection,Standards,Internal trade,Institution,Rural employment,Fish products,Food quality control/food safety,Fraud/deceit/adulteration,Packaging/labelling
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Special Act on Assistance to Farmers, Fishermen following the Conclusion of Free Trade Agreements.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the business management and to the stability of livelihood of farmers, fishermen by improving the competitiveness of agriculture, fisheries and formulating efficient measures for supporting farmers, fishermen who sustain or are likely to sustain any loss or damage in the course of implementing free trade agreements. Article 13 provides for the establishment of a Support Fund for implementation of free trade agreements to secure financial resources necessary to take measures to support farmers, fishermen who have sustained or are likely to sustain losses and damage as a consequence of the implementation of an agreement. The text – consisting of 23 articles – provides, amongst other things, for the following: basic principles for support of farmers, fishermen; formulation of comprehensive measures to support farmers and fishermen; support for improvement of competitiveness of agriculture, fisheries; criteria for payment of direct compensation for losses and damage; subsidization for discontinuance of business.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Kimchi Industry Promotion Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to increasing the income of farmers and fishermen and to developing national economy by strengthening the competitiveness of the kimchi industry, promoting the globalization of kimchi and increasing the added value of agriculture and fisheries by prescribing matters necessary for the promotion of the kimchi industry, such as quality improvement of kimchi, inheritance and development of kimchi-related culture. For the purpose of the present Act the term "kimchi" means food made by using vegetables, such as Chinese cabbage, as its main ingredients and following the process of pickling with salt and mixing with seasoning, which is presented as it is or after fermentation. In order to promote the kimchi industry and to inherit and develop kimchi-related culture, the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs shall establish and implement a master plan for promotion of the kimchi industry. Article 8 establishes that the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs may request research and development concerning the quality improvement, packing, preservation and production technology of kimchi, production machinery to specialized research institutes and implement measures necessary to promote industrialization of production technology. The text consists of 27 articles
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 73 of the Ministry of Public Health validating Sanitary rules and regulations “Hygienic requirements for terms and conditions of organization of agroecological tourism by natural persons and agricultural organizations”.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes terms and conditions for organization of agroecological tourism by natural persons and agricultural organizations, including state sanitary supervision. The following sanitary and hygienic provisions must be complied with: (a) transportation of fresh and perishable foodstuffs must be performed in cooling equipment; and (b) shall be prohibited use of spoiled, infected, expired foodstuffs and wild growing berries, mushrooms and herbs without prior radiation check.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Consumer protection,Public health,Tourism,Food quality control/food safety,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Fruits/edible nuts,Condiments/herbs/spices,Transport/storage
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 10 August 2011.

Policy: Regulation on good agricultural and environmental practices.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines several conditions aimed at imposing the good agricultural and environmental practices, including the related limits and measures for the effective control of the achievement of such rules, financial benefits and their percentage in relation with the effectiveness of performed tasks/practices, and also sets the official deadlines for the fulfillment of the same. Some of the topics covered by this text, and listed in the Annex, are as follows: erosion and soil conservation; issues on organic substance contents present in soil; harvest related practices; appropriate use of agricultural mechanization and machinery; preservation issues as regards various cultivated plants and crops; irrigation provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Non-Ionizing Radiation Protection Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Act on protection against non-ionizing radiation (BGBl. I p. 2433). In particular, the present Ordinance regulates the protection and precaution with regard to adverse effects of non-ionizing radiation generated by the application of such radiation on humans. The text consists of 11 articles as follows: Sphere of application (1); Definition of terms (2); Requirements for generating non-ionizing radiation (3); Tasks and qualifications of personnel (4); Vocational training (5); Equivalence in other member states (6); Duty to inform (7); Duty to keep books (8); Penalties (9); Transitional provisions (10); Entry into force (11). Eight Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: Law No. 463-IV “On state regulation of manufacturing and turnover of some types of petrochemicals”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates social relations originating in the process of manufacturing and trade of some types of petrochemicals: petrol and diesel gas oil. State regulation of manufacturing and turnover of petrochemicals shall be performed through: (a) validation of the terms of delivery of crude oil and gas condensate by nature managers to the internal market; (b) validation of oil processing plans; (and) technical regulation in the sphere of manufacturing, processing and turnover of petrochemicals. The scope of this Law shall be to meet the demand of consumers for qualitative and ecofriendly fuel and petrochemicals.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Federal Law No. 246-FZ “On artificial land plots”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law regulates relations originating from creation of artificial land plots on waterbodies pertaining to federal property. Artificially created land plot can adjoin existing land plots or be separated therefrom. Initiators of creation of artificial land plots can be federal executive bodies, regional executive bodies, local self-government, natural persons, including individual entrepreneurs, and legal persons. Authorization for creation of artificial land plot shall be granted by the Government, authorized federal executive body and regional executive body. Creation of artificial land plots shall be regulated by contract concluded between the initiator and state body or local self-government. Artificial land plot can be owned by natural person if such plot was created in accordance with contract, except for concession contracts.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Federal Law No. 246-FZ “On artificial land plots created in waterbodies pertaining to federal property”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law regulates relations concerning creation of artificial plots of land in waterbodies pertaining to federal property with a view of construction on them. Artificially created plot of land can be either adjacent to existing plots of land or be separated from them (art. 3). Project of creation of an artificial plot of land shall be inserted in land use planning project, specifying projected purposeful use of artificial land plot (art. 4). Authorization for creation of artificial land plot in water bodies shall be issued by the Government of the Russian Federation, authorized federal state institution and by the regional executive body in accordance with the delimitation of their respective spheres of competence (art. 5). Creation of artificial land plot shall be carried out in accordance with contracts concluded by public authorities with the winner of the competitive tender (art. 7).
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Council Directive 2011/70/Euratom establishing a Community framework for the responsible and safe management of spent fuel and radioactive waste.
Policy_Content: This Directive sets out a European Community framework for ensuring responsible and safe management of spent fuel and radioactive waste with a view to preventing both workers and the general public from dangers arising from ionizng radiation. It lays down specific provisions concerning the management of radioactive waste, from generation to disposal. The Directive requires Member States to establish a national legislative, regulatory and organizational framework in this field.
Subject: Energy, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Order No. 308 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on forest management for growing planting material of forest species (seedlings, nurselings).
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that growing of planting material of forest species (seedlings, nurselings) shall be entrepreneurial activity for afforestation and reforestation purposes. Plots of forests for the aforesaid purposes shall be conceded to state and municipal institutions on condition of permanent (open-ended) management and to other persons – on lease. Forest management for growing planting material of forest species (seedlings, nurselings) shall be carried out in accordance with forestry regulations applicable to forest districts or forest parks. The relations between forest administration and growers of planting material shall be regulated by contracts. Unforested land pertaining to forest fund, unforested cutting areas, glades and other land areas that are not covered by forest vegetation, and also land of other categories under forest cover shall be primarily used for growing planting material of forest species (seedlings, nurselings).
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 1824 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations consolidate, principally for England only, the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) (England and Wales) Regulations 1999 and subsequent amendments. The Regulations, among other things: impose procedural requirements in relation to the consideration of applications for planning permission under the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. Principal amendments to the 1999 Regulations are: a limitation to the requirement for subsequent applications to be subject to the screening process to those cases where the development in question is likely to have significant effects on the environment which were not identified at the time that the initial planning permission was granted; a requirement for the reasons for negative screening decisions to be provided in writing, to be registered and to be available for public inspection; clarification that any person may ask the Secretary of State to exercise the power of direction; the inclusion of sites for the geological storage of carbon dioxide in Schedule 1(22) and installations for the capture of carbon dioxide streams for the purposes of geological storage in Schedule 2(3)(j). These amendments are required by the Directive on the Geological Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Directive 2009/31/EC); consideration of the effects of the development as a whole once modified.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: EIA,Land-use planning,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Authorization/permit,Access-to-information,Waste disposal,Hazardous waste,Transport/storage,Waste management
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 3 - Modifica el Acuerdo Nº 62, Reglamento autónomo para la adquisición de tierras.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo modifica el Reglamento autónomo para la adquisición de tierras, en relación a los suplentes de los miembros de la Comisión Técnica Permanente de Análisis y Calificación de Fincas.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Circular No. 26/2011/TT-BTNMT detailing a number of articles of the Government’s Decree No. 29/2011/ND-CP of 8 April 2011 on strategic environmental assessment, environmental impact assessment and environmental protection commitment.

Policy: Decree No. 4/2011 approving the amendments to the Protocol of Montreal relating to substances that deplete the ozone layer.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 2 articles, approves the amendments to the Protocol of Montreal relating to substances that deplete the ozone layer. The original text of the amendments to the aforementioned Protocol (signed in Bejing on 3 December 1999) is appended to this Decree in English.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Regional Law No. 56-oz “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) implementation of state policy in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; (b) law-making in energy sector; (c) validation of mandatory arrangements for energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; and (d) law enforcement in energy sector.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
