Policy: Regulation on identification cards for persons authorized to perform the control of the implementation of prescribed fire protection measures.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the official form of identity card for persons authorized to perform certain tasks related to the mandatory control over the implementation of prescribed fire protection measures, including the correct way of issuance, replacement and cancellation of cards, and the manner of keeping the register of all issued and cancelled cards.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation on the official card and official badges for fire protection inspectors.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the form and content of the official identity card worn by all fire protection inspectors of the Ministry of the Interior, and the manner of issuance, use, and keeping records of issued cards and badges.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation on projects in the area of procedures for adopting the assessment of the environmental impact, and determination of integrated environmental conditions in which the Ministry of the Interior, or the competent authorities is not participating in the part related to the fire protection.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedures in which the competent local authorities does not participate when implementing the assessment of the environmental impact and determining the integrated environmental protection in accordance with special fire protection standards (these situations are: electricity production plants; use of fossil fuels and solid biomass and biogas; pipelines for oil and gas; surface storage of natural gas and other fossil fuels; underground storage of combustible gases; storage of petroleum, petrochemical and chemical products; industrial briquetting of coal and lignite; biofuel production; plants for metal forming also using explosives; plant for dry distillation of coal; trade, business, shopping, sports and recreation centers; plant for destruction of explosive substances).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 766 - Reforma el Código Familiar en materia de protección a la vivienda familiar.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo reforma el Código Familiar en materia de protección a la vivienda familiar, a fin de proteger a aquéllos miembros de la familia que son más vulnerables por la falta de normativa que expresamente les garantice el derecho a una vivienda familiar.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 768 - Reforma el Código Civil en materia de gravamen del derecho de habitación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo reforma el Artículo 687 del Código Civil, estableciendo que se deben inscribir las sentencias y resoluciones mediante las cuales se constituya el gravamen del derecho de habitación, así como cualquier medida en la materia que afecte los inmuebles objeto de registro.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Technical Review Committee Regulation (Man. Reg, 119/2011).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enforces the Planning Act. The Regulation outlines the process to be followed by livestock producers making an application for a new or expanding large livestock operation (300 or more animal units). The text consists of 10 sections.

Entry into force notes: The present Regulation enters into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: Décret 2011-445/PRES/PM/MEF/MAH du 18 juillet 2011 portant détermination des taux et des modalités de recouvrement de la taxe de prélèvement de l’eau brute.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret determine les taux et les modalités de recouvrement de la taxe de prélèvement de l'eau brute en application des articles 8 et 11 de la loi n° 058-2009/AN du 15 décembre 2009 portant institution d'une taxe parafiscale au profit des agences de l'eau dénommée Contribution financière en matière d'eau (CFE).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Mineral resources, Water

Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the provisions of the Law on the quality of agricultural products (here for the purposes of compulsory education that is imposed and conducted by State Inspectorate for Agriculture, ie the Food Agency in case of committed irregularities determined during performed inspections), prescribes the form and content of the invitation for education, the manner of conducting the education as well as the manner of keeping records on conducted education.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Sistema de Evaluación Ambiental en Línea (SEAL) para la presentación, evaluación y otorgamiento de Certificación Ambiental para la mediana y gran minería.

Policy: Resolución Nº 026/11/AG/DGFFS - Cupo nacional de exportación de caoba para el año 2011.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el cupo nacional de exportación de madera de la especie caoba (Swietenia macrophylla) para el año 2011, el cual está compuesto por un total de doscientos cinco árboles provenientes de los planes operativos anuales.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Timber extraction/logging,International trade,Protection of species,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Biosafety (Contained Use) Regulations, 2011 (L.N. No. 96 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Biosafety Act, 2009 in relation to contained use of genetically modified organisms (GMO’s) that are controlled by specific measures. The objective of these Regulations is to ensure that potential adverse effects of GMO’s are addressed to protect human health and the environment when conducting contained use. The Regulations, among other things, define containment measures, which the implementation of which shall be ensured by the National Biosafety Authority, provide for classification of containment levels and require research institutions undertaking contained use activities to establish an Institutional Biosafety Committee. They also require the Authority to keep a register and provide with respect to emergency measures.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Biosafety (Environmental Release) Regulations, 2011 (L.N. No. 98 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Biosafety Act, 2009 in relation to introduction into the environment of a genetically modified organism (GMO) for which an approval has been granted in accordance with these Regulations and for which no specific containment measures are used to limit their contact with and to provide a high level of safety for the general population and the environment (‘Environmental release’). Environmental release requires the approval of the National Biosafety Authority. Moreover, a person shall not place on the market a GMO without the written approval of the Authority. The Regulations also provide for, among other things, risk assessment, handling of information, public awareness and participation and registration of decisions of the Authority in the National Biosafety Clearing House.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Biosafety (Import, Export and Transit) Regulations, 2011 (L.N. No. 97 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Biosafety Act, 2009 in relation to control of international trade in genetically modified organisms (GMO’s). The objective of these Regulations is to ensure safe movement of GMO’s into and out of Kenya while protecting human health and the environment. A person shall not import, export or transit a GMO without a written approval from the National Biosafety Authority. Applications for approval shall be registered and Authority shall liaise with the relevant regulatory agency to monitor any imported genetically modified organisms for compliance with the requirements of these Regulations.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Regulation establishing criteria for classifying mining wastes as inert wastes.
Policy_Content: The Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of three paragraphs, establishes criteria for classifying mining wastes as inert waste. The criteria depend on physical, chemical and biological properties of mining wastes, including solubility, combustibility, biodegradation, leachability, pollution of wastes and potential threat of wastes to the quality of surface and underground waters.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 9 September 2011.

Policy: Act on the national eco-management and audit scheme (EMAS).
Policy_Content: The present Act, which is composed of 19 articles, establishes institutions competent at tasks resulting from European Union legislation permitting voluntary participation of organizations in the Community eco-management and audit scheme (EMAS). The national eco-management and audit scheme consists of the Minister of Environment, General Directorate for Environmental Protection and Polish Centre for Accreditation. The General Directorate for Environmental Protection is obliged to keep the national register of organizations registered in the EMAS. The register contains the following information: unique number, name, address, date of registration, date of verification, notes concerning suspension of the registration, notes concerning cancellation of the organization and environmental declaration of an organization.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 29 September 2011.

Policy: Decreto Nº 36.721/MP/PLAN - Modelo de valoración de vulnerabilidad ante el riesgo de desastres, aplicable a amenazas naturales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Modelo de valoración de vulnerabilidad ante el riesgo de desastres, aplicable a amenazas naturales, que se utilizará para la valoración del riesgo de desastres por amenazas naturales, el cual será definido y coordinado por la Comisión Nacional de Prevención de Riesgos y Atención de Emergencias (CNE).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Consumer Protection (Price and Supplies Control) (Amendment) Act 2011 (No. 23 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Consumer Protection (Price and Supplies Control) Act 1998, in the Fourth Schedule, by inserting, an entry on the contribution to the COVID-19 Solidarity Fund.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: European Communities Environmental Objectives (Groundwater) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 389 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the European Communities Environmental Objectives (Groundwater) Regulations 2010 in regulation 8 so as to facilitate the possibility of carbon capture and storage following the transposition of Directive 2009/31/EC on the geological storage of carbon dioxide.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Emissions,Ozone layer,Transport/storage,Waste disposal,Hazardous waste,Waste management,Groundwater,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Regional Law No. 84-OZ amending Regional Law No. 157-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species”.
Policy_Content: Article 1 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Citizens shall be granted the right of timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract for forest species concluded by regional executive body and local government within the limits set for timber extraction for current calendar year”.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 101 “On local government”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes basic principles of organization of local self-government at the level of administrative and territorial units, delimits jurisdictional competence thereof and ensure the right of local communities to self-government. Local self-government shall be based upon the following principles: (a) delimitation of functions and plenary powers; (b) transparency and accountability; (c) legality and social justice; (d) self-financing; (e) public participation; and (f) constant monitoring of local legislative acts. Local self-government shall be performed by local communities through representative and executive local bodies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 40/2011-OZ amending Regional Law No. 7/2008-OZ “On some issues of legal regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: Article 1 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Multi-child families, with three or more children of 18 to 23 years of age living in rural areas plots of public land shall be granted free of charge for individual housing construction, gardening, horticulture and subsistence farming on conditions that the aforesaid children are studying in general educational institutions attending full-time course of studies”.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law amending the Law on spatial planning and construction.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Loi n° 2011-040 du 15 juillet 2011 portant statut des exploitations et des exploitants agricoles.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit le statut des exploitations et des exploitants Agricoles. Cette definit une exploitation Agricole comme une unité de production dans laquelle l’exploitant et ses associés mettent en œuvre un système de production Agricole (agriculture, élevage, pêche et foresterie). L’entreprise Agricole est soumise à la législation relative aux entreprises commerciales et les groupements d’intérêt économique.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural development,Family farming,Farming,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Smallholders/peasants,Cooperative/producer organization,Traditional rights/customary rights

Policy: Cadastral Survey Act 2011 (No. 22 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns land survey and the land cadastre. It constitutes the Land Administration, Valuation and Information Management System Committee and provides for control of land surveys and the setting of standards and rules for the conduct of cadastral surveys by the Chief Surveyor. The Act prescribes how land surveys shall be carried out and the memorandum of survey or survey report, which has been approved by the Chief Surveyor, be registered in the digital cadastral database, which is created by this Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Loi n°2011-002 du 15 juillet 2011 portant Code de la Santé.
Policy_Content: La Loi portant Code de la Santé comporte 360 articles du nouveau Code sont répartis en 10 Livres. Le Livre Préliminaire présente règles fondamentales de l’organisation institutionnelle et administrative des services médicaux de Madagascar, entre autres, le Comité National d’Hygiène et de Santé; l’Agence de Contrôle de la Sécurité Sanitaire et de la Qualité des Denrées Alimentaires (ACSQDA) chargée protéger la santé des consommateurs en veillant à ce que des denrées alimentaires consommées, distribuées, commercialisées ou produites à Madagascar soient conformes aux normes nationales et internationales en vigueur, en matière de sécurité sanitaire et d’hygiène alimentaire.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Environmental planning,Public health,Basic legislation,Food quality control/food safety,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Institution,Standards,Certification,Fraud/deceit/adulteration,Waste management,Hazardous waste

Policy: Economic and Financial Measures (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 (Act No. 2011 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Sugar Industry Efficiency Act 2001 and various other laws relating to land, fisheries and agriculture. The amendments concern  economic and financial matters. The Fisheries and Marine Resources Act is amended by repealing section 8A and replacing it by a section concerning fish farming zones and fish farming industry. The Environment Protection Act is amended by inserting a new section on EIA licence under LPES (“Land Productivity Enhancement Scheme”). Notwithstanding this Act, an application for an EIA licence by a person registered under section 40F of the Planning and Development Act shall be made through the LPES Technical Committee in accordance with section 40D(2) of that Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Fisheries, Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,EIA,Aquaculture,Agricultural land,Land based credit,Tax/levy,Plant production,Sugar cane/sugar beet

Policy: Law No. 13.761 establishing the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 16 articles and one Annex, establishes the State Technical Cadastre for Potentially Polluting Activities or using Environmental Resources under the National Environmental System (SISNAMA), the Environmental Control and Inspection Fee (TCFA-RS), in accordance with Federal Law No. 6.938 of 31 August 1981. Registration is mandatory for natural or legal persons engaged in activities potentially polluting, using natural resources and/or extracting, producing, transporting and marketing potentially hazardous products to the environment, as well as fauna and flora products and by-products.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise à ratifier l'accord de partenariat entre la République du Cameroun et l'Union européenne sur l'application des réglementations forestières, la gouvernance et les échanges commerciaux des bois et produits dérivés vers l'Union européenne (APV/FLEGT), signé à Bruxelles en Belgique, le 6 octobre 2010.

Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Resolución se afecta el 66 por ciento del porcentaje del Fondo Nacional para el Enriquecimiento y Conservación de los Bosques Nativos establecido por el artículo 36 del Decreto Nº 91 de 2009 a la ejecución del Programa Nacional de Protección de los Bosques Nativos.

Policy: Order No. 859 on geological storage of CO2.

Policy: Law No.10448 dated 14.7.2011 on the environment permits.
Policy_Content: The Law aims at preventing, reducing and controlling the pollution caused by several activities in order to reach a high level of protection for the environment, human health and life quality. The Law includes the following Chapters: General Provisions, A type Environment Permits, B Type Environment Permits, C type Environment Permits, General Provisions for Environment Permits, and Transitory and Final Provisions. There are also provisions on A, B, and C environmental permits pending on the production capacity, and main polluters to be considered for discharging limits, SO2 discharging limits –solid fuels, SO2 discharging limits – liquid fuel, SO2 discharging limits – gas fuels, NO2 discharging limits.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 96 “On local government”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes and regulates the modalities of organization and functioning of local government. Local government shall exercise executive power at local level. Local government shall carry out the following tasks: (a) management of public property; (b) coordination and performance of the arrangements for prevention of emergencies and disasters, and mitigation of the consequences thereof; and (c) transfer of agricultural land to other land categories.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Decreto Ley Nº 8.330/11 - Ley del Banco Agrícola de Venezuela, C.A.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto con rango, valor y fuerza de Ley del Banco Agrícola de Venezuela C.A., que reviste la forma de compañía anónima, dispone que tendrá por objeto, como banca especializada, realizar todas las operaciones financieras y técnicas inherentes a la financiación del sector agrícola, pudiendo en consecuencia realizar las operaciones financieras y técnicas en el ámbito nacional, administrar recursos, fomentar y promover todas las acciones necesarias para procurar el desarrollo agrícola nacional para satisfacer los requerimientos de los sectores agrícolas vegetal, animal, pesquero, forestal y acuícola, así como operaciones de financiamiento para el transporte, almacenamiento y comercialización de productos alimenticios y cualquier otro servicio conexo a la actividad agrícola.

Policy: Regional law No. 54-OZ amending Regional Law No. 11-OZ “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: Article 2 shall be amended to add the following wording: “5.1) plot of land for individual housing construction shall be allotted once-only out of stock of public urban land to citizens registered at public authorities for improvement of housing facilities and having three or more children under 18 years of age having permanent residence with their parents”.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº 4.269 - Modifica varios artículos de la Ley de minería.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce algunas enmiendas a la Ley de minería. En primer lugar se modifica el artículo 2º, el cual define las actividades contempladas por este marco normativo, a saber la prospección, exploración y explotación. Asimismo se establece que la prospección, exploración y la explotación de minerales radiactivos se regirán por esta Ley en los aspectos que no estuvieran específicamente establecidos en las normas internacionales ratificadas por el Paraguay. Las restantes modificaciones se refieren entre otros aspectos a los permisos, concesiones y derechos mineros.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Regional Law No. 12-6058 “On organization of collection and shipping point for timber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and functioning of collection and shipping point for timber, and establishes the requirements for acceptance, registration and transportation of timber. Incoming, processing and shipping timber shall be subject to compulsory registration and shall be recorded in registration log. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to prevent illegal logging. Each collection and shipping point must issue monthly declarations related to accepted, processed and shipped timber (art. 2). At the moment of timber delivery to collection and shipping point for timber copies of the following documents must be submitted: (a) forest parcel lease contract; and (b) forest declaration (art. 3).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: German-Guatemalan Agreement on financial cooperation.

Policy: Estrategia institucional para la articulación de políticas y acciones en materia de Cambio Climático en Colombia. Documento CONPES Nº 3700.
Policy_Content: El presente documento sobre la Estrategia institucional para la articulación de políticas y acciones en materia de Cambio Climático en Colombia, tiene como Objetivo General facilitar y fomentar la formulación e implementación de las políticas, planes, programas, incentivos, proyectos y metodologías en materia de cambio climático, logrando la inclusión de las variables climáticas como determinantes para el diseño y planificación de los proyectos de desarrollo, mediante la configuración de un esquema de articulación intersectorial. Este esquema deberá permear el actual modelo de desarrollo social y económico de manera transversal a todos los niveles y en todas las instituciones. Adicionalmente, deberá permear los más altos niveles de toma de decisiones en cada uno de los sectores y comunidades.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Climate change,Community management,Governance,Education,Clean development mechanism,Emissions trading,Ozone layer,Sustainable development,Land-use planning,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber extraction/logging

Policy: Loi n° 2011-835 du 13 juillet 2011 visant à interdire l'exploration et l'exploitation des mines d'hydrocarbures liquides ou gazeux par fracturation hydraulique et à abroger les permis exclusifs de recherches comportant des projets ayant recours à cette technique.
Policy_Content: En application de la Charte de l'environnement de 2004 et du principe d'action préventive et de correction prévu à l'article L. 110-1 du code de l'environnement, l'exploration et l'exploitation des mines d'hydrocarbures liquides ou gazeux par des forages suivis de fracturation hydraulique de la roche sont interdites sur le territoire national. Il est créé une Commission nationale d'orientation, de suivi et d'évaluation des techniques d'exploration et d'exploitation des hydrocarbures liquides et gazeux.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 35 - Prohíbe la circulación de bienes forestales maderables y no maderables en  horarios que establece.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución prohíbe la circulación de bienes forestales maderables y no maderables provenientes sólo del bosque nativo en el territorio nacional durante el horario comprendido desde las 6:00 pm hasta las 6:00 am, y los sábados y domingos las veinticuatro horas.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 152/11 approving the Statute for the Management Cabinet of the Touristic Development Centre of Futungo de Belas.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, approves the Statute of the Management Cabinet for the Touristic Development Centre of Futungo de Belas. This Statute, consisting of 4 Chapters and 2 Tables, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Management Cabinet, entitled to: submit to the competent authorities the touristic development plans (including urbanization and land use planning of the Centre); take care about the legal aspects related to the Centre; delimit and organize bath beaches, sport fishing zones and other aquatic sports; regulate new urbanization areas and fix their characteristics; install public parks, camping and other recreational areas; investigate and propose the creation of attractive areas; promote the building of touristic facilities including docks and other water infrastructures; promote hotel, restaurants and other activities to be performed within this area, etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Regulation No. 502 dated 13.7.2011 of the Council of Ministers approving the uniform regulation of the territory development, as amended.
Policy_Content: The Regulation No. 502 of 2011 approves the uniform regulation for the control of the territory development according to the addenda 1, 2, and 3 attached to this decision. The uniform regulation is composed of the following sections: I- General Provisions, II- Regulations of the Development Control, III- Implementation of the Development Control that includes sections on development (I), permissions (II), subdivisions and mergers of parcels(III), local detailed plans (V), financing of development (IV), special instruments of development control (VI), implementation and inspection of works (VII), rules and conditions of development (VIII), and Final Provisions (IX).

Policy: Regional Law No. 64-RZ “On allocation of territory for pastoralism”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of allocation of agricultural lands for grazing, transhumance and pastoralism and is aimed at promotion of traditional forms of pastoralism. Land destined for grazing, transhumance and pastoralism shall be public property and shall not be subject to privatization. Land destined for grazing, transhumance and pastoralism can be allotted to natural and legal persons exclusively on lease. Map of areas destined for grazing, transhumance and pastoralism is attached in the Annex.

Policy_Content: La presente introduce algunas enmiendas a la Ley de Servidumbres de Conservación de Puerto Rico con el propósito de reforzar la figura de la servidumbre de conservación y establecer ciertos controles adicionales en el otorgamiento de los beneficios contributivos. Policy: Regional Law No. 65-Z “On family farms”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the main directions of implemantation of state policy in the sphere of agricultural development with a view of assistance to sustainable development of rural areas, including creation of favourable conditions for organization and operation of family farms. Family farm shall include plot of agricultural land with infrasturcture, conceded to citizens in accordance with the modalities established by the acting legislatio, used for agricultural activity by family (generation). Registration of family farms shall be carried out on a voluntary basis in-situ. State support of rural areas and family farms shall be carried out as follows: (a) accessibility to credits for then producers of agricultural commodities; (b) extension; and (c) improvement of soil fertility.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural land,Farming,Family farming,Agricultural development,Agricultural commodities,Credit,Extension,Soil conservation/soil improvement

Policy: Act on permanent geological storage of carbon dioxide.
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions concerning environmentally safe storage of carbon dioxide, in order to contribute to the fight against climate change. The Act is composed of 25 articles and provides: (a) rights and obligations of natural persons and legal persons in the storing; (b) competence of state administration in the field of storage; (c) liability for violation of provisions established by this Act. This Act does not apply to storage for research, development or testing of new equipment and technological processes with a total intended dioxide emissions of less than 100,000 tons.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Mineral resources
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Climate change,Continental shelf,Exploration,Authorization/permit
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 3 August 2011.

Policy: Act amending the Act on the management of waste from extractive industries.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to the Act on the management of waste from extractive industries. In particular, the present Act amends provisions concerning categorization of locations or devices designed to deposit extractive waste in the solid state, liquid state, solution or suspension (art. 4 of the amended Act), management plan prepared for the purposes of minimization, treatment, recovery and disposal of mining waste, taking into account the principle of sustainable development (art. 5), prevention of the deterioration of water and pollution of air and soil.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Mining,Exploration,Pollution control,Access-to-information,Hazardous waste,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Waste disposal,Waste prevention,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Ley Nº 1474 - Ley por la cual se dictan normas orientadas a fortalecer los mecanismos de prevención, investigación y sanción de actos de corrupción y la efectividad del control de la gestión pública.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley por la cual se dictan normas orientadas a fortalecer los mecanismos de prevención, investigación y sanción de actos de corrupción y la efectividad del control de la gestión pública, con la finalidad de prevenir y combatir la corrupción en la contratación pública. La presente Ley establece medidas para la eficiencia y eficacia del control fiscal en la lucha contra la corrupción, y a tal fin crea la Comisión Nacional para la Moralización y la Comisión Nacional Ciudadana para la Lucha contra la Corrupción, que tendrá entre sus funciones velar por que la Administración Pública mantenga actualizado el inventario y propiedad de bienes muebles e inmuebles pertenecientes a las diversas entidades, así como su adecuada utilización.
Subject: Land & soil, General

Policy: Ministerial Joint Decree No. 175174 establishing terms, conditions and supporting documents for subsiding Action 4.2 “Support and operation of laboratories for honey analysis”, within the implementation framework of the three-year program for the improvement of production and marketing of apiculture products, 2011-2013.
Policy_Content: In application of the provisions of article 2 of Ministerial Joint Decree No. 312751/728/12-01-2011, funding to support the cost of institution and operation of laboratories for honey analysis shall be subsidized up to a hundred percent. The analysis shall be carried out for quality assessment and ISO or HACCP certification of honey and honey products placed on the market so as to ensure the protection of public health. The Decree establishes the sum of the subsidy, requirements for the beneficiaries, required documentation and procedures to be followed.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on 1 September 2010.

Policy: European Union (Energy Labelling) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 366 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Directive 2010/30/EU of the European Parliament and the Council of on the indication by labelling and standard product information of the consumption of energy and other resources by energy-related products. They oblige suppliers of energy-related products regulated by an EU measure (listed in the Schedule to these Regulations) to supply an energy label and fiche together with the product. Dealers of energy-related products covered by an implementing measure shall ensure that an energy label is displayed properly to end-users for products offered for sale, hire or hire-purchase.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Timber Trade Security Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act implements the Council Regulation (EC) No. 2173/2005 on the establishment of a FLEGT licensing scheme for imports of timber into the European Community of 20 December 2005. Article 1 establishes that the Federal Agency for Agriculture and Food is entrusted with the enforcement of the afore-mentioned Council Regulation. The text consists of 10 articles as follows: Sphere of application and enforcement (1); Intervention (2); Participation of custom authorities (3); Exchange of data (4); Power to issue provisions (5); Duty to give information (6); Penalties (7); Administrative fines (8); Sequestration of objects (9); Entry into force (10).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2011-829 du 11 juillet 2011 relatif au bilan des émissions de gaz à effet de serre et au plan climat-énergie territorial.
Policy_Content: Le décret définit le contenu des bilans d'émissions de gaz à effet de serre rendus obligatoires par la loi du 12 juillet 2010 portant engagement national pour l'environnement pour les entreprises de plus de 500 salariés en métropole, les entreprises de plus de 250 salariés en outre-mer, les établissements publics de plus de 250 personnes, les collectivités territoriales de plus de 50 000 habitants et l'Etat. Il définit deux périmètres que le bilan devra renseigner: les émissions directes et les émissions indirectes émises par l'utilisation d'électricité, de chaleur ou de vapeur. Le décret précise les modalités de mise à disposition de publicité et des bilans. Il met en place un pôle de coordination nationale qui arrêtera le périmètre des émissions et les principaux choix méthodologiques nécessaires à l'élaboration des bilans. Le décret définit également le rôle du préfet de région et du président du conseil régional s'agissant du suivi des bilans.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Data collection/reporting,Climate change,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Pollution control

Policy: National Food and Nutrition Strategic Plan for Zambia 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: The development of the National Food and Nutrition Strategic Plan (NFNSP) 2011-2015 is a result of broader consultations and participation of key stakeholders including international partners, representatives of NGOs, civil societies and the private sector. The NFNSP covers 11 key strategic directions related to improving food and nutrition, and give a major priority to new multi sectoral efforts to strengthen and expand interventions related to “the First 1,000 Most Critical Days” that prevent stunting in children less than two years of age. This strategy is founded on the National Food and Nutrition Policy of 2006. The NFNSP is aligned with the global “Scale Up Nutrition” movement that calls for emphasis on well-proven, effective and low cost food and nutrition interventions. This 5-Year National Food and Nutrition Strategic Plan (NFNSP) is the first National multi-sectoral response to combat malnutrition.

Policy: National Agriculture and Livestock Extension Policy (NALEP). The Implementation Framework, Plan and Budget.
Policy_Content: The NALEP document and its Implementation Framework is a national plan with a multi-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the Implementation Framework is 5 years from 2011 to 2016. The Implementation Framework aims at promoting the development of extension services. The goal of the NALEP is to transform agriculture and livestock from traditional and subsistence systems to achieve food security, wealth creation and national economic growth through science based, market oriented, competitive and profitable agricultural and livestock systems.

Policy: Regional Law No. 84-ZS “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency based upon the following principles: (a) efficient and rational management of energy resources; (b) support and stimulation of energy saving and energy efficiency; and (c) planning of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. State support of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency shall be carried out in the following forms: (a) propaganda of the application of energy servicing contracts; (b) education and information on energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 118 of 2011 (VII.11.) on nuclear safety requirements of nuclear establishments and on public administrative duties related to it.
Policy_Content: This Decree applies to nuclear establishments, installations and components already existing or to be built in the territory of Hungary, to activities related to, and operators working in, nuclear establishments. Public administrative duties falling under this Decree must be carried out by the National Atomic Energy Office (nuclear safety authority). Requirements common to all nuclear establishments are laid down in Chapter II. Chapter III sets out provisions regarding official control (licensing, approval, control and validation, procedures). Chapter IV provides rules on the obligations of licensees (general responsibilities, reporting on and evaluation of safety). Chapter V provides for periodic (every ten-years period) verification of safety. Chapter VI regards investigation of events and the utilization of past experiences to increase safety. Chapter VII contains rules regarding the preparation for the event of malfunctioning, nuclear danger and nuclear incident, and preventive measures. Regulations on Nuclear Safety are comprised in Annexes 1-9.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: National Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) Policy.
Policy_Content: This Policy aims at better conservation and management of the water resources of Dominica through an integrated water resources management (IWRM) approach. Water is recognized by the Government as one of the most crucial elements in developmental planning: water is a precious national resource to be planned, developed and conserved for optimal and sustainable use on a holistic, integrated and participatory basis, keeping in view the needs of Dominica. Planning and development of water resources need to be governed by national perspectives.

Policy: Guyana Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: Guyana Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper 2011 – 2015 is a confirmation of the path taken in 2001 with the Guyana’s first PRSP and it is a review of the key developments outlined at that time. Goals of the Strategy are: (i) generating economic growth; (ii) improving social services’ provision; (iii) enhancing governance structures; and (iv) progressing towards the achievement of the Millennium Development Goals. The poverty reduction agenda for 2011 - 2015 is rooted in the Government’s vision of the medium-term that centers on (i) high-value employment creation; (ii) improved standards of living; (iii) dramatic reduction in poverty; (iv) the rule of law and public safety; (v) protection of individual constitutional rights; and (vi) investments in human resource development. The core of the Strategy is set out in Chapters 8 – 12 that deal, respectively, with: the medium term economic policy agenda in support of the poverty reduction programme, including maintaining sound macroeconomic framework, establishing a business-friendly environment conducive to accelerated investment, continued modernization of the traditional sectors, supporting the emergence and growth of new sectors and cross-cutting policies to support growth and development (8); the institutional, regulatory and administrative reforms necessary to support growth and poverty reduction which include improving citizens’ security, justice administration and modernizing the public sector (9); the medium-term infrastructure strategy and programs referring to construction, rehabilitation and ongoing maintenance of (i) drainage and irrigation systems; (ii) roads and bridges; (iii) sea defenses; (iv) air and marine transport infrastructure; and (v) power generation, transmission and distribution (10); investment in human capital, by closing regional and gender disparities and improving equity in the allocation of resources and laying out the policies in health and education (11); and the overall medium-term macroeconomic framework (12).

Policy: Ley Nº 769 - Ley de fomento y regulación de las microfinanzas. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el fomento y la regulación de las actividades de microfinanzas, a fin de estimular el desarrollo económico de los sectores de bajos ingresos del país. Asimismo, regula el registro, autorización para operar, funcionamiento y supervisión de las Instituciones de Microfinanzas legalmente constituidas como personas jurídicas de carácter mercantil o sin fines de lucro. Se entiende por Microcrédito, los créditos de pequeño monto, hasta por un máximo equivalente a diez veces el Producto Interno Bruto (PIB) per cápita del país, destinados a financiar actividades en pequeña escala de producción, comercio, vivienda y servicios, entre otros, otorgados a personas naturales o jurídicas que actúan de manera individual o colectiva, con negocios propios o interés de iniciarlos, y que serán devueltos principalmente con el producto de la venta de bienes y servicios del mismo. Estos créditos son otorgados masivamente utilizando metodologías crediticias especializadas para evaluar y determinar la voluntad y capacidad de pago del potencial cliente.

Policy: Loi n° 11-009 du 09 juillet 2009 portant Principes Fondamentaux relatifs à la Protection de l’Environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi énonce les principes fondamentaux  en matière de preotection de l'environnement et fixe le cadre institutionnel ainsi que les mécanismes procéduraux et de financement de la protection de l’environnement; elle établit les règles de gestion et de conservation des ressources naturelles et réglemente la responsabilité civile en la matière en prévoyant des infractions et des peines. Elle comprend 9 chapitres: chapitre Ier porte dispositions générales; chapitre II fixe le cadre institutionnel; chapitre III réglemente les mécanismes procéduraux; chapitre IV détermine les mécanismes de financement ; chapitre V parle de la gestion et de la conservation des ressources naturelles; chapitre VI traite de la prévention des risques et de la lutte contre les pollutions et nuisances; chapitre VII établit la responsabilité civile; chapitre VIII prévoit des infractions et des peines et chapitre IX porte dispositions transitoires, abrogatoires et finales.

Policy: Decree on activities and greenhouse gases for which a permit for greenhouse gas emissions is required or monitoring of greenhouse gas emissions should be implemented.

This Decree establishes: (1) greenhouse gases, activities and types of devices, for which their operators must obtain a permit for greenhouse gas emissions in accordance with the law governing protection of the environment (specified in Annex 1); (2) types of aviation activities of aircraft operators which need monitoring of greenhouse gas emissions in accordance with the law governing protection of the environment (specified in Annex 2).

Policy: Arrêté du premier ministre n° 75/01 du 08/07/2011 portant mission, fonctions, structure organisationnelle et synthèse des emplois du Ministère de la Gestion des Catastrophes et des Réfugiés (MIDIMAR).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté détermine la mission, les fonctions, la structure organisationnelle et la synthèse des emplois du Ministère de la Gestion des Catastrophes et des Réfugiés (MIDIMAR). Le Ministère de la Gestion des Catastrophes et des Refugiés a pour mission générale de: mettre en place un mécanisme efficace de prévention, d’atténuation, de réaction rapide, de sécurisation, de contrôle et d’action au moment opportun en vue de la gestion des risques provoqués par les catastrophes naturelles et humaines tels que les activités volcaniques, les tremblements de terre, les inondations, les tempêtes, les glissements de terrain, les coulées de boue, les incendies et la sécheresse; mettre en place une politique proactive de gestion des réfugiés et un mécanisme rationnel de la gestion des refugiés rwandais et étrangers conformément au droit national et aux traités internationaux pour la protection des réfugiés qui permettent d’élaborer une solution stratégique aux problèmes des réfugiés.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Law No. 3687-VI “On particulars of lease and concession of fuel and energy complex facilities pertaining to state property”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the modalities of transfer in lease of in concession of some objects of fuel and energy complex pertaining to fuel and energy complex and the particulars of lease and concession of such objects. It deals with mining of coal. The aforesaid relations shall be regulated by lease and concession contracts and agreements. Concession operator (participant) and leaseholder can be exclusively legal person. Transfer in lease of in concession of some objects of fuel and energy complex pertaining to fuel and energy complex shall be performed through tenders. This Law establishes tender terms and conditions.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 014-2011-MINAM ─  Plan Nacional de Acción Ambiental PLANAA PERÚ: 2011 - 2021.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Plan Nacional de Acción Ambiental PLANAA PERÚ: 2011 - 2021, en el marco del Sistema Nacinal de Gestión Ambiental, como instrumento de planificación nacional ambiental de largo plazo. El PLANAA Perú: 2011–2021 se rige por los mismos objetivos, general y específicos determinados en la Política Nacional del Ambiente, y en este sentido busca mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas, garantizando la existencia de ecosistemas saludables, viables y funcionales en el largo plazo; y el desarrollo sostenible del país, mediante la prevención, protección y recuperación del ambiente y sus componentes, la conservación y el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales, de una manera responsable y congruente con el respeto de los derechos fundamentales de la persona. El Plan establece siete Metas a alcanzar en los siguientes sectores: 1) Agua; 2) Residuos sólidos; 3) Aire; 4) Bosques y Cambio Climático; 5) Diversidad biológica; 6) Minería y energía; 7) Gobernanza ambiental.

Policy: Regional Law No. 46 “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the process of bee raising regarding honey bees (Apis mellifera), use thereof for pollination of entomophilous plants, obtaining ecological apiculture products, protection of honey bees, safeguarding rights and legal interests of natural and legal persons carrying out bee raising activity, and also safeguarding rights and legal interests, life and health of persons living nearby apiary sites. Veterinary supervision in the sphere of apiculture, realization of preventive arrangements for combating honey bee diseases and control over usability of apiculture products for alimentary purposes shall be carried out by the regional veterinary inspection. Owners of apiary sites must be in possession of sanitary and veterinary certificates for apiary sites owned thereby, which must be issued by the regional state veterinary institutions (art. 4). Bee farmers shall have the following rights: (a) place stationary apiaries on land plots in their ownership, lease or tenancy; (b) place mobile apiaries by written consent granted by owners, leaseholders or tenants of agricultural land, forest land or urban land irrespectively of the place of registration of bee families; (c) require state support; (d) obtain veterinary assistance; (e) obtain information of state of environment and risks for bees from state bodies; and (f) set up beekeepers associations (art. 5).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 901 validating the Regulation on interaction between regional executive bodies in the process of constituting of protected areas of regional significance.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of interaction between regional executive bodies in the process of constituting of protected areas of regional significance intended as state nature reserves, natural complexes and nature monuments. It deals with elaboration, drafting and substantiation of decisions related to setting up protected areas of regional significance. Complex environmental investigation shall perform prior to decision-making. Complex environmental investigation shall contain the following information and data: (a) general characteristics of the territory; (b) list of identified wild fauna and wild flora species; (c) description of natural complexes destined for protection; (d) characteristics of anthropogenic impact on the territory; (e) data related to green planting, amenity stand and landscaped areas; and (f) substantiation and land-use planning proposals.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Policy/planning,Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Land-use planning,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,Recreational forest,Wild fauna,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 2.476 establishing the Environmental Adequacy Programme for Property and Rural Activity (TO-LEGAL).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 20 articles divided into two Chapters, establishes the Environmental Adequacy Programme for Property and Rural Activity (TO-LEGAL). This Programme aims at promoting the regularization of rural properties by their insertion into the Rural Environmental Registration System (CAR) and the Environmental Licensing (LAU). The rural owner or agricultural land holder who spontaneously requires the Rural Environmental Registry and the Environmental Licensing is immune from the notices provided for in State Law No. 261/91 and Law No. 771/95 as well as Federal Law No. 9605/98. The Rural Environmental Registry (CAR) regulates the registration of rural properties in the Control System and Environmental Monitoring of NATURATINS with the purpose of evaluating land uses. The CAR aims to inform on the following land aspects: a) quantify assets and liabilities of the property related to the obligation to maintain permanent preservation areas and legal reserve; b) identify activities developed in the rural property. The Environmental Licensing (LAU) establishes the administrative procedure for the environmental regularization of the rural property, aiming at: location, installation and operation of activities and undertakings of low impact to the environment; the environmental regularization of the rural properties/activities of the agricultural activities, regardless the size, whose areas have already been converted to alternative land use up to the date of this law.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 121 implementing Directive 2008/99/EC on the protection of the environment through criminal law as well as Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for infringements.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree amends legislation in force to put it in line with the provisions laid down under Directive 2008/99/EC on the protection of the environment through criminal law and Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for infringements. Firstly, it amends the Criminal Code by inserting new articles 727 bis and 733 bis, which lay down the penalties to be applied in case of violation of rules cocnerning the protection of habitats and the conservation of wildlife species. Further, the Decree lays down some amendments to the Code on the Environment as regards infringements and related penalties.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Marine pollution,Oil pollution,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

In particular, these provisions relate to emissions of sulfur dioxide, nitric oxide, nitric dioxide, organic substances in the form of gas or vapor, gas and dust from waste incineration.

Policy: Law No.10440 dated 7.7.2011 on the environment impact assessment.
Policy_Content: The Law aims at ensuring a high level of environment protection by preventing, minimizing, and compensating the environmental harms to be caused by projects not yet implemented, and enabling an open decision making process during the identification and the evaluation of the negative environmental impacts. It lays out the framework for the requirements, responsibilities, rules and procedures for the evaluation of the negative environmental impacts. The Law consists of the following Chapters: General Provisions, Procedures for Assessing the Environmental Impact, EIE Parties and Consultation, Access to Information and Confidential Data, Planning Authorities Decision-Making, Borderline environment EIE, EIE’s experts, Appeal and sanctions, and Final Provisions.

Policy: Arrêté du 7 juillet 2011 modifiant et complétant l' arrêté du 28 mars 2011 fixant les conditions de participation des chambres d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture.
Policy_Content: L'article 3 de l'arrêté du 28 mars 2011 fixant les conditions de participation des chambres d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture, est complété par deux alinéas ainsi rédigés:  "Afin d'orienter le foncier disponible vers les publics prioritaires définis dans le schéma directeur départemental des structures agricoles, la chambre d'agriculture, à la demande du préfet et sur mandat de ce dernier, recherche ou identifie les candidats les plus prioritaires à la reprise. Elle a pour mission de concilier les parties concurrentes et de rencontrer l'exploitant cédant, notamment en cas de démembrement progressif d'exploitation. Dans le cadre de cette mission, qui fait l'objet d'un compte rendu à l'attention du préfet, l'intervention de la chambre d'agriculture vise à l'obtention d'un accord négocié auprès des acteurs concernés".
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Law No. 3613-VI "On state land cadastre".
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for the functioning of state land cadastre. State land cadastre shall be unified state geoinformation system of data related to land located within state boundaries of the Ukraine, specifying purposeful use thereof, use restrictions, and also data on qualitative and quantitative characteristics of land, valuation thereof and distribution of land between owners and tenants. The scope of keeping state land cadastre shall be to supply state bodies, local government, natural and legal persons in the process of: (a) regulation of land relations; (b) management of land resources; (c) organization of rational management and protection of land; (d) land survey; (e) land valuation; and (f) application and collection of land charges. Keeping State Land Cadastre is carried out by: (a) creation of an appropriate state geodetic and cartographic basis, which is determined and provided in accordance with this Law; (b) entering information about the objects of State Land Cadastre; (c) making changes to the information on the objects of State Land Cadastre; and (d) processing and systematization of information about the objects of State Land Cadastre. Keeping and administration of State Land Cadastre is performed by the central executive body that implements the state policy in the field of land relations. State Land Cadastre includes the following information on the cartographic basis: (a) composition of information displayed on a cartographic basis; (b) date of creation of the cartographic basis; (c) information about the person who created the cartographic basis; (d) scale (accuracy) of the cartographic basis; and (e) coordinate system of the cartographic basis. Objects of State Land Cadastre are: (a) land within the state border of Ukraine; (b) land within the territory of administrative-territorial units; (c) restrictions on land use; and (d) land plot. This Law contains VII Sections divided into 204 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II determines bodies responsible for keeping state land cadastre. Section III defines composition of information contained in state land cadastre. Section IV establishes the procedure for keeping state land cadastre. Section V establishes guarantees of reliability of state land cadastre information and responsibility in the field of state land cadastre. Section VI regards financing of keeping and functioning of state land cadastre and sets fees for services of state land cadastre. Section VII lays down final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Cadastre/land registration,Land tenure,Land valuation,Survey/mapping,Tax/levy,Local government,Use restrictions,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Plan Estratégico 2011-2014 del Centro Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria y Forestal (CENTA)
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene el Plan Estratégico 2011-2014 del Centro Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria y Forestal (CENTA), que ha sido formulado tomando en cuenta el Plan Quinquenal de Desarrollo 2010-2014 del Gobierno de El Salvador, el Programa de Comunidades Solidarias Rurales, la Estrategia de Desarrollo Productivo y el Plan de Agricultura Familiar y Emprendedurismo Rural para la Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional (PAF). El Plan, de carácter multisectorial y alcance nacional, tiene por objetivo general proporcionar soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras al sector agropecuario ampliado, para contribuir a mejorar la situación ambiental del país, garantizando la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional de la población salvadoreña y su calidad de vida. Son objetivos estratégicos específicos los siguientes: 1) garantizar la seguridad y soberanía alimentaria y nutricional de la población; 2) desarrollar la diversificación agroproductiva sostenible; 3) impulsar la innovación tecnológica; 4) generar tecnología para la adaptación al cambio climático; 5) fortalecer el desarrollo integral del talento humano institucional y de los usuarios.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural development,Family farming,Food security,Food sovereignty,Rural youth,Business/industry/corporations,Climate change,Research,Poverty
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 194/11 approving the Regulation on damages caused to Environment.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation on damages responsibilities caused to Environment. The Regulation, consisting of 4 Chapters and 1 Annex, aims at establishing the responsibility for the risk or degradation of the environment, based on the principle of «polluter-payer», in order to prevent and repair damages caused to the environment, according to Environmental Law No. 5/98. This Regulation applies for any activity susceptible to cause damage to the environment and/or be a threat of damage. It establishes the obligation of civil insurance for all individuals or collective persons, who perform activities which may be dangerous or risky for the environment. It also specifies competent authorities, guarantees, offences and penalties for illegal activity. The Regulation is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Environmental responsibility (Chap. II); Competencies (Chap. III); Guarantees (Chap. IV). The Annex specifies fines to be paid for offenders.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

El Ministerio de Energía y Minas (MEM), será el organismo del Estado encargado del otorgamiento de concesiones de exploración y explotación de recursos geotérmicos.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regional Law No. 67-oz “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal, economic and organizational relations (basic policy) in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to set forth legal, economic and organizational basis for stimulation of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. Main provisions in the sphere of energy saving shall be as follows: (a) program approach to energy saving and raising energy efficiency; (b) ecological direction in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency; (c) promotion of renewable energy; (d) complex arrangements; and (e) monitoring and assessment of consumption of energy resources.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Law No. 815 providing for the transformation of the State Foundation for the Environment, Science and Technology of the State of Roraima (FEMACT-RR), and the Forest Development Institute of the State of Roraima (IDEFER).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles divided into four Chapters, provides for the transformation of the State Foundation for the Environment, Science and Technology of the State of Roraima (FEMACT-RR), and the Forest Development Institute of the State of Roraima (IDEFER). It establishes that the Forest Development Institute of the State of Roraima (IDEFER-RR), created by State Law No. 706 of 30 March 2009, has been transformed into a Supporting Institute for Science, Technology and Innovation of the State of Roraima (IACTI-RR), SEPLAN. The science, technology and research activities carried out by FEMACT-RR are now absorbed by the IACTI-RR, linked to SEPLAN. The Law establishes that The State Foundation for the Environment and Water Resources of Roraima (FEMARH-RR) aims to promote, elaborate, manage, coordinate and execute the environmental and water resources policy of the State of Roraima, in order to guarantee control, preservation, conservation and environmental recovery, aiming at the sustainable socioeconomic development and the improvement of the quality of life of the population. The Institute of Support for Science, Technology and Innovation of the State of Roraima (IACTI-RR), aims to promote, elaborate, manage, coordinate and execute the policy of science, technology, innovation and forest management of the State of Roraima, with the purpose to promote and foster scientific and technological development, with the realization and use of scientific research and Amazonian studies and their applications, aiming at the sustainable socioeconomic development of the State and the improvement of the quality of life of the population.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Measures for declaration of natural gas business operation information.
Policy_Content: These Administrative Measures, consisting of 7 Articles, are enacted in accordance with the Natural Gas Business Act. Natural gas utility enterprises should report to the central competent authority the previous month's gas supply  quantity, categories of users, etc. before the 15th of each month. Natural gas production enterprises and natural gas import enterprises shall report the production quantity, import quantity, export quantity, and other relevant data of the previous month to the central competent authority by the 15th of each month.

Policy: Law no. 3/2011-Republic of Guinea Bissau Investment Code.
Policy_Content: The Investment Code approved by this law seeks to harmonize the rules in force in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau with the current version of the draft Community Code with a view to ensuring a smooth transition, with little changes, for an eventual alignment of legislation in this area in the framework of our sub-regional economic integration. The Code is composed of 5 chapters: general provisions (I); rights and guarantees (II); tax incentives (III); conflict resolution (IV); and final provisions (V).  This Code aims to encourage and guarantee investments in the Republic of Guinea-Bissau and applies indiscriminately to investments, irrespective of the sector of operation of business, the nationality of the investor and the legal form of the company, or any other distinction nature, except as provided in this Code. Exceptions to this Code relate to investments in the areas of mining, oil and forestry, as well as those in free zones and duty free shops, which are governed under the legislation itself or investment contracts.
Subject: General

Policy: Decreto Nº 105/11 - Ley de seguridad poblacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de seguridad poblacional tiene como propósito establecer mecanismos de fortalecimiento para combatir toda amenaza a la convivencia pacífica y de seguridad personal y material de los habitantes. El capítulo III del título II crea una contribución especial de protección al medio ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Décret n° 2011-807 du 5 juillet 2011 relatif à la transmission des diagnostics de performance énergétique à l'Agence de l'environnement et de la maîtrise de l'énergie.
Policy_Content: L'article 1er de la loi du 12 juillet 2010 portant engagement national pour l'environnement a introduit l'obligation de transmettre les diagnostics de performance énergétique, réalisés à l'occasion de la vente ou de la location d'un bâtiment ou d'un logement, à l'Agence de l'environnement et de la maîtrise de l'énergie. Le décret prévoit en conséquence la création d'une application informatique pour le recueil des diagnostics de performance énergétique. Il précise les modalités de transmission de ces diagnostics à l'agence, ainsi que les modalités qui permettent à l'Etat et aux collectivités territoriales d'y avoir accès.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 361 validating the Instruction on safe application and storage of pesticides.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes general rules for environmental protection in the process of application, storage and transportation of pesticides and agrochemicals. It shall be compulsory for all natural and legal persons. Pesticides shall be classified as follows: (a) extremely hazardous; (b) highly hazardous; (c) moderately hazardous; and (d) low hazardous. Only officially registered pesticides shall be authorized for plant protection purposes. Excessiveness of the established application rate and increase of multiplicity of application of pesticides shall be categorically prohibited. Only certified pesticides shall be authorized for purchase by clients.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regulation on assesment of ambient air quality and public information on ambient air quality.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment and Spatial Planning lays down, in accordance with Directive 2008/50/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe: (1) methods and criteria for assessing ambient air quality; (2) details on access to information on air quality to support the reduction of air pollution and to monitor long-term trends, and improvements due to measures at local, national and European Union levels; (3) details on regular informing the public about air quality. The present Regulation is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Assessment of air quality (Sec. 2); Air quality assessment program (Sec. 3): Informing the public and annual reports (Sec. 4); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 5).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Emissions,Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards,Pollution control

Policy: Order No. 287 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on classification of natural forest fire risks.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes classification of natural forest fire risks (Annex 1) and forest fire risks depending upon weather conditions (Annex 2). Natural forest fire risks shall be classified in five categories: (a) extremely high; (b) high; (c) medium; (d) low; and (e) non-existent. Classification of forest fire risks depending upon weather conditions defines the degree of possibility of outbreak and propagation of forest fires on a given territory depending upon meteorological conditions that influence forest fire risks.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 545 of 2011 on Sustainability Criteria for Biofuels and Bioliquids, the Mechanism for Introducing Thereof, and the Procedure by Which They Shall Be Supervised and Monitored
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the sustainability criteria for biofuels and bioliquids, the mechanism for introducing thereof, and the procedure by which they shall be supervised and monitored. It defines the national certification scheme as a system for conformity certification regarding the conformity with the sustainability criteria (in respect of the raw material cultivated in Latvia for production of biofuels and bioliquids, and in respect of the raw material and intermediate products brought or imported into Latvia for production of biofuels and bioliquids intended for production and consumption of the biofuels and bioliquids in Latvia, as well as in respect of biofuels or bioliquids brought or imported into Latvia).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Legislative Decree No.78 of 2011 establishing the General Authority for the management, development and protection of desert lands.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 17 articles aims at establishing the General Authority for the management, development and protection of the desert lands with also the membership of a representative of the General Union of the Peasants. Main tasks of the Authority are (i) develop and protect desert lands together with the development of its local community and its natural and human resources and infrastructure; (ii) manage the various activities ; (iii) coordinate between stakeholders to implement economic, social and environmental development programs; (iv) propose economic, social and environmental strategies and policies; (v) organize the communities in the desert lands and create administrative units where improving investment and providing social, cultural, health and economic services in line with the pastoral production system; (vi) prepare studies and scientific researches; (vii) develop production and investment plans for development in the desert lands and follow up on their implementation; (viii) prepare development programs to provide employment opportunities for the local population.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 29736 - Ley de reconversión productiva agropecuaria.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de reconversión productiva agropecuaria, declara de interés nacional y carácter prioritario la reconversión productiva agropecuaria como política permanente del Estado, destinada al cambio o transformación voluntaria hacia una producción agropecuaria diferente a la actual para innovar y agregar valor a la producción mediante la utilización de sistemas tecnológicos eficientes en toda la cadena productiva.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Order No. 179 of the Ministry of Transport validating the Regulation on issuance of special authorization for movement on highways of vehicles transporting hazardous substances.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of submittal, acceptance and examination of application for the issuance of special authorization for movement on highways of vehicles transporting hazardous substances, and also the issuance of the aforesaid authorization. Application shall be submitted by the transporter or by representative(s) thereof to the competent authority. The following accompanying documentation shall be also submitted: (a) copy of registration certificate of the vehicle used for transportation of hazardous substances; (b) copy of compliance certificate for vehicle authorizing transportation of hazardous substances; (c) copy of driver adequacy certificate; (d) copy of emergency card; and (e) documents attesting plenary powers of representative of the transporter in case of submittal of application to the competent authority thereby. Decision shall be taken within two day from the date of submittal of the application.
Subject: Environment gen.
