Policy: Act No. LXXXV of 2011 on environmental protection fee.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act to raise funds for the prevention and reduction of environmental hazards and damages caused by products which directly or indirectly endanger the environment or one of its elements during the production, marketing, utilization of the product, as well as to contribute to the prevention and reduction of environmental pollution and to the promotion of activities oriented towards the sustainable management of natural resources. Products subject to environmental protection fee are batteries, Packaging materials, petroleum products, electric and electronic equipments, rubber tires, paper-based advertising materials.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decree No. 112 of 2011 (VII. 4.) Korm. of the Government concerning European and international obligations in the field of nuclear energy of the National Atomic Energy Office and its related duties, on the appointment of technical authorities collaborating with the Office in its proceedings, on the measure of fines leviable, and on the scientific board which assists the Office in its work.
Policy_Content: Article 1 of this Decree determines the scope of duties of the National Atomic Energy Office among which the most important are the coordination of Hungarian participation in the research and development framework program of EURATOM, cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency and with other international atomic energy agencies, carrying out of duties for the national implementation of intergovernmental agreements in the field of peaceful use of atomic energy. The Office has also the duty of reporting to international and European organizations. Further provisions of the Decree concern the imposition of a fine, the appointment of technical authorities listed in Annexes 1 and 2, and the scientific board and its members.

Policy: Dahir n° 1-11-83 du 29 rejeb 1432 (2 juillet 2011) portant promulgation de la loi cadre 11° 34-09 relative au système de santé et à l'offre de soins.
Policy_Content: La présente loi cadre a pour objet de fixer les principes et les objectifs fondamentaux de l'action de l'Etat en matière de santé ainsi que l'organisation du système de santé. La loi est composée par 5 titres, à savoir: du système de santé (I); de l’offre de soins (II);  de la carte sanitaire et des schémas régionaux de l’offre de soins (III); des instances de concertation en matière de santé (IV); et dispositions finales (V).  Le système de santé est constitué de l'ensemble des institutions, des ressources et des actions organisées pour la réalisation des objectifs fondamentaux de santé sur la base des principes suivants: la solidarité et la responsabilisation de la population dans la prévention, la conservation et la restauration de la santé; l'égalité d'accès aux soins et services de santé; l'équité dans la répartition spatiale des ressources sanitaires; la complémentarité intersectorielle; et l'adoption de l'approche genre en matière de services de santé.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Resolución Nº 609/2011 - Requiérese a los establecimientos radicados en la Cuenca Matanza-Riachuelo, cuya actividad sea susceptible de generar impactos negativos en el ambiente o la salud de las personas, la elaboración e implementación de un Sistema de Gestión Ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución requiere a los establecimientos radicados en la Cuenca Matanza-Riachuelo cuya actividad sea susceptible de generar impactos negativos en el ambiente o la salud de las personas, la elaboración e implementación de un Sistema de Gestión Ambiental. Dichos Sistma debe tener base documental e incluir, como mínimo, la identificación y grado de cumplimiento de la normativa ambiental aplicable, un programa de gestión de residuos sólidos, efluentes líquidos y emisiones gaseosas generadas por la actividad y un plan de prevención y respuesta ante emergencias.

Policy: Regional Law No. 17-RZ “On state support and stimulation of agricultural production”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for state support and stimulation of agricultural production through authorized regional state executive bodies and in some cases by local government. State support in the form of incentives shall be allocated out of regional budget within available finances envisaged for the current fiscal year. State support to the producers of agricultural commodities shall be destined for the following measures: (a) partial reimbursement of credits for purchase of agricultural equipment; (b) partial reimbursement for purchase of planting materials of fruit species and elite seeds of agricultural species; (c) compensation for sold milk, dairy products, eggs, fish, poultry and young livestock; and (d) partial reimbursement of expenditure to breeders of rare livestock species.

Policy: General (O. Reg. 45/11).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enforces various section of the Mining Act (R.S.O. 1990, c. M.14). The Regulation lays down provisions relating to general issues in the mining sector. In particular, section 1 establishes that for purposes of the definition of “mine” when used as a noun in section 1 of the Act, a prescribed substance is any discharge or waste produced as a result of various processes, such as washing, crushing, grinding,t reating or research on a mineral or mineral bearing substance. The text - consisting of 16 sections - deals with the following aspects: annual rents, rate of interest and tax, filing documents, conditions for partial abandonment, criteria, size of the land.

Policy: Regional Law No. 66-ZAO “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. Main provisions in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency shall be as follows: (a) registration by metering devices pf manufacturing, processing, transportation, storage, distribution and consumption of energy resources; (b) stimulation of investments in energy saving; (c) stimulation of the development of market of commodities and services with high energy efficiency and energy saving; (d) monitoring and assessment of consumption of energy resources; (e) regional law enforcement concerning application of legislative requirements on energy saving and raising energy efficiency; and (f) dissemination of information on energy saving and raising energy efficiency.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Koga Irrigation Development Project Office Establishment, Council of Regional Government Regulation No 84/2011.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Council of Amhara National Regional Government establishes the Koga Irrigation Development Project Office as an office  of the regional government with its own autonomy and legal personality. It shall be accountable to the Amhara National Regional State Agriculture Bureau. The Office shall, pursuant to this Regulation, have the following objectives: 1. To promote the per-capita or household income of farmers by taking care of the Koga Irrigation Development Project infrastructure and making its utilization effective, by using various technologies as well as production-boosting inputs and thereby enhancing productivity as well as producing a variety of crops, more than twice a year, having demand on markets; 2. To follow–up the proper protection and maintenance of the irrigation development construction, ensure its sustainability, and thereby facilitate a condition whereby the project would entirely be transferred to and administered by the community. The Regulation also defines some duties of the Bureau for purposes of this Regulation (facilitation, supervision and approval of plans).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Politique Nationale sur les Changements Climatiques.
Policy_Content: La vision de la Politique Nationale sur les Changements Climatiques du Mali est de définir d’ici 2025 un cadre de développement socio-économique durable qui intègre les défis des changements climatiques dans tous les secteurs de son développement afin d’améliorer le bien être des populations. Les objectifs spécifiques de la Politique sont: faciliter une meilleure intégration des défis climatiques dans les politiques et stratégies sectorielles de développement socio-économique et dans les processus de planification au niveau national et territorial; renforcer la capacité d’adaptation des populations et la résilience des systèmes écologiques, des systèmes économiques et des systèmes sociaux face aux effets des changements climatiques par l’intégration de mesures d’adaptation prioritairement dans les secteurs les plus vulnérables; renforcer les capacités de prévention et de gestion des risques et des catastrophes naturelles; contribuer à l’effort mondial de stabilisation des émissions de gaz à effet de serre dans l’atmosphère, et promouvoir la coopération internationale et régionale; promouvoir la recherche nationale et le transfert de technologies en matière de changements climatiques; et renforcer les capacités nationales sur les changements climatiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, General
Keyword: Poverty,Social protection,International relations/cooperation,Irrigation,Agricultural development,Climate change,Risk assessment/management,Disasters,Capacity building,Biofuel,Renewable energy,Governance,Environmental planning,Aquaculture,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Fuelwood,Freshwater resources management,Ecosystem preservation,Flood,Integrated management,Biodiversity

Policy: Organic Law of Georgia on Economic Freedom (No. 4979-ES of 2011)
Policy_Content: This Organic Law provides for economic freedom. It states that under the Constitution of Georgia and this Law, the citizens of Georgia shall establish guarantees of economic rights and freedoms for the present and the next generations. Economic rights and freedoms are human rights and freedoms that can only be limited according to the rules and within the limits established by the Constitution and laws of Georgia. The state guarantees economic rights and freedoms that are to become the basis of the development of society, the welfare of the people and the long term, stable growth of the economy. Freedom is a basic principle of economic policy that is expressed in reduced government, responsible macroeconomic policy and low taxes. From the date this Law enters into force: (a) the introduction of a new type of national tax, except for excise tax, or the introduction of an increase in the upper margin of the rate according to the type of national tax, except for excise tax, shall be permissible only through a referendum. Only the Government of Georgia shall have the right to initiate the calling of a referendum; and (b) the introduction or modification of a tax that is an alternative to an existing tax or replaces it without increasing the tax burden shall not be considered as the introduction of a new type of national tax or as an increase in the upper margin of the rate. The modification of the rate of tax according to the tax type within the existing marginal rate shall not be considered as the introduction of a new type of national tax or as an increase in the upper margin of the rate either. The Organic Law also provides for the maximum limits of macroeconomic parameters, budget universality principle, and free movement of capital.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Keyword: Property rights,Human rights,Governance,Tax/levy,Public participation,Financial agricultural measures,Internal trade
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Regulation on the unique methodology for classifying agricultural land into categories according to their suitability.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for detailed technical criteria for the classification of agricultural land in categories according to effective suitability of particular land parcels (soil suitability). This text further defines the method and procedures for determining such soil suitability categories, including method of work, land valuation and calculation of assessment of soil benefits with formula, criteria and basis for evaluation and rating of agricultural land into different categories which are: valuable arable land (P1) and valuable arable land (P2). These rules are aimed at setting procedures for the correct classification of suitability of the land, all for the purpose of planning further development of agricultural production, for spatial planning, as well as for conducting various land inventories and determining data on areas and on quality of present land resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Classification/declassification,Land-use planning,Land valuation,Soil conservation/soil improvement
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Policy: Ley Nº 1469 - Medidas para promover la oferta de suelo urbanizable y disposiciones para promover el acceso a la vivienda.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por objetivo facilitar la ejecución de operaciones urbanas integrales en las cuales confluyan en forma coordinada la iniciativa, organización y gestión de la Nación, las entidades territoriales, las áreas metropolitanas, los particulares, las autoridades ambientales y las empresas de servicios públicos domiciliarios con la política nacional urbana, a fin de promover la sostenibilidad del desarrollo territorial y urbano, controlar la especulación del suelo, velar por la defensa del espacio público y la protección del medio ambiente y promover una política integral de la gestión del riesgo.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Land-use planning,Institution,Urban land,Land tenure,Environmental standards,Soil pollution/quality

Policy: Foreshore Regulations (S.I. No. 353 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe bodies for consultation and submission of observations to the Minister for the Environment, Community and Local Government in respect of an application for a foreshore lease, licence or permission as may be issued under the Foreshore Act. They also prescribe a statutory time limit for such consultations.

Policy: Circular No. 46/2011/TT-BGTVT on grant and withdrawal of certificates of insurance or financial security under the 2001 International Convention on Civil Liability for Bunker Oil Pollution Damage.
Policy_Content: This Circular provides for the grant of certificates of insurance or financial security of civil liability for bunker oil pollution damage. The Circular specifies the ships eligible for certificates, the conditions for obtaining certificates, the certificate applications dossiers and the order of dossier submission, receipt and processing.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Arrêté n° 9491 du 30 juin 2011 portant attributions et organisation des services de la communauté urbaine.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte attributions et organisation des services de la communauté urbaine. La communauté urbaine est placée sous l’autorité d’un d’administrateur-maire chargé, notamment, de : - gérer le personnel en service dans la communauté urbaine; - gérer les crédits mis à sa disposition; - prendre toutes les mesures relatives à l’entretien des voiries, espaces et bâtiments publics dont il a la charge; - participer à l’élaboration des documents d’urbanisme et veiller à la bonne exécution des plans d’urbanisme et des travaux urbains; - tenir les registres, délivrer les actes relatifs aux naissances, mariages, décès et en assurer la conservation ; -  veiller au fonctionnement régulier du centre d’état civil; - procéder chaque année au recensement administratif de la population et des personnes imposables; - promouvoir l’équipement culturel, sanitaire, sportif et socioéducatif; - établir les listes électorales et procéder à leur révision; - créer et entretenir des espaces verts; - exercer le pouvoir de police administrative générale et de polices spéciales; - intervenir dans les domaines de l’eau et l’assainissement, l’habitat, la défense contre l’incendie, la voirie et réseaux divers, les marchés d’intérêt communautaire, la signalisation et les parcs de stationnement, les cimetières, l’éclairage public; - préparer et assurer les conditions nécessaires à l’érection de la communauté urbaine en commune.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Vessels in Commercial Use for Sport or Pleasure) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 49 of 2011).

The Regulations require vessels to comply with legislation regarding safety of shipping and prevention of sea pollution. Different rules may apply to vessels operating only in a limited geographical area of the Caribbean Region.

Policy: Order No. 318 of the Ministry of Economic Development validating the Regulation on Federal Service of State Registration, Cadastre and Cartography in relation to carrying out state inspection in the sphere state land control concerning legal persons and individual entrepreneurs.
Policy_Content: This Order regards state land control of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs for compliance with the mandatory requirements of land legislation related to land protection and land management. Chief state land inspector shall have the authority to examine land offences and apply administrative sanctions, issue notifications of committed land offences and file claims related to land offences. Inspection shall be concluded with: (a) drawing up land inspection act; (b) issuance of notifications of committed land offence; and (c) issuance of mandatory warrants related to correction of committed land offences and mitigation of the consequences thereof.

Policy: Ley Nº 2624: Declara de interés provincial la restauración y conservación y aprueba el Ordenamiento Territorial de los Bosques Nativos de la Provincia de La Pampa.
Policy_Content: En primer lugar esta Ley declara de interés provincial la restauración, conservación, aprovechamiento, manejo sostenible, la forestación, la reforestación de los bosques pampeanos, y de los servicios ambientales que éstos brindan a la sociedad. En segundo lugar aprueba el Ordenamiento Territorial de los Bosques Nativos de la Provincia de La Pampa. Las categorías de conservación se establecen conforme lo dispuesto en el artículo 9º de la Ley Nacional Nº 26.331 de Presupuestos Mínimos de Conservación de Bosques Nativos. Se introduce un régimen sancionatorio.

Policy: Order No. 821 on system operation and use of electricity transmission.

An annual environmental report shall be submitted to the Energy Board, and should included issues related to electricty supply development and forecast for its production.

Policy: Decree Law No. 644 on the establishment and functions of the Ministry of Environment and Urban Planning.
Policy_Content: This Decree Law sets forth the duties and responsibilities of the Ministry of Environment and Urban Planning. According to the Decree the duties and responsibilities of the Ministry are drafting legislations concerning environment and urbanization and auditing  their implementation, making policies to prevent pollution and determining standards for the protection of the environment, audit and impact assessment of facilities which may create pollution by leaving waste to receiving environment, making policies regarding global climate change, making urbanization policies and auditing their implementation. The Decree furder covers provisions on the organization and structure of the Ministry, duties and responsibilities of each general directorate and department as well as the duties and responsibilities of the personnel.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Law on spatial information.
Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Spatial Information Act of 5 October 2007 and the related Ordinances. The purpose of the present Law is to provide authorities both at a national and cantonal level, economy, science and the public with spatial information in a sustainable, up to date, quick and simple way. Furthermore, this data shall be of good quality and at reasonable costs. The text consists of 34 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Geo-data and geo-data infrastructure (II); Official survey (III); Other provisions (IV); Financing (V); Penalties and final provisions (VI).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 645 on the establishment and duties of the Ministry of  Forestry and Water Management.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law sets forth provisions regulating the establishment, duties, powers and responsibilities of the Ministry of Forestry and Water Management. The Decree-Law is consisted of 32 articles and 7 chapters: Purpose Scope and Duties (I), Organization of the Ministry (II), Departments (III), Provincial Departments, Commissions, Working Groups and Funds (IV),  Authority and Responsibility (V), Provisions on the Personnel (VI), General Provisions (VII).  The duties of the Ministry are establishing policies concerning the protection, management and improvement of forests, pasture land reclamation, desertification and erosion control, afforestation as well as establishing policies concerning the sustainable use, protection and management of water resources. The Ministry is responsible the protection, management and improvement of national parks, nature parks, natural monuments, wetlands, biological diversity and wildlife.

Policy: Regional Law No. 968-OZ “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, conservation, protection and management of protected areas of regional and local significance. Regional protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; and (e) healthcare areas and health resorts. Protected areas of local significance shall be set up by decision of local government.

Policy: Decree No. 867 of the Council of Ministers regarding the sphere of competence of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the Ministry of Agriculture and Food shall be national state body subordinated to the Council of Ministers. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) implementation of state policy in the sphere of agriculture, fisheries (including aquaculture), food production, seed growing, plant varieties, plant protection and plant quarantine, soil fertility, animal production and reproduction, veterinary, land reclamation and agricultural production; (b) improvement of economic policy and business practices; and (c) attraction of investments in agriculture.

Policy: National Emergency Management Plan.
Policy_Content: The National Emergency Management Plan is a cross-sectoral plan of Saint Lucia. Its main objective is to outline preparedness, prevention mitigation and response activities to an emergency situation associated with natural/man-made disaster or technological incidents on the island.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Government of Archangel region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields.
Policy_Content: The subject of this Agreement is the interaction between the Parties on the issues of: (a) federal and regional works in the field of hydrometeorology and related areas on the territory of Archangel region; (b) implementation of state environmental monitoring (state ecological monitoring); (c) improving the functioning of the integrated system of environmental monitoring in the territory of the Arkhangelsk region; improving the operation of the integrated system of the environment monitoring in the territory of Archangel region, including the environmental in the areas of the anthropogenic impact on environment, assessment and forecast of the environmental changes under the impact of the natural and anthropogenic factors; (d) exchange of the data about the environment conditions, environmental pollution in Archangel region; (e) exchange of data on the state of environment and its pollution as a part of state information systems of the Parties contained inter alia in databases; (f) providing the population of the Archangel region and state bodies concerned with the information about the environment and environmental pollution to develop the forecasts of the social and economic development and making of the corresponding decisions, development of the programs and activities in the field of the environment protection, control in the field of environment protection, ensuring environmental security and sustainable development of the Russian Federation and Archangel region. Roshydromet and the Government of Archangel region shall cooperate in the following forms: (a) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the interaction in the fields that are the subject of this Agreement; (b) working meetings and conferences in order to identify the most important and urgent issues, preparation of proposals for their implementation in the field of environmental monitoring; (c) exchange of information on the regulations for the management of information exchange during interdepartmental interaction; (d) development and adoption of jointly agreed decisions in order to prevent pollution, toxicity or contamination of the environment and harm to human health on the territory of the Archangel region; and (e) ensuring integration of federal, territorial and local observation networks as well as integration of the information flows using the geoinformation technologies.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,Environmental security
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Tyrol Land Use Planning Law 2011.

The text consists of 123 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: National land use planning (I); Local land use planning (II); Land consolidation (III); Land Use Planning Fund (IV); Final and transitional provisions,entry into force (V).

Policy: Décret n° 2011-785 relatif à la gestion comptable et financière du Fonds national de gestion des risques en agriculture ainsi qu'au Comité national de gestion des risques en agriculture et à ses comités départementaux d'expertise.
Policy_Content: Le Fonds national de gestion des risques en agriculture participe au financement des pertes économiques liées à l'apparition d'un foyer de maladie animale ou végétale ou d'un incident environnemental par les fonds de mutualisation agréés; il incite au développement de l'assurance récolte par la prise en charge partielle des primes et cotisations d'assurance payées par les exploitants agricoles et indemnise les victimes des calamités agricoles. Le présent décret a pour objet de définir les modalités de gestion du Fonds national de gestion des risques en agriculture, les missions et les modalités de fonctionnement du Comité national de gestion des risques en agriculture et des comités départementaux d'expertise.

Policy: Décret n° 2011-764 du 28 juin 2011 relatif à la procédure de surveillance du marché national des produits ayant un impact sur la consommation d'énergie.
Policy_Content: Le droit européen fixe un ensemble d'exigences dites "d'écoconception" pour les produits liés à l'énergie, visant à améliorer leur performance environnementale tout au long de leur cycle de vie ou à rendre obligatoire la fourniture d'informations sur leurs caractéristiques environnemental. Onze règlements ont été adoptés au terme d'une procédure prévoyant la consultation de l'ensemble des parties intéressées.  Ce décret recense ces règlements qui constituent les mesures d'exécution de la directive-cadre du 6 juillet 2005. Il fixe par ailleurs les mesures assurant la surveillance du marché national (évaluation de la conformité, déclaration de conformité et marquage des produits conformes).
Subject: Energy

Il prévoit qu'un plan de prévention des risques naturels prévisibles doit être approuvé dans les trois ans qui suivent sa prescription et que le préfet définit les modalités d'association des collectivités territoriales dans l'arrêté prescrivant le plan.  Il précise la procédure de modification d'un plan de prévention des risques naturels prévisibles que l'article 222 de la loi du 12 juillet 2010 portant engagement national pour l'environnement a introduit à l'article L. 562-4-1 du code de l'environnement.

Policy: Town and Country Planning General (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 1589 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend, in relation to England, the Town and Country Planning General Regulations 1992 by excluding from the working of regulation 9 of the principal Regulations interested planning authorities which are urban development corporations. Regulation 9 provides that where an interested planning  authority grants itself planning permission for its own development, the permission enures only  for the benefit of the authority or, in the case of joint development, the authority and the other  person specified in the application for planning permission as the joint developer.

Policy: Tyrol Building Law 2011.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources of 23 April 2009. In particular, the Law lays down provisions relating to building technology and building equipment, as well as to special environmental, health and energy requirements of buildings. Furthermore, the Law also applies to parcel of lands and other constructions and facilities subject to requirements of the present Law. The text consists of 63 articles divided into 11 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Development regulations (2); Project of building land (3); Building regulations (4); Procedural rules (5); Construction, conservation of building conditions (6); Demolition of buildings (7); Other projects (8); Special provisions (9); Authorities (10); Final, penal and transitional provisions (11).

Policy: Law No. XI-1550 “On geological storage of carbon dioxide”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the rights, duties and responsibilities of individuals with regard to the exploration, use and closure of carbon dioxide geological storage, the state management of carbon dioxide geological storage, the selection of carbon dioxide geological storage facilities, the conditions for the issuance, renewal and withdrawal of authorization for exploration for carbon storage facilities, and for the storage of carbon dioxide. The objective of geological storage of carbon dioxide is to reduce climate change by permanently isolating carbon dioxide in such a way as to avoid adverse effects on the environment and human health, or, if that is not possible, to minimize such effects and risks. The areas of the national territory that can be explored for the purpose of the construction of repositories are selected on the basis of possible use of subsoil resources, economic and social needs of the country. The Ministry of Environment assesses the national territory and submits proposals to the Government regarding the approval of areas of the national territory in which the storage facilities are not permitted. Certain areas of the national territory shall be prohibited for geological storage of carbon dioxide because of possible leakage due to the type of geological formation, slide of rock or brine polluting freshwater layer. Exploration permit for identification of location for geological carbon storage facilities shall be issued through tenders. Operator of dioxide carbon storage facility must obtain permit for such activity. A permit to store carbon dioxide in a single storage facility shall be granted to only one operator. The authorization to store carbon dioxide shall be open-ended. Carbon dioxide flow subject to storage must be free of waste or other additional substances. This Law consists of VII Sections divided into 21 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II regards state management of geological storage of carbon dioxide. Section III regards selection of carbon dioxide storage sites and permit for exploration. Section IV regards authorization for storage of carbon dioxide. Section V establishes obligations related to operation, closure and post-closure management of carbon dioxide storage facility. Section VI regards dispute settlement and international cooperation. Section VII lays down final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Keyword: Climate change,Environmental security,Pollution control,Public health,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Risk assessment/management,Business/industry/corporations,Authorization/permit,Transport/storage,Exploration
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. XI—1539 “On nuclear security”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the legal framework for ensuring nuclear security, the duties of persons engaged in nuclear energy sector and nuclear and/or nuclear fuel cycle materials, duties and responsibilities in nuclear security as well as the functions of state institutions in the field of nuclear security related to state regulation. This Law establishes the basic principles of nuclear security aimed at ensuring the highest possible level of nuclear security and minimizing the risks to human beings, their property and the environment from the functioning of nuclear facilities and any other activities related to nuclear energy and/or nuclear fuel cycle materials management. Basic principles for ensuring nuclear security shall be as follows: (a) the principle of responsibility for ensuring nuclear security - full responsibility for protecting nuclear security rests with those responsible for the nuclear facility or activity that poses the risk of ionizing radiation; (b) the principle of state regulation of nuclear security - in order to ensure security, an effective regulatory and governance structure must be created and maintained, including an independent state regulatory and supervisory authority in the field of nuclear energy and other activities in the field of nuclear energy and nuclear fuel cycle materials; (c) the principle of nuclear security priority for organizations engaged in nuclear activities and other activities in the field of nuclear energy and nuclear fuel cycle management; (c) the principle of reasonableness and expediency of activities - the economic, social or other benefits of a nuclear facility or other activity related to the acquisition, possession, use or transport of nuclear and/or nuclear fuel cycle materials must be objectively greater than the risk of possible operational activities; (d) the principle of nuclear safety optimization - nuclear safety assurances are used to achieve the highest possible rational level of nuclear security, but there must be no requirements that would unreasonably prevent the commissioning of a nuclear facility or other acquisition, possession, use of nuclear energy and/or nuclear fuel cycle materials or transportation thereof; (e) the principle of reducing the risk to the population - nuclear security measures must ensure the lowest possible risk that any person will be exposed to ionizing radiation and will therefore suffer damage, the effect of ionizing radiation shall be as small as possible and not exceed the limit values prescribed by laws and other legal acts of the Republic of Lithuania; (f) the principle of protection of the present and future generations - the present and future generations and the environment must be protected from the harmful effects of ionizing radiation; (g) accident prevention principle - all reasonable measures must be taken to prevent nuclear or radiological accidents and, if they do occur, to mitigate their effects; (h) emergency preparedness and response principle - emergency preparedness and response measures must be applied in the event of nuclear and radiological emergencies, other radiological hazards; and (i) the principle of protection against natural or man-caused ionizing radiation due to unregulated human activities - appropriate and optimized measures should be taken to protect against the effects of natural or man-caused exposure to ionizing radiation. This Law consists of X Chapters divided into 51 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards nuclear security, documentary system, administrative decisions and nuclear impact prevention measures. Chapter III regards state nuclear security regulatory system. Chapter IV regards nuclear energy project manufacturer (contractor), nuclear energy subsidiary organizations or other activities related to nuclear energy and/or nuclear fuel cycle materials. Chapter V regards issuance of licenses, authorization and certification for nuclear security. Chapter VI regards nuclear security assessment. Chapter VII regards prevention and management of nuclear and radiological emergencies and accidents. Chapter VIII regards access to information. Chapter IX establishes scientific and technical substantiation of nuclear security. Chapter X lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Nuclear energy,Radiation,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Certification,Authorization/permit,Access-to-information,Environmental security,Hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 October 2011.

Policy: Ley Nº 144 - Ley de la revolución productiva comunitaria agropecuaria.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece y regula el proceso de la Revolución Productiva Comunitaria Agropecuaria con el objeto de alcanzar la soberanía alimentaria, en el marco del desarrollo rural integral sustentable; estableciendo políticas de fortalecimiento de la base productiva, conservación de las áreas de producción, intercambio equitativo y comercialización, investigación, innovación y saberes ancestrales y gestión territorial indígena, entre otras. En particular la Ley fija las bases institucionales y políticas, así como los mecanismos técnicos, tecnológicos y financieros de la producción, transformación y comercialización de productos agropecuarios y forestales. El mencionado proceso prioriza la producción orgánica en armonía y equilibrio con los recursos naturales. El principio fundamental que rige estas disposiciones es el de soberanía alimentaria, en virtud del cual el pueblo boliviano, a través del Estado Plurinacional, define e implementa sus políticas y estrategias destinadas a la producción, acopio, transformación, conservación, almacenamiento, transporte, distribución, comercialización, consumo e intercambio de alimentos. Se reconoce a las comunidades indígenas originarias campesinas, comunidades interculturales y afro bolivianas como Organización Económica Comunitaria. Entre las restantes disposiciones, cabe destacar la creación del Seguro Agrario Universal Pachamama, con la finalidad de asegurar la producción agraria  afectada por daños provocados por fenómenos climáticos y desastres naturales adversos. Promueve la creación de Institutos Técnicos Agropecuarios, a nivel Nacional y las entidades territoriales autónomas, en convenio con organizaciones sociales, para la formación técnica superior y capacitación en el área rural basada en principios de respeto a la Madre Tierra, la producción Agroecológica, la recuperación de practicas, conocimientos y saberes ancestrales y la organización social y política comunitaria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Resolución Nº 60 - Requisitos para la cesión o traspaso de los derechos de incentivos turísticos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece los requisitos y el procedimiento para la cesión o traspaso de los derechos de incentivos turísticos a las empresas que adquieran los derechos de tales incentivos.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 877/2011 - Estándares comunes para las organizaciones de inspección y reconocimiento de buques y para las actividades correspondientes de la Administración marítima.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto establecer las condiciones y requisitos que deben cumplir las organizaciones y sociedades de clasificación de buques para ser reconocidas por la Comisión Europea y ser autorizadas por la administración marítima para efectuar en su nombre las funciones de inspección, reconocimiento y certificación de los buques de su propio pabellón, en cumplimiento de los convenios internacionales y de las normas de carácter nacional sobre seguridad en el mar y prevención de las contaminación marítima.

Policy: Order No. 700 on requirements for trucks and buses in urban green zones.
Policy_Content: This Order aims to regulate buses and trucks in an environmental zone, including administrative rules for issuing environmental zone marks. It applies to transiting vehicles in these areas and the application of particle-filtering devices in order to control emission pollution. Vehicles are required to have an environmental zone label on their windshield when they are in an environmental zone. Zone marking issued in adherence to Order 478 of 15 May 2007, Order No. 598 of 23 June 2008 and Order No. 57 of 28 January 2009 remain valid.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Emissions,Zoning,Noise pollution,Transport/storage,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Urban land,Environmental standards

Policy: Nauru Utilities Corporation Act 2011 (No. 13 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Nauru Utilities Corporation. It also establishes an advisory committee, which shall advise the Minister about matters related to the operations of the Corporation. The Act defines functions of the Corporation in respect of electricity, water and fuel and functions of the Corporation in general. It shall, among other things, acquire, store, treat, distribute, market and otherwise supply water for any purpose. The Cabinet may prescribe safety standards for the exercise of powers and the performance of functions of the Corporation.
Subject: Energy, Water

Policy: State Lands (Vesting) Order 2011 based on the State Lands Act (Chapter 314).
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 3 articles and 1 Schedule, regulates the following aspects of the implemented Law for alienation, use of and control over State land as follows: Vesting of land in Government (1) The lands described in the Schedule are hereby vested in the Government free from encumbrances, and all the rights of any owner of the estate or interest in that land or his or its assigns or representatives and of any other person claiming by, from or under the owner therein shall absolutely cease. (2) The land so vested shall, from the commencement of this Order, be deemed to be State land. 3. The ownership of any apparatus belonging to an owner or supplier of gas, electricity, water or telecommunication services and situated in, under or over any land described in the Schedule shall not be altered by reason only of the vesting of that land under paragraph 2. Schedule specifies lots and definitions of Lands Vested In Government.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Public land,Land valuation,Institution,Right of use
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Small Island Developing States, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Le présent décret approuve les modifications des statuts des Chambres Régionales d’Agriculture du Burkina Faso (CRA).

Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: National Policy on Youth Development.
Policy_Content: In order to create human resources for national development, the Royal Government has a long-term vision by calling on all concerned sectors to work together to improve youth’s capacity and provide them with opportunity to develop their potential in education, employment, health and decision making, and participation in development of their families, communities, nation and the world. The Objective of this Policy aims to develop young people in a way that enable them to have physical integrity, intelligence, conscience, morality, value, and skills so that they can become good citizens. Its goal is: provide young people with access to education and vocational training with quality and equality; promote gender among young people and especially give opportunity and rights to women; provide opportunity for young people to express opinions and to make decision concerning community and national development; call on all concerned sectors such as ministries, institutions, development partners, civil societies, communities and parents or guardians to join youth development.
Subject: General
Keyword: Rural employment,Rural youth,Gender,Agricultural development,Social protection,Sustainable development,Internal trade,Capacity building,Community management,Education,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Act No. 39 on electricity certificates.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to to contribute to increased production of electrical energy from renewable energy sources. The Act has 32 Sections divided into the following Chapter: 1. Introductory provisions; 2. Issuance of electricity certificates; 3. The electricity certificates registry and sales of electricity certificates; 4. Mandatory electrify certificate; 5. Various provisions; 6. Entry into force, transitional provisions and amendments.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Arrêté du ministre de l’agriculture et de la pêche maritime n° 1926-11 du 21 rejeb 1432 (24 juin 2011) portant reconnaissance  de  l’Indication  géographique  «  Figue  de  Barbarie d’Aït Baâmrane » et homologation du cahier des charges y afférent.
Policy_Content: Par le présent arrêté, il est reconnue l'indication géographique  «  Figue  de  Barbarie d’Aït Baâmrane » demandée par le groupement d'intérêt économique (GIE) Cactus Ait Baâmare, obtenue dans les conditions fixées par le cahier des charges homologué et annexé à l'original du présent arrêté. Seule peut bénéficier de l'indication géographique «  Figue  de  Barbarie d’Aït Baâmrane » la figue produite exclusivement dans les conditions fixées par le cahier des charges homologué et mentionné ci-dessus.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Order No. 684 on EIA, impact assessment of international conservation areas and protection of certain species in offshore projects related to research and abstraction of hydrocarbon storage, laying of underground pipelines.

These permits shall be submitted for authorization to the Energy Agency in adherence to EU regulations.

Policy: Resolución por la que la Comisión Reguladora de Energía expide la metodología para determinar la capacidad de generación aportada al Sistema Eléctrico Nacional de las centrales eólicas, hidráulicas y de cogeneración.
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Resolución se expide la metodología para determinar la capacidad de generación aportada al Sistema Eléctrico Nacional de las centrales eólicas, hidráulicas y de cogeneración, de conformidad con los principios reguladores establecidos en la Ley para el Aprovechamiento de Energías Renovables y el Financiamiento de la Transición Energética.

Policy: Loi n° 21/2011 du 23/06/2011 régissant l'électricité au Rwanda.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les activités de production, de transport, de distribution et de commercialisation de l’énergie électrique à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur du territoire de la République du Rwanda. Les objectifs de la présente loi sont les suivants: la libéralisation et la régulation du secteur de l’électricité; le développement harmonieux de la distribution de l’énergie électrique pour toutes les couches de la population et pour tous les secteurs de développement économique et social; la création des conditions facilitant les investissements dans le secteur de l’énergie électrique;  le respect des conditions d’une concurrence juste et loyale et des droits des utilisateurs et des opérateurs.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Controls on Ozone-Depleting Substances Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 239 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations enforce for Northern Ireland Regulation (EC) No 1005/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council, which controls the production, placing on the market and use of “controlled substances”, which are substances that deplete the ozone layer. They: provide that the Department of the Environment is the competent authority for the purposes of the EU Regulation; declare breach of selected provisions of the EU Regulation to be an offence; and provide with respect to enforcement notices and other matters regarding enforcement.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Enforcement/compliance,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Offences/penalties

Policy: Ozone-Depleting Substances (Qualifications) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.I. No. 240 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, for purposes of implementation of Regulation (EU) No 1005/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council, provide for certain matters relating to minimum qualifications for those working on the recovery, recycling, reclamation or destruction of controlled substances and the prevention and minimizing of leakages of controlled substances (terms are defined by the EU Regulation). It shall be offence for a person to carry out relevant work involving controlled substances unless that person is competent to do so. The Regulations also concern training of employees, supervision of work by competent persons and enforcement.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Pollution control,Waste disposal,Waste management,Hazardous substances,Recycling/reuse,Authorization/permit,Enforcement/compliance

Policy: Act No. 86 on trade in alcohol and tobacco.
Policy_Content: The present Act sets rules for the retail sale of alcohol and the wholesale of tobacco. Its objectives are (a) to define a framework for the retail sale of alcohol and the wholesale of tobacco based on improved public health and social responsibility; (b) to limit and control access to alcohol and tobacco and thus reduce the harmful effects of alcohol and tobacco consumption; (c) to protect young people from alcohol and tobacco use and to limit the supply of unwanted products.

Policy: Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (First Schedule) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 308 of 2011).

Directive 2008/1/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning integrated pollution prevention and control shall now apply to the capture of carbon dioxides streams for the purpose of geological storage from installations covered by Directive 2009/31/EC.

Policy: European Communities (Environmental Liability) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 307 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the European Communities (Environmental Liability) Regulations 2008 in relation Council Directive 2004/35/EC2 concerning environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage. The duty in relation to prevention and remedying of environmental damage as defined in the Directive should be applied to the operation of geological carbon dioxide storage sites.

Policy: Development Fund Act 2011 (No. 10 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Development Fund. The Fund shall facilitate the funding of development projects. A person must not withdraw, or authorize or permit a withdrawal of, an amount from the Fund unless: (a) the purpose of the withdrawal has been approved by Cabinet in writing; and (b) the procedures for the withdrawal prescribed by Regulations have been complied with. The Act grants regulation-making powers to Cabinet.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Decision No. 481 of 2011 on land use planning instruments.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for the form and structure of various territory planning instruments according to their type, classification, and level. It consists of the following Chapters: General Provisions (I); National Planning (II); Local Planning (III); Interlocal Planning (IV); Integrated Planning (V); Suggesting standards, indicators, and mandatory sector conditions (V/I); Use of Land, its Structures, Structural Units, and Subunits (V/II).

Policy_Content: This Regulation aims at promoting sustainable territory development and land use planning, and shall serve as the sole instrument for examining permits and licensing requests. Policy: Decreto Nº 798 - Crea la Secretaría de Gestión Inmobiliaria del Sector Público ─ INMOBILIAR.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Secretaría de Gestión Inmobiliaria del Sector Público ─ INMOBILIAR, adscrita a la Secretaría Nacional de la Administración Pública, transformando la Unidad de Gestión Inmobiliaria del Sector Publico ─ INMOBILIAR. El ámbito de acción de la Secretaría de Gestión Inmobiliaria del Sector Público ─ INMOBILIAR, será respecto de los bienes inmuebles urbanos de las siguientes entidades: 1) Las instituciones de la Administración Pública Central e Institucional; 2) Las empresas públicas creadas por la Función Ejecutiva y las empresas en las que el Estado posea participación accionaría mayoritaria.

Policy: Ley Nº 8952 - Reforma el Artículo 64 de la Constitución Política.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reforma el Artículo 64 de la Constitución Política, que dispone que el Estado fomentará la creación de cooperativas como medio para facilitar mejores condiciones de vida de los trabajadores. Asimismo, procurará el desarrollo del solidarismo como instrumento de crecimiento económico y social de los trabajadores, tanto en el sector privado como en el sector público.

Policy: Décret n°0728/PR/MECIT du 21 juin 2011 portant réorganisation de la Chambre de Commerce, d'Agriculture, d'Industrie, des Mines et d'Artisanat du Gabon.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret  porte réorganisation de la Chambre de Commerce, d'Agriculture, d'Industrie, des Mines et d'Artisanat du Gabon. La réorganisation de la Chambre de Commerce porte sur la redéfinition de la nature, des missions et de l'organisation de cette structure. Ce Décret est composé de 6 chapitres: chapitre I traitre des attributions; chapitre II se rapporte à la composition; chapitre III présente l'organisation; chapitre IV concerne les élections; chapitre V des personnels; Chapitre VI concerne les ressources; et enfin le chapitre VII couvre les dispositions diverses et finales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 765 - Ley de fomento a la producción agroecológica u orgánica. Texto refundido.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto fomentar el desarrollo de los sistemas de producción agroecológica u orgánica, mediante la regulación, promoción e impulso de actividades, prácticas y procesos de producción con sostenibilidad ambiental, económica, social y cultural que contribuyan a la restauración y conservación de los ecosistemas, agro-ecosistemas, así como al manejo sostenible de la tierra. La presente Ley está dirigida a productoras y productores que individual u organizadamente, implementan o tienen interés de desarrollar Sistemas de Producción Agroecológica u Orgánica, mediante la realización de buenas prácticas productivas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Regulation on the control and certification in organic production and organic production methods.

Policy: Planning and Building (General Development) (Jersey) Order 2011.
Policy_Content: This Order provides general rules and specifies permitted development for articles 8(3)(a) of the Planning and Building (Jersey) Law 2002. That provision empowers the Minister to grant, by Order, planning permission in respect of a class or classes of development specified in Schedule 2 Order. The Minister may give a direction that the permission shall not apply in respect of: (a) all or any development of the Part, class or paragraph; or (b) the change of use within the use class, specified in the direction. Some development concerns agricultural land as defined by the Protection of Agricultural Land (Jersey) Law 1964.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 470 of 2011 on Procedures for the Management of Waste from the Extraction of Mineral Resources
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the procedures for the management of waste from the mineral extraction industry. This Regulation shall apply to the management of such extractive waste which results from prospecting, extraction of mineral resources in accordance with the laws and regulations regarding subterranean depths, treatment and storage of mineral resources if the extractive waste is stored at a Category A extractive waste facility (in accordance with Paragraph 16 of this Regulation). This Regulation further provides for criteria for determining the classification of extractive waste facilities; extractive waste management plans; receipt of the permit for the storage of extractive waste; public participation; prevention of accidents and provision of information; construction and management of extractive waste facilities; closure of extractive waste facilities and management thereof after closure; financial guarantees; and transboundary effects.

Policy: LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF ARMENIA ON FREE ECONOMIC ZONES (Law edited by HO-395-N of 3 October 2018).
Policy_Content: This Law shall regulate relations pertaining to the establishment, organization and liquidation of free economic zones. Free economic zones shall be established through engagement of investments, creation of new jobs, promotion of export for the purpose of contributing to the social and economic development of the Republic of Armenia. Free economic zone shall be intended a part of the territory of the Republic of Armenia, determined by the Government based on the initiative of the Government or a private initiative, pursuant to this Law, wherein entrepreneurial and other activities are carried out in compliance with the peculiarities prescribed by this Law, the Agreement and the Customs Code of the EaEU, and where the customs procedure of “free customs zone” may be applied. The criteria for selecting the Organizer of free economic zone shall be as follows: (a) the amount, forms, orientation and time limits of investments of the Organizer; (b) the number of jobs to be created by the Organizer; (c) the list and tariffs of services provided by the Organizer; (d) measures for international recognition of the free economic zone and brand promotion, including availability of marketing contracts and engagement of Operators of free economic zone, including the engagement of international brands, works aimed at assisting in the export of goods produced and services provided in free economic zone, and expected outcomes; (e) forms of expected state assistance; (f) justification on the need for establishing a free economic zone and selecting its location (only in case of a private initiative). The authorized state body shall conclude relevant contract with the Organizer on behalf of the Government. Mandatory requirements to a free economic zone shall include: (a) provision with facilities for bringing in cargo transportation means, including railway transport means, as well as with a parking lot and a blind alley; (b) demarcation with a border in compliance with the technical requirements to the borderline approved by the Government; (c) provision with conditions and technical means necessary for exercising customs control and carrying out customs operations by officials of customs authorities; (d) provision with security, first-aid and fire prevention systems with regard to the respective territory; (e) provision with uninterrupted water supply and water drainage, energy supply, gas supply, waste disposal and means of communication (at least telephone communication and Internet); (f) provision with relevant means of complying with sanitary and hygienic norms; (g) availability of a quarantine service area; and (h)  provision with logistics equipment for the preservation of goods, as well as with equipment and other means necessary for loading, unloading and transportation means and storage facilities.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment Act, 2011 (No. 10 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to preparation and review of environmental impact assessment statements of proposed activities that may have a harmful effect on the environment and for the post-environmental impact assessment of implemented activities (environmental audit). The Act also establishes the Environmental Assessment Practitioners Board. The Act applies to the activities in respect of which the Minister may prescribe by Regulations. Such Regulations shall prescribe — (a) a list of activities which are likely to cause significant adverse effects on the environment, or the locations that may be environmentally sensitive, in respect of which a statement shall be mandatory; (b) threshold determinations of environmental impact assessment with respect to those activities; and (c) criteria which shall be used to determine the likely effects of a proposed activity in order to further determine whether or not a statement is required for the activity.

Policy: Ley Nº 1450 - Plan Nacional de Desarrollo, 2010-2014: Prosperidad para Todos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley expide el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo, 2010-2014: Prosperidad para Todos. Se trata de un plan multisectorial de alcance nacional cuyo objetivo es el de consolidar la seguridad con la meta de alcanzar la paz, dar un gran salto de progreso social, lograr un dinamismo económico regional que permita desarrollo sostenible y crecimiento sostenido, más empleo formal y menor pobreza y, en definitiva, mayor prosperidad para toda la población. El Plan está estructurado en torno a los siguientes ejes: 1) Convergencia y desarrollo regional; 2) Crecimiento sostenible y competitividad; 3) Igualdad de oportunidades para la prosperidad social; 4) Consolidación de la paz; 5) Sostenibilidad ambiental y prevención del riesgo; 6) Soportes transversales de la prosperidad democrática. En tema de inclusión social, el documenta brinda especial atención a los grupos étnicos y a las cuestiones de género y contempla las relativas políticas diferenciadas y acciones (ver punto C dentro del Capítulo IV). El Capítulo IX contiene el Plan Nacional d Inversiones para el período 2011-2014.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Regulation establishing requirements concerning measurement of levels of substances and energy in the environment by managers of road, railroad, tram road, airport or port.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment is composed of nine paragraphs and four Annexes. Exploitation of roads, railroads, tram roads, airports and ports must not cause exceeding standards of the environment quality. It relates to introduction of gas or dust into the air, introduction of effluent into waters or ground, wastes production and noise emission. Managers of roads, railroads, tram roads, airports and ports are obliged to periodical measurement of levels of substances or energy in the environment. This Regulation lays down requirements concerning these measurements, and establishes cases when required: (1) permanent measurement of levels of energy in the environment; (2) periodical measurement of levels of indicated substances or energy in the environment; (3) referential methods of measurement; (4) criteria of localization of measurement points; (5) ways of recording results of measurement.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Noise pollution,Air quality/air pollution,Environmental standards,Effluent waste water/discharge,Emissions,Water quality standards
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 22 July 2011.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 341-P validating the Regulation on state biological reserve “Prichulymsky”.
Policy_Content: State biological reserve “Prichulymsky” is a protected area of regional significance, formed without expropriation of land plots form landowners, land tenants and land managers for an unlimited period of time. Land, subsoil, flora and fauna, waterbodies located in the reserve can be allotted for use in the manner prescribed by the regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation and the Krasnoyarsk Territory, and in accordance with this Regulation. State biological reserve “Prichulymsky” was organized with the aim of protecting and reproducing hunting and game wild fauna species, preserving and restoring the number of rare and endangered species of animals and birds, valuable in economic, scientific and aesthetic terms, as well as protecting their habitats. The reserve was organized to fulfill the following tasks: (a) preservation of biodiversity of the unique natural landscape; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for the reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book; (c) conservation of natural complex as habitat of wild fauna and wild flora species; (d) monitoring of environment, wildlife and scientific research; and (e) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) final felling and selective felling for timber extraction; (d) procurement of soft resin; (e) drainage, irrigation and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) logging; (h) procurement of food forest resources, medicinal plants, non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens for their own needs); (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage of pesticides and chemicals; (k) littering of the territory with household and industrial waste; (l) the passage and parking of motor vehicles off public roads, except for the transport of bodies exercising protection and control over the observance of the established regime or other rules for the protection and use of natural resources on the territory of the reserve, owners of land plots, vehicles used for agricultural activities and arrangements for reproduction and production of natural resources; (m) washing of vehicles; and (n) destruction or damage of installed warning or information signs (notices). Use of wild fauna species for scientific purposes and regulation of their numbers on the territory of the reserve shall be performed in accordance with acting legislation. Allotment for use the territory of the reserve or certain types of natural resources on its territory is carried out in accordance with applicable law in conformity with the regional executive authority, performing legal regulation in the field of organization and functioning of protected areas of regional significance.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Biodiversity,Monitoring,Research,Education,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Protection of habitats,Endangered species,Birds,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret no 2011-678 du 16 juin 2011 relatif aux schémas régionaux du climat, de l’air et de l’énergie.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit le contenu et les modalités d’élaboration du schéma régional du climat, de l’air et de l’énergie. Le schéma régional du climat, de l’air et de l’énergie est composé d’un rapport présentant l’état des lieux dans l’ensemble des domaines couverts par le schéma, d’un document d’orientation qui définit les orientations et les objectifs régionaux en matière de réduction des émissions de gaz à effet de serre, de lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique, de développement des filières d’énergies renouvelables et d’adaptation aux changements climatiques, et d’une annexe intitulée «schéma régional éolien» qui regroupe les parties du territoire régional où devront être situées les propositions de zone de développement de l’éolien.

Policy: Regional Law No. 63-RZ “On protection of atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that emission of pollutants from stationary sources to the atmospheric air shall be authorized in accordance with permits issued by the competent regional institution that must envisage terms and conditions for protection of the atmospheric air. Regional Government can apply additional atmospheric air protection requirements in addition to those imposed by federal legislation on condition that regional requirements cannot be lower that federal air quality standards. Atmospheric air shall be subject to constant and continuous air quality monitoring. Polluter pays principle shall be applicable on the regional territory for atmospheric air pollution.

In addition, this Fund will financially support activities of management, promotion and conservation of the environment; will contribute in promoting activities related to the rational management of environmental protected areas, rehabilitation or recover of degraded areas; support performance in technical and scientific activities, aiming at the introduction of clean and safe technologies to promote the sustainable development, etc.

Policy: LEGE nr. 104 din 15 iunie 2011privind calitatea aerului înconjurător.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law is to protect human health and the environment as a whole by regulating measures to maintain air quality to meet air quality objectives established by this Law and its improvement. This Law provides for measures at national level regarding: (a) definition and setting ambient air quality targets to avoid and prevent the occurrence of harmful events and reduce their effects on human health and the environment as a whole; (b) air quality assessment throughout the country on the basis of established common methods and criteria at European level; (c) obtaining information on ambient air quality to support the process of combating air pollution and the discomfort caused thereby, as well as to monitor long-term trends and improvement results from measures taken at national and European level; (d) guaranteeing public availability of information on ambient air quality; (e) maintaining the quality of the ambient air where it is appropriate and/or its improvement in other cases; (f) promoting increased cooperation with the other Member States of the European Union with a view to reducing air pollution; and (g) fulfillment of the obligations assumed by the agreements, international conventions and treaties to which Romania is a party. The implementation of the provisions of this Law shall be carried out by the National System for Integrated Air Quality Assessment and Management (SNEGICA), which provides the organizational, institutional and legal cooperation between public authorities and institutions, with competences in the field, for the purpose of unified air quality assessment and management, on the entire territory of Romania, as well as for informing the population and public authorities on European and international standards on ambient air quality. National Body of Meteorology and Climatology performs the following functions: (a) transmits, upon request, to the territorial public authorities for environmental protection, information on the climatology; (b) supplies short-term weather forecasts and forwards them to the authorities upon request and to the territorial public services for environmental protection, in order to implement short-term action plans and monitoring of the effects of the measures taken. This Law sets forth criteria for assessment of air pollution by emissions of hazardous substances to the ambient air and assessment of risks to the human health from air pollution.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Institution,Emissions,Public health,Pollution control,Risk assessment/management,Monitoring,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,International relations/cooperation,Framework law

Policy: Guideline No.11 dated 14.6.2011 on the methods of verification and change of the cadastral categories of agricultural land
Policy_Content: The Guideline lays down rules of procedure for implementing changes in the cadastral categories of the agricultural land. It regulates the application process, defines the parties that are eligible for such application, and the methods applied for verification and approval of requests for changing the land categories.  Attachments on “Average number of plants for  area units’, ‘The verification act’ and ‘Certification on the cadastral change of the agricultural land” are also attached to it.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Act on buffer zones (ecotones) (No. 894 of 2014).
Policy_Content: This Act sets regulations related to the fertilization of soil in rural areas (soil conditioners, spraying, cultivation, etc.) which is not permitted in buffer zones of maximum 10 meters from the shores of open water courses and lakes with a surface area of more than 100 square meters (article 1). These regulations do not apply to land used for forestry, gardens or fish farming activities. The document is regulated by the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries. The Ministry may, after consultation with municipal organizations, set rules on another public authority or institution responsible for carrying out duties under this Act. In doing so, rules on appeal against the authority's or institution's decisions cannot be brought before any other administrative authority, or have cases reopen after appeals are submitted.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Fertilizers/nutrients,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Inland waters,Bank,Pollution control

Policy: Applications for Environmental Compliance Approvals (O. Reg. 255/11).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enforces the Environmental Assessment Act (R.S.O. 1990, c. E.18). In particular, the Regulation sets out requirements for submitting a complete environmental compliance approval application. The focus is on generic requirements that shall be applied to all project types. These requirements shall only apply to applicants who are applying for an environmental compliance approval and do not apply to renewable energy approvals, permits to take water, drinking water systems and municipal licensing, or licensing and certification programmes such as pesticides and well drillers. These requirements shall affect applications for the new Environmental Compliance Approval, which replaces the Certificate of Approval program, starting 19 September 2011. The text consists of 7 sections and 1 Schedule.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 51-GD “On state support of tourism”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for state support and promotion of regional tourism. Organizational basis of state policy in the sphere of regional tourism shall be regional special program. Priority for promotion of tourism shall be internal tourism within the Russian Federation which shall be regulated by inter-regional (sub-national) agreements. Financial support out of regional budget shall be granted for ensuring tourism for specific protected vulnerable categories of citizens residing on the regional territory.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
