Policy: Política para el desarrollo comercial de la biotecnología a partir del uso sostenible de la biodiversidad. Documentos CONPES Nº 3697.
Policy_Content: La presente Política para el desarrollo comercial de la biotecnología a partir del uso sostenible de la biodiversidad, tiene como objetivo crear las condiciones económicas, técnicas, institucionales y legales que permitan atraer recursos públicos y privados para el desarrollo de empresas y productos comerciales basados en el uso sostenible de la biodiversidad, específicamente de los recursos biológicos, genéticos y sus derivados. Estos recursos son la base de nuevos productos para diversas industrias como la cosmética, la farmacéutica, la agroalimentaria, y la de ingredientes naturales, entre otras. Para esto se propone: 1) Mejorar la capacidad institucional para el desarrollo comercial de la biotecnología a partir del uso sostenible de la biodiversidad, específicamente de los recursos biológicos, genéticos y sus derivados; 2) Desarrollar un conjunto de instrumentos económicos para atraer inversiones públicas y privadas para el desarrollo de empresas y productos basados en el uso sostenible con fines comerciales de la biodiversidad, específicamente de los recursos biológicos, genéticos y sus derivados y la biotecnología; 3) Adecuar y revisar el marco normativo relacionados con el acceso a los recursos genéticos, los procesos de registro sanitario de medicamentos biotecnológicos, y la regulación sobre producción y comercialización de productos fitoterapéuticos; y 4) Evaluar la creación de la Empresa Nacional de Bioprospección.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Sectional Titles Schemes Management Act, 2011 (No. 8 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides that, with effect from the date on which any person other than the developer becomes an owner of a unit in a scheme, there shall be deemed to be established for that scheme a body corporate of which the developer and such person are members, and any person who thereafter becomes an owner of a unit in that scheme is a member of that body corporate. The body corporate shall be, subject to the provisions of this Act, responsible for the enforcement of the rules and for the control, administration and management of the common property for the benefit of all owners. The Act also establishes the Sectional Titles Schemes Management Advisory Council who shall keep legislation under review and provide advice to the Minister.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Community Schemes Ombud Service Act, 2011 (No. 9 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Community Schemes Ombud Service, defines its functions and powers and provides for a dispute resolution mechanism in community schemes, i.e. any scheme or arrangement in terms of which there is shared use of and responsibility for parts of land and buildings such as a sectional titles development scheme. The Service shall develop and provide a dispute resolution service in terms of this Act and carry out various other tasks including regulate, monitor and control and monitor community scheme governance. The Act also lays down detailed rules regarding dispute resolution mechanisms.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: The Social Development Sector Strategic Investment Plan (SDIP 2)  2011/12 – 2015/16.
Policy_Content: This Social Development Sector Strategic Investment Plan (SDIP 2) emphasises the development priorities for the period 2011-2016. It focuses on promoting employment and the rights of vulnerable and marginalised groups for improved wellbeing and gender-responsive development. In executing its mandate, through the SDIP 2, the Ministry of Gender, Labour and Social Development employs the twin-track approach, providing direct services to specific vulnerable and marginalised groups and mainstreaming issues such as social rights, through influencing and supporting policy and programme development in other sectors.

Policy: Riparian Buffer Zone Policy for Managing Freshwater Bodies in Ghana.
Policy_Content: The Riparian Buffer Zone Policy for Managing Fresh Water Bodies in Ghana was designed as a harmonized document of all the dormant and fragmented regulations in the country concerning buffers bordering water bodies or river systems. It is also designed to provide comprehensive measures and actions that would guide the coordinated creation of vegetative buffers for the preservation and functioning of water bodies and vital ecosystems in the country. The Policy aims at ensuring that all designated buffer zones along rivers, streams, lakes, reservoirs and other water bodies shall be sustainably managed for all.

Policy: Regulation to the Community Rights Law with Respect to Forest Lands.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Forestry Development Authority (FDA) implements provisions of the Community Rights Law of 2009 with Respect to Forest Lands  ("Community Rights Law"), and determines the rules, guidelines and procedures for the establishment of forest communities and to access, manage, use and the benefits of forest resources within the Republic of Liberia, and participation by communities in the reforestation, rehabilitation and conservation of forest and wildlife resources in Liberia. The Regulation also clarifies  forest Communities’  rights and obligations under Community Forest Agreements.  Community Forests are  forested or partially-forested land traditionally owned or used by a communities for socio-cultural, economic and development purposes, of a  size smaller than 50.000 hectares.

Policy: Second Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper DENARP/PRSP II (2011–2015).
Policy_Content: This 2nd Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper DENARP/PRSP II (2011–2015) was prepared in broad consultation with stakeholders and development partners. The PRSP describes the country’s macroeconomic, structural, and social policies in support of growth and poverty reduction and major sources of financing. The PRSP II takes into account the lessons learned in the following areas: Gradual adoption of the approach to the poverty reduction strategy based on a holistic vision of national development involving all stakeholders; Taking on Guinea-Bissau’s commitments at all levels regarding strategic choices for poverty reduction and improving the quality of basic social services; Reduction in disparities between men and women and elimination of inequalities and forms of discrimination against women (pag. 7). Strong link between the PRSP II priorities and the state budget through the MTEF and program budgets in agriculture and social sectors (pag. 8). This strong and durable growth should be more pro-poor and calls for two complementary approaches, with particular attention to vulnerable groups, among which women. The first step is to involve poor farmers, particularly to create more wealth. One of the main avenues is to establish or strengthen promising activities or sectors, while ensuring food security and diversification of production bases in connection with the development of SMI/SME that can serve as intermediate networks for exports of cashew nuts (pag. 71).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: National Agricultural Sector Extension Policy (NASEP), June 2012.
Policy_Content: The National Agricultural Sector Extension Policy (NASEP) spells out modalities for effective management and organization of agricultural extension in a pluralistic system where both public and private service providers are active participants. The new policy provides a point of reference for service providers and other stakeholders on standards, ethics and approaches, and guides all players on how to strengthen coordination, partnership and collaboration. The success of the implementation of this policy will depend on the commitment of all sector players: public and private sector service providers, farmers, fisherfolk, pastoralists, ranchers and development partners. Implementation of this policy will contribute towards improved transfer of technology and management for higher agricultural sector productivity, a key prerequisite to poverty reduction and enhanced food and nutrition security (pag. ii).

Policy_Content: La meta del presente Plan de Inversión de País para el Sector Agroalimentario (PIPSA) es contribuir a la reducción de los niveles de pobreza incrementando el ingreso de los beneficiarios a través de crecimiento económico incluyente, generación de empleo y seguridad alimentaria y nutricional sostenible. Se buscan una producción orientada al mercado, tecnologías de producción actualizadas, productividad y competitividad incrementada, servicios de apoyo e infraestructura mejorados, y un acercamiento al sector público-privado unido, eficiente e impulsador de resultados para transformar el sector y las poblaciones rurales.

Policy: Manual sobre Lineamientos y normas para un mejor manejo forestal.
Policy_Content: El presente Manual sobre Lineamientos y normas para un mejor manejo forestal, contiene cuatro capítulos: 1) Lineamientos técnicos para la preparación y ejecución de Planes de Manejo y Planes Operativos; 2) Normas y Pautas de Manejo Forestal de Bosque de Pino; 3) Manual de Evaluación de Impactos Ambientales en Actividades Forestales; 4) Normas técnicas de manejo forestal de las zonas de amortiguamiento de las Áreas Protegidas del país. Policy: Criterio de interpretación de los artículos 80 de la Ley de Aguas Nacionales y 120 de su Reglamento en materia de generación de energía hidroeléctrica en pequeña producción o escala.
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones tienen por objeto homologar el criterio a seguir en la aplicación del artículo 80 de la Ley de Aguas Nacionales y el artículo 120 del relativo Reglamento, en lo que respecta a la generación de energía hidroeléctrica en pequeña producción o escala. En particular, queda establecido que no se requerirá de concesión para el aprovechamiento de aguas nacionales para la generación de energía hidroeléctrica en pequeña producción o escala, cuando la capacidad de generación no exceda de 30 Megavatios y no se desvíen las aguas, ni se afecte su cantidad y calidad. En caso de superar la mencionada capacidad de generación, o estando dentro de dichos parámetros se desvíen las aguas o se afecte su cantidad y calidad, el particular deberá solicitar la concesión correspondiente.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 4.661 - Crea el Registro Provincial de Productores Agropecuarios y Propietarios de Inmuebles Rurales, para inscribir todos los inmuebles que se encuentren fuera de los ejidos urbanos municipales.
Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Ley se crea el Registro Provincial de Productores Agropecuarios y Propietarios de Inmuebles Rurales, en el cual deben inscribirse todos aquellos inmuebles que se encuentren fuera de los ejidos urbanos municipales. Dicha inscripción es anual, obligatoria y gratuita, comprendiendo a todos los productores agropecuarios, titulares y ocupantes de predios rurales.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Termination of Licences) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 1483 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement in part in the United Kingdom Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the geological storage of carbon dioxide. In particular, they implement Articles 18 and 20 on the transfer of responsibility for a closed storage site and the associated financial mechanism. The holder of a licence for a storage site that has been closed may apply to the authority for the licence to be terminated. An application must include a transfer report. The Regulations prescribe the basis on which the authority must reach an initial decision whether to terminate a licence.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Sea, Waste & hazardous substances, Environment gen.

Policy: Mining Act (No. 621 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act seeks to promote mining and organise the use of areas required for it, and exploration, in a socially, economically, and ecologically sustainable manner. In order to fulfil the purpose of the Act, particular attention is given to: a) the preconditions for engaging in mining activity; b) the legal status of landowners and private parties sustaining damage; c) the impacts of activities on the environment and land use, and the economic use of natural resources. Further objectives of the Act include: ensuring opportunities of municipalities to and individuals influence decision-making them and their living environment; promoting the safety of mines and preventing, decreasing, and averting any inconvenience and damage incurred in the activities referred to in this Act; and ensuring liability for damages for the party causing the inconvenience or damage. The Act also specifies special permit procedure to be applied in the Sami Homeland,  Skolt area, and special reindeer herding areas.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Order No. 587 on payment for authorities' implementation of the Heat Supply Act.
Policy_Content: This Order promotes economic- and environmentally- friendly use of energy for heating, by supplying hot water to reduce energy production from oil. It applies to costs related to the national Energy authorities' administration associated with establishing and operating approved Appeal Tribunals on energy issues, and which shall be paid by distribution companies. Specific charges are as follows: for 2010 charges of DKK 127.86 each TJ (Terajoule), and for 2011 charges of 130.97 each TJ (of which DKK 124.46 for the national energy Monitoring Body, and DKK 6.51 for the Appeal Tribunal for energy-related matters.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Tax/levy,Energy conservation/energy production,Transport/storage,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Internal trade,Hydropower generation

Policy: Order No. 588 on authorities' administration pursuant to the Natural Gas Supply Act.
Policy_Content: Transmission and distribution companies together with Energinet.dk and its subsidiaries, shall pay to national authorities, a fixed tax for natural gas transportation from 2005 onwards. These costs shall cover Energinet.dk's expenditures with regard to inspection of transmission grids and the administration of applications from distribution companies, establishment of new transmission plants and their authorizations. Specific costs are listed in article 2.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Order enters into force on 15 June 2011.

Policy: Order No. 586 on fees for authorities' implementation of the Electricity Supply Act and the Act on the promotion of renewable energy.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Order is to enforce the implementation of fee-paying for electricity consumption in Denmark. Energinet.dk, the national entity ensuring electricity connectivity in the country, shall apply fees for each MWh consumed as follows: for year 2010, the fee is of DKK 1.22/MWH and for year 2011, DKK1.37/MWH (of which DKK 0.82 shall be paid to the the Energy Monitoring Authorities, DKK 0.11 to the Appeal Tribunal for energy-related matters and DKK 0.44 to kroner to the Energy Board.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Order enters into force on 15 June 2011 and shall be valid as of 1 January 2011.

Policy: Geological and Mining Act.
Policy_Content: This Act, which is composed of 13 Sections and one Annex, lays down the general principles of: (1) geological activities; (2) extraction from deposits; (3) underground non-reservoir storage of substances; (4) underground landfill of wastes. The present Act specifies also requirements concerning protection of mineral deposits, underground waters and other environmental elements affected by geological activities. The Act is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Mining property, mining use and other mining privileges (sect. 2); Concessions (sect. 3); Qualifications, experts and professional liability (sect. 4); Geological activities (sect. 5); Mining company and mining rescue (sect. 6); Fees (sect. 7); Liability for damages (sect. 8); Administration, state geological service and supervision (sect. 9); Penalties (sect. 10); Criminal provisions (sect. 11); Changes in valid provisions (sect. 12); Transitional and final provisions (sect. 13).
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Basic legislation,Mining,Liability/compensation,Exploration,Offences/penalties,Institution,Authorization/permit,Pollution control,Waste disposal,Waste management,Waste prevention,Hazardous waste,Classification/declassification
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 January 2012.

Policy: First Nation Tenures Regulation (BC Reg 104/2011).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation provides for the enactment of the Forest Act.  The Regulation lays down provisions relating to tenures hold by first nations. In particular, section 4 contains the definition of “replaceable forest licence”. The text consists of 5 sections as follows: Definitions (1); Representative - direct award of community forest agreement (2); Representative - first nations woodland licence (3); Representative - replaceable forest licence (4); Change to area of first nations woodland licence (5).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law No.10431 dated 9.6.2011 on the environment protection.
Policy_Content: The Law sets out the framework for providing a high level protection for the environment, its preservation and improvement, prevention and reduction of the human health-associated risks and improvement of the life quality of today and next generations as well as ensuring sustainable development. It consists of the following Chapters: General Provisions, The principles of environment protection, Protection of environment ingredients, Environment protection during the planning process, Prevention and control of pollution (including sections on environmental norms, and environmental permits), Environmental Monitoring,  Environmental Information, Environmental responsibility, Policy instruments regarding environment protection, Responsible state bodies , Administrative Infringements, and Final Provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Framework law,Basic legislation,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Pollution control,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Institution,EIA

Policy: Mining Regulations 2011.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 114 sections divided into twelve Parts and completed by four Schedules, implement provisions of the Mining Act 1971. The Regulations provide specifications on prescribed costs for the transportation and shipping of minerals; mineral and access claims; mining leases and retention leases; exploration and other types of licences; entry on land; programs for environment protection and rehabilitation; registration of documents related to mining activities; use of the Extractive Areas Rehabilitation Fund; private mines; keeping of records; etc.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Parliamentary (Seimas) Resolution “On the future of the common agricultural policy of the European Union after 2013”.
Policy_Content: The Parliament (Seimas) states that rural development must remain a constituent part of the Common Agricultural Policy, maintaining the set priorities, and must not be identified with the cohesion policy of the European Union, while market regulation measures must be improved and ensure stability in the face of crisis.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 12/GM/VI/2011 establishing the Higher Technique Specialized Team of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order, consisting of 8 Chapters and one Annex, establishes the Higher Technique Specialized Team of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries. The above mentioned Specialized Team, abbreviated as EETS, consists of Directors of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries and experts in specific areas of agriculture, which are selected by a Selection Committee headed by the Director general of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries or competent authorities of this Ministry. This Team is entitled to carry out the following activities: to participate in the design, evaluation and policy review, strategic plan and specific regulations of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries, for the development of agricultural sectors, industrial plants, forests, livestock and fisheries; to provide technical support to the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries in policy implementation, strategic plan and regulations; to review and give feedback on annual action plans, biennial or annual multi Ministry and/or project outlines submitted by the National and District Directors; to monitor the implementation of programmes and projects of the Ministry through regular field visits, reports, and to provide technical guidance to achieve the objectives of programmes and projects; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural development,Inspection,Research,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States, South-Eastern Asia

Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources shall be state managing body in the sphere of subsoil carrying out the following tasks: (a) realization of state policy in the sphere of geological exploration, management and reproduction of mineral resources; (b) access to reliable geological information on subsoil and mineral deposits; (c) elaboration of subsoil exploration programmes for the periods varying from one year to more than three years; and (d) training of staff.

Policy_Content: This Regulation sets out requirements for the labelling of plant protection products. The labels shall contain the standards phrases for special risks to human or animal health or to the environment, according to Annex II, as well as the standard phrases for safety precaution for the protection of animal or human health or the environment, as set out in Annex III.

Policy: Directive 2011/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment.
Policy_Content: This Directive sets out provisions on the restriction of the use of hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment. The aim is to contribute to the protection of human health and the environment. The Directive covers also the environmentally sound recovery and waste disposal. Annex II lays down the list of restricted substances and related maximum tolerated values.

Policy: Decree Law No. 639 on the establishment and functions of the Ministry of Food Agriculture and Livestock.
Policy_Content: This Decree Law sets forth the principles and procedures of the establishment, duties, powers and responsibilities and regulates the organizational structure of the Ministry of Food Agriculture and Livestock. The Decree Law states that the Ministry has duties and responsibilities such as certification, inspection, capacity building and data collection in the field of agricultural development, agricultural land development, animal husbandry, pastoral farming, rural development, water management, plant production, fisheries, food safety and security, biodiversity conservation and environmental protection.  The Ministry develops agricultural policies, supervises the implementation of those policies and controls. It further manages agricultural support policies and agricultural markets.

Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Policy: Enforcement Act of Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Enforcement Act is to implement the 1979 United Nations Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women,  remove all forms of discrimination against women,  promote the sturdy development of women, materialize protection to gender and human rights and advance gender equality. The Enforcement Act  consist of 9 Articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Gender,Human rights,Inspection,Policy/planning,Fiscal and market measures,Capacity building

Policy: Ley Nº 89 - Ley de Escuelas Eco Eficientes.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto los parámetros de climatización que deberán respetarse para la construcción de escuelas. Se entiende por climatización la práctica del diseño, posicionamiento, construcción, equipamiento y operación de un edificio para optimizar su eficiencia energética y, además, que éste mismo produzca, dentro de lo técnico y económicamente factible, parte o la totalidad de la energía que consume mediante la aplicación de las medidas y tecnologías para el aprovechamiento de las fuentes renovables de energía.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Environmental Protection Agency Act, 1992 (Registration of Coal Bagging Operators and Fuel Suppliers) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 271 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations set out the functions of the Environmental Protection Agency in relation to maintaining registers of coal bagging operators and fuel suppliers for the purpose of ensuring compliance with environmental parameters for bituminous coal as prescribed in Regulations made separately under the Air Pollution Act 1987. The Agency may refuse to register a bagging operator or fuel supplier where the Agency is not satisfied that the sulphur content specification for bituminous coal as prescribed by Regulations made under the Act is being complied with by the applicant.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Air Pollution Act, 1987 (Marketing, Sale and Distribution of Fuels) (Amendment) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 270 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Air Pollution Act, 1987 (Marketing, Sale and Distribution of Fuels) Regulations, 1998 by: defining additional restrictions regarding the composition and packing of bituminous coal supplied for residential heating; the functions of the Environmental Protection Agency in relation to registration by coal bagging operators and fuel suppliers; and a ban on the marketing, sale and distribution of bituminous fuel to four additional restricted areas.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 7.495 creating National Committees for the United Nations Conference Rio+20 on Sustainable Development.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 18 articles, creates various National Committees for the implementation and counselling of the Conference of the United Nations on Sustainable Development to be held in Rio on 2012. It provides for competencies and duties of the above mentioned Committees, of the Directive Group of the Commission and Council. It also lists all the institutions and ministries involved in the organization, assessment and counselling of this event.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Offshore Exploration for and Exploitation of Natural Resources including Petroleum (Marine Environment Protection) Regulation No. 1 of 2011.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of fourty-eight sections and nine Schedules, specify the requirements for the Granting a Marine Environment Protection License. They apply to any person engaged in offshore exploration for and exploitation of natural resources including petroleum in the exploration block. Any person who makes an application to the Petroleum Resources Development Committee established under section 5 of Petroleum Resources Act, No. 26 of 2003, shall submit to the Marine Environment Protection Authority prior to the commencement of any petroleum activity, a detailed account of the steps to be taken by him to mitigate, control or manage the discharge of any pollutant in accordance with the Discharge Management Plan and an Environment Impact Assessment (EIA). EIA shall be carried out by a classification society approved by the Authority. The Discharge Management Plan shall conform to the requirements specified in Schedule I and shall consist of a plan for marine environment protection including: for environmental monitoring, for prevention of an oil spill, for storage, transportation, cleaning, refining and locating oil extracts and the procedure for rehabilitation of the area after completion of the exploration for exploitation of natural resources including petroleum and a completed chemical data sheet acceptable to the Authority which shall be in the form set out in Schedule II.
Subject: Mineral resources, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 26 May 2011.

Policy: Regional Law No. 34/2011-OZ amending Regional Law No. 60/2006-OZ “On protection of the population and territory against regional and intermunicipal technological and natural disasters.
Policy_Content: Article 8 shall be amended to add the following wording: “arrangements in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters except for forest fires”.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Commission Regulation (EU) No. 550/2011 on determining, pursuant to Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, certain restrictions applicable to the use of international credits from projects involving industrial gases.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prohibits the use of international credits from projects involving the destruction of trifluoromethane and nitrous oxide from adipic acid production for the purposes of article 11 of Directive 2003/87/EC. This prohibition applies as from 1 January 2013.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Emissions,Clean development mechanism

Policy: Ordinance implementing land use planning and building legislation.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Land Use Planning and Building Law of 2 May 2010 and the Building Ordinance of 23 February 2011. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the correct and efficient implementation of the afore-mentioned Law and Ordinance. The text consists of 16 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: Competences (1); Building application documents (2); Control stage of construction phases (3); Binding standards of specialized organizations (4); Final provisions (5).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 July 2011.

Policy: Décret n° 11/28 du 07 juin 2011 fixant les statuts d'un établissement public dénommé Centre d'Expertise, d'Evaluation et de Certification des substances minérales précieuses et semi­précieuses, CEEC en sigle.
Policy_Content: Le Centre d'Expertise, d'Evaluation et de Certification des substances minérales précieuses et semi-précieuses, CEEC service public créé par le Décret n° 09/57 du 03 décembre 2009, est transformé en établissement public à caractère technique doté de la personnalité juridique et de l'autonomie administrative et financière, appelé Centre d'Expertise, d'Evaluation et de Certification des substances minérales précieuses et semi-précieuses, en sigle "CEEC". Le Centre a pour objet d'expertiser, analyser, évaluer et certifier en République Démocratique du Congo: les substances minérales précieuses, semi-précieuses et pierres de couleur; les métaux précieux et semi-précieux et les métaux rares associés ou non aux métaux majeurs ferreux et non ferreux et les substances minérales de production artisanale.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 439 of 2011 on Implementation of Flag State Supervision of Ships
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the procedures for the implementation of flag State supervision of ships in relation to inspections of Latvian ships and the periodicity thereof, the certificates of ships to be issued, the suspension of operation thereof or cancellation of certificates, the recognition of ship certificates issued by foreign states, ship class inspections; and the functions and rights of ship control inspectors of the Maritime Safety Inspectorate of the State joint stock company "Maritime Administration of Latvia", when implementing flag State supervision of ships. The Inspectorate shall implement the flag State supervision of Latvian ships by performing, among others, evaluation and approval of Latvian shipbuilding and modernisation projects, documentation regarding the stability of a ship, the pollution contingency plan in case of an accident, the ship's manual and other documentation of the ship specified in international regulatory enactments.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolution No. 17 of 2011 of Adjara Government on Reorganizing Rescue Service in Water and Creating Rescue Service, and Natural Disaster Forecasting and Management Center
Policy_Content: This Order adopts the charter (bylaws) of the Rescue Service of Adjara and of the Natural Disaster Forecasting and Management Center. Both the charter for the Rescue Service of Adjara and of the Natural Disaster Forecasting and Management Center consist of 11 articles: General provisions (1); Service goals, objectives and function (2); Management of the Service (3); Authority of the chairman of the Service (4); State control of the Service (5); Service activities that require consent (6); Property of the Service (7); Finances of the Service (8); Accounting within the Service (9); Reorganization and liquidation of the Service (10); and Making amendments and additions to the charter (11).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Institution,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Governance,Procedural matters
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 288 validating the Regulation on issuance of special permit for removal of plant species from their natural habitats for scientific research purpose.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates special nature management in the form of collection of plant species on the territory of state forest fund for scientific research purposes. The aforesaid collection of plant species shall be carried out in accordance with special authorization issued for fee. This Ministerial Decree shall be applicable to wild flora species. Issuance of special permit to natural and legal persons, including foreign legal persons, shall be done within 5 days from the date of submittal of the application that must contain the following information: (a) full name and legal address for legal persons, and personal identification data for natural persons; (b) projected amount of collection distributed by species; (c) area of collection; and (d) collection methods (mowing, harvesting etc.).
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 634 validating the Regulation on liquidation and conservation of mining sites.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of liquidation and conservation of mining sites related to state geological study, exploration, prospecting, mining and extraction of minerals, including hydrocarbons, groundwater, thermal and medicinal waters, and also exploration of subsoil for effluent waste water discharge. Liquidation and conservation project shall envisage: (a) explanatory note; (b) geological documentation attesting the state of subsoil; (c) copies of topographic maps; and (d) location scheme of sites subject to liquidation or conservation.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Exploration,Mining,Minerals,Groundwater,Thermal and medicinal waters,Effluent waste water/discharge,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 289 amending Ministerial Decree No. 376 validating the arrangements for the protection of environment against negative impact of some chemicals and pesticides.
Policy_Content: Item 4 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Authorized state customs body of Kyrgyzstan shall timely submit information to the authorized state institution in the sphere of environmental protection related to disclosure of cases of illegal import of chemicals and pesticides in accordance with the list validated by this Ministerial Decree”.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree amending the Decree concerning exploitation of wood, marking removed wood and documentation on wood extraction.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development lays down some amendments and addenda to the Decree concerning exploitation of wood, marking removed wood and documentation on wood extraction. In particular, the present Decree establishes the new form of certificate of the wood origin, specified in Annex 5 of the amended Decree.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 July 2011.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1492-ZRK “On exceptional cases of timber extraction for public and municipal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contracts for forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes exceptional cases of timber extraction for public and municipal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contracts for forest species listed as follows: (a) fuelwood for heating supply companies; (b) fuelwood for citizens without centralized heating system; and (c) prevention of environmental and technological disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 207 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on state forest inventory.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of state forest inventory to be conducted by the Federal Forest Agency concerning the forests pertaining to state forest fund, and also located on land of other categories, by terrestrial and aerial methods with the use of mathematical statistics. State forest inventory shall have the following purposes: (a) timely identification and forecast of processes having negative impact on forests; (b) evaluation of the efficiency of forest conservation, protection and reproduction arrangements; and (c) information support of forest management. The following arrangements shall be applied for carrying out state forest inventory: (a) distant forest monitoring; (b) evaluation of forest conservation, protection and reproduction arrangements; (c) formation of federal information resources; and (d) specification of quantitative and qualitative characteristics of forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation on the Network for Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the conditions and manner of establishing, organization and operation of the Network for Rural Development,  which brings together all interested stakeholders in the development of rural areas of the Republic of Croatia.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Data collection/reporting
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decree No. 36 of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food validating the Instruction on price regulation in the process of purchase of agricultural commodities for public needs.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of price regulation in the process of purchase of agricultural commodities for public needs and it shall be applicable to legal persons and individual entrepreneurs manufacturing agricultural commodities and supplying thereof for public needs. Price regulation shall be performed within the framework of minimum rates of prices for crop products and animal products inserted in the national and provincial lists of produce destined for public needs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force after its official publication.

Policy: Regulation on balance of forest reproductive material.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the exact necessary content and manner for keeping and elaborating the official state of the quantity/balance of forest reproductive materials (on the territory of the Republic of Serbia, and made on the basis of comparative indicators of production and effective stock of forest reproductive material, on the five year model needs).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Federal Law No. 129-FZ amending Federal Law No. 221-FZ on state cadastre of immovable property.
Policy_Content: Item 13 shall be amended to add the following wording: "13. Access to information related to land valuation and cadastre number of a plot of land recorded in state land cadastre shall be granted to all persons free of charge in accordance with the modalities established by legislation related to land cadastre."
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret-loi n° 2011-50 du 4 juin 2011, portant autorisation pour la ratification de l'adhésion de la République Tunisienne au protocole de 1997 modifiant la convention internationale de 1973 pour la prévention de la pollution par les navires, telle que modifiée par le protocole de 1978 y relatif.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret la ratifie l'adhésion de la République Tunisienne au protocole de 1997, modifiant la convention internationale de 1973 pour la prévention de la pollution par les navires, telle que modifiée par le protocole de 1978 y relatif et adopté à Londres le 26 septembre 1997.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret-loi n° 2011-49 du 4 juin 2011, portant autorisation pour la ratification de l'adhésion de la République Tunisienne à la convention internationale de 2001 sur le contrôle des systèmes antisalissure nuisibles sur les navires.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret ratifie la ratification de l'adhésion de la République Tunisienne à Est autorisé, la ratification de l'adhésion de la République Tunisienne à la convention internationale de 2001 sur le contrôle des systèmes antisalissure nuisibles sur les navires, adoptée à Londres le 5 octobre 2001.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Resolución de 3 de junio de 2011 - Programación de la generación de origen renovable no gestionable de los sistemas eléctricos insulares y extrapeninsulares.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el procedimiento de operación 3.7  sobre Programación de la generación de origen renovable no gestionable de los sistemas eléctricos insulares y extrapeninsulares, que describe los flujos de información y los procesos necesarios para la programación de la generación de origen renovable no gestionable con el fin de garantizar la operación segura de los sistemas eléctricos insulares y extrapeninsulares.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Transport/storage,Internal trade,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Consumer Protection Act: Rules: Functioning of National Consumer Commission (G.N. No. 489 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Rules concern the functioning of National Consumer Commission established by section 85 of the Consumer Protection Act. The Rules concern, among other things, the handling of documents, the delivery of documents, access to information, complaint procedures, consent agreements, the condonation of time limits, procedures relating to exemptions applications, and publication of Notices that are required to be issued under the Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Environmental Liability (Prevention and Remediation) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 210 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Liability (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009 by making provision for implementing of an amendment to Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on environmental liability by Article 34 of Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of on the geological storage of carbon dioxide.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Rural Development Programme (Transfer and Appeals) (England) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 1433 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations transfer from regional development agencies to the Secretary of State rights ((including charges over land or other property) and liabilities arising under Council Regulations (EC) No 1698/2005 and 1257/1999, and provide that agreements entered into by those agencies under those Community Regulations now vest in the Secretary of State. They also provide for appeals against any decision, made by a regional development agency or by the Secretary of State under Council Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005, to a person appointed by the Secretary of State.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi n° 29 - 2011 du 3 juin 2011 portant création du fonds national du cadastre.
Policy_Content: Il est créé un établissement public à caractère administratif, doté de la personnalité morale et jouissant de l’autonomie financière, dénommé fonds national du cadastre. Le fonds national du cadastre a pour mission d’assurer le financement des travaux relatifs: - à l’aménagement des terrains; - à l’établissement, la conservation et la rénovation du cadastre; - à la mise à jour permanente des documents cadastraux; - à l’établissement et la densification des réseaux géodésiques; - à la conservation et la rénovation des repères et des signaux; - à la réhabilitation des réseaux cadastraux; - aux études et contrôles techniques des travaux cadastraux.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Loi n° 28 - 2011 du 3 juin 2011 portant création du bureau d’études et de contrôle des travaux cadastraux.
Policy_Content: Il est créé un établissement public à caractère scientifique et technique, doté de la personnalité morale et jouissant de l’autonomie financière, dénommé bureau d’études et de contrôle des travaux cadastraux.  Le bureau d’études et de contrôle des travaux cadastraux est placé sous la tutelle du ministère en charge des affaires foncières. Il a pour mission d’assurer l’exécution des activités ci-après: - le contrôle, le suivi des documents des travaux cadastraux, topographiques, photogrammétriques et géodésiques exécutés sur le territoire national ; - l’étude et la conception des travaux cadastraux et des techniques connexes conformément à la réglementation en vigueur; - la recherche dans le domaine du foncier, du cadastre et de la topographie; - la formation et le recyclage du personnel nécessaire à la réalisation de son objet.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Loi n° 27 - 2011 du 3 juin 2011 portant création de l’agence foncière pour l’aménagement des terrains.
Policy_Content: Il est créé un établissement public à caractère industriel et commercial, doté de la personnalité morale et de l’autonomie financière dénommé agence foncière pour l’aménagement des terrains, placée sous la tutelle du ministère en charge des affaires foncières. L’agence foncière pour l’aménagement des terrains a pour missions de: - procéder aux opérations d’acquisition foncière; - aménager et céder des espaces de terres nécessaires à la réalisation des projets d’intérêt général ; - contribuer pour le compte de l’Etat, au recouvrement par le trésor public, des droits et redevances relatifs à l’acquisition, à l’aménagement et à la cession des espaces fonciers; - effectuer des recherches dans le domaine du foncier.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No. 271-Z amending Law No. 133-Z “On state registration of immovable property and transactions therewith”.
Policy_Content: Article 29 shall be amended to add item 51 of the following wording: “51. The authorized state institution can establish other types of information that can be released by the state register of immovable property, rights and transactions therewith, with the consideration of restrictions to release such information as envisaged by this article.”
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force six months after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2527-OZ “On allotment of land plots for housing construction”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that public land pertaining to the ownership of regional government shall be allotted to citizens for individual urban and suburban individual residential housing construction free of charge with land area of 0,15 ha.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Public Private Partnership Regulations, 2011 (G.N. No. 165 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Public Private Partnership Act in respect to a wide variety of matters including: identification of projects that may be undertaken by the public sector in partnership with the private sector; feasibility studies; appointment of project officers; selection of projects; recommendation of projects by the Contracting Authority; other procedures for the approval and preparation of projects; procurements by the Contracting Authority for purposes of a project; negotiation and agreement with a successful bidder; and implementation and termination of projects.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Written Laws (Miscellaneous Amendments) Act, 2011 (No. 3 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends various written laws including the Executive Agencies Act. The Executive Agencies Act is amended is section 6 by: (a) deleting subsection (3) and substituting for it the following: "(3) A principal officer from the Ministry under which the agency is established who shall be a member of the Board."; (b) deleting paragraph (a) of subsection (6) and substituting for it the following: "(a) a Chief Executive Officer from the Ministry establishing an agency;"
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Afar National Regional State Rural Land Use and Administration Regulation No. 4/2011.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, made under the Afar National Regional State Rural Land Use and Administration Proclamation, concerns equal land use rights on communal holdings of the pastoralist communities and separation of communal holdings for use of the pastoralist community. Any pastoralist shall be entitled to equal land use right on communal holding. Such right shall include the right to equal distribution of grazing, water, land lease, forestry resources and any other proceeds from the communal holding. Any male or female person who is a member of a given community and is above 18 years of age shall have the right to obtain proportionate share of proceeds from grazing or lease on the communal holding of land. Land holdings for use of grazing purposes of the pastoralist shall be identified and delineated. Without prejudice to the traditional practice where the pastoralist is allowed to use the delineated plot of private holdings in their movement in search of grazing and water, it is prohibited to take hold of new possessions or expand possessions and Kebele administration shall ensure prevention of such expansion. Any person who transfers communal holding to private holding shall face criminal prosecution by law.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Order No. 114 of 2011 of Minister of Finance and Economy of Adjara on Purchase-Sale Agreement Forms between Seller and Purchaser when Privatizing Property of Adjara
Policy_Content: This Order adopts the purchase-sale agreement forms that are to be entered into between a seller and a purchaser when privatizing the property of Adjara. More specifically, it adopts a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing immovable property through an auction imposing terms (Annex No. 1); a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing movable property through an auction imposing terms (Annex No. 2); a list of documents that need to be presented by the purchaser when privatizing immovable and movable property through an auction imposing terms (Annex No. 3); a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing immovable property through an auction imposing no terms (Annex No. 4); a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing movable property through an auction imposing no terms (Annex No. 5); a list of documents that need to be presented by the purchaser when privatizing immovable and movable property through an auction imposing no terms (Annex No. 6); a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing company shares through an auction imposing terms (Annex No. 7); a form of purchase-sale agreement when privatizing company shares through an auction imposing no terms (Annex No. 8); a list of documents that need to be presented by the purchaser when privatizing company shares through an auction imposing terms and an auction imposing no terms (Annex No. 9).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Environmental Education Act Enforcement Rules.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 17 Articles, are enacted in accordance with the Environmental Education Act.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Rules for the Establishment of Environmental Education Certification Review Panel of the Environmental Protection Administration.
Policy_Content: These Rules is for the establishment the  Environmental Education Certification Review Panel. The Rules consists of 10 items.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Planning and Development (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 262 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 in relation with: the prescribed authorities for the purposes of sections 11, 12 and 13 of the Planning and Development Act 2000, the prescribed authorities for the purposes of section 20 of the Act, the prescribed authorities for the purposes of section 24 of the Act and specified bodies for the purposes of sections 37D(2)(a), 181C(3) and 182E(3) of the Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Land Registration (Amendment) Rules 2011 (S.I. No. 1410 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Rules amend the Land Registration Rules 2003 in rule 217 in the definition of “conveyancer” to include those who are or who employ authorized persons, authorized or licensed under the provisions of the Legal Services Act 2007 to carry on certain reserved instrument activities relating to land registration The definition also includes public officers carrying on those activities, and specifies when the conveyancer giving a certificate must be an individual.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: This Order amends the Land Registration (Proper Office) Order 2010 in the definition of “conveyancer” in article 2(2) order to include those who are or who employ authorized persons, authorized or licensed under the provisions of the Legal Services Act 2007 to carry on certain reserved instrument activities relating to land registration. The definition also includes public officers carrying on those activities.

Policy: Décret présidentiel n° 11-211 du 30 Joumada Ethania 1432 correspondant au 2 juin 2011 portant création de l’institut algérien de formation en génie nucléaire.
Policy_Content: Il est créé, un institut algérien de formation en génie nucléaire, par abréviation "IAGN", qui pour mission la prise en charge de la formation spécialisée en génie nucléaire. A ce titre, il organise: la formation spécialisée dans les différents domaines d’activité du commissariat à l’énergie atomique, principalement celui du génie nucléaire; la formation spécialisée des personnels d’exploitation et de maintenance des réacteurs nucléaires de recherche et de centrales nucléaires; la formation spécialisée des personnels destinés aux activités de prospection, d’exploration, d’exploitation, de traitement, de transformation, de valorisation, de gestion et de stockage des matières premières nucléaires; la formation spécialisée dans les domaines de la sûreté nucléaire, la sécurité nucléaire, la sûreté radiologique, la physique médicale et radiologique, la sûreté de transport des matières radioactives, la gestion des déchets radioactifs ainsi que la réglementation y afférente; la formation continue, le perfectionnement et le recyclage des personnels des centres de recherche nucléaire ainsi que celui du personnel d’exploitation et de maintenance des installations nucléaires.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decree No. 7.492 creating the Plan for Brazil without misery.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 7 articles, creates the Plan for Brazil without misery. It aims at responding to extreme poverty situations faced by population within the entire National territory, through the integration and articulation of policies, programmes and actions to fight rural and urban poverty. Specific objectives of this Plan are: to raise family income per capita of extreme poor population; to improve the access of this population to public services; and to promote the access to opportunities for work and other income generating activities, through actions of productive inclusion.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Law on agricultural commodity exchange.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to regulate transactions with agricultural commodities and raw materials and to establish legal basis for stock exchange of agricultural commodities and raw materials, purchase, storage, transport and exchange trade thereof. Agricultural commodity exchange shall be intended the place of purchase of agricultural commodities in designated premises or on the electronic marketplace and in the market exchange. Agricultural commodity exchange shall operate on the principles of independence, transparency and openness. The objective of this Law shall be to stimulate involvement of agricultural cooperatives and farmers in agricultural commodity exchange trade. Regulatory board of agricultural commodity exchange shall monitor, supervise and suppress the intention to raise or reduce artificially priced commodities trading. Purchase, sale and trading of agricultural commodities at agricultural commodity exchange shall be regulated by contracts. Participants of agricultural commodity stock exchange shall be classified as permanent and non-permanent members. This Law consists of V Chapters divided into 17 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards agricultural commodity exchange operations. Chapter III regards agricultural commodity exchange traders. Chapter IV regards financial audit and accounting. Chapter V lays down additional provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 June 2012.

Policy: Ley Nº 14/2011 - Ley de la Ciencia, la Tecnología y la Innovación.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco para el fomento de la investigación científica y técnica y sus instrumentos de coordinación general, con el fin de contribuir a la generación, difusión y transferencia del conocimiento para resolver los problemas esenciales de la sociedad. El objeto fundamental es la promoción de la investigación, el desarrollo experimental y la innovación como elementos sobre los que ha de asentarse el desarrollo económico sostenible y el bienestar social.

Policy: European Communities (Merchant Shipping) (Compliance with Flag State Requirements) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 260 of 2011).

They appoint the Marine Survey Office as competent authority in the State for the purposes of these Regulations and the Directive. The Marine Survey Office shall enhance safety and prevent pollution from ships flying the Irish flag that come within the scope of certain conventions of the International Maritime Organisation. It shall ensure that certain safety, audit and operative quality requirements are observed by Irish ships.

Policy: Regional Law No. 16-ZKO "On allotment of land parcels free of charge to some categories of citizens for individual construction".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes cases of allotment of public and municipal land parcels free of charge to some categories of citizens for individual construction to the following categories of citizens: (a) citizens with three or more children under 18 years of age; (b) young families, and single parents of maximum 35 years of age; (c) persons deprived of the only one housing facility as a result of natural or technological disaster; and (d) persons with handicapped children. Allotment of land parcels free of charge to the aforesaid categories shall be performed once-only.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 17-ZKO “On maximum land plot area allotted for subsistence farming”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes maximum total land area that can be owned or belong in any other form to citizens carrying out subsistence farming. Maximum land area of agricultural land cannot exceed 2 ha per each subsistence farm. In case of excess of the aforesaid limit the exceeding land area must be expropriated within one year from the date of origin of the aforesaid rights or within the same time period the citizen must be registered as individual entrepreneur in the form of peasant farm.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Ontario Forest Tenure Modernization Act, 2011(S.O. 2011, c. 10).
Policy_Content: The present Act changes the forest tenure system and provides a more competitive market environment in the allocation and pricing of Crown timber. The Act introduces two new forest management models for harvesting wood from Ontario’s forests: Local Forest Management Corporations (LFMCs) will now manage Crown forests and oversee the competitive sale of the timber in a given area; and Enhanced Shareholder Sustainable Forest Licences (SFL): a group of mills and/or harvesters that collectively form a new company to manage Crown forests under the Sustainable Forest Licence that is issued to them. The text consists of 30 sections.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ontario Forest Tenure Modernization Act, 2011 (S.O. 2011, c. 10).
Policy_Content: The present Act introduces two new forest management models for harvesting wood from Ontario forests. The first is the set up of Local Forest Management Corporations (LFMCs), which will be mandated to manage Crown forests and oversee the competitive sale of the timber in given areas. The second is the Enhanced Shareholder Sustainable Forest Licences (SFLs), a group of mills and harvesters that collectively form a new company to manage Crown forests under the licence that is issued to them. The text consists of 30 sections.

Policy: Early Childhood Development Policy.
Policy_Content: The ECD vision is to enable the Republic of Rwanda to achieve its national development goals and to ensure that all Rwandan children attain their developmental potential. To achieve the Vision, the Government and its partners will pursue the following goal: to ensure all Rwandan children achieve their potential, are healthy, well-nourished and safe, and their mothers, fathers and communities become nurturing caregivers through receiving integrated early childhood development services. The ECD policy seeks to contribute to the following specific objectives: 1. To improve birth outcomes, reduce infant and maternal mortality and high fertility rates through the expanded use of family planning, pre-conception services, HIV prevention and care services and antenatal education, health and nutrition care services and the increased use of medically attended births as well as improved neonatal care; 2. to improve parents’ and legal guardians’ knowledge, skills and resources to support the development of their children; 3. to ensure infants and toddlers receive nurturing care and developmental services, and that young children from 3 years to primary school entry are well developed and prepared for success in school and life; 4. to prevent and reduce stunted growth, and improve child development outcomes for the most vulnerable children and children with special needs; 5. to reduce malnutrition and children under-5 child mortality and morbidity through preventive measures and basic maternal-child health care and nutrition services, with emphasis on neonatal and post-natal care and maternal-child nutritional rehabilitation services; 6. to reduce the incidence of childhood illnesses and diseases due to unclean water, poor hygiene and unhygienic waste disposal; 7. to ensure that all new-borns are registered, the rights of all young children are respected, and orphans and vulnerable children from birth to 6 years are identified and receive quality, well-coordinated child protective services; 8. to provide comprehensive ECD services of high quality through developing culturally appropriate and state-of-the-art curricula, training manuals, educational materials, teaching aides, and pre-and in-service training for teachers, community facilitators and supervisors of ECD programmes and services. 9. to ensure that all children are ready to begin school at the correct age and this may entail the special provision of rapid school readiness programmes. 10. To support the coordination, monitoring and evaluation of all processes, programmes and services related to ECD, and to promote the preparation of research studies on key child development issues. 11. To sensitise local authorities, opinion leaders, parents, communities and journalists about the importance of children’s early development, ECD Policy provisions, and their roles in assisting with planning, implementing, and overseeing essential children’s services.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water, General
Keyword: Poverty,Social protection,Human rights,Governance,Public health,Capacity building,Education,Enforcement/compliance,Breastfeeding/infant food,Nutrition,Food security,Water supply,Potable water

Policy: European Communities (Marine Strategy Framework) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 249 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations require, for purposes of Directive 2008/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, the Minister for the Environment, Community and Local Government, with the assistance of other relevant Ministers, to develop a marine strategy for Ireland’s marine water. For this purpose the Regulations require, within give time limits: (a) an initial assessment of the status of Ireland’s marine waters, a determination of good environmental status and the establishment of a series of environmental targets and associated indicators; (b) the establishment and implementation of monitoring programmes for ongoing assessment and regular updates of targets; and (c) the development of a programme of measures designed to achieve or maintain good environmental status.

Policy: Regional Law No. 610 “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes rules and regulations for management of forests for hunting purposes with the consideration of conservation, protection, reproduction of commercial forests, protection forests, reserve forests and forests of protected areas. Forest management for hunting purposes of common use forests and forest parcels thereof shall be carried out by citizens (natural persons) without allotment of forest parcels. Forest parcels for hunting management shall be allotted to legal persons and individual entrepreneurs in accordance with hunting contracts. Hunting managers – legal persons and individual entrepreneurs shall have the following duties: (a) comply with the provisions of hunting contract and forest parcel lease contract; (b) carry out conservation arrangements of wild fauna species; (c) carry out biotechnical arrangements; (d) prevent environmental damages; and (e) alert Forest Service in case of the outbreak of forest fires.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 419 of 2011 on Maximum Permissible Emission into the Air in the State
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the maximum permissible emission into the air in the State for the air pollutants and groups of substances referred to in Paragraph 4 of this Regulation. The total maximum permissible emission into the air in the State for the pollutants and groups of pollutants referred to in Paragraph 4 of this Regulation must be determined, taking into account all the emissions in the territory of Latvia and its exclusive economic zone, except for emissions from international maritime traffic; and aircraft emissions beyond the landing and take-off cycle. Latvian Environment, Geology and Meteorology Centre, on the basis of the methodologies and guidelines agreed upon by the Member States of the 1979 Geneva Convention on Long-range Transboundary Air Pollution prepares and submits state emission inventories and projections.

In particular, this Regulation establishes mandatory and optional organizational units of the inspectorate, and provides guidelines for the organization of laboratories of provincial inspectorates and their representations.

Policy: Order No. 194 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on keeping state forest register.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of keeping state forest register that represents systematized body of documented information on forests, forest management, protection, conservation, reproduction of forests, forest districts and forest parks. The purpose of state forest register shall be rational management, conservation, protection, reproduction of forests, systematic control over quantitative and qualitative changes to forests and provision with reliable data state bodies, regional authorities, local self-government, forest managing institutions, and natural and legal persons concerned. State forest register shall be composed of four Sections: (a) forests and forest resources; (b) forest management; (c) conservation and protection of forests; and (d) reproduction of forests.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No. 404-z "On regulation of grazing and passage of livestock".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of organization of grazing and passage of livestock and has as its cope to ensure veterinary well-being, protection of agricultural land, crops and vegetation against destruction by animals and prevention of theft of livestock. Passage and grazing of farm livestock shall be performed under obligatory supervision either by the ownwers or by authorized persons. The modalities of passage and grazing of farm livestock shall be determined by local government. By decision of local government marking of horses and cattle can be performed for identification thereof.

Policy: Regional Law No. 29 “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency, defining the main forms of state support and dissemination of information in the aforesaid sphere. State support shall be performed in the following forms: (a) promotion of investments in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency; (b) fixing social quota for consumption of energy resources by the population; (c) partial reimbursement of interests on credits and loans granted by the Russian crediting organizations for investment projects in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency; (d) support of municipal energy saving and raising energy efficiency programs; and (e) promotion of utilization of energy servicing contracts.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Arrêté interministériel n°018/MERF/MPDAT/MATDCL du 30 mai 2011 précisant la composition, l’organisation et le fonctionnement des commissions locales de développement durable.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté précise, les attributions, l’organisation et le fonctionnement des commissions communales, préfectorales et régionales de développement durable. Par ailleurs, il détermine la composition de ces commissions de développement durable (CCDD) qui sont notamment composées de: représentants de commune, de préfecture, de région le ou les chefs cantons de la commune; des présidents des comités villageois de développement (CVD) de la commune; des chefs des services déconcentrés de la commune; des représentants des réseaux des associations et ONG; et des représentants des groupements féminins.
